messages.name: Jozsef Beres
messages.msg:
Dear Joel,

Thank you for contacting us about your DW Soundworks.

I'm sorry you are having an issue with its sound.

Let me ask you if the other instruments sound well?

Please check the driver settings in the app.
Try to select ASIO at Audio API and add a bit more buffer size if it is necessary.

 ![](https://rolandus.zendesk.com/attachments/token/yjRPfQfrwprsevYAkgsO9bhZC/?name=image.png)

I hope this helps, but please let us know if you need more help.

Kind regards,

József

Customer Service

Roland Europe Group Ltd
DW Drums Customer Support

messages.msg:
What's the difference between MC-707 and MV-1
Product Category: Aira & DJ
Product: No Data
Phone Number: No Data
Postal Code: No Data

messages.name: Scotty Anderson
messages.msg:
Hello David,

Thank you for contacting Roland Product Support.
**MC-707:** https://www.roland.com/us/products/mc-707/
**Verselab MV-1:** https://www.roland.com/us/products/verselab_mv-1/

There are a lot of similarities on the Verselab MV-1 and the MC-707, however the workflow is completely different.
The MC-707 is a "groovebox" and is great at performance, but also works great inside the studio.

The Verselab is not aimed at performance and is mainly for creating complete songs including vocal takes and taking them to the mix and mastering of the finished track.
If you are wanting to do any live performances or "jamming" with a device the Verselab wouldnt be a great candidate for this, as it's really a studio piece for production.

I'd recommend checking out some of the discussions on Reddit where this is discussed in greater detail: https://www.reddit.com/r/Mc707_Mc101/comments/1gmss1g/does_it_make_sense_to_own_both_the_mc707_and_the/

Let me know if ou have any questions.




Best Regards,

messages.msg:
Hello Trevor,

Thank you for contacting Roland Product Support.
I'm sorry to hear that you are having so many issues with your SP-404MKII.
I'd like to do some troubleshooting and check out the **"unsupported file"** that you exported.
Before we get started can you check the SP and tell me what System Profgram Version (firmware) is loaded on the machine? Access the utility menu > SYSTEM > PUSH ENTER on the main knob > use the CTRL 3 knob to go all the way to the right to VERSION.
Also, Is there a way you can send me the export, or upload it to your Google Drive account and provide me a link to download it? I want to see if something is getting corrupted along the way.

Let me know and we can go from there.

messages.name: Scotty Anderson
messages.msg:
Trevor,

It is likely that your SP-404MKII needs service, however, I would recommend attempting to update and follow with a factory reset to see if this improves any of the issues you are having.
Please follow the update instructions below and follow with a factory reset.

Let us know once this is complete.

* * *
**WHAT YOU WILL NEED TO UPDATE YOUR SP-404MKII**

- SP-404MKII System Program (Ver.5.00)
- SP-404MKII
- An SD card **(32gb or less)**
- A personal computer with a SD Card Reader/Writer.

* * *
**CAUTION WHEN PERFORMING THE UPDATE**

- Never apply this update data to any product other than the SP-404MKII. This update data may destroy the data or system program of other products.
- Never power-off your SP-404MKII while the update is in progress!
If a power failure or similar accident occurs during the update process, the SP-404MKII won't be able to start up in normal operating mode. This will require servicing, so you will need to contact Roland service center near you if this occurs.
- We regret that we are unable to answer questions regarding the update procedure using this system program. Please perform the update responsibly, following the directions given in this document.

* * *
**GETTING THE UPDATE FILE**
**The update file can be found here:** SP-404MKII System Program (Ver.5.00)
Please open/extract the downloaded "sp404mk2_sys_v500.zip" file on your computer to get the "sp404mk2_sys_v500" folder.
Please make sure you have unzipped the downloaded update file.

* * *
**PROCEDURE FOR THE UPDATE**

1. Format an SD card **(32gb or less)** > Use caution, as doing this causes all data originally saved on the SD card to be lost.
2. Insert the SD **(32gb or less)** card into the SD card slot.
3. Hold down the [SHIFT] button and press the pad [14]. The IMPORT/EXPORT screen appears.
4. Use the [VALUE] knob to select “FORMAT SD-CARD,” and press the [VALUE] knob. The FORMAT SD-CARD screen appears.
5. Use the [VALUE] knob to select “OK,” and press the [VALUE] knob. When formatting is complete, the screen indicates “Operation Completed!”. **NOTE Never turn off the power while you see the message “Working...” on the screen.**
6. Copy the update files (SP404MKII_APP0.bin, SP404MKII_APP1.bin) to the root folder of the SD card described above using a personal computer.
7. Insert the SD card **(32gb or less)** described above into the SD card slot on the unit.
8. Hold down [SHIFT] and turn on the power.
[UPDATE SURE?] is displayed on the screen.
9. Press the [PUSH ENTER] knob.
The update starts.
* Never turn off the power while the update is in progress.
When [UPDATE COMPLETE!] appears, the update has finished.
10. Turn the SP-404MKII power off and remove the SD card from the SP-404MKII.
11. Please verify the version number "5.00" with the procedure described in "HOW TO TELL THE VERSION" part of this document.
12. Hold down the [SHIFT] button and press the pad [13].
The UTILITY MENU screen appears.
13. Use the [VALUE] knob to select "FACTORY", and press the [VALUE] knob.
The UTILITY / FACTORY RESET screen appears.
14. Turn the [VALUE] knob to select the "SYSTEM DATA", and press the [VALUE] knob to confirm.
A confirmation message appears, asking if you want to initialize the data.
15. If you wish to initialize, turn the [VALUE] knob to select "OK", and press the [VALUE] knob.
The message "Please Power OFF" appears.
16. Turn this unit's power off, and then on again.

* * *
**UPDATES & DRIVERS**

- SP-404MKII System Program (Ver.5.00)
- SP-404MKII Outline Data

#### OWNER’S MANUALS

- [English] SP-404MKII Quick Start
- [English] SP-404MKII Reference Manual (Version 4) [HTML]
- [English] SP-404MKII Reference Manual (Version 4) [PDF]
- [English] SP-404MKII App User’s Guide [HTML]
- [English] SP-404MKII App User’s Guide [PDF]
- [English] SP-404MKII Roland Cloud User’s Guide [PDF]
- [English] SP-404MK2 Shortcut List [HTML]
- [English] SP-404MK2 Shortcut List [PDF]
- [English] Using Melodics with the SP-404MK2: Setup Guide [HTML]
**SUPPORT DOCUMENTS**

- SP-404MKII App Installation Procedure
- SP-404MKII CREATIVE SAMPLER AND EFFECTOR VIDEO MANUAL
- TO REGISTER YOUR GEAR: ROLAND BACKSTAGE
- ROLAND CLOUD ACADEMY
- ZENBEATS YOUTUBE CHANNEL
ROLAND PRODUCT SUPPORT YOUTUBE CHANNEL


Best Regards,

messages.name: Jules Richard
messages.msg:
Hi Michael,

Thanks for contacting us!

You can either load them via the WC-1 and Roland Cloud Connect app, or by purchasing a “Lifetime Key” and loading them via USB flash drive.

Play 4 Life requires the “purchase” of an annual membership so the free one wouldn’t apply

The following site seems to have the WC-1–not sure if that’s a helpful location. You can order from many online retailers such as Sweetwater as well. https://www.musiquegagne.com/en/roland-wc-1-wireless-usb-adaptor-for-roland-cloud-wc-1?srsltid=AfmBOop7HW3LVadCQY0hL8NI34Z2vsSghu9boYF-HTL9B1EIx7qkEwQG

Please let us know if you have any other questions regarding this matter.

Best regards,

Jules

messages.msg_o: I am trying to update my Roland Cloud Manager to be able to use my Zenology VST. I press "install" in the RCM but it just goes into "queued 0%" and nothing happens. I cannot authenticate my Zenology in FL Studio, since it requires the update. I am trying to install the 3.1.15 version.
messages.name: Julius Isokääntä
messages.msg: I am trying to update my Roland Cloud Manager to be able to use my Zenology VST. I press "install" in the RCM but it just goes into "queued 0%" and nothing happens. I cannot authenticate my Zenology in FL Studio, since it requires the update. I am trying to install the 3.1.15 version.

messages.name: Jules Richard
messages.msg:
Hi Julius,

Thanks for contacting us!

1. Make sure you have Roland Cloud Manager v3.1.2 or later.
2. In the top right hand corner, click on Settings
3. Select Preferences
4. Click the "Advanced Options" button
5. Check the "Show Plugin Installer" option.
6. Close the window
7. Restart Cloud Manager
8. Install the desired product

 ![](https://support.roland.com/attachments/token/51WmEMVBKb014iF1mzIms7IdC/?name=Screenshot+2024-11-27+at+11.05.09%E2%80%AFAM.png)

Please let us know if you have further questions concerning this matter, and thanks for choosing Roland.

Regards,

Jules

messages.name: Austin Sandick
messages.msg:
Hello Tom,

Thanks for reaching out and contacting Roland BOSS USA Operational Product Support about the KATANA-50 (KTN-50).

**Please review and execute the following steps below, to get setup with your KATANA-50/100/HEAD/ARTIST GEN3 amp.**

**You'll need the following gear at the ready:**
- Your KATANA GEN3 amp e.g., KATANA-50 GEN3, KATANA-100 GEN3, KATANA-HEAD GEN3, KATANA-ARTIST GEN3.
- USB-C to USB 2.0/3.0 A data cable. e.g.: https://a.co/d/6w69VFK
- WINDOWS OS / macOS desktop/laptop computer, with inter web access, and a USB 2.0/3.0 A port / USB adapter or USB-Hub adapter, with a USB 2.0/3.0 A port.

* * *
**As a quick overview there are three main steps to get you connected that you'll need to manually perform:**
**1 - Download, extract*, and install the** **KATANA3 System Program (Ver.1.07)** **firmware update files in to your amp, using a computer.**
**(Yes, unfortunately, you'll need to manually update the firmware on your amp using a computer, it takes around 6 months for a product to arrive in the hands of the end user, from overseas, and there are often updates during the interim, so the user should update the firmware immediately).**

**2 - Download, extract*, and install the KATANA USB device driver for your specific WINDOWS/macOS computer OS and Version. **

- **KATANA3 Driver Ver.1.0.0 for Windows 10/11**
- **KATANA3 Driver Ver.1.0.0 for macOS Monterey 12.x / Ventura 13.x / Sonoma 14.x / Sequoia 15.x**

**3 - If using the sold separate** **BT-DUAL ADAPTER** **for BT/Bluetooth connecting with your Android / iOS mobile device.**
**Download and install the BTS for KATANA GEN3 APP for your mobile device.**

choose a destination, either the DOWNLOAD folder or DESKTOP.

Use both the **KATANA3.BIN and ROMINFO.TXT files (see example below).**

 ![](https://rolandus.zendesk.com/attachments/token/aQw0jByQ8M2nURAmblM1U5qyz/?name=inline1935427345.png)

**UPDATE THE FIRMWARE, INSTALL THE USB DRIVER AND BTS FOR KATANA GEN3 SOFTWARE EDITOR.**

**2. DOWNLOAD AND INSTALL THE USB DEVICE DRIVER FOR YOUR SPECIFIC COMPUTER OS AND VERSION:**
**https://www.boss.info/us/products/katana-100_gen_3/downloads/**

REVIEW TROUBLESHOOTING FOR SPECIFIC macOS AND VERSION. USE SPOTLIGHT SEARCH IN UPPER RIGHT CORNER OF DESKTOP AND TYPE: "INSTALL HELPER" CHECK IF INSTALLED DRIVER CAN BE "ALLOWED".**_

**Download** **“BTS for KATANA GEN 3” for iOS**

**4. DOWNLOAD AND INSTALL BOSS TONE STUDIOS FOR KATANA GEN3 SOFTWARE EDITOR FOR YOUR COMPUTER:**

- **BOSS TONE STUDIO for KATANA Gen3 Ver.1.1.0 for Windows**
- **BOSS TONE STUDIO for KATANA Gen3 Ver.1.1.0 for macOS**

- **THIS SHOULD ALLOW FOR YOUR KATANA GEN3 AMP TO SYNC WITH YOUR COMPUTER AND BTS/BOSS TONE STUDIOS for KATANA GEN3.**

- **After getting connected go visit BTX/BOSS TONE EXCHANGE for KATANA GEN3 USER PATCH SHARING:**
**BOSS TONE EXCHANGE/BTX WEB FORUM PORTAL FOR KATANA GEN3 USER PATCH SHARING**

- **[English] Connecting the BOSS TONE STUDIO for KATANA Gen3 Android App to the KATANA Unit [PDF]**

* * *

* * *
**Here are some quick tips for troubleshooting USB connectivity with your Roland/BOSS devices.**

**USB CONNECTIVITY TROUBLESHOOTING:**
1. If your Roland BOSS device connects to a desktop computer via USB, try and connect to a couple of different ports:
USB 2.0/3.0 A or USB-C, female type port directly on the computer.
- Often times, USB ports on the front of computers and those on monitors and QWERTY keyboards are considered hubs, and are not recommended for proper Roland BOSS device USB connectivity.
- However, some newer computers only have USB 3.0 or USB-C ports available, in some cases a USB hub adapter may be necessary. We test and use the following USB hub adapter, and it provides multiple USB connectivity options most importantly the USB 2.0/3.0 A port options.

2. Depending on the BOSS device, connect using either:
- A USB B type to USB 2.0 A cable: for old KATANA MKI/MKII
**- A USB-C to USB-C cable: for new KATANA GEN3**
**- A USB-C to USB 2.0/3.0 A cable: for new KATANA GEN3**
For example: **https://a.co/d/cmTWOuK**

OR alternate USB cabling for other BOSS devices:
**(****micro B type USB to USB 2.0 A type data cable****).**
For example used with: POCKET-GT, WAZA-AIR, WAZA-AIR BASS, RC-5, RC-10R, RC-500, GT-1000CORE, BOSS DD/EQ/MD/OD/SY-200 Series Pedals, etc.

Note: Not all USB cables are the same, some are for charging only and not for data.
If necessary when troubleshooting connectivity, try some alternate USB 2.0 or micro B type USB cables and try some alternate USB 2.0 A compatible ports on computer or USB hub.

3. If you have any onboard computer 3rd party or native security software running please disable/disarm them temporarily while attempting to connect your Roland BOSS device along with software editor applications. Some native security features on both WINDOWS/macOS can block proper connectivity, and app/driver functionality.
Also, temporarily disconnect any 3rd party USB interfaces or devices that may impede your Roland BOSS device connectivity.

Visual images of USB type connections for proper cable identification:
 ![](https://rolandus.zendesk.com/attachments/token/0clHRgOHVre7Alk4Bbh0Rwrsp/?name=inline821420174.png)

* * *

* * *
**All instructions are included in the update download link, we'll try to reword them for you to see if it helps:**

Once you've extracted the zipped download, there should be a folder: **"katana3_sys_v107" folder**,
you'll need to copy/paste or drag/drop the two update files into the connected KATANA GEN3 amp update drive, when the amp is connected via USB in update mode.
Make sure to first connect the amp in updater mode as instructed: [Hold down the TAP TEMPO button and power ON], then connect the KATANA via USB-C to USB 2.0/3.0A cable to your computer USB port.
The KATANA should connect and appear as an external drive, on your desktop: **KATANA3(DRIVE:).**
You'll then need to copy/paste or drag/drop the two update files: **KATANA3.BIN and ROMINFO.TXT** files into/onto the drive.
Once copied over to the KATANA3(DRIVE:), you can soft-eject the drive by dragging it to the Trash (for macOS only) or right mouse click EJECT (works for WINDOWS/macOS).
Then disconnect USB cable, this should start the update process, if it doesn't, then turn toward the amp and press the blinking RED LED PANEL button, manually if necessary. This will execute the update and will take about a minute to complete.

Once completed you should see all EFFECTS LEDS blinking GREEN simultaneously together showing a successful update.
If the EFFECT LEDs blink RED rapidly then the update was a failure and you'll need to try again.

In either situation, power OFF to exit updater mode and power back ON.

* * *
**PROCEDURE FOR THE UPDATE**
Caution

- You must not rename the extracted files.
- Never turn off the KATANA GEN3's power while the update is in progress.
Otherwise the system program or the KATANA GEN3 itself may be destroyed.

**PROCEDURE FOR THE UPDATE**
**Caution**

- You must not rename the extracted file.
- Never turn off the KATANA's power while the update is in progress. Otherwise the system program or the KATANA itself may be destroyed.
Please install the extracted system program files into your KATANA according to the following procedure.

1. Adjust the [MASTER] knob to minimum.
* Do not connect the KATANA and the computer yet.
2. Turn the POWER switch on while holding down the [TAP] button.
The indicators for the [EFFECTS] buttons flash.
3. Connect the computer to the KATANA's USB port by a USB cable.
"KATANA3" drive appears on the computer screen.
4. Open the KATANA3 icon.
"Removable Disk (*:)" may appear instead of the KATANA3 icon.
5. Copy (drag and drop) all the files included in the "katana3_sys_v107.zip" folder into the "KATANA3" icon.
* Do not copy the "katana3_sys_v107" FOLDER.
With Windows
Right-click on the "KATANA3" icon in My Computer (or the "Removable Disk (*:)" icon) and execute "Eject."
With macOS
Drag the "KATANA3" icon to the Trash icon in the Dock.
6. Disconnect the USB cable, start the update process.
7. While the update is in progress, the "EFFECTS" indicators light up.
When the update has finished, the "EFFECTS" indicators slowly flash simultaneously.
8. Turn the KATANA3 power off.

This completes the update operation. The new system program runs at the next startup.
Follow the procedure for verifying the version to verify that the version has been updated.

* * *

* * *
We'll further explain the instructions provided in the Procedure for Update here:

- **KATANA3 System Program (Ver.1.07)**
- Set the KATANA-50/100/ARTIST GEN3 amp to "updater mode" by starting with amp OFF,
Press and hold the [TAP] button, while powering ON the KATANA GEN3 amp.
- Connect the USB-C to USB 2.0/3.0 A data cable from KATANA USB-C port to computer USB-C/ 2.0/3.0 A port.
Blinking RED CHANNEL LEDs should be visible if not connected,
Solid RED CHANNEL LEDs should be visible if already connected with the USB cable to computer.

The KATANA3(DRIVE:) should mount and appear on computer:
- For WINDOWS KATANA3(DRIVE:) should appear in the WINDOWS FILE EXPLORER WINDOW left column.
- For macOS the KATANA3 Drive Icon should appear on the desktop or in the FINDER.

Make sure to download the update zip folder to your local drive and extract all the contents to your desktop, open the **katana3_sys_v107 folder, does not need to be extracted.**
If necessary RIGHT MOUSE CLICK the download and EXTRACT ALL to the DOWNLOADS folder or DESKTOP: ***katana3_sys_v107.zip (Compressed/zipped folder) needs to be EXTRACTED.**
NOTE: macOS will automatically extract an unzip the download into the DOWNLOADS folder, open folder, use the two update files: **KATANA3.BIN and ROMINFO.TXT** files.
User doesn't need to OPEN these files, only drag/drop or copy/paste these files into the mounted external KATANA3(DRIVE:).
*For WINDOWS users, right-mouse click the zip then select Extract All, follow the instructions and extract to your desktop or know location.
See side by side of the ZIPPED(highlighted) vs. extracted unzipped folder:
 ![](https://rolandus.zendesk.com/attachments/token/KhKtZlN5n4pHLoPL47UxGuFLx/?name=inline-357342756.png)
**Already extracted, open folder: Select copy/paste or drag/drop the two files KATANA3.BIN and ROMINFO.TXT files into the  KATANA3(DRIVE:) manually.**
 ![](https://rolandus.zendesk.com/attachments/token/6FMuRoPWABgVbxH6W2puqZMlF/?name=inline-2108821361.png)
When doing the update, make sure to copy/paste, drag/drop only the two update files into the KATANA3(DRIVE:).
**Again, use both the KATANA3.BIN and ROMINFO.TXT files for the update.**
NOT the zipped folder, or the extracted folder, ONLY these two update files should be added to the KATANA3(DRIVE:).
Once the update files are copied over into the KATANA3(DRIVE:) and only the two update files, soft-eject the KATANA3(DRIVE:), by Right Mouse Clicking, the KATANA3(DRIVE:) and choose EJECT.
Then disconnect the USB-C to USB 2.0/3.0 A cable from the computer or amp.

This will trigger the amp to recognize the update and you'll see the KATANA GEN3 amp, start the update process automatically, if it doesn't, then press the PANEL button with the RED flashing LED.
If necessary, press the PANEL LED button once and this will execute the update firmware code you've added to the amp.
Wait about a minute for the update to complete, check for slow blinking **GREEN EFFECT LEDS for successful update.**
Once the update has been confirmed, power OFF, and power ON, complete.

After attempting the update:
- If the EFFECT LEDS are flashing GREEN slowly simultaneously together, this indicates the update was a success.
- If the EFFECTS LEDS are flashing RED rapidly, this indicates the update failed and you'll need to try the process again.
In either circumstance/result, you'll need to recycle power, power OFF and back ON again to leave the "updater mode."

It's ok to power OFF the amp after the update processes has run and completed.
However, DON'T power OFF the amp while it's transmitting the update or in the process of updating.

* * *

* * *
**KATANA GEN3 FACTORY RESET INSTRUCTIONS:**

 ![](https://rolandus.zendesk.com/attachments/token/2PtLEtfq5Ch5kSdIwXovvCrHp/?name=inline1560582286.png)

**ATTACHING THE BT-DUAL ADAPTER INSTRUCTIONS:**
 ![](https://support.roland.com/attachments/token/hnk3slgafbjrm4MMWt18mcenb/?name=image.png)



* * *


Thanks and enjoy your day.
Roland/BOSS Product Support

messages.msg:
I am new to doing volume swells. I purchased an expression pedal to use with my Katana Go. I have it set up to control the volume. I am wondering how to get it to naturally decay after I do the swell in. Right now when I pull it back, the volume actually decreases. Which might be normal, but I’m not sure. Is there a way to make it naturally decay when I pull it back instead of getting quieter. I would like my swells to continue more.

messages.name: Austin Sandick
messages.msg:
Hello Jordan,

Thanks for reaching out and contacting Roland BOSS USA Operational Product Support about the EV-30.

Sorry to hear you're having issues.
I think we need a little more information about your situation and products you're using.
To be clear, the EV-30 does not connect directly to the KATANA:GO. The EV-30 is an analog dual output expression pedal. The only way to control the volume on the KATANA:GO over expression would be through Bluetooth MIDI.

There are two options to connect an expression pedal wirelessly to the KATANA:GO
An EV-30 expression pedal can connect to the BOSS FS-1-WL via TRS 1/4" male to male cable, and then the FS-1-WL would connect via BLE-MIDI to the KATANA:GO MIDI signal.

The other product that can connect to the KATANA:GO for volume control is the BOSS EV-1-WL (this might be the product you have, but it is unclear from your message). The EV-1-WL would connect via BLE-MIDI to the KATANA:GO MIDI signal.

Below is additional KATANA:GO support documentation and links.

* * *
**PLEASE SEE OUR KATANA:GO SUPPORT WEB LINKS BELOW:**

**KATANA:GO FEATURES:**
**https://www.boss.info/us/products/katana-go/features/**

**KATANA:GO SPECS:**

Jordan Dwyer

messages.name: Austin Sandick
messages.msg:
Jordan,

Thanks for clarifying which BLE-MIDI controller you're using with the KATANA:GO.

You may need to adjust the MIN VOL control on the EV-30 to get the full sweep of the expression pedal.
1. Connect the EV-30 to your equipment.
2. Advance the pedal all the way, and on the connected effect units, specify the maximum amount of effect.
3. Return the pedal (back toward yourself), and use the EXP 1 and EXP 2 knobs to specify the minimum amount of effect.
* You can’t use the MIN knobs to change the maximum amount of effect.


* * *


Thanks and enjoy your day.
Roland/BOSS Product Support

messages.msg_o:
Hello!


I have the volume on the Katana Go all the way up. And when I swell in, it is fine. What I’m trying to figure it out is when I pull it back again so that I can do another swell I would like it to not affect the current sound so that the swell can naturally decay. Does that make sense? Is this possible? Thanks!


Jordan Dwyer
messages.name: Jordan Dwyer
messages.msg:
Hello!


I have the volume on the Katana Go all the way up. And when I swell in, it is fine. What I’m trying to figure it out is when I pull it back again so that I can do another swell I would like it to not affect the current sound so that the swell can naturally decay. Does that make sense? Is this possible? Thanks!


Jordan Dwyer

messages.name: Austin Sandick
messages.msg:
Jordan,

I'm not sure that I understand what you're asking, if you pull the volume back while the guitar is decaying/sustaining the decayed sound will be affected. This is the nature of using a volume pedal.
The volume control has one function, which is to control the volume pedal in the effect chain.
The volume's curve can not be changed.

* * *


Thanks and enjoy your day.
Roland/BOSS Product Support

I am not seeing the app appear in my downloads or apps. I just put it on an older laptop with the legacy download. 
Thanks
messages.name: Gregg Peterson
messages.msg:
Hi there,

I have tried to download the Spd sx pro app onto my laptop several times now and it's not working. I have the M1 chip, sequoia running, everything is up to date and I've tried the OS14 and above. I am not seeing the app appear in my downloads or apps. I just put it on an older laptop with the legacy download. 
Thanks

messages.name: Jules Richard
messages.msg:
Hi Gregg,

We're sorry to hear you're having this issue.


1. Make sure you have Roland Cloud Manager v3.1.2 or later.
2. In the top right hand corner, click on Settings
3. Select Preferences
4. Click the "Advanced Options" button
5. Check the "Show Plugin Installer" option.
6. Close the window
7. Restart Cloud Manager
8. Install the desired product

 ![](https://support.roland.com/attachments/token/51WmEMVBKb014iF1mzIms7IdC/?name=Screenshot+2024-11-27+at+11.05.09%E2%80%AFAM.png)

Regards,

Jules

messages.msg_o: Hello Roland Cloud! I own several Lifetime Keys. But when I try to access my software synths I get the following message.... "No longer active" when I try to authorize my software synthesizers. I need your help! Could you please explain? How can I regain access to my many Lifetime Keys which I already own. Enjoy your weekend! Stay safe. Take care. Gary.
messages.name: GARY MCAVOY
messages.msg: Hello Roland Cloud! I own several Lifetime Keys. But when I try to access my software synths I get the following message.... "No longer active" when I try to authorize my software synthesizers. I need your help! Could you please explain? How can I regain access to my many Lifetime Keys which I already own. Enjoy your weekend! Stay safe. Take care. Gary.

messages.name: Jules Richard
messages.msg:
Hi GARY MCAVOY,

We're sorry to hear you're having this issue.

Try these steps.
If you've already done one of the steps, just move on to the next one.
Please be sure that you've done all of the steps.

1. Make sure that you have **v3.1.16 **of Roland Cloud Manager installed.
2. In the Library of Cloud Manager, update any plug-ins that show an available update.
3. Clear your browser cache.
4. **Restart your computer. If you're on a Mac, make sure that the "reopen windows" isn't selected**
5. Launch Roland Cloud Manager
6. Start your DAW. <--very important!

Regards,

Jules

messages.msg_o:
Hello Roland Cloud Jules



Thank you so much for your help! I followed your instructions and installed 3.1.16. Everything works great! Enjoy the rest of your weekend. Also, thanks for your quick response over the weekend! Awesome service from Roland Cloud. Stay safe. Take care.



Gary

messages.name: Huw Lloyd-Williams
messages.msg:
Hi Robert,

Thank you for getting int touch, sorry to hear about your TD-07KVX's kick!

Can you try adjusting the pad sensitivity to see if this helps register a softer playing style?

Refer to "MAKING PAD SETTINGS" in the TD-07 manual on page 19.

I would also suggest adjusting the threshold as well. A lower threshold will allow softer hits to be registered better.

If the issue persists, please try connecting another cable from the loom to your kick pedal to see whether the issue is coming from the pad itself or the cable it uses.

Do let me know how you get on.

Kind regards,

Huw

Customer Service

Roland Europe Group Ltd

In this case, the kick pad itself may require inspecting I am sorry to say. We can of course, do this for you free of charge under warranty pending verifying your kit's warranty status.

I will assign your ticket to my colleagues in the Service Department, who will assist you from here. In the meantime, please would you be so kind as to provide the following?


- Summary of the fault - Kick not responding to softer hits. Pad parameters checked
- Serial number of KD-10 (kick pad)
- Proof of purchase (if still under warranty)
- Address
- Contact number

Kind regards,

Huw

Customer Service

Roland Europe Group Ltd

messages.msg:
Hello Daniel Marion,

Thanks for reaching out and contacting Roland BOSS USA Operational Product Support about the DS-1.

Sorry to hear you're having issues with your DS-1.
We'll forward you over to our Roland BOSS Service Center Admins for follow up service info and help.
Please stand by for our Service Admins to reach out to you.

**Please be prepared to provide the following info.**

**Your Name:**
**Phone Number:**
**Shipping Address:**
**Model Number:**
**Serial Number:**
**Detailed description of issue:**
**Point of Purchase:**

* * *
In the meantime and interim:
- Please troubleshoot and test your BOSS compact pedal with the Manufacturer Recommended Power Supplies.

- Test using a brand new 9 volt quality, dry alkaline battery, or a Roland BOSS PSA-120S 500mA 9V power supply.
Unfortunately, we can't guarantee 3rd party other brand power supplies will provide proper functionality and performance. Some 3rd party other brand power supplies, can cause temporary device issues, or terminal damage.
Using a 3rd party other brand power supply will void all warranty terms.

- Test and check all cabling, use 1/4" TS mono unbalanced, instrument/guitar cables, for all guitar audio Input/Output connections, for proper connectivity, and audio signal transfer.

- Connect a 1/4" TS Mono Instrument guitar cable to pedal INPUT for pedal power ON/OFF.
_(For BOSS RC COMPACT LOOPERS: Connect to **OUTPUT A** for power ON)._

- For example cabling, use quality BOSS BIC Lifetime Instrument Cables for all guitar effect chain audio signal cable connections. _(NOTE: DO NOT USE_ _1/4" TRS STEREO CABLES_ _FOR GUITAR EFFECT CHAIN AUDIO CONNECTIONS. TRS cables may not engage the INPUT jack for power ON properly. TRS cables can be used for HEADPHONES audio connections, to a dedicated HEADPHONE jack, or for FS/EXP (FOOTSWITCH/EXPRESSION) CV/CONTROL VOLTAGE external control pedals)._

**EXPLANATION AND VISUAL OF DIFFERENT AUDIO CABLES:**
TS = TIP SLEEVE (UNBALANCED),
TRS = TIP RING SLEEVE (STEREO/BALANCED),
TRRS = TIP RING RING SLEEVE (STEREO LINE LEVEL WITH MIC/MOBILE DEVICE).
 ![](https://rolandus.zendesk.com/attachments/token/uDQRgtwMWKdTbpBwFYntcI8OF/?name=inline1957521896.jpeg)

- Review the BOSS pedal included Owner's Manual for functionality and how to use the pedal or go online for the Owner's Manual PDF downloadable:  https://www.boss.info/us/support/owners_manuals/
Search alphabetically for your device model and owner's manual.

- If the pedal is still malfunctioning, then we suggest exchanging with your point of purchase/dealer/store/web store, for a new product, under the dealer's warranty (usually 30-day warranty terms).

Please inform the dealer/sales tech, of the product issues you're having, and arrange an exchange of product, for a new device. This would help with an expedited quick turn around.

- If outside of Dealer Warranty terms and Manufacturer Warranty Service/Repair is needed, you may choose to submit a Service Repair Request to our Roland BOSS Factory Service Department in Chino, CA. Once you have an RA/Return Authorization number, you may send your device in, for evaluation, diagnosis, service and repair.

- All BOSS stompbox compact and twin pedals are Manufacturer Warrantied for 5 Years, parts and labor, from the date of purchase, for the original user and non-transferable.

- All that is needed, is to submit a Service Repair Request, and submit necessary service info, device, and a copy of your original point of sale purchase receipt/invoice, to honor the Manufacturer Warranty Terms.
If outside of warranty terms, the user may choose to have the device serviced/repaired outside of warranty.
Our Service Techs can provide a service/repair quote for parts and labor, if a repair option is available.
(Note: Some vintage legacy device pedals/products may not have parts available for service/repair)

* * *
**Please review our Roland BOSS Manufacturer Warranty Information, create a Roland BOSS Backstage account, register your product and submit a Service Repair Request and use the other self-service tools and weblinks available:**
 ![](https://support.roland.com/attachments/token/jchHAj757yHujYD2P8NF4bR38/?name=image.png)

* * *
**WARRANTY INFORMATION**
Roland BOSS Product Manufacturer Warranty Information:
https://www.roland.com/us/support/service_repair/

**REGISTER PRODUCT**
Register your Roland BOSS Product here:
https://www.boss.info/backstage/mygear#register_product

**SERVICE REPAIR REQUEST**
Submit a Service Repair Request for Warranty Service by Roland BOSS Factory Service Department.
https://www.boss.info/backstage/support#service_request

**REPAIR STATUS**
https://www.boss.info/backstage/support#repair_status

**PARTS REQUEST**
https://www.boss.info/backstage/support#parts_order_request

**SERVICE CENTER LOCATOR**
If your product is within or outside the Manufacturer Warranty terms, you can use one of our Roland BOSS Certified Service Centers nearest you for service repair. If there's not an available 3rd party Service Center nearby, then you'll need to submit a Service Repair Request to our Roland BOSS Factory Service Center.
https://www.roland.com/us/support/service_repair/service_centers/


* * *


Thanks and enjoy your day.
Roland/BOSS Product Support

messages.name: 亮太 齊藤
messages.msg:
米原さま、こんにちは。

日頃は弊社製品をご愛用いただきありがとうございます。

このたびは RC-505mkII でエフェクトが消えることがあるとのご相談をいただきました。

意図しない動作が発生してしまう場合、工場出荷時の状態に戻すファクトリー・リセットが有効な場合があります。
まずは設定をバックアップのうえ、ファクトリー・リセットをお試しいただけないでしょうか。

ファクトリー・リセットで改善しない場合は、お手数ですが症状について詳細をお伺いできますと助かります。

「エフェクトが消える」とは、ボタンの点灯状態から消灯状態になるということでしょうか。
それとも、エディットした内容が消えてしまい、デフォルトの状態に戻ってしまうのでしょうか。

また、RC-505mkII は設定による動作も多岐にわたり、症状の情報だけでは原因を特定するのが
困難な場合があるため、可能でしたら本体のバックアップデータと、症状が発生する様子を動画で撮影して
お送りいただけないでしょうか。

バックアップ手順は取扱説明書P.19「データのバックアップ／復元をする」をご参照ください。
※バックアップした「ROLAND」フォルダーを圧縮してお送りください。

動画やバックアップファイルはファイルサイズが大きいため、極力メールへの添付をお控えいただき、可能であればご利用可能な
サーバー上（Google Drive 等）にアップロードをお願いいたします。
または、インターネット上の大容量データ転送サービスをご利用になっている場合は、それらのサービスを
お使いいただいても結構です。
※ Google Drive の場合、Google アカウントでのログイン不要でダウンロードできるようにアップロードしてください。

ご面倒をおかけいたしますが、どうぞよろしくお願いいたします。

担当：齊藤

messages.msg_o:
斉藤様



このたびはお世話になります。



まず、ファクトリー・リセットは試し済みです。



昨日もライブ中にエフェクトが消えました。

消えたというのは、消灯ではなく点灯はしてあるものの、エディットした状態が消え、しかし昨日の場合はデフォルトではなく、何もエフェクトがかかっていない状態になりました。



そしてライブのその曲が終わり、すぐに再起動したらエフェクトがかかった状態に戻りました。



戻る時もあるし、戻らない時もあります。



動画を撮りたいところですが、いつなるかわからない感じで少し難しいです。



ちなみに私はボーカリストなのでボーカルで使用してます。



特にそのような状態になるのはinputのAボタンが多いです。

最近Bもなることがあります。



よろしくお願いします。



米原



2025年6月12日(木) 11:35 Roland Corporation <support@rolandus.zendesk.com>:
messages.name: りえ 米原
messages.msg:
Mr. Saito



 Thank you for your assistance this time.



 First, I have tried a factory reset.



 The effects disappeared again yesterday during a live performance.

 When I say it disappeared, I don't mean that it was turned off, but that it was still lit, and the edited state was gone. However, in yesterday's case, it was no longer the default state, but rather no effect was applied.



 After the song ended at the live show, I immediately restarted the device and the effect was back on.



 Sometimes it comes back, sometimes it doesn't.



 I'd like to take a video, but it's a little difficult because I don't know when that will happen.



 By the way, I'm a vocalist so I use it for vocals.



 This is especially true for the A input button.

 Recently I've also been getting B.



 thank you.



 Maibara



 June 12, 2025 (Thursday) 11:35 Roland Corporation<support@rolandus.zendesk.com> :

messages.msg_o:
斉藤様


2番目のビデオです。

よろしくお願いします。



米原

 thank you.



 Maibara

大きい容量なので2回に分けて送ります。



インプットエフェクトのAボタンがやはり何もエフェクトがない状態になり、再起動すると戻ります。

 The A button for input effects still has no effect, but it returns to normal after restarting the device.

messages.msg_o:
Hej Johan!

Min RD88ex verkar nog ha nåt knas, det är toner som fastnar, alltså det blir ingen ingen "note off". Inte ofta, men ibland. Detta är internt, helt utan tillkopplad dator och verkar oftast inträffa vid layers eller "trippelljud".

(Den har dock inte totalhängt sig mer sedan senast, men jag har kört väldigt lite Mainstage sedan dess iofs...)

Dessutom funkar inte writefunktionen som den ska, men bara ibland, och man vet inte riktigt när. Exempel: (jag använder klockslag, så svårt att förklara annars...)
Kl. 12-13 gör jag ändringar i ljud, ändrar effekter, layers osv på några ljud jag ska ha på gig. Allt funkar. Alla write/saves funkar och är registrerade, man kan byta mellan ändrade och nya ljud och allt är finemang.
Kl 13 stänger jag av pianot, packar ner och åker till rep.
Kl 14 startar jag pianot. 9 gånger av 10 finns alla ändringarna som gjordes kl 12-13 kvar. Men ibland är allt som gjordes 12-13 borta, och ljud/parametrar är som de var före kl 12 - som att allt som gjordes kl 12-13 "glömts bort". Typ. Enerverande när man lagt upp och krånglat med en ny setlist som plötsligt försvinner. 

Tips eller förslag på nåt jag kan göra? 
Mvh Dennis F
Produktnamn: RD-88 EX
Serienummer: Z8r3192
Inköpsdatum: 2025-05-03
Inköpsmetod: In a store
Återförsäljare: Musikhuset (Karlstad)
messages.name: Dennis Friberg
messages.msg:
Hi John!

 My RD88ex seems to have something wrong with it, it's notes that get stuck, so there's no "note off". Not often, but sometimes. This is internal, completely without a computer connected and seems to mostly occur with layers or "triple sounds".

 (It hasn't completely crashed since last time, but I've used Mainstage very little since then anyway...)

 Also, the write function doesn't work as it should, but only sometimes, and you don't really know when. Example: (I use time, so hard to explain otherwise...)
 At 12-1pm I make changes to the sound, change effects, layers, etc. on some sounds I'm going to have at the gig. Everything works. All writes/saves work and are registered, you can switch between changed and new sounds and everything is fine.
 At 1 p.m. I turn off the piano, pack up and go to the rehearsal room.
 At 2pm I start the piano. 9 times out of 10 all the changes made between 12pm and 1pm are still there. But sometimes everything that was made between 12pm and 1pm is gone, and the sound/parameters are as they were before 12pm - like everything that was made between 12pm and 1pm has been "forgotten". Kind of. Annoying when you've put together and messed around with a new setlist that suddenly disappears.

 Any tips or suggestions on what I can do?
 Regards Dennis F
 Product name: RD-88 EX
 Serial number: Z8r3192
 Purchase date: 2025-05-03
 Purchase method: In a store
 Retailer: Musikhuset (Karlstad)

messages.name: Johan Gullbo
messages.msg:
Hej Dennis.
Tusen tack för din återkoppling.
Jag och Ludvig har diskuterat ditt case nu på morgonen och tyvärr så verkar det vara något fel på ditt nya RD-88EX.
Vi vet tyvärr inte vad felet kan bero på, men kanske ett felande main board kan skapa problemet.
Får vi snällt be dig att kontakta Musikhuset där du köpte dit piano, dom kommer att hjälpa dig vidare i ärendet.
Om du stöter på något problem på vägen så kan du maila mig direkt på johan.gullbo@roland.com

Vänliga hälsningar.


Johan

Customer Service

Roland Europe Group Ltd

messages.msg_o:
Hej, tackar för snabbt svar!



Ja, jag misstänker att det är nåt som inte stämmer med just det här exemplaret.



Kollar med musikaffären. Tror du att det blir reparation eller ett annat ersättningsinstrument?



Litar kanske inte riktigt på (den billigare) RD-serien längre, och funderar nämligen på om jag ska köpa något annat, kanske en Fantom 08 eller något av de andra instrumenten med inbyggt ljudkort istället.



Mvh Dennis







Skickat från min Galaxy

 Yes, I suspect there is something wrong with this particular copy.



 I'll check with the music store. Do you think it will be repaired or a different replacement instrument?



 I may not really trust the (cheaper) RD series anymore, and am considering whether to buy something else, maybe a Fantom 08 or one of the other instruments with a built-in sound card instead.



 Regards Dennis

messages.name: Johan Gullbo

Jag ville kontakta dig angående vårt senaste biljettutbyte, men jag har inte fått något svar från dig än. Kan du låta mig veta om du har några ytterligare supportfrågor eller behöver ytterligare hjälp?

Jag ser fram emot att höra från dig, men observera att det här ärendet kommer att stängas automatiskt om jag inte hör från dig inom de närmaste dagarna. Om du behöver kontakta mig (efter att ärendet har stängts) öppnar du bara ärendet igen så kan vi fortsätta att arbeta tillsammans för att lösa dina supportfrågor.

Allt gott.

messages.msg_o:
何度も申し訳ありません。先日からお問い合わせしていました米原でふ。


あれから何度か試してみて、やはりinputエフェクトのAボタンが必ず途中でエフェクトが変える状態になります。



そして電源を切ってまた入れると元に戻ります。

でもパフォーマンス始めるとまたエフェクトが無くなります。

デフォルトに戻るのではなく、何もかかっていない状態です。



今ビデオを撮ってみたので添付してみます。



ファイルサイズが大きくなるので、次のメールに2番目を添付して送ります。

とても困っています。





これは修理に出さないと無理でしょうか？
messages.name: りえ 米原
messages.msg:
I'm sorry for contacting you so many times. I've been inquiring about this for a while now.


 I've tried it a few times since then, and I've found that the A button for input effects always causes the effect to change midway through.



 Then when you turn the power off and on again it goes back to normal.

 But once you start performing the effect disappears again.

 It doesn't revert to the default, it just goes to a state where nothing is being applied.



 I just took a video so I'll attach it now.



 Since the file size is large, I will attach the second one to the next email and send it to you.

 I'm in a lot of trouble.





 Is there no way to fix this without sending it in for repair?

messages.msg:
This is a supplementary comment to the previous request No. 878143 "Regarding the malfunction of the effect of Boss RC-505mk2"





 ---------- Forwarded Message ---------
 From: **Lily**<rie.y.0402@gmail.com>
 Date: Sunday, June 15, 2025 at 21:43
 Subject: Regarding effects issue with Boss RC-505mk2
 To:<support@rolandus.zendesk.com>



 I'm sorry for contacting you so many times. I've been inquiring about this for a while now.


 I've tried it a few times since then, and I've found that the A button for input effects always causes the effect to change midway through.



 Then when you turn the power off and on again it goes back to normal.

 But once you start performing the effect disappears again.

 It doesn't revert to the default, it just goes to a state where nothing is being applied.



 I just took a video so I'll attach it now.



 Since the file size is large, I will attach the second one to the next email and send it to you.

 I'm in a lot of trouble.





 Is there no way to fix this without sending it in for repair?

messages.msg_o:
Witam, kupiłem dzisiaj wzamcniacz BOSS KATANA MK 3 100W , chciałbym połączyć go z boss tone studio na komputerze stacjonarnym, niestety aplikacja wyrzuca błąd połączenia (katana connection failure. please selecft external AUDIO/MIDI device connection. Please turn the unit from slave to normal settings). Aktualizowałem software wzmaka, instawlowałem sterowniki do win10.
Używam windows 10, w ustawieniach zezwoiłem aplikacją na używnie mikrofonu. 
Kabel USB i gniazdo są wporządku.
Wzmacniacz jest włączony.

Nazwa produktu: KATANA-100 GEN 3
Numer seryjny: B9R2763
Data zakupu: 2025-06-09
Metoda zakupu: In a store
Sprzedawca: Guitar Center (Łódź)
messages.name: Jacek Kanicki
messages.msg:
Hello, I bought a BOSS KATANA MK 3 100W amplifier today, I would like to connect it to boss tone studio on a desktop computer, unfortunately the application throws a connection error (katana connection failure. please select external AUDIO/MIDI device connection. Please turn the unit from slave to normal settings). I updated the amplifier software, installed drivers for win10.
 I use Windows 10, in the settings I allowed the application to use the microphone.
 USB cable and socket are fine.
 The amplifier is on.

 Product name: KATANA-100 GEN 3
 Serial number: B9R2763
 Purchase date: 2025-06-09
 Purchase method: In a store
 Seller: Guitar Center (Łódź)

messages.name: Daniel Stegmann
messages.msg:
Witam Jacek,

Dziękuję za wiadomość i szczegóły.

Proszę sprawdzić następujące rzeczy, które często są przyczyną błędu „katana connection failure”:

1. **Menadżer urządzeń Windows**
Sprawdź, czy wzmacniacz KATANA-100 GEN 3 jest poprawnie wykrywany przez system Windows:

- Kliknij prawym przyciskiem myszy na przycisk Start i wybierz Menadżer urządzeń.
- Rozwiń sekcję Kontrolery dźwięku, wideo i gier lub Kontrolery magistrali szeregowej USB.
- Sprawdź, czy urządzenie BOSS KATANA pojawia się na liście bez żółtego znaku ostrzeżenia.

1. **Połączenie bezpośrednie (bez hubów USB)**
Upewnij się, że wzmacniacz jest bezpośrednio podłączony do portu USB komputera, a nie przez zewnętrzny hub USB.
2. **Kabel USB z transmisją danych**
Niektóre kable USB są przeznaczone tylko do ładowania (bez danych). Proszę upewnić się, że kabel, którego używasz, obsługuje transmisję danych – najlepiej użyć kabla dostarczonego z urządzeniem lub sprawdzonego kabla USB 2.0 lub 3.0.

Po wykonaniu tych kroków uruchom ponownie zarówno komputer, jak i wzmacniacz, a następnie spróbuj ponownie uruchomić BOSS TONE STUDIO.

Czekam na informacje, czy to pomogło – w razie potrzeby chętnie pomogę dalej.

Pozdrawiam serdecznie,

Daniel
Roland Customer Support

messages.msg_o: Niestety, dalej nic. Przewód na pewno ma funkcje przesyłu plików, jest podłączony bezpośrednio do komputera, urządzenie pojawia się bez żółtego wykrzyknika.

messages.msg_o:
Hej,


Jag har en Roland TD-50 (uppgraderad till 50X) på villen SD kortläsaren gått sönder. En del stift inne i SD-dockan hade gått av.



Jag blev då refererad till en auktoriserad Roland verkstad. De ringde då er, som sa att den delen inte fanns att köpa löst utan i så fall skulle man behöva byta ut hela det pcb kortet.



Jag lyckades dock få tack på exakt den SD-dockan på nätet. Så verkstaden bytte ut den gamla dockan mot den nya (det tog en månad). Tyvärr funkade inte det utan när man tex försökte formatera kortet så stod det ”Format Error..” el liknande och försökte man göra en backup så stod det ”Error SD Card is Locked” trots att så inte var fallet.



Så nu till min fråga, ( jag går lite omväga, efter att ha kikat på lödningarna som verkstaden gjort och de ser inte 100:a ut, men jag orkar inte med att argumentera med dom, då de är lite ”svåra” ), skulle ni kunna vara så snälla och kolla om just detta PCB kort (med SD-läsaren) finns i lager hos er i Europa och hur mycket ett sådant i så fall skulle kosta?



Modulen är inköpt 2017 och är väl inte inom garanti förmodar jag.



Mvh Kristian
messages.name: xenisolutions@gmail.com
messages.msg:
Hello,


 I have a Roland TD-50 (upgraded to 50X) but the SD card reader broke. Some pins inside the SD dock had broken.



 I was then referred to an authorized Roland repair shop. They then called you, who said that the part was not available for purchase separately, but in that case you would have to replace the entire PCB board.



 However, I managed to get a quote for the exact SD card online. So the repair shop replaced the old card with the new one (it took a month). Unfortunately, it didn't work, but when you tried to format the card, it said "Format Error.." or something similar, and when you tried to make a backup, it said "Error SD Card is Locked" even though that wasn't the case.



 So now to my question, (I'm going a bit off topic, after looking at the soldering done by the workshop and they don't look 100%, but I can't bear to argue with them, as they are a bit "difficult"), could you be so kind as to check if this particular PCB board (with the SD reader) is in stock with you in Europe and if so, how much would one cost?



 The module was purchased in 2017 and is not under warranty, I assume.



 Regards, Kristian

messages.name: Joris Van Sand
messages.msg:
Hej,

TD-50
Mycket tråkigt att höra att detta inte blev så bra.
Från oss kan vi bara leverera det fullständiga huvudkortet som har den SD-kortplatsen på den.

Vi säljer endast reservdelar via vårt återförsäljarnätverk och våra servicepartners, men vi ger dig mer än gärna reservdelsnumret/numren.

Det eller de reservdelsnummer du behöver är:

Referens:                      Beskrivning:
5100049030               MAIN BOARD ASSY

För att göra din beställning vänligen kontakta din lokala auktoriserade återförsäljare:
https://www.roland.com/se/dealer_locator/
eller lokala servicepartner: https://www.roland.com/se/support/spares/
De kommer att kunna bekräfta tillgängligheten vid den aktuella tidpunkten samt informera om förväntade leveransdatum.

 ![](https://rolandus.zendesk.com/attachments/token/tsCiyFyizdLF0pTF30z8QpVxq/?name=image.png)


Joris Van Sand

Roland Europe Group Ltd

messages.msg:
Good morning,

This customer says he bought a 2nd hand TD-50 upgraded to TD-50X.

Now probably he has a problem with his main board.

Is he entitled to again reupdate his TD-50 to TD-50X version if his TD-50 returns from service?


Best regards,

messages.name: Travis Hartnett

No, the customer doesn't have a license for the TD-50X upgrade. The original purchaser has that license.

Nej, när du köper begagnat har du ingen licens för TD-50X-uppgraderingen. Den ursprungliga köparen har den licensen.



Vänliga hälsningar,

Joris Van Sand

We’re so sorry to hear about the issue with the setup which includes the GO:MIXER PRO X and an iPad.

messages.msg_o:
Meine Frage:
Ich nutze das FP30X standalone.
Bei Spielen in den Oktaven C6/C7 schalten sich oftmals Metronom und/oder Wiedergabe ein - natürlich ungewollt und ohne eine der Fkt.-Tasten auch nur berührt zu haben. Dieses Verhalten tritt nicht immer und reproduzierbar auf. Nicht reproduzierbar ist auch, ob das Metronom nur blinkt oder auch tickt - ebenso leuchtet manchmal nur die Wiedergabe-LED ohne Ton, manchmal aber auch mit Ton.
Sie könen sich denken, dass dies beim Spiel den ganzen Vortrag durcheinander bringt. 
Kann man die Wiedergabe-/Metronom-Funktion irgendwie komplett abschalten? 
Mit freundlichen Grüßen.
Thomas Tacke
Produktname: FP-30X (White)
Seriennummer: A9M4528
Kaufdatum: 2025-03-28
Kaufmethode: In a store
Händler: Achim Franz Klaviere & Flügel (Hamburg)
messages.name: Thomas Tacke
messages.msg:
My question:
 I use the FP30X standalone.
 When playing in the C6/C7 octaves, the metronome and/or playback often turn on – unintentionally, of course, and without even having touched any of the function keys. This behavior doesn't always occur or is reproducible. It's also not reproducible whether the metronome just flashes or also ticks – likewise, sometimes only the playback LED lights up without sound, but sometimes it does.
 You can imagine that this will mess up the whole presentation when playing.
 Is there any way to completely turn off the playback/metronome function?
 Best regards.
 Thomas Tacke
 Product name: FP-30X (White)
 Serial number: A9M4528
 Purchase date: 2025-03-28
 Purchase method: In a store
 Dealer: Achim Franz Pianos & Grand Pianos (Hamburg)

messages.name: Johan Gullbo
messages.msg:
Hallo Thomas.
Vielen Dank, dass Sie sich an den Roland Kundendienst gewandt haben.
Es tut uns sehr leid, dass Sie Probleme mit der Metronomfunktion Ihres FP-30X haben.
Diese Funktion wird durch Drücken der Metronom-Taste aktiviert und sollte nicht durch das Spielen einer Taste gestartet werden können.
Bitte setzen Sie Ihr FP-30X auf die Werkseinstellungen zurück und prüfen Sie, ob das Problem dadurch behoben wird.
Ich habe eine Anleitung in dieser Nachricht angehängt. Vergessen Sie nicht, eine Sicherungskopie zu erstellen, wenn Sie Ihre Einstellungen speichern möchten.
Ich hoffe, diese Informationen sind hilfreich für Sie. Wenn Sie weitere Unterstützung benötigen, antworten Sie bitte auf diese E-Mail.


 ![](https://rolandus.zendesk.com/attachments/token/dx4OFpY0AWGCXoKyydBLb6Ylm/?name=image.png)

Mit freundlichen Grüßen.


Johan

Customer Service

Roland Europe Group Ltd

messages.name: Johan Gullbo
messages.msg:
Hallo Thomas,

ich habe leider noch keine Antwort von dir erhalten. Kannst du mir bitte Bescheid geben, wenn du weitere Fragen hast oder weitere Unterstützung benötigst?

Ich freue mich darauf, von dir zu hören. Bitte beachte, dass dieses Ticket automatisch geschlossen wird, wenn ich nicht innerhalb der nächsten Tage von dir höre. Wenn du mich kontaktieren möchtest (nachdem das Ticket geschlossen wurde), öffne das Ticket einfach erneut und wir können gemeinsam an der Lösung deines Anliegens weiterarbeiten.

Mit freundlichen Grüßen

Johan

Customer Service

Roland Europe Group Ltd

messages.msg_o:
Hi there,

I'm experiencing a mechanical issue with my Roland Aerophone AE-30. The rubber/silicone component underneath one of the octave keys (the nipple that provides return action) has broken off. As a result, the key no longer springs back up correctly, and this is affecting the playability of the instrument.

The instrument is no longer under warranty, but I’d like to know the best way to have it professionally repaired. I’m based in London and can deliver the unit to a recommended service center if needed. Could you please advise on the following:

    The nearest authorized Roland service center that can carry out this repair.

    Estimated turnaround time for this type of repair.

    A rough idea of cost if possible (diagnostic and repair).

    Whether this type of component can be replaced or if the top shell must be replaced as a unit.

Thanks in advance for your help.

Best regards,
Richie Garrison
Product Name: Aerophone Pro (AE-30)
Serial Number: z7m4691
Purchase Date: 2024-12-22
Purchase Method: Secondhand
Purchase Dealer: No Data

messages.name: Christian Köhl
messages.msg:
Good day,

 some questions about the Loop Station RC-500:

 Two microphones I've tried (including a Fame MS 57 dyn.) remain extremely quiet, virtually inaudible, despite the volume control being fully turned up, regardless of whether phantom power is on or off. What should I do?

 When recording two tracks that are supposed to run in parallel (e.g., chords on track 1, accompaniment on track 2), I can only hear the drum rhythm when recording the second track, but not the chords of track 1. Is this always the case, or can I adjust it?

 When transferring to a PC: What settings do I need to make sure that the drum track is also transferred?

 Thanks,
 Christian Köhl

 Product name: RC-500
 Serial number: F4Q1451
 Purchase date: 2023-12-29
 Purchase method: In a store
 Retailer: MUSIC STORE professional GmbH (Cologne)

messages.name: Huw Lloyd-Williams
messages.msg:
Hallo Christian,

vielen Dank für Ihre Kontaktaufnahme!

Der rote Peak-Indikator des RC-500 ist auf -6dBfs ausgelegt, was für Aufnahmezwecke relativ zur vollen Skala ist.

Dieser Wert wird berücksichtigt, damit das Audiomaterial nicht auf die volle Skala überläuft, wenn viele Overdubs übereinander gelegt werden.
Da die grüne Peak-Anzeige bei der Nenneingabe aufleuchtet, können Sie sehen, dass es sich in diesem Zustand um einen angemessenen Aufnahmepegel handelt.
Im Falle des RC-30 ist der Pegel, bei dem die Anzeige aufleuchtet, fast der Vollausschlag (0 dBfs),
Die richtige Lautstärke wird also erreicht, wenn die Anzeige nicht leuchtet.

Wir haben ausgiebig mit verschiedenen Mikrofonen getestet, und Sie können ohne Probleme eine einheitliche Lautstärke erreichen. Wir verstehen jedoch, dass Sie vielleicht erwarten, dass der Mikrofoneingangspegel niedriger ist und/oder dass die Lichter die Farbe wechseln, aber wie oben erklärt, ist dies nicht unbedingt der Fall.

Es handelt sich hierbei um ein anderes Design als beim Vorgängermodell (RC-30), aber es ist kein Fehler des Geräts und könnte erklären, warum Sie niedrigere Mikrofonpegel hören.

Was die Aufnahme der beiden Spuren betrifft, die Sie mit dem RHYTHM haben, können Sie überprüfen, ob die Spur 2 einen ausreichenden Pegel hat, um in den Parametern des PLAY-Menüs gehört zu werden? Ich würde auch empfehlen, die INPUT- und OUTPUT-Einstellungen zu überprüfen, damit Ihr aufgenommener Input richtig gehört wird.

Wenn Sie die aufgezeichneten Audiodaten auf den PC übertragen, ist der RHYTHM standardmäßig nicht in dieser Übertragung enthalten. Um dies zu umgehen, müssen Sie entweder live in einer DAW aufnehmen (Ableton, Audacity, Reaper usw.).

Mit freundlichen Grüßen,

Huw

Customer Service

Roland Europe Group Ltd

messages.name: Johan Gullbo
messages.msg:
Hi Richard.
Thank you for contacting us at Roland Customer Support.
This info is taken from page 14 in the parameter guide of the JUPITER-Xm, and the whole manual is also available for download from our website.
https://www.roland.com/global/support/by_product/jupiter-xm/owners_manuals/6583b480-03e7-4478-a84f-d680817a53e3/

Velocity duck
This temporarily lowers the velocity of a specific note of a specific part when an arpeggio note coincides at the same timing.
You can use this to prevent the volume from being excessive when notes overlap,
or in a way similar to how a side-chain compressor effect can lower the volume of other instruments at the timing of the kick drum, so that a sense of musical groove is created.

**Duck Part:** OFF, PART 1–PART 4,PART R.
Enter the part to which the effect applies. For example, to specify the rhythm part, set this to “PART R.” If this is “OFF,” velocity duck does not occur.

**Duck Note: Any** C -–G 9.
Specifies the note of the Duck Part sound that is the target. For example, if you want to target the kick drum, specify “C2.” If you specify “Any,” all notes of that part are the target.

**Duck Rate:** 0–100.
Specifies the proportion by which Velocity Duck lowers the velocity value. Higher values produce a greater ducking effect, so that with a setting of “100” there will be no sound at that timing (maximum velocity duck effect). With a setting of “0” there will be no velocity ducking.

I hope you find this information useful. Please reply to this email if you need any further assistance.

Kind regards.

Johan

Customer Service

Roland Europe Group Ltd

messages.msg_o:
I have a Fantom 07 which I am trying to install a wave expansion, but receive "Incorrect File!"

Steps taken as below, which is inline with the documentation I have read...

From the Roland Cloud Manager application, I select
- Hardware Instruments
- FANTOM-06/07/08
- EXZ006 World Instruments for FANTOM-0  -> Download
The file downloads to by PC as expected
I then copy the files
- EXZ006_World.exz 
- EXZ006_World.png
to the root folder of a USB thumb drive

I plug the USB into the FANTOM and boot up the keyboard while holding in the "Tempo" button. The keyboard boots into the EXPANSION window,
I click INSTALL,  select "EXZ006_World.exz"
But then the keyboard responds with "Incorrect File!"

Other troubleshooting steps I have taken
- Reformatted the USB drive using the FANTOM
- Upgraded firmware from 1.05 to 1.07
- Tried uninstalling one of the other preinstalled EXSN02 just incase I didn't have space, that expansion did uninstall, I tried reinstalling that too, but go same error.

messages.name: Huw Lloyd-Williams
messages.msg:
Hi Dom,

Thanks for getting in touch, so sorry to hear about your kit's ride pad. Unfortunately, yes this will likely require inspecting for repair.

According to your registered purchase method, your TD-17KV2 was purchased second-hand. Please provide us with the original owner's proof of purchase so we can backdate any remaining warranty from when your unit was first purchased.

As per our warranty policy, the warranty for Roland products can be transferred to a new owner if the original proof of purchase from the first owner is provided.

If the product is out of warranty or you do not have the original proof of purchase, we recommend contacting one of our trusted Service Partners. They specialize in repairs for out-of-warranty and second-hand products and should be able to help you.

To find a convenient location, you can visit our European Engineers Map, which lists all our Service Partners. This tool will help you find the best option for you.

If you have any other questions or need more help, please don't hesitate to contact us.

Kind regards,

Huw

Customer Service

Roland Europe Group Ltd

Hi Ian,

Thank you for getting in touch, sorry to hear about your VAD506's crash cymbal!

Can you please check that the pad is correctly assigned and whether volume/sensitivity parameters can help alleviate the issue? Here are some articles to help.

TD-27: Adjusting Pad Sensitivity
TD-27: Adjusting the Pad Volume Level
TD-27: Specifying the Trigger (Pad) Type for a Pad

Huw

Roland Europe Group Ltd

messages.name: Travis Hartnett
messages.msg:
Hi David Saunders,

We're sorry to hear you're having this issue. No serial code is required.

Try these steps.
If you've already done one of the steps, just move on to the next one.
Please be sure that you've done all of the steps.

1. Make sure that you have **v3.1.16 **of Roland Cloud Manager installed.
2. In the Library of Cloud Manager, update any plug-ins that show an available update.
3. Clear your browser cache.
4. **Restart your computer. If you're on a Mac, make sure that the "reopen windows" isn't selected**
5. Launch Roland Cloud Manager
6. Start your DAW. <--very important!

Regards,

Travis

messages.msg_o:
以前、お取り扱いのあったBR-900CDにつきまして。

現行品ではなく過去に販売されていたものですが、おたずねします。
今から20年ほど前に使っていました。
それから、最近またギターを弾き始めましてMTRを探しているところです。

打ち込みでは、小節を映したディスプレイにオリジナルのパターンを作成したり、
練習では、市販のCDの楽曲の中央の音を消すセンター キャンセルやスピードを遅くできるタイム ストレッチがあったりと、魅力的な機能が満載だったのを覚えています。

ここ最近は、他メーカーも含めて色々とMTRを探しているのですが、タッチパネル操作やパソコンに一度通すなどのことが苦手ということもあり、なかなか見つけきれないでいます。

上記に書いたように、センター キャンセルやタイム ストレッチ機能はBOSSのMTRならではの機能だと思います。
センター キャンセルの機能はBR-80にも搭載されていますが、オリジナルのパターンが作成できないようなので、断念せざるを得ません。

20年前から現在まで、何ひとつMTRを使ってきていませんし、比較してきたものが無いので、機能がなにがどう変わったかも分からないのですが、またBR-900CDを使っても良いと思われますか？
コンパクト フラッシュカードなんて今どき使わないでしょうけど、用途は自宅のみ、自主練習だけで使おうと思っていますので、個人的には問題はありません。

BR-900CDが、最近の最新のものと比べて、機能など引けを取らないのであれば中古での購入を考えています。

以上、よろしくお願いいたします。
製品カテゴリー: デジタル・レコーダー
製品名: No Data
電話番号*: No Data
郵便番号: No Data
messages.name: 智樹 島
messages.msg:
Regarding the BR-900CD that we previously sold.

 This is not a current product but something that was sold in the past, but I would like to ask.
 I used it about 20 years ago.
 Also, I've recently started playing the guitar again and am currently looking for an MTR.

 You can create your own patterns on the display that shows the bars.
 During practice, I remember that it was packed with attractive features, such as center cancel, which eliminates the central sounds of songs on commercially available CDs, and time stretch, which allows you to slow down the speed.

 Recently, I've been looking for various MTRs, including those from other manufacturers, but I'm not very good with touch screen operation or running them through a computer, so I'm having trouble finding one.

 As I wrote above, I think the center cancel and time stretch functions are features unique to BOSS MTRs.
 The BR-80 also has a center cancel function, but it doesn't seem to allow you to create original patterns, so I have no choice but to give up on it.

 I haven't used any MTRs from 20 years ago to the present, and I have nothing to compare it to, so I don't know how the functions have changed, but do you think it would be a good idea to use the BR-900CD again?
 Compact flash cards aren't used much these days, but I plan to use them only at home and for independent practice, so it's not a problem for me personally.

 If the BR-900CD is comparable in terms of features to the latest models, I am considering purchasing it used.

 Thank you for your cooperation.
 Product Category: Digital Recorder Product Name: No Data
 Phone Number*: No Data
 Zip Code: No Data

messages.name: Taichi Nishimura
messages.msg:
島さま、こんにちは。

お問い合わせをいただきありがとうございます。

まず、弊社ではいわゆる本格的な「MTR」製品を近年取り扱っておらず、BR-900CDのような本体だけで完結する高機能なモデルのご紹介が難しい状況です。
比較的最近の生産完了モデルとしてBR-800やBR-1200CD、BR-1600CD（と言っても生産完了から久しいですが）がありますが、
いずれも島さまがご要望されている機能を有しておりません。ご参考までに、以下のような仕様でございます。

・BR-800（2020年販売完了）
センターキャンセルやタイムストレッチができるフレーズ・トレーナー機能を有しておりますが、
本体でオリジナルパターンを作成することができません。PCにインストールする専用ソフトBR-800 Rhythm Editorで作成します。

・BR-1200CD、BR-1600CD（2012年販売完了）
センターキャンセルやタイムストレッチができるフレーズ・トレーナー機能を有しておりません。
オリジナルパターンは本体で作成することができます。

これらを踏まえて、BR-900CDをお使いいただくという選択肢もご一考かと存じます。
ただし、BR-900CDも生産完了から久しく補修部品も枯渇しているため、何かトラブルがあった時に修理を承れない状況であったり、
弊社にも完動実機がなく詳細なサポートが難しいケースがあることをお含みおきください。

以上、ご参考になりましたら幸いです。
なにとぞよろしくお願いいたします。

担当：西村

messages.msg_o:
西村 様、ご連絡ありがとうございました。


各商品の機能を教えていただき、ありがとうございました。

仕様を見ましたが、やはり900CDが一番万能で凄い商品だということが分かりました。



これから、なるべく中古美品を探して購入することで進めていきたいと思います。

もし不具合があり修理になる場合、商品状態や部品の在庫にもよると思いますが、修理自体はしていただけるのでしょうか？

 If there is a problem and it needs to be repaired, it will depend on the condition of the product and the stock of parts, but will you be able to repair it?

せっかくのお問い合わせながら、お力になれず申し訳ございません。

なにとぞよろしくお願いいたします。

Dear Roland East Europe Ltd.!


 I would like to inquire about the service process. I have a Roland TD-11 electric drum that I bought a while ago, but unfortunately the module has been getting harder and harder to turn on in the past month and now it doesn't respond to the power button at all. I bought the drum about 7 years ago, so it's definitely out of warranty and unfortunately I don't even know where the receipt is.



 My question is, is there still a possibility to service this module?

 If so, what would be the process and how would I know how much it would cost to repair it? Is there a way to have it inspected and then decide whether I should request the repair or not based on the amount?



 Thank you,

 Tamas Pamuk

messages.msg_o: Is there anyway to transfer licenses so i can use the products that ive purchased already on my new computer?
messages.name: oren stern
messages.msg: Is there anyway to transfer licenses so i can use the products that ive purchased already on my new computer?

messages.name: Jules Richard
messages.msg:
Hi Oren,

Thanks for contacting us!

A Roland Cloud account can be used on up to five devices at the same time. You just have to install Roland Cloud Manager and from there install the instruments.

If you need to remove a device from your account, you can use Roland Cloud Manager to un-sync that device.



1. In Roland Cloud Manager, click on the "Settings" icon located in the top right corner of the application.
 ![Screen_Shot_2023-02-09_at_2.44.07_PM.png](https://rolandus.zendesk.com/hc/article_attachments/12789487900955)
2. Click on "Preferences."
 ![Screen_Shot_2023-02-09_at_2.45.50_PM.png](https://rolandus.zendesk.com/hc/article_attachments/12789565383195)
3. Click on "Manage my Devices."
 ![rcm_manage_my_devices.png](https://rolandus.zendesk.com/hc/article_attachments/19905056926363)

The Device Manager box will open and allow you to un-sync any non-required devices.
Note: You can sync up to five devices.
 ![rcm_manage_my_devices_2.png](https://rolandus.zendesk.com/hc/article_attachments/19905080104475)

Regards,

Jules

We're sorry to hear you're having this issue.

Try these steps.
If you've already done one of the steps, just move on to the next one.
Please be sure that you've done all of the steps.

1. Make sure that you have **v3.1.16 **of Roland Cloud Manager installed.
2. In the Library of Cloud Manager, update any plug-ins that show an available update.
3. Clear your browser cache.
4. **Restart your computer. If you're on a Mac, make sure that the "reopen windows" isn't selected**
5. Launch Roland Cloud Manager
6. Start your DAW. <--very important!

Regards,

Jules

messages.name: Peter Jowett
messages.msg:
Hello Ian,

Thanks for contacting us, I hope you're well.
I'm sorry for the wait, a few of my colleagues were off ill, myself included - leaving only a few of our agents for all our European tickets.
I'm also sorry for the problems you're having, let's look into it - please check the below points.

USB.
Please ensure that you are using a USB cable that transfers data and that it’s plugged directly into a USB port on your PC. It would be worth trying multiple cables. USB hubs can cause interference with the communication to your PC; the connection needs to be direct. Additionally if it's a desktop, please try using one of the ports on the rear of the tower, so that it's connected directly to the motherboard of your PC.

Driver.
Please ensure that you have the correct driver installed. If you do, it would also be worth uninstalling and reinstalling it. It’s necessary for communication with your PC, any of the MacOS ones below should work.

- Gigcaster8 GCS-8 Driver Ver.1.0.0 for Windows 10 / 11
- Gigcaster8 GCS-8 (MTK-RECORD) Driver Ver.1.0.1 for macOS Big Sur 11.x / Monterey 12.x / Ventura 13.x / Sonoma 14.x / Sequoia 15.x
- Gigcaster8 GCS-8 (MTK-STREAM) Driver Ver.1.0.1 for macOS Sonoma 14.x / Sequoia 15.x
- Gigcaster8 GCS-8 (MTK-STREAM) Driver Ver.1.0.0 for macOS Big Sur 11.x / Monterey 12.x / Ventura 13.x

Factory Reset.
Please try a factory reset, as it can fix many problems.
Gigcaster 8: Restoring the factory settings

From there you should be able to install the latest firmware.
Gigcaster8 GCS-8 System Program (Ver.1.05)

Please let me know if it doesn't work, we can see the next steps from there.
Best Regards,

Pete

Customer Service

Roland Europe Group Ltd

messages.msg_o:
Buongiorno,
pochi giorni fa il ride della mia Roland TD-02KV V-Drums Kit presa su MusicalStore2005 a settembre ha smesso di funzionare correttamente. Dal nulla ha iniziato a non rispondere sempre al tocco della bacchetta, alle volte suona e molte altre no. Ho fatto delle prove con il jack del crash e funziona, quindi immagino che sia il filo/jack difettoso. Neanche a dirlo la batteria è ancora sostanzaliamente nuova e usata benissimo con tutte le accortezze del caso. Non ho mai tirato un filo e sono sempre stato attentissimo a trattarla bene. Volevo chiedere quindi in questi casi come funziona, immagino che si possa chiedere aiuto a voi per sistemare la faccenda, visto che la batteria è ancora in garanzia. Cosa posso fare? Aspetto vostre gentili risposte.
P.S. Se serve posso mangare video per mostrare la situazione.
Product Name: TD-02KV
Serial Number: A7Q1304
Purchase Date: 2024-08-31

messages.name: Alberto Covato
messages.msg:
Good morning,
 a few days ago the ride of my Roland TD-02KV V-Drums Kit bought on MusicalStore2005 in September stopped working properly. Out of nowhere it started not to always respond to the touch of the stick, sometimes it plays and many other times it doesn't. I did some tests with the crash jack and it works, so I imagine that it is the faulty wire/jack. Needless to say, the battery is still substantially new and used very well with all the necessary precautions. I have never pulled a wire and I have always been very careful to treat it well. So I wanted to ask in these cases how it works, I imagine that we can ask you for help to fix the matter, since the battery is still under warranty. What can I do? I await your kind replies.

messages.name: Theo N
messages.msg:
Dear,
I have bought Zenology pro, but every time I want to load the plugin in a DAW (Cakewalk or Zenbeats), the plugin says it is unable to authenticate me. Ihave already tried several times uninstalling everything, rebooting the computer, updating Roland Cloud Manager and re-installing everything, but nothing works.
Best regards,
Théo

messages.name: Jules Richard
messages.msg:
Hi Theo N,

We're sorry to hear you're having this issue.

Try these steps.
If you've already done one of the steps, just move on to the next one.
Please be sure that you've done all of the steps.

1. Make sure that you have **v3.1.16 **of Roland Cloud Manager installed.
2. In the Library of Cloud Manager, update any plug-ins that show an available update.
3. Clear your browser cache.
4. **Restart your computer. If you're on a Mac, make sure that the "reopen windows" isn't selected**
5. Launch Roland Cloud Manager
6. Start your DAW. <--very important!

Regards,

Jules

messages.name: Travis Hartnett
messages.msg:
We recommend rolling back to v3.1.3 of Roland Cloud Manager for the time being.

If you're using Windows, please go to the Windows Control Panel and use Add/Remove Programs to uninstall the current version of Cloud Manager.

If you're using macOS, use the uninstaller included on the installer disk image to uninstall the current version of Cloud Manager.

The installer for v3.1.3 can be found on this page:

If you're using Windows

and here

If you're using macOS 11 or later


Sorry for the inconvenience.

messages.name: Andy Santos
messages.msg:
Hi Jared,

Thanks for contacting us! We're sorry to hear that you're having trouble.

Try first setting up the microphone like the following:

- In the Bridge Cast app, select the type of microphone being used by clicking on the “MIC SETUP” tab and then set the “MIC TYPE” to "DYNAMIC".
 ![](https://rolandus.zendesk.com/attachments/token/1TQ53d6caL8jgQoFhosHgoTYO/?name=image.png)
- Raise the input gain only high enough so that the waveform in the graph averages within the blue area while speaking into the microphone.

If the noise continues, here's a bit of troubleshooting:

- Perform a factory reset and setup the microphone within the app again:
https://static.roland.com/manuals/bridge_cast_x/eng/142246543.html?&k=factory
- Try using the noise suppressor to clean up the audio a bit:
https://static.roland.com/manuals/bridge_cast_x/eng/142248763.html?&k=calibrating
- Test with a different microphone (if you have one available).
- If the microphone being used has a low output (the Shure SM7B has a notoriously low output volume), you could consider using a Cloudlifter to boost the signal without boosting the noise floor:
https://www.cloudmicrophones.com/cloudlifter-cl-1
Note that while we haven't had reports of users generally needing this, some customers do use them. Inline preamps are available in the market to address these specific low output issue from certain microphones:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GkbTdHA42dw

Please let us know how it goes.

Kind regards,
Roland Customer Support

messages.msg_o:
Hey there, thank you for the quick reply.



I do have it setup as dynamic already, and I've raised it to the point where it mostly stays in the blue (which tends to be around 53-57dB). After a factory reset I still have the same issue, and the noise suppressor doesn't do anything to remove the hiss from the audio. I don't have another microphone but I did retest the same sm7b with my GoXLR Mini (another audio interface) and Im not getting the same hiss, even at louder dB gains such as 68dB. I haven't needed a cloudlifter before and the main reason I choose devices like these is to not require one.



I'd like to point out that even without a microphone connected, that hiss is still very apparent in playback.



Thank you.

messages.name: Andy Santos
messages.msg:
Hi Jared,

Thanks for the update. You can try clicking on the MIC CLEANUP tab and try using both GATE and ADAPTIVE types; then adjust the LEVEL beneath each to try to suppress the noise. If the noise still makes the product unusable, you could contact the dealer for an exchange with a different Bridge Cast. However it may be the inherent noise floor of the product.

However please let us know if we can be of any additional assistance.

Kind regards,
Roland Customer Support

Cordialement,

Huw

Roland Europe Group Ltd

messages.msg_o:
Hi there,

I am running version 1.5 firmware on my RC600. I am using it as my audio interface in my DAW Ableton Live 10. (I also have an Orca Worlde Pad connected to it to trigger drum sounds) I have a Lenovo laptop that runs my DAW.  I need serious support when it comes to routing the DAW tracks correctly. My main issue is that I get a constant infinite loop on my headphones when monitoring my audio track. I tried every single routing option in my DAW and on the RC600for over 4 days now. I wanted to input my vocals (via my mixing desk, and going out via SUB GROUP channel)  into INSTR1 input on the RC600. In my DAW I choose External Input 3 (INSTR1 L) but no matter the output choice. The signal is there but I end up with infinite feedback loop on almost all channels as soon as the monitor function is enabled. I want to add vocal effects and other things via the track in my DAW it seems also that the effect on my channel is not getting recorded. When choosing the "individual" function for my headphones on the RC600 all sounds are gone completely from my DAW. It seems that I can hear only recorded loops while everything else is muted that comes from my DAW to the looper.
I wish to achieve a state where I can have a track for my mic only and a track for my guitar only in my DAW, As well as individual tracks for my midi instruments, which seems to work. That would allow me to record and mix performances in a "clean" way. I know its a complicated topic and I researched a lot online already but it seems that there is no public answer to these questions. I appreciate your response in advance and hope that you can help me to guide me through this. Many thanks and greetings. Phillipp Santiago 
Product Name: RC-600
Serial Number: Z2N5304
Purchase Date: 2024-01-04
Purchase Method: Secondhand
Purchase Dealer: No Data

messages.name: Yasuhiro Ando
messages.msg:
塩川様、こんにちは。
お問い合わせをいただきありがとうございます。
RUBIX22で録音ができないとのことでご不便をおかけして申し訳ございません。
お知らせいただいた内容から、RUBIX22の不良が原因ではなく、お使いのパソコンの設定が原因だと思われます。

RUBIX22とWindowsサウンド機能のサンプルレート設定が異なっている場合、RUBIX22でサウンドを再生できない、録音できない、という問題が生じます。恐れ入りますが、以下の記事に記載されている方法で、Windowsのサウンド設定で、出力デバイス、入力デバイスの「形式」を一致させてください。「24ビット 48000Hz」で統一することをおすすめします。

- Rubixシリーズ: サンプル・レートを変更する方法を教えてください。（Windows）
なお、不良品交換については弊窓口では承ることはできません。Amazon指定の方法でお申し出ください。

ご確認のほどよろしくお願いいたします。
担当：あんどう
