messages.msg_o: I'm not sure if this is a bug but I am using Roland cloud on a MacBook pro running Macos Sequoia 15.5. I am using Galaxias. I can play the instruments in galaxias but when I try to add Zenology Fx in the mixer section I get a weird sound that is certainly not any effect. Also, I cannot access any of the reverbs in Zenology Fx. They just don't appear. The other effects like eq, compressor, Chorus etc appears in the menu but not the reverb and the reverb is the most important effect I need right now. It's frustrating. Can you help? It would be greatly appreciated. Thanks in advance.
messages.name: Fabian Sirju
messages.msg: I'm not sure if this is a bug but I am using Roland cloud on a MacBook pro running Macos Sequoia 15.5. I am using Galaxias. I can play the instruments in galaxias but when I try to add Zenology Fx in the mixer section I get a weird sound that is certainly not any effect. Also, I cannot access any of the reverbs in Zenology Fx. They just don't appear. The other effects like eq, compressor, Chorus etc appears in the menu but not the reverb and the reverb is the most important effect I need right now. It's frustrating. Can you help? It would be greatly appreciated. Thanks in advance.

messages.name: Jules Richard
messages.msg:
Hi Fabian,

We're sorry to hear you're having this issue.

It sounds like may be having authorization issues with Zenology FX. Also, the Zenology-FX plugin doesn't have any reverbs, only the Zenology plugin has those. You may want to give the Galaxias reverbs a try.

Try these steps.
If you've already done one of the steps, just move on to the next one.
Please be sure that you've done all of the steps.

1. Make sure that you have **v3.1.16 **of Roland Cloud Manager installed.
2. In the Library of Cloud Manager, update Zenology FX if it shows an available update.
3. Clear your browser cache.
4. **Restart your computer. If you're on a Mac, make sure that the "reopen windows" isn't selected**
5. Launch Roland Cloud Manager
6. Start your DAW.

Regards,

Jules

messages.msg_o:
Hey Jules, thanks for responding. I have done all the steps as indicated but still the same problem. I am using Galaxias in stand alone mode (without DAW). Under the Instrument tab, I added the XV-5080 and launched Program 1, the 128voice Piano. I then went to the Mix tab where I am only seeing two reverbs (Mutiverb and PulseVerb). messages.name: Jules Richard
messages.msg:
Hi Steve,

Thanks for contacting us!

Once you've authorized an instrument, the **authorization is good for up to 30 days**, after which you’ll be prompted to re-enter your password the next time you use a plug-in on a project.

Regards,

Jules

messages.msg_o: Why? I’ve purchased the plug in, so why does it need constant reauthorization?
messages.name: Steve Schutz
messages.msg: Why? I’ve purchased the plug in, so why does it need constant reauthorization?

messages.name: Jules Richard
messages.msg:
Hi Steve,

Thanks for contacting us!

The monthly check-in is simply a security measure, it’s not about re-authorizing ownership. We understand it's not ideal for some customers, and apologize for any inconvenience.

Best regards,
Jules

I I'm trying the free trial for ULTIMATE monthly package. I see that a lot of the legendary instruments (Juno, Jupiter, 808, etc) are not available for download. I was wondering if the reason is beacuse may accont is on free trial mode or if I'm doing something wrong.

Thanks
messages.name: Lorenzo Caballero
messages.msg:
I I'm trying the free trial for ULTIMATE monthly package. I see that a lot of the legendary instruments (Juno, Jupiter, 808, etc) are not available for download. I was wondering if the reason is beacuse may accont is on free trial mode or if I'm doing something wrong.

Thanks

messages.name: Travis Hartnett
messages.msg:
Hello Lorenzo Caballero,

Thanks for contacting us!
The Roland Cloud 30-day Ultimate trial includes almost everything that a paid Ultimate membership provides:

- All of the plugin virtual instruments, including Zenology Pro
- All of the expansion patches and patterns for those plugins
- All of the Zenology sound, wave and model expansions, which can be used in the Zenology plugin
- Zenbeats
- Galaxias

What's **not** included in the trial:

- Any of the Sample Packs or Jam Tracks
- Any of the hardware-enabled sound, wave and model expansions for use on Zen-Core hardware

messages.msg_o:
Hi there, I own a Fantom 07. I just bought a WC-1 adaptor which comes with a year or pro membership.....which i hope enables me to avail of the play 4 Life offer?. My issue is, i'm trying install Jupiter 8 onto my Fantom.......and even though it reads I have installed the exp into my computer....I can't find it to drag it onto a usb stick!...Please let me know if the WC-1 adapter is useless with Fantom 07? and even if thats the case how can i get the exp pack onto my board....i have watched every possible video. 
Thank you
David
messages.name: David Walsh
messages.msg:
Hi there, I own a Fantom 07. I just bought a WC-1 adaptor which comes with a year or pro membership.....which i hope enables me to avail of the play 4 Life offer?. My issue is, i'm trying install Jupiter 8 onto my Fantom.......and even though it reads I have installed the exp into my computer....I can't find it to drag it onto a usb stick!...Please let me know if the WC-1 adapter is useless with Fantom 07? and even if thats the case how can i get the exp pack onto my board....i have watched every possible video. 
Thank you
David

messages.name: Jules Richard
messages.msg:
Hi David,

Thanks for reaching out!

Sorry, the Fantom series isn't compatible with the WC-1. If your Fantom _was_ compatible, you'd be able to install Model Expansions using the Roland Cloud Connect app on your iOS or Android device.

To install Model Expansions via USB flash drive instead, you'd need to purchase a "Lifetime Key" for the product. After that, you can download it from the Hardware Instruments section on Roland Cloud, then transfer the files to your USB flash drive.

Let me know if you have any other questions — happy to help.

Best regards,
Jules

messages.msg_o: I can't authorize my license for Zenology Pro. I'm just a hobbyist. I don't have a lot of time to play with my plugins and DAW and all I've been doing today is getting frustrated with this issue.
messages.name: Matt Tuggle
messages.msg: I can't authorize my license for Zenology Pro. I'm just a hobbyist. I don't have a lot of time to play with my plugins and DAW and all I've been doing today is getting frustrated with this issue.

messages.name: Jules Richard
messages.msg:
Hi Matt Tuggle,

We're sorry to hear you're having this issue.

Try these steps.
If you've already done one of the steps, just move on to the next one.
Please be sure that you've done all of the steps.

1. Make sure that you have **v3.1.16 **of Roland Cloud Manager installed.
2. In the Library of Cloud Manager, update Zenology Pro if it shows an available update.
3. Clear your browser cache.
4. **Restart your computer. If you're on a Mac, make sure that the "reopen windows" isn't selected**
5. Launch Roland Cloud Manager
6. Start your DAW. <--very important!

Regards,

Jules

messages.msg_o: Yeah. Ive done all that multiple times. Uninstalled and reinstalled Zenology, too.

messages.msg_o:
I just purchased the E-X10 keyboard, plugged it in and turned it on. 
Isn't the display supposed to light up? This one does not. Is there a switch somewhere? 
I can barely see the tiny letters, had to get a flashlight. Am I doing something wrong? The manual doesn't show a switch for the display...help!
Product Name: E-X10
Serial Number: 9C38933
Purchase Date: 2025-05-30
Purchase Method: In a store
Purchase Dealer: LONG & MCQUADE
messages.name: Steve Cogan
messages.msg:
I just purchased the E-X10 keyboard, plugged it in and turned it on. 
Isn't the display supposed to light up? This one does not. Is there a switch somewhere? 
I can barely see the tiny letters, had to get a flashlight. Am I doing something wrong? The manual doesn't show a switch for the display...help!
Product Name: E-X10
Serial Number: 9C38933
Purchase Date: 2025-05-30
Purchase Method: In a store
Purchase Dealer: LONG & MCQUADE

messages.name: Vincent Cifarelli
messages.msg: **Dan Amorim**

messages.name: Dan Amorim
messages.msg:
Hello Steve,

We're very sorry to hear this. There is no switch to turn the display on or off.

It is most likely that either the display is defective, or there might be a loose connection inside.

Our recommendation is to take it to your nearest Roland authorized service centre. You can locate them here: Roland - Support - Service & Repair - Repairs and Parts

Please let us know if you have any other questions.

Kindly,

Dan

Dan Amorim
Piano Products Sales Manager, Roland Canada

messages.msg_o:
Thanks Dan,
Are you sure it is supposed to light up?
It does actually work, it just doesn't light.


Sent from Rogers Yahoo Mail on Android
messages.name: Steve Cogan
messages.msg:
Thanks Dan,
Are you sure it is supposed to light up?
It does actually work, it just doesn't light.


Sent from Rogers Yahoo Mail on Android

messages.name: Dan Amorim
messages.msg:
Hello Steve,

I am sorry that I think I misunderstood your question the first time reading through.

The display is not "back-lit" and so it doesn't have any additional lighting beyond what you see.

It is not great in a dimly-lit room. It's important to have adequate lighting for a non-backlit LCD.

The E-X50 has a backlit display but of course, it is a higher price point and might not be affordable for you at this time.

Kind regards,

Dan

Dan Amorim
Piano Products Sales Manager, Roland Canada

messages.msg_o:
Ok, thanks for checking that, Dan


Sent from Rogers Yahoo Mail on Android
messages.name: Steve Cogan
messages.msg:
Ok, thanks for checking that, Dan


Sent from Rogers Yahoo Mail on Android

messages.name: Dan Amorim
messages.msg:
You're welcom Steve.

Dan Amorim
Piano Products Sales Manager, Roland Canada

please help
messages.name: Adam Horgan
messages.msg:
my authorisation for the juno-60 soft synth i purchased is not working
i have checked my password and email are correct but still not working.
i have an active membership under adamhorgan1@gmail.com and a lifetime licence for the juno-60 soft synth.

please help

messages.name: Jules Richard
messages.msg:
Hi Adam Horgan,

We're sorry to hear you're having this issue.

Try these steps.
If you've already done one of the steps, just move on to the next one.
Please be sure that you've done all of the steps.

1. Make sure that you have **v3.1.16 **of Roland Cloud Manager installed.
2. In the Library of Cloud Manager, update any plug-ins that show an available update.
3. Clear your browser cache.
4. **Restart your computer. If you're on a Mac, make sure that the "reopen windows" isn't selected**
5. Launch Roland Cloud Manager
6. Start your DAW. <--very important!

Regards,

Jules

messages.msg_o:
I purchased the PM-100 amp for my son, who connected it to a electronic drum set. After a little over a month of the amp just sitting there, my son finally tested it out 3 days ago and discovered that the amp doesn't work for more than a minute. He had to constantly turn it OFF and ON to make the amp work. So, I tried to return it to the seller, but since the return window had already closed, the seller told me he can't take it back; so, he asked me to contact Roland to see if it can serviced and repaired. It does appear to be defective, and my son only used it once. Wouldn't the repair service be covered under the warranty? Please let me know. Thank you

Bonjour,
Je tente d'installer des Wave Expansion, des SCENE et des MODEL, mais j'ai le message d'erreur "Incorrect File!".
Mon équipement est un Fantom 8 en EX 1.0 Build 04.12 Serial Number Z6P6375 . 
J'ai pu installer le World Expansion "India General" EXZ101.
Mais tous les Wave Expansion (EXZ001-EXZ015) font remonter cette erreur "Incorrect File!", alors que je maintiens la touche "Tempo" au lancement du Fantom, et que j'ai bien mis à la racine les fichiers .EXZ et .PNG en les téléchargeant ce jour.
Auriez vous une explication ?
Merci par avance.
messages.name: Stéphane DELANNOY
messages.msg:
Good morning,
 I'm trying to install Wave Expansion, SCENE, and MODEL, but I get the error message "Incorrect File!".
 My equipment is a Fantom 8 in EX 1.0 Build 04.12 Serial Number Z6P6375 .

 But all Wave Expansions (EXZ001-EXZ015) give this "Incorrect File!" error, even though I hold down the "Tempo" key when launching the Fantom, and I have correctly put the .EXZ and .PNG files in the root directory when downloading them today.
 Do you have an explanation?
 Thank you in advance.

messages.name: Dan Diamond
messages.msg:
Hi Thomas,

We apologize for the mix up. I found the order you placed for the drum head and confirmed this is not the correct one. I've created a return authorization in place on RA#1419371 to get the incorrect head back from you at no charge. My shipping associate will email you prepaid UPS return label within the next 24 hours, and we'll get that one swapped out for the correct head.

Once you receive the return label, just drop the head off at any UPS location and show them the prepaid label on your phone or printed out and they'll take it from there.

Let me know once it's dropped off so we can keep track of it. Per our warranty policy, as soon as we get that one back the correct one will ship.

Be on the lookout from an email from my associate Frank for the return label and let me know if you have any questions along the way.


Best,

Dan Diamond





DW Drums Customer Support

messages.msg_o: For some reason my Juno 106 virtual instrument won't authorise even though I have  a lifetime key
messages.name: RORY A PRESTON
messages.msg: For some reason my Juno 106 virtual instrument won't authorise even though I have  a lifetime key

messages.name: Jules Richard
messages.msg:
Hi RORY A PRESTON,

We're sorry to hear you're having this issue.

Try these steps.
If you've already done one of the steps, just move on to the next one.
Please be sure that you've done all of the steps.

1. Make sure that you have **v3.1.16 **of Roland Cloud Manager installed.
2. In the Library of Cloud Manager, update any plug-ins that show an available update.
3. Clear your browser cache.
4. **Restart your computer. If you're on a Mac, make sure that the "reopen windows" isn't selected**
5. Launch Roland Cloud Manager
6. Start your DAW. <--very important!

Regards,

Jules

I downloaded the latest v3.1.16 so I don’t know why I cant install this. Please help asap





Ken

 ![](https://support.roland.com/attachments/token/YA5x72pxpcD9FqLMSmPkGngti/?name=Screen+Shot+2025-06-14+at+4.51.18+PM.png)
messages.name: Ken Nana
messages.msg:
Hi


I purchased the 7x7 Expansion on Roland Cloud and follows all of the steps but when I try to install on my TR-8 I keep getting this “Incompatible version of Roland Cloud Manager” error:



I downloaded the latest v3.1.16 so I don’t know why I cant install this. Please help asap





Ken

 ![](https://support.roland.com/attachments/token/YA5x72pxpcD9FqLMSmPkGngti/?name=Screen+Shot+2025-06-14+at+4.51.18+PM.png)

messages.name: Jules Richard
messages.msg:
Hi Ken,

Sorry to hear you're having this issue.

We recommend rolling back to v3.1.3 of Roland Cloud Manager for the time being.

If you're using Windows, please go to the Windows Control Panel and use Add/Remove Programs to uninstall the current version of Cloud Manager.

If you're using macOS, use the uninstaller included on the installer disk image to uninstall the current version of Cloud Manager.

The installer for v3.1.3 can be found on this page:

If you're using Windows

and here

If you're using macOS 11 or later

and here

If you're using macOS 10.14 or 10.15


Sorry for the inconvenience,

Jules

messages.name: Jules Richard
messages.msg:
Hi IP,

Thanks for contacting us!

The Roland Cloud Manager (RCM) would only be used to download the SPD-SX Pro app. RCM is also used to install the Roland Cloud instruments and expansions. The SPD-SX drivers are downloaded separately via Roland’s website.

What happens when you try to open RCM and which version do you have installed?

Regards,

Jules

messages.msg_o:
Hi Jules -



Thanks for your message. I'm getting lost with all the attempts to download the SPD-SX PRO App in order to use it w/ my SPD SX Pro. Ready to throw in the towel and wondering what my warranty is like at this point.



I have a new MacBook Pro running Mac OS 15.5 Sequoia with settings enabled to download apps. My mac works w/ 99.9% of all tools / apps, etc. However not so much w/ the Roland Apps.



Each time I attempt to download the SPD SX Pro APP it shows the % downloading going to 90%+, but never shows it going to 100%. What do you mean, **_'What happens when you try to open RCM and which version do you have installed?"_** Version of what installed? RCM?



My Mac shows the RCM as a musical note but not the standard App logo (if that makes sense).



What other support is available to resolve this issue? Or should I just look at sending in via RMA or returning the product. I've already lost days worth of productivity and cannot use it for musical settings.



Please advise, Thanks

IP

messages.name: Jules Richard
messages.msg:
Hi IP,

Give this a try:

1. In the top right hand corner, click on Settings
2. Select Preferences
3. Click the "Advanced Options" button
4. Check the "Show Plugin Installer" option.
5. Close the window
6. Restart Cloud Manager
7. Install the desired product

 ![](https://support.roland.com/attachments/token/51WmEMVBKb014iF1mzIms7IdC/?name=Screenshot+2024-11-27+at+11.05.09%E2%80%AFAM.png)

Regards,

Jules

messages.msg_o:
Hi Jules -



It worked, thanks!🙏🏼



I removed RCM, reloaded it for MAC OS 14 & above, then followed your preferences/ advanced options instructions and restored RCM to successfully load the APP.



I did peruse ‘advanced options’ in earlier attempts, just didn’t have proper guidance at the time. Kudos to you!



Big sigh of relief now, and thanks for sticking w/me on this issue.



Appreciate all your troubleshooting support.



Cheers!



IP

messages.name: Eric Highsmith
messages.msg:
Hi Christopher,

Here is your Return Authorization (RA) number for your VERSELAB MV-1: RA# S14906680

Please use appropriate packaging and ship to the following address:

Roland Corporation US
15750 Mountain Ave
Chino, CA 91708

Please note - our factory service center does NOT have a will call area for drop offs or pickups, therefore all products must be shipped to the above address with UPS/FedEx. There is no postal service available at our service location, SO PLEASE DO NOT SHIP VIA USPS. Please make sure signature is required for package delivery.

Personnel at this address are not authorized to receive repairs directly from customers. Any attempt to drop off units will be rejected.

Please write your RA# clearly on the outside of the shipping box underneath the address. If this is a warranty repair, please place a copy of your sales receipt inside the box. We recommend that you insure your VERSELAB MV-1 with your shipping carrier to cover any accidental damage or loss that may occur in the shipping process.

For non-warranty repairs, we will contact you with an estimate after we have inspected your VERSELAB MV-1. In most cases this will be 3-5 business days after we receive it.

Kind Regards,
Roland Service Department

Eric

Jules

messages.msg_o:
RAM usage of Cloud Manager is out of control. 

I was concerned of the excessive usage (about 550M) of memory required just to run DW Soundworks. Apparently the solve was to update to the latest version of RCM. So I did.

Now it's using 720M. See screenshot: https://ibb.co/4v5QhV6

The MacOS Finder doesn't even use HALF that. And that's the computer's operating system. 

What's up? I get it, devs don't like paying the license fee for iLok. But this is a not-insignificant drain on resources - just to make sure I'm not stealing anything. Come on - we can get that number down, can't we?

Now it's using 720M. See screenshot: https://ibb.co/4v5QhV6

The MacOS Finder doesn't even use HALF that. And that's the computer's operating system. 

What's up? I get it, devs don't like paying the license fee for iLok. But this is a not-insignificant drain on resources - just to make sure I'm not stealing anything. Come on - we can get that number down, can't we?

messages.name: Travis Hartnett
messages.msg:
Hello Judson Snell,

Thanks for contacting us!
Cloud Manager is essentially a standalone browser, loaded with content, so the fact that uses that amount of memory isn't unusual.

However, you don't need to have Cloud Manager running unless you're updating, installing or uninstalling something.

Please let us know if you have further questions concerning this matter, and thanks for choosing Roland.

Regards,

Travis

messages.msg_o:
Good day. I’ve been setting up my newest 2019 Mac Pro 16 core 192GB RAM 2 TB SSD and have downloaded and installed my Roland Cloud Manager to obtain all my files that I’ve been working on from my previous Mac Pro 2012 8 Core 64 GB RAM 480 GB SSD. First thing I noticed when I started Logic Pro to access the ZENOLOGY plugin was that the plugin window when opened as a software instrument in Logic Pro is substantially smaller than what I was used to on the previous computer. The display monitor from the previous computer is now being used with the newer 2019 Mac Pro, resolution is the same and has not been changed. Can the ZENOLOGY plugin window be re-sized?, if yes, how? Also, I noticed that none of my User Presets that I created and saved from my Jupiter X and Fantom 7 are not in the ZENOLOGY plugin on the 2019 Mac Pro. Where are my User presets? Thank you for your time, Roger Parenteau.
Product Name: FANTOM 7
Serial Number: Z3k0137
Purchase Date: 2019-10-22
Purchase Method: Online
Purchase Dealer: GUITAR CENTER #122

messages.name: Travis Hartnett
messages.msg:
Hello Roger Parenteau,

Thanks for contacting us!
The Zenology UI window can be resized by click dragging the bottom right corner of the plugin window. The edit and browser views cannot be resized.

Zenology user presets are stored in this location:

/Users/YOUR_USER/Library/Application Support/Roland Cloud/ZENOLOGY/

Please let us know if you have further questions concerning this matter, and thanks for choosing Roland.

Regards,

Travis

Hi Bevan,

messages.msg_o:
Hi there is an issue with my sh-01a.  I have turned off all the lfo triggers and the lfo still effects my sounds.  I went through the manual and also used various AI to trouble shoot.  It Seems Roland is aware of this issue and it is a hardware manufacturing/ wiring issue.  What do we do to fix this issue?
******
If the LFO still affects the sound despite all sliders being at 0 and switches correctly set, it could indicate a malfunction, as reported by some users who experienced persistent LFO effects due to faulty wiring.
• In such cases, contact Roland support or your retailer, especially if the unit is under warranty, to check for hardware issues.
Product Name: SH-01A
Serial Number: A5P5515
Purchase Date: 2023-10-13
Purchase Method: In a store
Purchase Dealer: STORE DJ SYDNEY

messages.msg:
Hi James,

What have you found to suggest "Roland is aware of this issue and it is a hardware manufacturing/ wiring issue"?

It's not something I've encountered before, but I'm happy to investigate further if there is any published info to suggest it's a recurring issue.

Is that info below the ***** copied from our knowledge base or somewhere, or is that just the AI bot giving you this?

Firstly... Can you confirm you are running the latest SH-01A System Program ( Ver.1.08 )?

 ![](https://rolandus.zendesk.com/attachments/token/d8axXHM0JE7kuMrmlC8BmdUCt/?name=image.png)

Secondly... Have you tried a factory reset of the unit?

 ![](https://rolandus.zendesk.com/attachments/token/3yxZgycXZAC5Z45OGxYWueTdo/?name=image.png)
Thirdly... If both of those aren't getting any change, Could you please send a Video of the issue occurring so I can see exactly what you are referring to in action? So I can try and replicate the issue on an SH01A on my end.



Kind Regards,
**Braedon Good**
Technical Support/Customer Service
Roland Australia

messages.name: Kosuke Miura
messages.msg:
橋詰 英治様

ローランド（株）修理受付窓口です。

CUBE Streetをご愛用いただき、誠にありがとうございます。

電池、アダプターご使用時に電源が入らなくなったとのことで、ご不便をおかけして大変申し訳ありません。

以下、点検／修理のお手続きについてご案内させていただきます。

＜修理に出していただく方法につきまして＞
ローランド製品を取り扱われる楽器店様にお持ち込みいただき、修理の取り次ぎをご依頼する方法と、楽器店様を介さず、弊社修理センターへ宅配便にて直送する方法がございます（弊社修理センターではお持ち込みは受付できませんのでご了承ください）。

最寄りのローランド製品を取り扱う楽器店様に持ち込んでいただき、修理の取り次ぎを依頼していただくのが、最も安全でお手間がかからない方法と存じます。ご購入先の楽器店様でなくてもローランド製品を取り扱っておられる楽器店様でしたらお取り次ぎいただけると存じます。
※楽器店様に持ち込まれる場合は、最終的な修理料金や納期などは楽器店様にてご確認ください。
※お持ち込みの前に、楽器店様にお電話で諸条件をご確認いただきますようお願いいたします。

楽器店様へのお持ち込みが困難な場合は、弊社へ宅配便で直送いただいても結構です。

以下、弊社修理センターへ直送していただく場合についてのご案内です。
●修理の流れ
１）まず現物を宅配便などで弊社修理センターに送っていただきます
※弊社へ直送いただく場合の送料はご負担をお願いします。ご返却時の送料は弊社が負担いたします。
※弊社への着荷・受領のご連絡はしておりません。ご了承ください
※修理センターは修理品のお持ち込みを受け付けることができませんので、宅配便をご利用ください
※弊社は土・日・祝は非営業日です。修理品の受領は翌営業日になります

２）製品全体を点検し修理料金を見積もります
※通常は見積りが出るのは着荷より7～8営業日後となりますが、症状によってはさらに日数を要することもございます
※点検開始後は、修理をなさらない場合でも点検料（税込3,300円）のご請求となりますのでご了承ください
※修理実施の場合は点検料は頂戴しません
※点検料は作業量により多少変動することがあります

３）修理料金の見積額およびお支払い方法をメールにてご連絡します

４）修理を進めるようご指示いただきましたら作業にかかり、準備ができ次第宅配便でお送りします

●修理品の直送につきまして

＜お送りいただきたいもの＞
＊本体
＊ACアダプター
＊メモ（以下の項目を記載したメモを添付してください）
　・ 修理受付番号：R07003522
　・ お名前／ご住所／お電話番号
　・ 修理内容／症状など

＜送付先住所＞
〒133-0065
東京都江戸川区南篠崎町1-7-4　ローランド関東流通センター3F
ローランド修理センター
電話： → 記載不要です
※送料は発送時のみご負担をお願いします。弊社からの発送につきましては弊社が負担します
※破損事故回避のため、十分な梱包をお願いします
※見積後の修理のご発注からご返却までの所要日数は12営業日程度の見込みですが、作業内容により前後いたします
※このメールに記載の内容は現時点の状況をお知らせするものであり、部品在庫などの状況が変動いたしますため、お早めのご発送をお願いいたします

ご案内は以上となりますが、なにかございましたらお気軽にお問い合わせください。
どうぞよろしくおねがいいたします。

修理受付担当：三浦

messages.msg_o:
Miura様



お世話になっております、橋詰です。

早速のご回答をありがとうございます。

二点ほど確認させて頂きたく思います:



1 最寄りの楽器店に持ち込む場合、御社と楽器店の間の配送費の負担はどうなりますでしょうか



2 おおよその修理代のレンジを教えていただけますでしょうか。場合によっては、新品を購入する方がよいかの判断材料にしたく思います



宜しくお願いいたします。





橋詰
messages.name: 英治 橋詰
messages.msg:
Dear Miura,



 Thank you for your support, this is Hashizume.

 Thank you for your quick response.

 I would like to confirm two things:



 1. If I bring it to the nearest music store, who will cover the shipping costs between your company and the store?



 2 Could you please tell me the approximate range of repair costs? I would like to use this as a basis for deciding whether it would be better to buy a new one.



 Thank you for your cooperation.





 Bridge

messages.name: Kosuke Miura
messages.msg:
橋詰 英治様

ローランド（株）修理受付窓口です。

お問い合わせいただき、ありがとうございます。以下回答させていただきます。


> 1 最寄りの楽器店に持ち込む場合、御社と楽器店の間の配送費の負担はどうなりますでしょうか


楽器店様にお取り次ぎいただく場合、弊社への送料、その他諸条件は販売店様で取り決めとなりますので、販売店様にご相談いただければと存じます。
弊社製品の修理受け付けを多く取り扱われる大手の販売店様にご依頼されることをお勧めします。都内でしたら、ご購入先の山野楽器様や島村楽器様、イシバシ楽器様、イケベ楽器様等がよろしいかと存じます。


> 2 おおよその修理代のレンジを教えていただけますでしょうか。場合によっては、新品を購入する方がよいかの判断材料にしたく思います


電源が入らない症状の原因は多岐にわたるため、修理費用につきましては現物を実際にお預かりして点検してみませんと、正確にお伝えすることは難しいですが、過去の事例から電源スイッチの故障の場合は、部品料＋技術料で税込6,000円程度、バッテリー・パックが故障している場合は、12,000円程度が予測されます。

引き続きご検討いただければと存じます。

修理受付担当：三浦

messages.msg_o:
三浦様


お世話になっております、橋詰です。

修理をするにあたって一つご相談があります。

このアンプを使って、PAのない場所（屋内）で３０名程度の観客を想定したライブをしようと思っています。

このアンプではボーカルで使う予定なのですが、音量的に大丈夫と思われますか。

修理と違う話で恐縮ですが、修理を行うかどうかの判断として大事なポイントになってきますのでアドバイスをいただければ幸いです。



また、ACアダプターは送付しなくても大丈夫でしょうか。梱包の際、うっかりして入れ忘れてしまいました。可能であれば、ACアダプター無しで修理をお願いしたく思います。



以上、よろしくお願いいたします。





橋詰
messages.name: 英治 橋詰
messages.msg:
Mr. Miura


 Thank you for your support, this is Hashizume.

 I have a question regarding repairs.

 I plan to use this amp for a live performance in a location without a PA (indoors) for an audience of about 30 people.

 I'm planning on using this amp for vocals, do you think the volume will be okay?

 I'm sorry that this is unrelated to repairs, but this is an important point in deciding whether or not to have the repairs done, so I would appreciate any advice you can give me.



 Also, is it okay if I don't send the AC adapter? I accidentally forgot to include it when packing the product. If possible, I would like to have the product repaired without the AC adapter.



 Thank you for your cooperation.





 Bridge

messages.name: Kosuke Miura
messages.msg:
橋詰 英治様

ローランド（株）修理受付窓口 三浦です。

お問い合わせいただき、ありがとうございます。
屋内で30名程度を想定したライブでボーカルにご使用が可能かとのお問い合わせをいただきました。
どういった編成でのライブ演奏か、バックの楽器の音量などによると思われます。

ソロボーカルであれば問題ないかと思われます。
バックがアコースティック楽器の場合は編成次第（楽器の生音の音量次第）かと思われます。
アコースティックドラムのような生音が大音量の楽器を含むバンドの場合はCUBE Streetでは無理かと思われます。

ACアダプターはお送りいただかなくても修理の対応は可能ですので、ご安心ください。

引き続きご検討よろしくお願いします。

修理受付担当：三浦

messages.msg_o:
三浦様


お世話になっております、橋詰です。

アドバイスいただきありがとうございます、バックバンド（ギター、ベース、ドラム）付きなのですが、全体的に音量は控えめなので、検討の結果修理をお願いすることといたしました。

本日ヤマトにてお送りしましたので、明日16日に到着予定です。

見積のほど、よろしくお願いいたします。





橋詰
messages.name: 英治 橋詰
messages.msg:
Mr. Miura


 Thank you for your support, this is Hashizume.

 Thank you for your advice. Although it comes with a backing band (guitar, bass, drums), the overall volume is quite low, so after careful consideration, we have decided to ask for repairs.

 It was sent via Yamato today, so it is expected to arrive tomorrow, the 16th.

 Thank you for the estimate.





 Bridge

messages.name: Taichi Nishimura
messages.msg:
関山さま、こんにちは。

お問い合わせをいただきありがとうございます。

EXP ペダルをボリューム・ペダルとして使用する際の下限値を任意で設定したい場合は、以下の手順にて設定を行ってください。
※パッチごとに設定を行う必要がございます。

1. 該当のパッチを選びます。
2. EDIT > MASTER > PEDAL / GK CTL > EXP > EXP FUNCTION を「OFF」に設定します。
※ この画面にて SYSTEM SETTING と表示され設定変更が出来ない場合は、トップ画面に戻って以下の操作を行ったあと、再度手順 1. から設定を行ってください。

> 1) [EDIT] を押し、PAGE [＜] [＞] を押して「SYSTEM」タブを選びます。
>
> 2) カーソル [＜] [＞] で「PEDAL/GK CTL」を選び、 [ENTER]を押します。
>
> 3) PAGE [＜] [＞] を押して「EXP」タブを選びます。
>
> 4) ダイヤルを回して「OFF」を選択します。
>
> 5) [EXIT] ボタンを押して元の画面に戻ります。

3. [EXIT] ボタンを押して、画面をひとつ戻ります。
4. 続いて [▲] [▼] [＜] [＞] カーソル・ボタンを押して「ASSIGN」アイコンを選びます。
5. [ENTER] ボタンを押します。
6. PAGE [＜] [＞] ボタンを押して SWITCH が OFF になっているタブを選びます。
7. VALUE ダイヤルで SWITCH を「ON」に切り替え、その他のパラメーターを以下のように設定します。
（SWITCH　　：ON）
TARGET　　　：PATCH LEVEL
TARGET MIN　：50
TARGET MAX　：100
SOURCE　　　：EXP
ACT RANGE LO：0
ACT RANGE HI：100
8. [EXIT] ボタンを何度か押して、元の画面に戻ります。
9. EXP ペダルを操作して、意図通りに調整できるか確認します。
10. 設定に問題がなければ、[WRITE] ボタンを押して設定を保存します。

なにとぞよろしくお願いいたします。

担当：西村

messages.msg_o: I am constantly getting error dialogs saying that I have an Authorization Error - RCM Service not connected Error connecting to Roland Cloud Manage Service on my Mac Mini M4 running Sequoia
messages.name: Mark Johnston
messages.msg: I am constantly getting error dialogs saying that I have an Authorization Error - RCM Service not connected Error connecting to Roland Cloud Manage Service on my Mac Mini M4 running Sequoia

messages.name: Travis Hartnett
messages.msg:
Hi Mark Johnston,

We're sorry to hear you're having this issue.

Try these steps.
If you've already done one of the steps, just move on to the next one.
Please be sure that you've done all of the steps.

1. Make sure that you have **v3.1.16 **of Roland Cloud Manager installed.
2. In the Library of Cloud Manager, update any plug-ins that show an available update.
3. Clear your browser cache.
4. **Restart your computer. If you're on a Mac, make sure that the "reopen windows" isn't selected**
5. Launch Roland Cloud Manager
6. Start your DAW. <--very important!

Regards,

Travis

messages.msg_o: I think I have a perpetual license of system 8 but I can't find it and can't run stand alone.
messages.name: zac coarson
messages.msg: I think I have a perpetual license of system 8 but I can't find it and can't run stand alone.

messages.name: Travis Hartnett
messages.msg:
Hello zac coarson,

Thanks for contacting us!
You do have a lifetime key for the System-8 plugin.

The VST/AU/AAX plug-ins are installed in the operating system default locations and must remain there.

**macOS**
/Library/Audio/Plug-Ins/Components
/Library/Audio/Plug-Ins/VST
/Library/Audio/Plug-Ins/VST3
/Library/Application Support/Avid/Audio/Plug-Ins

**Windows**
C:\Program Files\VstPlugins
C:\Program Files\Common Files\VST3
C:\Program Files\Common Files\Avid\Audio\Plug-Ins\Roland\

Please let us know if you have further questions concerning this matter, and thanks for choosing Roland.

Regards,

Travis

messages.msg_o:
Play4life offer for existing members

Hi!
I have an ultimate membership valid till 6 September 2025. When I buy the play4life offer for 1 year with 1 lifetime key for $99,-, will this run then to 6 September 2026?
Another question, I still have 2 lifetime keys that I can claim, are they eligible forever?
Thanks already!

Patrick
messages.name: Patrick van Dijk
messages.msg:
Play4life offer for existing members

Hi!
I have an ultimate membership valid till 6 September 2025. When I buy the play4life offer for 1 year with 1 lifetime key for $99,-, will this run then to 6 September 2026?
Another question, I still have 2 lifetime keys that I can claim, are they eligible forever?
Thanks already!

Patrick

messages.name: Travis Hartnett
messages.msg:
Hello Patrick Dijk,

Thanks for contacting us!
You can't downgrade from an Ultimate to a Pro membership. You'd have to cancel your Ultimate membership, wait for it to end, then purchase a Pro membership.

_Another question, I still have 2 lifetime keys that I can claim, are they eligible forever?_
There's no expiration date.

Please let us know if you have further questions concerning this matter, and thanks for choosing Roland.

Regards,

Travis

購入日: 2022-06-28
購入方法: 店頭
購入店: 島村楽器 あべの and 店

Issue:
**発生している症状：**
F5-C6の音域の鍵盤が反応しない（音が出ない）

**症状の詳細：**
- 対象音域（F5-C6）の鍵盤を押しても音が出ない
- ディスプレイ上で該当鍵盤が緑色に点灯せず、打鍵信号自体が検出されていない状況
- どの音色を選択しても同様に反応しない
- MIDI出力機能も動作していないことを確認済み

**発生時期：**
2025年6月15日より発生

**発生頻度：**
常時発生（該当音域は全く反応しない状態が継続）

**発生条件：**
- ヘッドホン接続時に現象を確認
- 音色に関係なく発生

**接続環境：**
ヘッドホン接続、PC接続時のMIDI出力でも同様の問題を確認

**補足情報：**
- 2025年6月14日時点では正常に動作していた（PC接続で使用可能）
- 朝の使用開始時に問題を発見
- 同日（6/14）にcutoffパラメーターが0付近まで乱高下する現象も発生したが、電源のon/off操作で解消済み
- factory resetを実行したが問題は解消されず

 - No matter which tone you choose, it doesn't respond the same
 - MIDI output function is also not working.

 **Time of occurrence:**
 Occurs from June 15, 2025

 **Frequency of occurrence:**
 Constant occurrence (the corresponding range continues to have no reaction at all)

 **Conditions for occurrence:**
 - The issue was confirmed when headphones were connected.
 - Occurs regardless of tone

 **Connection environment:**
 The same problem was confirmed when using headphones and MIDI output when connected to a PC.

 **Additional Information:**
 - As of June 14, 2025, it was working properly (can be used with a PC connection)
 - Found a problem when starting up in the morning
 - On the same day (6/14), the cutoff parameter fluctuated wildly to around 0, but this was resolved by turning the power on and off.
 - I did a factory reset but the problem persisted

messages.msg: I have a issue , I just purchased zenology through your Roland cloud website but can I can’t install it onto my iOS 10 Mac book pro

messages.name: Jules Richard
messages.msg:
Hi Al,

Thanks for contacting us!

I’m guessing you meant macOS instead of iOS. Nevertheless, Zenology Pro and Roland Cloud Manager require you to have the minimum of macOS 11 installed.

Regards,

Jules

messages.msg_o: I apologize for the confusion, and that is very unfortunate. Is there any way I wouldnt have to use Roland cloud to use zenology? Also if not will a refund be possible?
messages.name: Al Duran
messages.msg: I apologize for the confusion, and that is very unfortunate. Is there any way I wouldnt have to use Roland cloud to use zenology? Also if not will a refund be possible?

messages.name: Jules Richard
messages.msg:
Hi Al,

You can try rolling back to RCM v3.1.3 of Roland Cloud Manager for the time being. This version is unsupported and you may still run into errors as Zenology is for use on macOS 11.

If you're using macOS 10.14 or 10.15

Regards,

Jules

messages.name: Jules Richard

It does not count towards the Pro membership selections. Bear in mind that if you choose an instrument for the Pro membership, the system won't let you choose it as a Play 4 Life reward. You'd just have to un-select the instrument using the Pro Access Selector and you can claim as your reward.

Jules

messages.msg_o: I'm getting an error message that says my Roland subsciption is no longer valid in Ableton Live. I have an active P4L subscription and I know I'm entering the correct password because it signs me into the app as well as the web portal.
messages.name: Walt Gaudino
messages.msg: I'm getting an error message that says my Roland subsciption is no longer valid in Ableton Live. I have an active P4L subscription and I know I'm entering the correct password because it signs me into the app as well as the web portal.

messages.name: Jules Richard
messages.msg:
Hi Walt,

We're sorry to hear you're having this issue.

Try these steps.
If you've already done one of the steps, just move on to the next one.
Please be sure that you've done all of the steps.

1. Make sure that you have **v3.1.16 **of Roland Cloud Manager installed.
2. In the Library of Cloud Manager, update any plug-ins that show an available update.
3. Clear your browser cache.
4. **Restart your computer. If you're on a Mac, make sure that the "reopen windows" isn't selected**
5. Launch Roland Cloud Manager
6. Start your DAW. <--very important!

Regards,

Jules

messages.name: Austin Sandick
messages.msg:
Hello Ben,

Thanks for reaching out and contacting Roland BOSS USA Operational Product Support about the VE-500.

The harmonies on the VE-500 can be controlled from a MIDI Keyboard as a note source. This can be used to control things like the vocoder and other vocal effects as well. We can provide you additional steps on achieving this is you have the device already.

The max number of harmonies in the device in an individual patch is 3 additional harmonies on top of your original vocal signal.

Additional support documentation and links below.

* * *
**PLEASE SEE THE VE-500 SUPPORT INFORMATION BELOW:**

**VE-500 FEATURES:**
**https://www.boss.info/us/products/ve-500/**

**VE-500 SPECIFICATIONS:**
**https://www.boss.info/us/products/ve-500/**

**VE-500 ARTICLES:**
**https://www.boss.info/us/products/ve-500/articles/**

**VE-500 ACCESSORIES:**
**https://www.boss.info/us/products/ve-500/accessories/**

* * *
**VE-500 UPDATES, DRIVERS and DOWNLOADS:**
**https://www.boss.info/us/products/ve-500/downloads/**

**VE-500 SYSTEM PROGRAM FIRMWARE UPDATE VERSION FIRMWARE:**

- **VE-500 System Program ( Ver.1.10 )**

**VE-500 USB DEVICE DRIVERS (WIN/macOS):**
**=> WINDOWS USERS:**

- **VE-500 Driver Ver.1.0.1 for Windows 10/11**
- **VE-500 Driver Ver.1.0.0 for Windows**

**=> macOS USERS:**

- **VE-500 Driver Ver.1.0.3 for macOS Big Sur 11.x / Monterey 12.x / Ventura 13.x / Sonoma 14.x / Sequoia 15.x**
- **VE-500 Driver Ver.1.0.1 for macOS 10.15**
- **VE-500 Driver Ver.1.0.0 for macOS / OS X**

* * *
**VE-500 SOFTWARE EDITOR APPLICATION (WIN/MAC):**

- **VE-500 Editor Ver.1.00 for Windows**
- **VE-500 Editor Ver.1.00 for macOS / OS X**

**VE-500 OWNER'S MANUAL (PDF):**

- **[English] VE-500 Owner's Manual [PDF]**
- **VE-500 Parameter Guide**
- **VE-500 Editor Owner's Manual**
- **[English] VE-500 MIDI Implementation Chart [PDF]**

#### **Support Documents**

- **What to Do If the Driver for Windows(R) 10 Is Not Automatically Installed**

**VE-500 KNOWLEDGE BASE ARTICLES (SEARCH "VE-500"):**
**https://www.boss.info/us/support/knowledge_base/?product=ve-500**

* * *

#### **VE-500 VIDEOS:**

#### **VE-500 with HANNAH BOULTON:**
**VE-500 Introduction (1/7): **
**https://youtu.be/PNFD8hlRWFc**

#### **VE-500 Getting Ready (2/7): **
**https://youtu.be/Oq7wEHWdFjU**

#### **VE-500 Enhance Your Vocal (3/7): **
**https://youtu.be/3B8OTqMV3CI**

#### **VE-500 How To Use De-Esser? (4/7): **
**https://youtu.be/R51PrB2dr-w**

#### **VE-500 More Accurate Pitch? (5/7): **
**https://youtu.be/bYJYmYHDQ_g**

#### **VE-500 Get Rich Ambience (6/7): **
**https://youtu.be/6MyQ7N1BIFg**

#### **VE-500 Get Creative With Delay (7/7): **
**https://youtu.be/z7SL1Sieuzo**

* * *

#### **VE-500 with JOHN ALLEN:**

#### VE-500 (How To Set Up A Mic, Guitar, Keyboard & Vocoder Tutorial w/ Just Alliance)
**https://youtu.be/UE8tbBvENhA**

VE-500 (How To Set EQ & Compression Tutorial w/ Just Alliance)
**https://youtu.be/5sNcYaH3V7M**

VE-500 (How To Set An Effect Tutorial w/ Just Alliance)
**https://youtu.be/Rc_XBjPm3Cw**

VE-500 : How to Set Up The Vocoder With The Roland JDXI
**https://youtu.be/a12hgmeqe1w**

* * *
**VE-500 FACTORY RESET:**

**Restoring the VE-500’s settings to their original factory default settings is referred to as “Factory Reset.” Not only can you return all the settings to the values in effect when the VE-500 was shipped from the factory, you can also specify the items to be reset. * When you execute “Factory Reset,” the settings you made will be lost. Save the data you need to your computer using the dedicated software.**
1. In the MENU screen, choose “F. RST” and press the [ENTER] button.
2. Choose the type of settings to be restored to the factory default settings with knobs [1] and [3].
Parameter Value Explanation
[1] knob: FROM SYSTEM - System parameter settings U01–U99 Settings for Patch Numbers U01–U50.
[3] knob: TO SYSTEM - System parameter settings U01–U99 Settings for Patch Numbers U01–U50.
3. Press the [ENTER] button. 4. To execute the factory reset, use the knob to select “OK,” and press the [ENTER] button.
* If you decide not to execute the factory reset, select “CANCEL” and press the [ENTER] button. Once the Factory Reset is complete, you are returned to the Play screen.


* * *


Thanks and enjoy your day.
Roland/BOSS Product Support

messages.name: David Marino
messages.msg:
Hello Chuck,

Thanks for reaching out and contacting Roland BOSS USA Operational Product Support about the KATANA-50 (KTN-50).

Can you please identify and confirm, if you're using a KATANA MKI / MKII / GEN3 series amp?
Please check both the INPUT jack on the front panel, and check the back panel label, it should read one of the following:


- KATANA-50/100/HEAD/ARTIST (indicating the original MKI series amps)
- KATANA-50/100/HEAD/ARTIST MKII (indicating the second MKII series amps)
- KATANA-50/100/HEAD/ARTIST GEN 3 (may just be on the back panel label indicating the newest GEN3 series amps)

Each KATANA amp series MKI/MKII/GEN3 have different features, downloads, firmware updates, drivers and software editors; knowing which is the correct amp is imperative for providing proper web links and support.

Thanks for your cooperation on the matter.

Kind regards

messages.name: David Marino
messages.msg:
Hello Chuck,

Thanks for the additional info.

**All the support info docs and weblink downloads are compiled below:**
**KATANA GEN3 SUPPORT:**
**https://www.boss.info/us/products/katana-50_gen_3/downloads/**

**KATANA GEN3 OWNER’S MANUALS:**

- **[English] KATANA3 Startup Guide [PDF]**
- **[English] KATANA3 Reference Manual [PDF]**
- **[English] Using BOSS TONE STUDIO for KATANA Gen3 (for PC) [PDF]**
- **[English] Using BOSS TONE STUDIO for KATANA Gen3 (for mobile) [PDF]**
- **[English] Connecting the BOSS TONE STUDIO for KATANA Gen3 iOS App to the KATANA Unit [PDF]**
- **[English] Connecting the BOSS TONE STUDIO for KATANA Gen3 Android App to the KATANA Unit [PDF]**

**Some BOSS KATANA ARTICLES HERE:**
**https://www.boss.info/us/products/katana-50_gen_3/articles/**

**The STUDIO RATS have a pretty good 3rd party KATANA GEN3 video run down here:**
**https://youtu.be/9QR69eRpoHk?si=539q5GU-DG3ZVXrH**

**Otherwise, you can review some more KATANA GEN3 videos on YT by using the following search:**
**https://www.youtube.com/results?search_query=KATANA+GEN3+tutorial+beginner+guide**

* * *
**Please review and execute the following steps below, to get setup with your KATANA-50/100/HEAD/ARTIST GEN3 amp.**

**You'll need the following gear at the ready:**
- Your KATANA GEN3 amp e.g., KATANA-50 GEN3, KATANA-100 GEN3, KATANA-HEAD GEN3, KATANA-ARTIST GEN3.
- USB-C to USB 2.0/3.0 A data cable. e.g.: https://a.co/d/6w69VFK
- WINDOWS OS / macOS desktop/laptop computer, with inter web access, and a USB 2.0/3.0 A port / USB adapter or USB-Hub adapter, with a USB 2.0/3.0 A port.

* * *
**As a quick overview there are three main steps to get you connected that you'll need to manually perform:**
**1 - Download, extract*, and install the** **KATANA3 System Program (Ver.1.07)** **firmware update files in to your amp, using a computer.**

**(Unfortunately, you'll need to manually update the firmware on your amp using a computer. It takes around 6 months for a product**
**to arrive in the hands of the end user from overseas, and there are often updates during the interim, so the user should update the firmware immediately).**

**After updating the firmware please Factory Reset your amp, this will realign the new firmware to defaults, just in case there was any data skew during the update process:** **KATANA-100 GEN 3: Factory Reset**

**2 - Download, extract*, and install the KATANA USB device driver for your specific WINDOWS/macOS computer OS and Version. **

- **KATANA3 Driver Ver.1.0.0 for Windows 10/11**
- **KATANA3 Driver Ver.1.0.0 for macOS Monterey 12.x / Ventura 13.x / Sonoma 14.x / Sequoia 15.x**

**3 - If using the sold separate** **BT-DUAL ADAPTER** **for BT/Bluetooth connecting with your Android / iOS mobile device.**
**Download and install the BTS for KATANA GEN3 APP for your mobile device.**
**Then follow instructions for BT-DUAL install on back of the amp, and KATANA3 BT AUDIO and KATANA3 BT MIDI connection, with your Android/iOS mobile device.**
**Download** **“BTS for KATANA GEN 3” for iOS**
**Download** **“BTS for KATANA GEN 3” for Android**

**4 - Download, extract*, and install the BTS/BOSS TONE STUDIO for KATANA GEN3 Ver.1.0.0 software editor application for your specific computer OS and Version.**

- **BOSS TONE STUDIO for KATANA Gen3 Ver.1.1.0 for Windows**
- **BOSS TONE STUDIO for KATANA Gen3 Ver.1.1.0 for macOS**
*Note if using WINDOWS 10/11, you'll need to EXTRACT the zipped/compressed download.
RIGHT MOUSE CLICK the downloaded zipped folder, and choose EXTRACT ALL,
choose a destination, either the DOWNLOAD folder or DESKTOP.

**If using macOS, the zipped download will auto unzip/extract, when downloaded, the two update files are ready to use:
Use both the **KATANA3.BIN and ROMINFO.TXT files (see example below).**

 ![](https://rolandus.zendesk.com/attachments/token/pI3AmTOC69PKWU2pzBOtbNwtC/?name=image.png)

**For USB-C to USB 2.0/3.0 A cable to USB-2.0/3.0 A port on computer troubleshooting:**
Test and check connection using an alternate USB-C to USB 2.0/3.0 A data cable, also try an alternate USB 2.0/3.0 compatible port directly on the computer if possible.
If possible try an alternate computer to check the same setup and see if the computer native security software features are blocking connection for the amp and BTS software editor.

* * *
**PLEASE COMPLETE THE FOLLOWING STEPS FOR THE KATANA GEN3.**
**UPDATE THE FIRMWARE, INSTALL THE USB DRIVER AND BTS FOR KATANA GEN3 SOFTWARE EDITOR.**

**THIS SHOULD ALLOW YOU TO SYNC KATANA GEN3 AMP WITH THE BOSS TONE STUDIO FOR KATANA GEN3 SOFTWARE EDITOR:**

**1. DOWNLOAD AND INSTALL THE LATEST SYSTEM PROGRAM VERSION UPDATE FIRMWARE FOR YOUR KATANA GEN3 AMP: **
**KATANA3 System Program (Ver.1.07)**

**2. DOWNLOAD AND INSTALL THE USB DEVICE DRIVER FOR YOUR SPECIFIC COMPUTER OS AND VERSION:**
**https://www.boss.info/us/products/katana-100_gen_3/downloads/**

**=>WINDOWS DRIVERS:**

- **KATANA3 Driver Ver.1.0.0 for Windows 10/11**
**(WINDOWS 10/11 USES AN AUTO DRIVER DOWNLOAD AND INSTALL PROTOCOL. MAKE SURE YOUR KATANA IS UP TO DATE WIHT THE LATEST SYSTEM PROGRAM FIRMWARE FOR THE WINDOWS 10/11 DRIVER AUTOMATED INSTALLATION. IF THE USB DRIVER DOESN'T AUTO INSTALL, YOU'LL NEED TO MANUALLY INSTALL THE USB DEVICE DRIVER USING THE LINK & DOWNLOAD ABOVE.**

**=>macOS DRIVERS:**

- **KATANA3 Driver Ver.1.0.0 for macOS Monterey 12.x / Ventura 13.x / Sonoma 14.x / Sequoia 15.x**
_**FOR OLDER macOS VERSIONS, PLEASE MAKE SURE TO ADJUST MAC SECURITY & PRIVACY SETTINGS AND "ALLOW" FOR THE DRIVER INSTALLATION AND FUNCTIONALITY. REVIEW TROUBLESHOOTING FOR SPECIFIC macOS AND VERSION. USE SPOTLIGHT SEARCH IN UPPER RIGHT CORNER OF DESKTOP AND TYPE: "INSTALL HELPER" CHECK IF INSTALLED DRIVER CAN BE "ALLOWED".**_
_**macOS Catalina (macOS 10.15) Driver Installation and Troubleshooting**_
_**macOS Mojave (macOS 10.14) Driver Installation and Troubleshooting**_
_**macOS High Sierra (macOS 10.13) Driver Installation and Troubleshooting**_

**3. INSTALL THE BT DUAL ADAPTER, DOWNLOAD THE BTS FOR KATANA GEN3 APP.**
** If using the sold separate** **BT-DUAL ADAPTER** **for BT/Bluetooth connecting with your Android / iOS mobile device.**
**Download and install the BTS for KATANA GEN3 APP for your mobile device.**
**Then follow instructions for BT-DUAL install on back of the amp, and KATANA3 BT AUDIO and KATANA3 BT MIDI connection, with your Android/iOS mobile device.**
**Download** **“BTS for KATANA GEN 3” for iOS**
**Download** **“BTS for KATANA GEN 3” for Android**

**4. DOWNLOAD AND INSTALL BOSS TONE STUDIOS FOR KATANA GEN3 SOFTWARE EDITOR FOR YOUR COMPUTER:**

- **BOSS TONE STUDIO for KATANA Gen3 Ver.1.1.0 for Windows**
- **BOSS TONE STUDIO for KATANA Gen3 Ver.1.1.0 for macOS**

- **THIS SHOULD ALLOW FOR YOUR KATANA GEN3 AMP TO SYNC WITH YOUR COMPUTER AND BTS/BOSS TONE STUDIOS for KATANA GEN3.**

- **After getting connected go visit BTX/BOSS TONE EXCHANGE for KATANA GEN3 USER PATCH SHARING:**
**BOSS TONE EXCHANGE/BTX WEB FORUM PORTAL FOR KATANA GEN3 USER PATCH SHARING**

* * *

* * *
**KATANA GEN3 DOWNLOADS / UPDATES and DRIVERS:**


#### **Updates & Drivers**

-

**KATANA3 System Program (Ver.1.07)**

-

**BOSS TONE STUDIO for KATANA Gen3 Ver.1.1.0 for Windows**

-

**BOSS TONE STUDIO for KATANA Gen3 Ver.1.1.0 for macOS**

-

**KATANA3 Driver Ver.1.0.0 for Windows 10/11**

-

**KATANA3 Driver Ver.1.0.0 for macOS Monterey 12.x / Ventura 13.x / Sonoma 14.x / Sequoia 15.x**

* * *

* * *
**Here are some quick tips for troubleshooting USB connectivity with your Roland/BOSS devices.**

**USB CONNECTIVITY TROUBLESHOOTING:**
1. If your Roland BOSS device connects to a desktop computer via USB, try and connect to a couple of different ports:
USB 2.0/3.0 A or USB-C, female type port directly on the computer.
- Often times, USB ports on the front of computers and those on monitors and QWERTY keyboards are considered hubs, and are not recommended for proper Roland BOSS device USB connectivity.
- However, some newer computers only have USB 3.0 or USB-C ports available, in some cases a USB hub adapter may be necessary. We test and use the following USB hub adapter, and it provides multiple USB connectivity options most importantly the USB 2.0/3.0 A port options.

2. Depending on the BOSS device, connect using either:
- A USB B type to USB 2.0 A cable: for old KATANA MKI/MKII
**- A USB-C to USB-C cable: for new KATANA GEN3**
**- A USB-C to USB 2.0/3.0 A cable: for new KATANA GEN3**
For example: **https://a.co/d/cmTWOuK**

OR alternate USB cabling for other BOSS devices:
**(****micro B type USB to USB 2.0 A type data cable****).**
For example used with: POCKET-GT, WAZA-AIR, WAZA-AIR BASS, RC-5, RC-10R, RC-500, GT-1000CORE, BOSS DD/EQ/MD/OD/SY-200 Series Pedals, etc.

Note: Not all USB cables are the same, some are for charging only and not for data.
If necessary when troubleshooting connectivity, try some alternate USB 2.0 or micro B type USB cables and try some alternate USB 2.0 A compatible ports on computer or USB hub.

3. If you have any onboard computer 3rd party or native security software running please disable/disarm them temporarily while attempting to connect your Roland BOSS device along with software editor applications. Some native security features on both WINDOWS/macOS can block proper connectivity, and app/driver functionality.
Also, temporarily disconnect any 3rd party USB interfaces or devices that may impede your Roland BOSS device connectivity.

Visual images of USB type connections for proper cable identification:
 ![](https://rolandus.zendesk.com/attachments/token/0clHRgOHVre7Alk4Bbh0Rwrsp/?name=inline821420174.png)

* * *

* * *
**All instructions are included in the update download link, we'll try to reword them for you to see if it helps:**

Once you've extracted the zipped download, there should be a folder: **"katana3_sys_v107" folder**,
you'll need to copy/paste or drag/drop the two update files into the connected KATANA GEN3 amp update drive, when the amp is connected via USB in update mode.
Make sure to first connect the amp in updater mode as instructed: [Hold down the TAP TEMPO button and power ON], then connect the KATANA via USB-C to USB 2.0/3.0A cable to your computer USB port.
The KATANA should connect and appear as an external drive, on your desktop: **KATANA3(DRIVE:).**
You'll then need to copy/paste or drag/drop the two update files: **KATANA3.BIN and ROMINFO.TXT** files into/onto the drive.
Once copied over to the KATANA3(DRIVE:), you can soft-eject the drive by dragging it to the Trash (for macOS only) or right mouse click EJECT (works for WINDOWS/macOS).
Then disconnect USB cable, this should start the update process, if it doesn't, then turn toward the amp and press the blinking RED LED PANEL button, manually if necessary. This will execute the update and will take about a minute to complete.

Once completed you should see all EFFECTS LEDS blinking GREEN simultaneously together showing a successful update.
If the EFFECT LEDs blink RED rapidly then the update was a failure and you'll need to try again.

In either situation, power OFF to exit updater mode and power back ON.

* * *
**PROCEDURE FOR THE UPDATE**
Caution

- You must not rename the extracted files.
- Never turn off the KATANA GEN3's power while the update is in progress.
Otherwise the system program or the KATANA GEN3 itself may be destroyed.

**PROCEDURE FOR THE UPDATE**
**Caution**

- You must not rename the extracted file.
- Never turn off the KATANA's power while the update is in progress. Otherwise the system program or the KATANA itself may be destroyed.
Please install the extracted system program files into your KATANA according to the following procedure.

1. Adjust the [MASTER] knob to minimum.
* Do not connect the KATANA and the computer yet.
2. Turn the POWER switch on while holding down the [TAP] button.
The indicators for the [EFFECTS] buttons flash.
3. Connect the computer to the KATANA's USB port by a USB cable.
"KATANA3" drive appears on the computer screen.
4. Open the KATANA3 icon.
"Removable Disk (*:)" may appear instead of the KATANA3 icon.
5. Copy (drag and drop) all the files included in the "katana3_sys_v107.zip" folder into the "KATANA3" icon.
* Do not copy the "katana3_sys_v107" FOLDER.
With Windows
Right-click on the "KATANA3" icon in My Computer (or the "Removable Disk (*:)" icon) and execute "Eject."
With macOS
Drag the "KATANA3" icon to the Trash icon in the Dock.
6. Disconnect the USB cable, start the update process.
7. While the update is in progress, the "EFFECTS" indicators light up.
When the update has finished, the "EFFECTS" indicators slowly flash simultaneously.
8. Turn the KATANA3 power off.

This completes the update operation. The new system program runs at the next startup.
Follow the procedure for verifying the version to verify that the version has been updated.

* * *

* * *
We'll further explain the instructions provided in the Procedure for Update here:

- **KATANA3 System Program (Ver.1.07)**
- Set the KATANA-50/100/ARTIST GEN3 amp to "updater mode" by starting with amp OFF,
Press and hold the [TAP] button, while powering ON the KATANA GEN3 amp.
- Connect the USB-C to USB 2.0/3.0 A data cable from KATANA USB-C port to computer USB-C/ 2.0/3.0 A port.
Blinking RED CHANNEL LEDs should be visible if not connected,
Solid RED CHANNEL LEDs should be visible if already connected with the USB cable to computer.

The KATANA3(DRIVE:) should mount and appear on computer:
- For WINDOWS KATANA3(DRIVE:) should appear in the WINDOWS FILE EXPLORER WINDOW left column.
- For macOS the KATANA3 Drive Icon should appear on the desktop or in the FINDER.

Make sure to download the update zip folder to your local drive and extract all the contents to your desktop, open the **katana3_sys_v107 folder, does not need to be extracted.**
If necessary RIGHT MOUSE CLICK the download and EXTRACT ALL to the DOWNLOADS folder or DESKTOP: ***katana3_sys_v107.zip (Compressed/zipped folder) needs to be EXTRACTED.**
NOTE: macOS will automatically extract an unzip the download into the DOWNLOADS folder, open folder, use the two update files: **KATANA3.BIN and ROMINFO.TXT** files.
User doesn't need to OPEN these files, only drag/drop or copy/paste these files into the mounted external KATANA3(DRIVE:).
*For WINDOWS users, right-mouse click the zip then select Extract All, follow the instructions and extract to your desktop or know location.
See side by side of the ZIPPED(highlighted) vs. extracted unzipped folder:
 ![](https://rolandus.zendesk.com/attachments/token/vezQ7t0wJZHhlMnmIy4a6KgiD/?name=image.png)
**Already extracted, open folder: Select copy/paste or drag/drop the two files KATANA3.BIN and ROMINFO.TXT files into the  KATANA3(DRIVE:) manually.**
 ![](https://rolandus.zendesk.com/attachments/token/KQeDHNUFeTwLEJKE1iOCpxgAR/?name=image.png)
When doing the update, make sure to copy/paste, drag/drop only the two update files into the KATANA3(DRIVE:).
**Again, use both the KATANA3.BIN and ROMINFO.TXT files for the update.**
NOT the zipped folder, or the extracted folder, ONLY these two update files should be added to the KATANA3(DRIVE:).
Once the update files are copied over into the KATANA3(DRIVE:) and only the two update files, soft-eject the KATANA3(DRIVE:), by Right Mouse Clicking, the KATANA3(DRIVE:) and choose EJECT.
Then disconnect the USB-C to USB 2.0/3.0 A cable from the computer or amp.

This will trigger the amp to recognize the update and you'll see the KATANA GEN3 amp, start the update process automatically, if it doesn't, then press the PANEL button with the RED flashing LED.
If necessary, press the PANEL LED button once and this will execute the update firmware code you've added to the amp.
Wait about a minute for the update to complete, check for slow blinking **GREEN EFFECT LEDS for successful update.**
Once the update has been confirmed, power OFF, and power ON, complete.

After attempting the update:
- If the EFFECT LEDS are flashing GREEN slowly simultaneously together, this indicates the update was a success.
- If the EFFECTS LEDS are flashing RED rapidly, this indicates the update failed and you'll need to try the process again.
In either circumstance/result, you'll need to recycle power, power OFF and back ON again to leave the "updater mode."

It's ok to power OFF the amp after the update processes has run and completed.
However, DON'T power OFF the amp while it's transmitting the update or in the process of updating.

* * *

* * *
**KATANA GEN3 FACTORY RESET INSTRUCTIONS:**

 ![](https://rolandus.zendesk.com/attachments/token/2PtLEtfq5Ch5kSdIwXovvCrHp/?name=inline1560582286.png)

**ATTACHING THE BT-DUAL ADAPTER INSTRUCTIONS:**

messages.name: David Marino
messages.msg:
Hello Curtis,

Thanks for reaching out and contacting Roland BOSS USA Operational Product Support about the MS-3.

Q: Did the MS-3 use to connect with the same computer?

Q: Were there any changes to the OS like an update from WINDOWS 10 to WINDOWS 11, etc.?

**The most common issues for connectivity are: **
**the device firmware update, USB device driver installation and finally the USB cabling.**

**Firmware update:**

-

**MS-3 System Program (Ver.1.20)**

**Factory Reset after firmware update**
**MS-3: Factory Reset (Initialization)**

**MS-3 USB device driver:**

-

**MS-3 Driver Ver.1.0.2 for Windows 10/11**


**Looks like there was an update to the MS-3 software editor a while back:**

-

**MS-3 Editor / Librarian Ver.1.0.3 for Windows**


**USB Troubleshooting:**

1. If your Roland BOSS device connects to a desktop computer via USB, it’s very important to try and connect to a dedicated USB 2.0 A female type port directly on the computer.
Often times, USB ports on the front of computers and those on monitors and QWERTY keyboards are considered hubs, and are not recommended for proper Roland BOSS device USB connectivity.
However, some newer computers only have USB 3.0 or USB-C ports available, in which case a USB hub adapter may be necessary. We test and use the following USB hub adapter, and it provides multiple USB connectivity options, most importantly the USB 2.0 A port option.

2. Depending on the BOSS device, connect using either:
(USB 2.0 A to B printer/data cable)
For example used with: KATANA MK1/MK2, KATANA-AIR, GT-1000, GT-100, GT-001, GT-1, GT-1B, SY-300, SY-1000, BOSS RV/DD/MD-500 Series Pedals, GR-55, RC-202, RC-3, RC-30, RC-300, RC-505 MK1, RC-505 MK2, RC-600, JS-10, GP-10, AD-10, VE-8, MS-3, ME-80, GP-10, etc.

OR alternate USB cabling:
(micro B type USB to USB 2.0 A type data cable).
For example, used with: POCKET-GT, WAZA-AIR, WAZA-AIR BASS, RC-5, RC-10R, RC-500, GT-1000CORE, BOSS DD/EQ/MD/OD/SY-200 Series Pedals, etc.

(USB C - to A Data Type Cable Option)
(USB C - to C Data Type Cable Option 2)
For example, used with: Katana Gen 3, Katana:GO and IR-2.

Note: Not all USB cables are the same, some are for charging only and not for data.
If necessary, when troubleshooting connectivity, try some alternate USB 2.0 or micro B type USB cables and try some alternate USB 2.0 A compatible ports on computer or USB hub.

3. If you have any onboard computer 3rd party security software running, please disable/disarm them temporarily while attempting to connect your Roland BOSS device along with software editor applications.
Also, temporarily disconnect any 3rd party USB interfaces or devices that may impede your Roland BOSS device connectivity.

Visual images of USB type connections for proper cable identification:

 ![](https://support.roland.com/attachments/token/HLAyr4WNBqRst4VWKFtUi4Ww0/?name=Screenshot+2024-07-10+at+4.37.54%E2%80%AFPM.png)


* * *

**PLEASE FOLLOW STEPS BELOW TO DOWNLOAD AND INSTALL FIRMWARE UPDATES, DRIVERS and SOFTWARE EDITOR TO SYNC YOUR MS-3 AND COMPUTER:**

**1. Download and install the latest MS-3 SYSTEM PROGRAM VERSION (DEVICE FIRMWARE);**

-

**MS-3 System Program (Ver.1.20)**


**2. Download and install the USB DEVICE DRIVER (WINDOWS/MAC):**
**https://www.boss.info/us/products/ms-3/downloads/**


**=>WINDOWS DRIVERS:**

-

**MS-3 Driver Ver.1.0.2 for Windows 10/11**

-

**MS-3 Driver Ver.1.0.0 for Windows**


**=>macOS DRIVERS:**

-

**MS-3 Driver Ver.1.0.3 for macOS Big Sur 11.x / Monterey 12.x / Ventura 13.x / Sonoma 14.x / Sequoia 15.x**

-

**MS-3 Driver Ver.1.0.2 for macOS 10.15**

-

**MS-3 Driver Ver.1.0.1 for macOS 10.13 / 10.14**

-

**MS-3 Driver Ver.1.0.0 for macOS / OS X**


**3. Download and install the ADOBE AIR UPDATE (WINDOWS/MAC):**
**ADOBE AIR is now owned, managed, and download hosted by HARMAN here:**
**https://airsdk.harman.com/download**

**4. Download and install the latest version of MS-3 SOFTWARE EDITOR (WINDOWS/MAC):**

-

**MS-3 Editor / Librarian Ver.1.0.3 for Windows**

-

**MS-3 Editor / Librarian Ver.1.0.3 for macOS / OS X**


**This should get your MS-3 updated and synced with your computer and MS-3 software editor.**



Kind regards

I’ve officially purchased from an official dw dealer a new DW Collector’s Maple 24″ Ruby Glass 4pz, with this size:

- 24×16″ bass drum, 13×9″ tom, 16×16″ floor tom, 18×16″ floor tom.



I’ve received the package directly from the store, because I live in a different city so I choose to receive the drum by ups.

I need to understand if this manufacture is the state of the art of dw collector’s drums quality, or this drums has assembly issues or is defective.

This will be very helpful for me in managing the replace or not of the item with the store.

Alex Galanti

messages.name: Joe Hofer
messages.msg:
_**Oh, I see what you're talking about. Those are the seams and normal.  **_

_**That is common on all our Finish ply kits. The seams are placed where they're not visible when setup.**_
_**On the kick and other big size drums, they're going to be two seams due to the size of the finish ply sheet and size of the drum shell. The sheet of finish wrap only come so big. **_

_**I hope this information clears up any confusions or concerns. **_

_**Do you have any other questions?**_

_**Joe- **_


DW Drums Customer Support

Hi Joe,

honestly, I'm very surprised to learn that a top-of-the-line product like a DW Collector's Series could be sold with such evident aesthetic flaws in the wrap finish.

In my opinion, a drum set costing over €5,300 should have a flawless finish.
I bought another DW Collector's three months ago with a Satin Oil Natural finish, and of course, it didn’t have any of these issues.

I will now try to understand with my local dealer how to proceed with getting the product replaced.

Thank you for your availability.

Best regards,

messages.name: Joe Hofer
messages.msg:
_**Alex, **_
_**Those are not flaws with the Finish Ply shell. I'm sorry you feel that way, but that is just how our drums with finish ply are made. It's been that way for over 30 years of us building drums. **_

_**We do the overlap seams because wood is a living organic materiel. When drums travel through different climates, the shell can expand in heat and humidity. And shrink in cold temperatures. Over a period of time, we've learned that the seam on finish ply separate and develop an ugly gap. By doing the overlap, it prevents the finish ply from developing that issue.   **_

_**And correct, your Satin Oil kit wouldn't have those type of seams because we don't need to do overlapping with wood. Those have whats called a buttseam. **_

_**I hope this makes more sense to you and that you have a better understanding.**_
_**If you have any other questions, please feel free to reach out to me anytime via email or phone. My direct number is 805 822-5340.**_

_**Take care and have a great weekend. **_
_**Joe- **_
_**✌️**_


DW Drums Customer Support

messages.msg_o:
Thank you.

Hi Ed,

Make sure to use a USB-C to 3.5mm TRRS cable set up.
That's a TIP RING RING SLEEVE cable.

There should be a USB-C to 3.5mm TRRS adapter available.
This would adapt the iPhone/Android mobile device with USB-C to the old standard 3.5mm TRRS connection.
The TRRS may be necessary depending on how the mobile device audio output is wired for USB-C.
This may be different for iPhone vs. Android as well.

messages.name: David Marino
messages.msg:
Hello WI,

Thanks for reaching out and contacting Roland BOSS USA Operational Product Support about the VE-8.
The user set KEY, will not track the guitar chord input unless using the auto or hybrid key tracking options.
So if you want to key harmonies off just the input guitar chords, then use AUTO, if you want to key off both set KEY and chords then use the HYBRID setting.
Make sure to WRITE/save the setting you plan to use for every Memory location, by pressing the WRITE/button multiple times.
This will save user adjustments and customizations to the current Memory patch location.

If necessary, you can troubleshoot and do a Factory Reset to get you back to default settings:
VE-8: Factory Reset (Initialization)

**If you'd like to redo the VE-8's settings from default, you can use the following procedure to clear the internal memory and reload its factory settings:**

**1. While holding down the REVERB TYPE and CHORUS TYPE buttons, located in the GUITAR section of**
**    the VE-8's controls, turn on the power.**

**         “Fr” appears in the display, and the [MEMORY] button blinks.**
**          NOTE: If you decide to cancel the factory reset, turn off the power.**

**2. Press MEMORY**

**3. Once “oK” appears in the display, you can turn off the VE8's power, then turn it back on and**
**    it will have its original Factory settings again.**

messages.name: David Marino
messages.msg:
Hello Mark,

Thanks for reaching out and contacting Roland BOSS USA Operational Product Support about the BC-1X.
It may be the incorrect power supply, make sure to only use a Roland BOSS 9V PSA-120S 500mA or PSB-1U/120 2000mA.
We can't guarantee proper functionality and performance if using 3rd party other brand power supplies.

**In the meantime and interim:**
- Please troubleshoot and test your BOSS compact pedal with the Manufacturer Recommended Power Supplies.

- Test using a brand new 9 volt quality, dry alkaline battery, or a Roland BOSS PSA-120S 500mA 9V power supply.
Unfortunately, we can't guarantee 3rd party other brand power supplies will provide proper functionality and performance. Some 3rd party other brand power supplies, can cause temporary device issues, or terminal damage.
Using a 3rd party other brand power supply will void all warranty terms.

- Test and check all cabling, use 1/4" TS mono unbalanced, instrument/guitar cables, for all guitar audio Input/Output connections, for proper connectivity, and audio signal transfer.

- Connect a 1/4" TS Mono Instrument guitar cable to pedal INPUT for pedal power ON/OFF.
_(For BOSS RC COMPACT LOOPERS: Connect to **OUTPUT A** for power ON)._

- For example cabling, use quality BOSS BIC Lifetime Instrument Cables for all guitar effect chain audio signal cable connections. _(NOTE: DO NOT USE_ _1/4" TRS STEREO CABLES_ _FOR GUITAR EFFECT CHAIN AUDIO CONNECTIONS. TRS cables may not engage the INPUT jack for power ON properly. TRS cables can be used for HEADPHONES audio connections, to a dedicated HEADPHONE jack, or for FS/EXP (FOOTSWITCH/EXPRESSION) CV/CONTROL VOLTAGE external control pedals)._

**EXPLANATION AND VISUAL OF DIFFERENT AUDIO CABLES:**
TS = TIP SLEEVE (UNBALANCED),
TRS = TIP RING SLEEVE (STEREO/BALANCED),
TRRS = TIP RING RING SLEEVE (STEREO LINE LEVEL WITH MIC/MOBILE DEVICE).
 ![](https://rolandus.zendesk.com/attachments/token/uDQRgtwMWKdTbpBwFYntcI8OF/?name=inline1957521896.jpeg)

- Review the BOSS pedal included Owner's Manual for functionality and how to use the pedal or go online for the Owner's Manual PDF downloadable:  https://www.boss.info/us/support/owners_manuals/
Search alphabetically for your device model and owner's manual.

- If the pedal is still malfunctioning, then we suggest exchanging with your point of purchase/dealer/store/web store, for a new product, under the dealer's warranty (usually 30-day warranty terms).

Please inform the dealer/sales tech, of the product issues you're having, and arrange an exchange of product, for a new device. This would help with an expedited quick turn around.

- If outside of Dealer Warranty terms and Manufacturer Warranty Service/Repair is needed, you may choose to submit a Service Repair Request to our Roland BOSS Factory Service Department in Chino, CA. Once you have an RA/Return Authorization number, you may send your device in, for evaluation, diagnosis, service and repair.

- All BOSS stompbox compact and twin pedals are Manufacturer Warrantied for 5 Years, parts and labor, from the date of purchase, for the original user and non-transferable.

- All that is needed, is to submit a Service Repair Request, and submit necessary service info, device, and a copy of your original point of sale purchase receipt/invoice, to honor the Manufacturer Warranty Terms.
If outside of warranty terms, the user may choose to have the device serviced/repaired outside of warranty.
Our Service Techs can provide a service/repair quote for parts and labor, if a repair option is available.
(Note: Some vintage legacy device pedals/products may not have parts available for service/repair)

**Please be prepared to provide the following info.**

**Your Name:**
**Phone Number:**
**Shipping Address:**
**Model Number:**
**Serial Number:**
**Detailed description of issue:**
**Point of Purchase:**

* * *
**Please review our Roland BOSS Manufacturer Warranty Information, create a Roland BOSS Backstage account, register your product and submit a Service Repair Request and use the other self-service tools and weblinks available:**
 ![](https://support.roland.com/attachments/token/jchHAj757yHujYD2P8NF4bR38/?name=image.png)

* * *
**WARRANTY INFORMATION**
Roland BOSS Product Manufacturer Warranty Information:
https://www.roland.com/us/support/service_repair/

**REGISTER PRODUCT**
Register your Roland BOSS Product here:
https://www.boss.info/backstage/mygear#register_product

**SERVICE REPAIR REQUEST**
Submit a Service Repair Request for Warranty Service by Roland BOSS Factory Service Department.
https://www.boss.info/backstage/support#service_request

**REPAIR STATUS**
https://www.boss.info/backstage/support#repair_status

**PARTS REQUEST**
https://www.boss.info/backstage/support#parts_order_request

**SERVICE CENTER LOCATOR**
If your product is within or outside the Manufacturer Warranty terms, you can use one of our Roland BOSS Certified Service Centers nearest you for service repair. If there's not an available 3rd party Service Center nearby, then you'll need to submit a Service Repair Request to our Roland BOSS Factory Service Center.
https://www.roland.com/us/support/service_repair/service_centers/



Kind regards

messages.msg:
Hello Dan,

Thanks for reaching out and contacting Roland BOSS USA Operational Product Support about the RC-5.

When renaming MEMORY locations, the WAV file that is saved to that memory location will not take the same name as the memory location. If you need the WAV file to match the name of the memory location, you can manually change the name of the WAV file when performing backups of your RC-5.

Let us know if you have further operational questions.

Additional RC-5 links and support documentation.


* * *
**PLEASE SEE ALL RC-5 SUPPORT INFO AND WEB LINKS BELOW:**

**RC-5 FEATURES:**

**RC-5 ACCESSORIES:**

* * *

**https://www.boss.info/us/products/rc-5/downloads/**

**RC-5 FIRMWARE SYSTEM PROGRAM UPDATE VERSION:**

- **RC-5 System Program ( Ver.1.10 )**

**RC-5 BOSS TONE STUDIOS APPLICATION (WINDOWS/MAC):**

- **BOSS TONE STUDIO for RC Ver.1.3.0 for Windows**
- **BOSS TONE STUDIO for RC Ver.1.3.0 for macOS**

* * *
**RC-5 SUPPORT (DOWNLOADABLE PDF LITERATURE PDF):**
**https://www.boss.info/us/products/rc-5/support/**

**RC-5 OWNER'S MANUAL:**

- **RC-5 Owner's Manual**

**RC-5 REFERENCE MANUAL:**

- **RC-5 Reference Manual**

**RC-5 BOSS TONE STUDIO FOR RC USER GUIDE**
**SEE ATTACHED: RC_BOSS_TONE_STUDIO_eng01**

* * *
**RC-5 KNOWLEDGE BASE ARTICLES, FAQ, SEARCH "RC-5":**
**https://www.boss.info/us/support/knowledge_base/?product=RC-5**


#### **RC-5 and RC-500: How To Control The Rhythm Pattern Selections Using MIDI?**
**https://www.boss.info/us/support/knowledge_base/6682373772571/**

**RC-5 YOUTUBE.COM LEARNING VIDEOS:**
**BOSS GUYS RC-5 BASICS AND GETTING STARTED DEVICE WALK THROUGH:**
**https://youtu.be/6pnhzD8Cl7Q**

**EQUIPBOARD HOW TO LOOP WITH RC-5 TUTORIAL VIDEO (Unaffiliated):**
**https://youtu.be/7z72qtos0Dw?si=djCbcbN8PTZrFpLI**


* * *
**RC-5 HOW TO WRITE SAVE YOUR LOOP TO MEMORY LOCATION:**
**Simply press the WRITE buttons : SETUP+MEMORY together, to enter the WRITE UTILITY menu, then press the SILVER MEMORY/LOOP LEVEL knob twice to confirm and WRITE/save your loop to the current MEMORY location.**

**RC-5 HOW TO CLEAR/ERASE YOUR LOOP AND MEMORY LOCATION:**
**Simply press the WRITE buttons: SETUP+MEMORY together, to enter the WRITE UTILITY menu, turn the SILVER MEMORY/LOOP LEVEL knob clockwise one click to CLEAR, then press the SILVER MEMORY LOOP/LEVEL KNOB twice to confirm the CLEAR/ERASE of the entire MEMORY location.**


* * *


Thanks and enjoy your day.
Roland/BOSS Product Support

messages.msg_o: Hello, I don’t need the .WAV file name to match the name in the memory location… I just want to be able to save the memory name information to my computer from the RC-5, in case the information gets lost/corrupted on the RC-5… can you tell where/how the memory name information is stored on the RC-5?… thank you
messages.name: Dan Edwards
messages.msg: Hello, I don’t need the .WAV file name to match the name in the memory location… I just want to be able to save the memory name information to my computer from the RC-5, in case the information gets lost/corrupted on the RC-5… can you tell where/how the memory name information is stored on the RC-5?… thank you

messages.name: Austin Sandick
messages.msg:
Dan,

The MEMORY: NAME information is store in the MEMORY(#).RC0 locations. If you performed a backup of the ROLAND folder, the MEMORY: NAME setting will carry over when performing a restore process of the internal memory. We strongly recommend not attempting to open the .RC0 files as this can cause a corruption to that file.
The only way to rename a memory slot is to adjust in the MEMORY: NAME setting.
We appreciate your understanding and cooperation.

* * *


Thanks and enjoy your day.
Roland/BOSS Product Support
