messages.name: David Marino
messages.msg:
Hello Dan,

Thanks for reaching out and contacting Roland BOSS USA Operational Product Support about the RC-5.
The name data for the memory location is saved in the ROLAND > DATA folder, and the audio is in the ROLAND > WAV folder.
The name data is not accessible using the computer or a computer application.
The Memory name needs to be programmed using the RC-5.|

You may also use BTS for RC app tool to import/export audio WAV files to/from RC-5 and rename the Memory:
**RC-5 BOSS TONE STUDIOS APPLICATION (WINDOWS/MAC):**

- **BOSS TONE STUDIO for RC Ver.1.3.0 for Windows**
- **BOSS TONE STUDIO for RC Ver.1.3.0 for macOS**

* * *
**PLEASE SEE ALL RC-5 SUPPORT INFO AND WEB LINKS BELOW:**

**RC-5 FEATURES:**
**https://www.boss.info/us/products/rc-5/features/**

**RC-5 SPECIFICATIONS:**
**https://www.boss.info/us/products/rc-5/specifications/**

**RC-5 ACCESSORIES:**
**https://www.boss.info/us/products/rc-5/accessories/**

* * *
**RC-5 UPDATES, DRIVERS and DOWNLOADS:**
**https://www.boss.info/us/products/rc-5/downloads/**

**RC-5 FIRMWARE SYSTEM PROGRAM UPDATE VERSION:**

- **RC-5 System Program ( Ver.1.10 )**

**RC-5 BOSS TONE STUDIOS APPLICATION (WINDOWS/MAC):**

- **BOSS TONE STUDIO for RC Ver.1.3.0 for Windows**
- **BOSS TONE STUDIO for RC Ver.1.3.0 for macOS**

* * *
**RC-5 SUPPORT (DOWNLOADABLE PDF LITERATURE PDF):**
**https://www.boss.info/us/products/rc-5/support/**

**RC-5 OWNER'S MANUAL:**

- **RC-5 Owner's Manual**

**RC-5 REFERENCE MANUAL:**

- **RC-5 Reference Manual**

**RC-5 BOSS TONE STUDIO FOR RC USER GUIDE**
**SEE ATTACHED: RC_BOSS_TONE_STUDIO_eng01**

* * *
**RC-5 KNOWLEDGE BASE ARTICLES, FAQ, SEARCH "RC-5":**
**https://www.boss.info/us/support/knowledge_base/?product=RC-5**


#### **RC-5 and RC-500: How To Control The Rhythm Pattern Selections Using MIDI?**
**https://www.boss.info/us/support/knowledge_base/6682373772571/**

**RC-5 YOUTUBE.COM LEARNING VIDEOS:**
**BOSS GUYS RC-5 BASICS AND GETTING STARTED DEVICE WALK THROUGH:**
**https://youtu.be/6pnhzD8Cl7Q**

**EQUIPBOARD HOW TO LOOP WITH RC-5 TUTORIAL VIDEO (Unaffiliated):**
**https://youtu.be/7z72qtos0Dw?si=djCbcbN8PTZrFpLI**


* * *
**RC-5 HOW TO WRITE SAVE YOUR LOOP TO MEMORY LOCATION:**
**Simply press the WRITE buttons : SETUP+MEMORY together, to enter the WRITE UTILITY menu, then press the SILVER MEMORY/LOOP LEVEL knob twice to confirm and WRITE/save your loop to the current MEMORY location.**

**RC-5 HOW TO CLEAR/ERASE YOUR LOOP AND MEMORY LOCATION:**
**Simply press the WRITE buttons: SETUP+MEMORY together, to enter the WRITE UTILITY menu, turn the SILVER MEMORY/LOOP LEVEL knob clockwise one click to CLEAR, then press the SILVER MEMORY LOOP/LEVEL KNOB twice to confirm the CLEAR/ERASE of the entire MEMORY location.**





Kind regards

messages.msg_o:
Hi Roland Team,

I hope this message finds you well.

My name is Cade Padilla, and I’m the co-founder of Cadence Creative Studios, a newly launched creative production studio and content hub based in Pitman, New Jersey. We recently opened our 2,000 sq. ft. studio space equipped for music recording, video production, podcasting, and branded content creation—and we’re currently curating high-quality gear that will be featured in our studio and across all our channels.

As long-time admirers of Roland’s innovation and impact in the music and creative tech industry, we’d love to explore a potential sponsorship or gear partnership. We’re reaching out to see if you’d be open to providing select Roland products that we can use in the studio and actively showcase in content across our platforms and with our network of musicians, producers, and creators.

In return, we’ll:

Feature your products in our studio content (YouTube, Instagram, TikTok, and behind-the-scenes reels)

Highlight Roland gear in our artist sessions, tutorials, and podcast productions

Provide clear attribution and brand tagging in all sponsored content

Offer high-res photos and video clips of your gear in use, available for your own promotional use

Our audience is growing rapidly, especially with regional artists and creators in the South Jersey and Philadelphia area. This partnership would give your gear exposure both in-person and across digital channels, while supporting our mission to empower creatives with quality tools.

If you’re interested, I’d love to hop on a quick call or provide more info about our studio and audience. Thank you for considering this opportunity—we’re big fans of what Roland stands for and would be honored to collaborate.

Best regards,
Cade Padilla
Co-Founder, Cadence Creative Studios
📧 cadencecreativestudios@gmail.com
📞 856-628-2461
🌐 www.cadencecreativestudios.com
📍 8 North Broadway, Pitman, NJ 08071
📸 Instagram: @cadencecreativestudios

Serial Number: Z8Q1415
Purchase Date: 2024-05-24
Purchase Method: In a store

messages.name: Vincent Cifarelli
messages.msg:
Hello Lonnie,

The GO:KEYS 5 and GO:KEYS 3 only receive on MIDI channel 4 and cannot be used as a multi-timbre sound generator.

Please set your MIDI track in FL Studio to transmit on channel 4.

https://support.roland.com/hc/en-us/articles/23556989696411-GO-KEYS-5-GO-KEYS-3-Can-I-use-the-piano-as-an-external-MIDI-sound-generator-for-DAW-software?_ga=2.44654948.1941925253.1749488490-1241316676.1647341036

Hope this helps.

Best regards,


Roland Customer Support
This email was written by an actual human being.

If you have any further questions or concerns, simply reply to this message.

*Please note that we aim to respond within 48 hours. Office hours are Mon-Thu 9am - 5pm. Fri 9am - 4.30pm.

*Veuillez noter que nous nous efforçons de répondre dans les deux prochains jours ouvrables. Les heures d'ouverture du bureau sont les suivantes: lundi au jeudi de 9h00 à 17h00, et vendredi de 9h00 à 16h30.

I would like to perform verse-chorus live looping where time signatures and/or tempos can be different. In addition, both verse and chorus require multi-track layering (i.e. RC-600 "single" mode will not work).

Note: song structures need to be improvised, thus cannot require configuration of tempo and/or time-signature beforehand. Loop Start / Stop transitions need to have the ability to be synchronized, i.e. transition at end-of-loop, etc... 

Please provide details as to how one would perform live looping with differing time-signatures and/or tempos, while still having two or more tracks for multi-layering.

messages.name: Austin Sandick
messages.msg:
Hello R,

Thanks for reaching out and contacting Roland BOSS USA Operational Product Support about the RC-600.

Sorry to hear you're having issues.
We can only provide general Roland BOSS device help and assistance; we don't provide audio flow effect chain/ MIDI event chain consultation or training.

It is difficult to use the RC-600 in this manner, only using one memory slot without predetermined tempos or time signatures.
It might be best for you to experiment with the LOOP SYNC MODE, LOOP SYNC SETTING, TEMPO SYNC and well as the timing of opening and closing your loops in a track.

The good news is by default, each track has its own dedicated start and stop button as well as an ALL START/STOP for all tracks.
Thus giving you control of Loop Start/Stop for all or individual tracks.

Let us know if you have further operational questions.
Additional RC-600 info and support documentation below.

messages.msg_o:
The request I've made, such that the RC-600 should be able to support at least (2) performance sections, e.g. verse and chorus, having different time signatures and/or tempos, and capable of multi-track layering, is an extremely obvious user / workflow / performance scenario.



The fact that the RC-600 does not have this capability, is effectively a bug in the firmware implementation and/or a design oversight. To expect customers to spend ~$600 and not have the ability to use the available (6) tracks in such a way that they can be grouped (e.g. Section 1 --> Tracks 1,4, Section 2 --> Tracks 2,5, Section 3 --> Tracks 3,4) is failing to deliver and adequate product to the customer. As well, BOSS is engaging in misleading advertisement by not supporting such an obvious / highly useful capability. For the cost point, the RC-600 severely lacks functionality.



The unit also needs, and with respect to price point is expected to have, much better MIDI support.



Please forward this message to the BOSS product and engineering teams. Musicians' needs and requests are far too often being ignored by equipment manufacturers, as BOSS is doing here, and thus constantly experiencing frustration while having to work around and deal with the cumbersome / inadequate design and implementation decisions made by these manufacturers.



BOSS is supposed to be making tools that help improve the music making experience - however, all too often, they just make it a headache.



Please show respect to your customers and address these design and implementation flaws.

* * *

messages.msg_o:
I have not been able to get Boss Tone Studio working properly on my M1 Max MacbookPro (2021) since I bought the device 4 years ago. The application can see my GT-100 pedal, but it fails to connect with the following error message: "GT-001/GT-100 Ver.2 connection failure. Please select external MIDI/AUDIO device connection." For the record, I have installed the latest firmware on the GT-100, the latest driver for it on my Mac, and the latest version of Boss Tone Studio. I can record properly into my DAW (Logic) via USB, and the Audio/MIDI utility application picks up everything fine. And again, Tone Studio can *see* my pedal, but it will not connect to it. I've changed USB cables, ports, uninstalled/reinstalled drivers/firmware, etc. I am on the latest MacOS Sequoia which, as of this time, is 15.5. The support/compatibility page seems to indicate that Tone Studio is in fact supported (https://www.boss.info/global/support/support_news/24100115m15a/) but I see that the application has not been updated since March 2017. Is it simply not compatible with MacOS 15 (and if so, will there ever be an update?)? Or am I doing something wrong here? 

- MacOS 15.5 on 2021 M1 Max Macbook Pro
- GT-100 running V 2.12 firmware
- Installed latest driver (V 2.1.5)
- Installed latest Tone Studio (V 1.1.3)

Thank you for your help! (Email: seanemmel@gmail.com)
Product Name: GT-100
Serial Number: E1F7176
Purchase Date: 2015-05-09
Purchase Method: No Data
Purchase Dealer: STREAMLINE AUDIO VID

messages.name: David Marino
messages.msg:
Hello Sean,

Thanks for reaching out and contacting Roland BOSS USA Operational Product Support about the GT-100.
Sorry you're still having issues with your GT-100 and BTS for GT connection using your macOS computer.
Unfortunately, the GT-100 is over a decade old and now considered a discontinued legacy device.
We no longer provide support for these older vintage units that are over 10 years old.

With that said, we happened to have an old personal GT-100 kicking around on the shelf as well as a fairly new Mac Mini M1 Chipset desktop computer, with macOS 15.5 update installed.
So, using the online GT-100 Downloads page, resources and web links,
we updated the GT-100 to the latest firmware version, installed the GT-100 USB device driver, and installed the BTS for GT software editor.
We connected up via our old USB 2.0 A to B printer/data cable, and connected to a USB-C Hub with a compatible USB 2.0 A port, and all connected and synced perfectly fine, without issue. The initial connection and load up is a little slow, but once connected all works great, we backed up all the default patches to the Librarian, and downloaded all the Tone Central artist collection patches to the Librarian and loaded some Architects patches, to check.
All worked great, so not sure what the issue is you're having, but you may want to use the GT-100 Downloads, and start fresh/new.
Then make sure to troubleshoot your USB 2.0 A to B data cable connection and make sure to check and try some alternate USB 2.0 A to B data cables, and try some alternate USB 2.0 A ports on the computer or use a 3rd party USB-C Hub with compatible USB 2.0 A port (black inside). Some USB 3.0 A ports (blue inside) are not backwards compatible and will not provide the proper connectivity, unless directly on the macOS computer.

**Here's the downloads we used, to get updated and properly connected on our macOS 15.5 computer:**
**GT-100 System Program ( Ver.2.12 )**
**GT-100 Ver.2 Driver Ver.2.1.5 for macOS Sonoma 14.x / Sequoia 15.x**
**BOSS TONE STUDIO for GT-100 Ver.1.1.3 for macOS / OS X**

* * *
**USB CONNECTIVITY TROUBLESHOOTING:**

1. If your Roland BOSS device connects to a desktop computer via USB, it’s very important to try and connect to a dedicated USB 2.0 A female type port directly on the computer.
Often times, USB ports on the front of computers and those on monitors and QWERTY keyboards are considered hubs, and are not recommended for proper Roland BOSS device USB connectivity.
However, some newer computers only have USB 3.0 or USB-C ports available, in which case a USB hub adapter may be necessary. We test and use the following USB hub adapter and it provides multiple USB connectivity options most importantly the USB 2.0 A port option.

2. Depending on the BOSS device, connect using either:
(USB 2.0 A to B printer/data cable)
For example used with: KATANA MK1/MK2, KATANA-AIR, GT-1000, GT-100, GT-001, GT-1, GT-1B, SY-300, SY-1000, BOSS RV/DD/MD-500 Series Pedals, GR-55, RC-202, RC-3, RC-30, RC-300, RC-505 MK1, RC-505 MK2, RC-600, JS-10, GP-10, AD-10, VE-8, MS-3, ME-80, GP-10, etc.

OR alternate USB cabling:
(micro B type USB to USB 2.0 A type data cable).
For example used with: POCKET-GT, WAZA-AIR, WAZA-AIR BASS, RC-5, RC-10R, RC-500, GT-1000CORE, BOSS DD/EQ/MD/OD/SY-200 Series Pedals, etc.

(USB C - to A Data Type Cable Option)
(USB C - to C Data Type Cable Option 2)
For example used with: Katana Gen 3, Katana:GO and IR-2.

Note: Not all USB cables are the same, some are for charging only and not for data.
If necessary when troubleshooting connectivity, try some alternate USB 2.0 or micro B type USB cables and try some alternate USB 2.0 A compatible ports on computer or USB hub.

3. If you have any onboard computer 3rd party security software running please disable/disarm them temporarily while attempting to connect your Roland BOSS device along with software editor applications.
Also, temporarily disconnect any 3rd party USB interfaces or devices that may impede your Roland BOSS device connectivity.

Visual images of USB type connections for proper cable identification:

 ![](https://support.roland.com/attachments/token/HLAyr4WNBqRst4VWKFtUi4Ww0/?name=Screenshot+2024-07-10+at+4.37.54%E2%80%AFPM.png)

* * *

* * *
**PLEASE SEE OUR GT-100 SUPPORT INFO AND WEB LINKS BELOW:**

**GT-100 FEATURES:**
**https://www.boss.info/us/products/gt-100/**

**GT-100 SPECIFICATIONS:**
**https://www.boss.info/us/products/gt-100/specifications/**

**GT-100 ACCESSORIES:**
**https://www.boss.info/us/products/gt-100/accessories/**

* * *
**GT-100 UPDATES, DRIVERS and DOWNLOADS:**
**https://www.boss.info/us/products/gt-100/downloads/**

**GT-100 SYSTEM PROGRAM VERSION 2.10 UPDATE (LATEST DEVICE FIRMWARE):**

- **GT-100 System Program ( Ver.2.12 )**

* * *
**GT-100 USB DEVICE DRIVER (INSTALL THE CORRECT DRIVER FOR COMPUTER OS & VERSION - WINDOWS/MAC):**
**https://www.boss.info/us/products/gt-100/downloads/**

**=>WINDOWS DRIVERS:**

- **GT-100 Ver.2 Driver Ver.2.1.1 for Windows 10/11**
-

**GT-100 Ver.2 Driver Ver.2.0.0 for Windows 10**

**This contains information on the GT-100 Ver.2 driver compatible with Microsoft Windows 10.**

- **GT-100 Ver.2 Driver Ver.2.1.0 for Windows 8.1 / 8 / 7**
- **GT-100 Ver.2 Driver Ver.2.0.0 for Windows 8.1 / 8 / 7 / Vista / XP**

_**=>macOS DRIVERS:**_

- **GT-100 Ver.2 Driver Ver.2.1.5 for macOS Sonoma 14.x / Sequoia 15.x**
- **GT-100 Ver.2 Driver Ver.2.1.4 for macOS Big Sur 11.x / Monterey 12.x / Ventura 13.x**

- **GT-100 Ver.2 Driver Ver.2.0.0 for OS X 10.11**
- **GT-100 Ver.2 Driver Ver.2.0.0 for OS X 10.10**
- **GT-100 Ver.2 Driver Ver.2.0.0 for Mac OS X**

* * *
**ADOBE AIR UPDATE (DOWNLOAD and INSTALL BEFORE INSTALLING BOSS TONE STUDIO):**

**The Adobe Air update can be downloaded securely here via Harman:**
**Usually Adobe Air is not needed, however for some older computers, user will need to install Adobe Air before installing BTS for GT-100 software editor.**
**https://airsdk.harman.com/runtime**
**(ATTACHED)**

* * *
**BOSS TONE STUDIOS FOR GT-100 (INSTALL ADOBE AIR UPDATE BEFORE INSTALLING BOSS TONE STUDIOS):**

- **BOSS TONE STUDIO for GT Ver.1.1.3 for Windows**
- **BOSS TONE STUDIO for GT-100 Ver.1.1.3 for macOS / OS X**
_**NOTE: BOSS TONE STUDIOS HAS AN INTEGRATED LIBRARIAN. **_
_**25 CLASSIC TONES ARE NOT COMPATIBLE WITH BOSS TONE STUDIOS, USE OLDER LIBRARIAN.**_

* * *
**LIBRARIAN SOFTWARE FOR GT-100 (SEE NOTE ABOVE BEFORE INSTALLING)**

- **GT-100 Librarian for Windows v1.01**
- **GT-100 Librarian for Macintosh**

**GT-100 25 CLASSIC TONES FOR DOWNLOAD (NOTE: LIBRARIAN IS NECESSARY TO INSTALL 25 CLASSIC TONES):**
**GT-100 25 Classic Tones**

* * *

* * *
**GT-100 SUPPORT INFORMATION:**
**https://www.boss.info/us/products/gt-100/support/**

**GT-100 OWNER'S MANUAL (PDF):**
**GT-100 Owner's Manual**

**GT-100 PARAMETER GUIDE (PDF):**
- **GT-100 Parameter Guide**
- **Parameter List**
- **Addendum**
- **Patch List**

* * *
**GT-100 VERSION 2.0 ADDENDUM (PDF):**
- **About GT-100 Ver. 2**
**GT-100 VERSION 2.0 PRESET PATCH LIST (PDF):**
- **GT-100 Ver.2 Preset Patch List**

* * *
**USING BOSS TONE STUDIOS FOR GT-100 MANUAL (PDF):**
**Using BOSS TONE STUDIO for GT**

* * *
**GT-100 MIDI IMPLEMENTATION:**
**MIDI Implementation**
**GT-001 / GT-100 Ver.2 MIDI Implementatio**n

* * *
**GT-100 TURBO START:**
**GT-100 Turbo Start**

**GT-100 KNOWLEDGE BASE ARTICLES (SEARCH "GT-100"):**
**https://www.boss.info/us/support/knowledge_base/**



Kind regards

messages.msg_o:
Thank you for the detailed reply! I truly appreciate it. Unfortunately, I've done basically all the steps described above re: troubleshooting (changing USB cables, changing ports, updating software/drivers/firmware, etc.) and it just doesn't work. What's odd is that Tone Studio _sees my GT-100 device when it is connected_, but it simply can't get a successful connection when I select it. It always fails with the same error message every time. And again, my DAW (Logic) sees it fine as well and I can record perfectly fine with it. It's just the Tone Studio application that seems to bork out. Anyway, I understand that this is a legacy device and so of course support will only last for some time (I myself am actually a software developer), so it may just be that my computer for whatever reason will not allow me to work with Tone Studio anymore with this device. It's not a deal breaker since this has been an issue for about 3 1/2 years now, but I was hoping I _might_ be able to get things working after updating MacOS, Logic, and everything else. I will continue troubleshooting on my end... Anyway, thanks again for the super detailed reply! Have a great day,


-- Sean

messages.name: David Marino
messages.msg:
Hello Sean,

Yes, we apologize that you can't get the GT-100 connected with BTS.
Seems odd, as we tested on our end with all the same downloads and had no issues.
So this would suggest an issue with the BTS software on your specific computer and OS.
The only other item for troubleshooting is to try and install the Adobe Air Update, then install the BTS for GT, see if that is the issue.
See attached, or download the new curated and owned Harman version here:
https://airsdk.harman.com/download

Again, please make sure your GT-100 is updated to the latest firmware.
We noticed that when doing the version check we could see that it was Version 2. but not see if it was Version 2.12, that we just installed.
So you should try to install the new firmware here:

- **GT-100 System Program ( Ver.2.12 )**
It will not harm anything for your unit if you flash the new firmware again, then do a Factory Reset on System > to System.
Either of these two final options may remedy your connection issue.

Note: you may back up all your GT-100 user data by doing a MIDI bulk dump to a DAW MIDI track, this is a backup you can reload into any GT-100 if necessary. The MIDI bulk dump option is in the SYSTEM button menu.





Kind regards

messages.msg_o:
The RC-600 has loop sync modes of IMMEDIATE, MEASURE, and LOOP LENGTH for individual tracks. However, these functions don't provide a critically important functionality for queuing up track / loop transitions while enabling the performer to make changes on other equipment (e.g. effects processors, keyboard patches, etc...) in preparation for the loop transitions / song section change.

The track MULTI mode needs a similar functionality as the SINGLE track mode that can synchronize loop transitions by waiting until end-of-loop (i.e. rather than measure). This would allow the musician the freedom to queue up the loop changes at the start of the loop and to provide the time needed to modify instrument and/or other parameters for performance (e.g. enabling distortion on guitar for solo, changing keyboard patches for chorus section, etc...).

Please review and improve this functionality such that musicians can use the RC-600 more effectively in live performance scenarios.

A simple TRACK (MULTI) based option can allow the user to select sync by "LOOP END", where the firmware can use the master loop (first recorded) as the sync reference, or possibly a more intelligent functionality where the user could select to sync to either the shortest or longest loop current being played.

Please help improve this functionality - it is extremely frustrating when the RC-600 can't even support basic / obvious performance modes. Due to the poorly designed software, many users waste hours and/or days trying to configure the RC-600 to help improve their performance workflows, to ultimately discover the unit creates more frustration than enjoyment and is far more limited in its capabilities compared to what is advertised. 
Product Name: RC-600
Serial Number: B8P0576
Purchase Date: 2023-10-04
Purchase Method: In a store
Purchase Dealer: GUITAR CENTER #216

messages.msg_o:
Thanks for getting back to me.

Unfortunately, the two Roland-authorized service centers near me are both over 30 miles away and neither will sell parts directly. They require that I pay for full service, and based on their consistently poor customer reviews, I’m not confident in having them work on the amp.

Given that the repairs I need (a tone pot and one input jack replacement) are very straightforward, I was hoping to have a qualified local tech handle it. I understand Roland’s policy, but I’d greatly appreciate **any suggestions or alternative channels** for sourcing these parts—especially given that many vintage JC-120s are still gigging and in active use by working musicians like myself.

Is there any way to purchase parts like the 100KB tone pot or input jack (Part #13449146) through Roland directly, through a distributor, or via a service partner who is willing to ship parts?

Thanks again for your time and support—I really want to keep this amp alive.

 ![image.png](https://support.roland.com/attachments/token/L8ek8EgXd1MLmvGWWdLZE5MPO/?name=image.png)
 ![image.png](https://support.roland.com/attachments/token/hg1R29b7fy3U1If93RmTPib4F/?name=image.png)

messages.name: Austin Sandick
messages.msg:
Hello Alberto,

Thanks for reaching out and contacting Roland BOSS USA Operational Product Support about the SY-200.

Sorry to hear you're having issues.
There are a couple of things you can check and troubleshoot to help the update process along.
Try the following.

For firmware update of the SY-200 please review, execute and do the following below link.

- SY-200 System Program ( Ver.1.03 )
- Review the What You'll Need and Procedure for the Update official instructions, included.

- Download the firmware update and extract the zipped downloaded contents to your computer desktop.
=> For WINDOWS users, you'll need to extract the contents, by RIGHT MOUSE CLICKING the download, and choosing EXTRACT ALL, and extract the contents to your computer desktop. This will unzip and make the update files usable by the SMF player.
=> For macOS users, the firmware update download will auto extract/unzip, and is ready to use in your Downloads folder.

- Download the SMF MIDI update file player and use it to update your SY-200 (WINDOWS/macOS)
- => SMF Player for Windows

- **=>macOS SMF APP:**
SMF Player for macOS Big Sur 11.x - macOS Sequoia 15.x
For macOS Big Sur 11.x and later, please use this.

- If on macOS please make sure to use the correct SMF player for your macOS version.
If using the incorrect player, it will scramble the order of the MIDI files for the firmware update.

- Download and extract/open the firmware update:
This is a screen capture from WINDOWS, see how there's a zipper across the folder, this shows it's zipped and compressed.
- So you need to RIGHT MOUSE CLICK it and choose EXTRACT ALL, and extract the contents to the desktop. See highlighted below and description is Compressed(Zipped), extract the contents.
 ![](https://rolandus.zendesk.com/attachments/token/xLhMvTUlSE33kbqiJ6GU0OtUI/?name=image.png)

**ONCE EXTRACTED, SHOULD LOOK LIKE THIS:**
- **See highligthed below, it is unzipped and with files inside ready to use.**
 ![](https://rolandus.zendesk.com/attachments/token/vVsVHycIBdBmhaNRzlxegIn91/?name=image.png)


- Keep the extracted/unzipped, folder : SY200_sys_v103 available or easily to locate, on your desktop, or in the Downloads folder.
- Double click and open the UPDSMFJ MIDI player application, see App Icon below:
 ![](https://rolandus.zendesk.com/attachments/token/1ZBLOjdTkZFYIui3lvwruxrVv/?name=image.png)


1. Set **MIDI Out Device** to the **SY-200**.
2. Click [**Path**] navigate your computer directory to the location where the update file downloads folder for SY200_sys_v103 is located.
Should either be on the Desktop or in your Downloads folder, wherever the zipped folder update was EXTRACTED.
Then, click the [**OK**] button.
3. Click [**Scan SMF**] (unnecessary for Mac) to check that the update file is displayed in the file list.
4. Click **Send**.
Sending of the update program starts.
* It will take about 25 minutes to update. Be sure never to switch off the power before the operation finishes.
When the message "OK" appears on the display, the update has finished.
 ![](https://rolandus.zendesk.com/attachments/token/iAPZMUT67cBviWoIhmIT4RDI5/?name=image.png)

Congrats, this should have updated your SY-200 to the latest firmware version.
After updating the firmware, power OFF, and power ON, then execute a Factory Reset on the unit.
This is good practice to Factory Reset so that it realigns the firmware back to defaults, just in case there was any data skew from the update process.


* * *
We've adjusted the Procedure for The Update below to better understand the update process.

**SY-200 SYSTEM PROGRAM FIRMWARE UPDATE:**
**SY-200 System Program ( Ver.1.03 )**

**WHAT YOU WILL NEED TO UPDATE YOUR SY-200**

- SY-200
- micro USB B type to USB 2.0 A data cable
* Provide a cable suitable for connection to the computer you're using.
- A personal computer which can run the following SMF players ("UpdSMF")
  - SMF Player for Windows
  - SMF Player for macOS
- Computer (Windows or Mac) equipped with a USB port compliant with USB 2.0 or USB 3.0

* * *
**PROCEDURE FOR THE UPDATE**
Follow the steps below to install the system program in the SY-200.
* Never power-off the SY-200 while the update is in progress.

1. Turn down all knobs all the way.
2. Connect the SY-200 to the computer via micro USB B type to USB 2.0 A **data cable, connect to a USB 2.0 A** port directly on computer.
3. Hold down the [**MEMORY**] knob on the SY-200 and insert a plug into the INPUT jack.
The SY-200's power is turned on, and the message **"UPDATER USB"** appears on the display.
4. On the computer, open the UpdSMF updater tool or run the **UpdSMF application.**
5. In the UpdSMF app tool, set the **MIDI Out Device** to the **SY-200**.
6. Then click the [**Path**] button (click [**Select...**] browse for DOWNLOADS FOLDER, within DOWNLOADS, locate the **"sy200_sys_v103"** unzipped/extracted folder.
**For macOS: on "UpdSMF" specify the location where the update files from SMF Path (SMF Folder for Mac). Then, click the [**OK**] button.
**For WINDOWS, locate the **"sy200_sys_v103"** unzipped/extracted folder, select it click the **[OK]** button,
then press the  [**Scan SMF**] (unnecessary for Mac), this should procreate the MIDI update files in the window,
check that the update files are displayed in the file list.
**NOTE: IF USING WINDOWS: MAKE SURE THE DOWNLOADED UPDATE HAS BEEN UNZIPPED/EXTRACTED, THEN LOCATE THE EXTRACTED FOLDER WITH THE UNZIPPED UPDATE MIDI FILES.**
7. Finally, when ready, click [**Send]** to send the update MIDI data update files into the SY-200.
Sending of the update program starts.
*** It will take about 25 minutes to update. Be sure never to switch off the power before the operation finishes.**
When the message "OK" appears on the display, the update has finished.
8. Detach the plug from the INPUT jack and turn off the power.
9. Please verify the version number "1.02" with the procedure described in "HOW TO KNOW THE VERSION" part of this document.
* If the update fails, redo the procedure from step 1.
**UPDSMF example for WINDOWS below:**
 ![](https://rolandus.zendesk.com/attachments/token/kaasBgIaYuqmU7uPkUzlp4WAq/?name=image.png)


* * *

* * *
**PLEASE REVIEW OUR SY-200 SUPPORT INFO AND WEBLINKS BELOW**

**SY-200 FEATURES:**
**https://www.boss.info/us/products/sy-200/**

**SY-200 SPECIFICATIONS:**
**https://www.boss.info/us****/products/sy-200/specifications/**

**SY-200 ACCESSORIES:**
**https://www.boss.info/us/products/sy-200/accessories/**


* * *
**SY-200 UPDATES DRIVERS DOWNLOADS**
**https://www.boss.info/us/products/sy-200/downloads/**

**SY-200 SYSTEM PROGRAM FIRMWARE UPDATE:**
**SY-200 System Program ( Ver.1.03 )**

**SMF APP FOR UPDATING FIRMWARE:**
**(SMF APP and USB A to MICRO USB CABLE NEEDED FOR UPDATE)**

**=> WINDOWS SMF APP:**
**SYSTEM REQUIREMENTS: ALL VERSIONS**
**SMF Player for Windows**

**=>macOS SMF APP:**
SMF Player for macOS Big Sur 11.x - macOS Sequoia 15.x

For macOS Big Sur 11.x and later, please use this.


**SYSTEM REQUIREMENTS:**
**macOS 11**
**Compatible with Apple Mac series (Intel-based).**
**Compatible with Apple Silicon Mac (using the M1 chip).**
**macOS 10.13 / macOS 10.14 / macOS 10.15**
**- ****SMF Player for macOS / OS X**

**SYSTEM REQUIREMENTS:**
**macOS 10.12 / OS X 10.10 / OS X 10.11**


* * *
**SY-200 SUPPORT:**
**https://www.boss.info/us/products/sy-200/support/**

**SY-200 OWNER'S MANUAL:**
**Owner’s Manuals**

- [English] SY-200 Owner's Manual [PDF]

#### Knowledge Base

- SY-200: Can the SY-200 transmit or recognize MIDI clock?
- SY-200: Outputting the direct and effect sound separately
- SY-200: Is there any latency?
- SY-200: How do I switch from GUITAR to BASS mode?
- SY-200: Can this unit play chords?
- SY-200: Does this unit model the sounds from actual analog synths?
- SY-200: Can I use this unit with a mic or keyboard?
- SY-200: Can I make the unit always play back at the same volume, regardless of how hard I pick the strings?
- SY-200: Does this unit use the same sound regardless of what type of guitar I use?
- SY-200: Can I use a guitar with seven strings or more?
- SY-200: Does this unit support USB bus power?
- BOSS 200 Series Pedals: Is it possible to backup my Memory patch user parameter settings data?
- SY-200: Switching the settings as appropriate for the playback device
- SY-200: Restoring the unit to its factory-set default state
- SY-200: Is the SEND/RETURN volume adjustable?
- SY-200: What kind of power supply can I use for this unit?
- SY-200 Factory Reset (Initialization)
- BOSS 200-Series Pedals: How to control patch changes and effect On/Off via MIDI in a BOSS 200-Series pedal using a single MIDI value sending controller?
- SY-200: How do I set EXP to control the Wet and Dry signal?
- SY-200 Write / Exchange / Initialize Menus Explained


* * *
**TIPS FOR CABLING AND UPDATE INSTRUCTIONS:**
When attempting the firmware update, check and try using some different USB cables:
microUSB B type, to USB 2.0 A type data cables, when possible, connect directly to a USB 2.0 A port directly on your computer. Not all micro USB B type cables are the same, some are for charging only and some are for charging and data transfer.
Please use a micro USB B type to USB 2.0 A type data cable, for example.

Also, to mention, if you're using a WINDOWS 10 computer, when you download the SY-200 firmware update, locate it in the Downloads Folder, then RIGHT MOUSE-CLICK choose EXTRACT ALL. It's necessary to unzip and EXTRACT the zipped update download, then open the extracted folder and use the update MIDI files within.
The update files will not be read correctly if using the zipped download and data files that have not been extracted.


* * *



Thanks and enjoy your day.
Roland/BOSS Product Support

messages.name: Austin Sandick
messages.msg:
Alberto,

Sorry to hear you're having issues.
Maybe you're having issues with the USB cable or connection you're making from the SY to your computer.
Here are some quick tips for troubleshooting USB connectivity with your Roland/BOSS devices.

**USB CONNECTIVITY TROUBLESHOOTING:**

If your Roland BOSS device connects to a desktop computer via USB, it’s very important to try and connect to a dedicated USB 2.0 A female type port directly on the computer.
Often times, USB ports on the front of computers and those on monitors and QWERTY keyboards are considered hubs, and are not recommended for proper Roland BOSS device USB connectivity.
However, some newer computers only have USB 3.0 or USB-C ports available, in which case a USB hub adapter may be necessary. We test and use the following USB hub adapter, and it provides multiple USB connectivity options most importantly the USB 2.0 A port option.

Example Cable:
(micro B type USB to USB 2.0 A type data cable).

Note: Not all USB cables are the same, some are for charging only and not for data.
If necessary when troubleshooting connectivity, try some alternate USB 2.0 or micro B type USB cables and try some alternate USB 2.0 A compatible ports on computer or USB hub.

If you have any onboard computer 3rd party security software running, please disable/disarm them temporarily while attempting to connect your Roland BOSS device along with software editor applications.
Also, temporarily disconnect any 3rd party USB interfaces or devices that may impede your Roland BOSS device connectivity.


* * *


Thanks and enjoy your day.
Roland/BOSS Product Support

messages.name: Austin Sandick
messages.msg:
Hello Darian,

Thanks for reaching out and contacting Roland BOSS USA Operational Product Support about the RC-10R.

Sorry to hear you're having issues.
If the RHYTHM or LOOP section of the RC-10r is playing while attempting to put the RC-10r in STORAGE MODE: ON, the error STOP ALL AND SAVE will appear, please stop all track/rhythm playback before attempting MASS STORAGE:ON.

If you're still having issues, then maybe there might be a corrupt file in your RC-10r somehow and a factory reset using the setting SYSTEM+MEMORY is required to remedy the issue.
RC-10R: Factory Reset (Initialization)

Let us know if you have further operational questions.
Additional links and support documentation below.

* * *
**PLEASE SEE OUR RC-10R SUPPORT INFO AND WEBLINKS BELOW:**

**RC-10R FEATURES:**
**https://www.boss.info/us/products/rc-10r/features/**

**RC-10R SPECIFICATIONS:**
**https://www.boss.info/us/products/rc-10r/specifications/**

**RC-10R ACCESSORIES:**
**https://www.boss.info/us/products/rc-10r/accessories/**

* * *
**RC-10R UPDATES DOWNLOAD & DRIVERS:**
**https://www.boss.info/us/products/rc-10r/downloads/**

**RC-10R SYSTEM PROGRAM FIRMWARE UPDATE:**

- **RC-10R System Program ( Ver.1.10 )**
**Review the "How To Tell Version" and "Procedure for Update" instructions.**

* * *
**RC-10R BOSS TONE STUDIOS SOFTWARE APPLICATION (WINDOWS/MAC):**

- **BOSS TONE STUDIO for RC-10R Ver.1.0.0 for Windows**
- **BOSS TONE STUDIO for RC-10R Ver.1.0.1 for macOS**

* * *
**RC-10R RHYTHM CONVERTER SOFTWARE APPLICATION (WINDOWS/MAC):**

- **RC-10R Rhythm Converter Ver.1.0.0 for Windows**
- **RC-10R Rhythm Converter Ver.1.0.1 for macOS**

* * *
**RC-10R SUPPORT DOCUMENTATION (PDF):**
**https://www.boss.info/us/products/rc-10r/support/**

**RC-10R OWNER'S MANUAL:**

- **RC-10R Owner's Manual**
- **RC-10R Owner's Manual (Español)**

**RC-10R PARAMETER GUIDE:**
**- ****RC-10R Parameter Guide**

**RC-10R MIDI IMPLEMENTATION GUIDE:**

- **RC-10R MIDI Implementation**

* * *
**RC-10R FIRMWARE VERSION CHECK:**
**HOW TO KNOW THE VERSION**
**Before you start, check the system program version of your RC-10R.**

1. **Hold down [MENU] button and connect the AC adaptor.**
*** Use only the included AC adaptor.**

**The power comes on, and the version is displayed on the LCD screen.**
*** If this shows the latest version (version 1.10 or later), there's no need to update your RC-10R.**
2. **After verifying the displayed version, switch off the power.**

* * *
**RC-10R FACTORY RESET INSTRUCTIONS:**
**Resetting the RC-10R’s settings to their original factory default settings is referred to as “Factory Reset.” **
**Factory reset lets you return the system settings to their factory-set state of last System Program Update and will initialize all phrase memories. When you initialize the phrase memories, the phrases are deleted. **
**1. Press the [MENU] button. The MENU screen appears.**
**2. Turn the [VALUE] knob to select “FACTORY RESET,” and then press the [VALUE] knob to confirm. **
**You see a screen where you can specify the range of the factory reset.**

**3. Specify the range of the factory reset**

**4. Press the [VALUE] knob to confirm the range of the factory reset. If you decide to cancel, press the [EXIT] button. **
**5. Turn the [VALUE] knob to select “YES,” and then press the [VALUE] knob. The factory reset is executed.**



 **![](https://rolandus.zendesk.com/attachments/token/1GQEVkR8y5Eu1lW2f0gEd83TT/?name=inline-1037220627.png) ![](https://rolandus.zendesk.com/attachments/token/5O2JfNVeaocgwvgQoPTZTy3vH/?name=inline-870365580.png)**

* * *


Thanks and enjoy your day.
Roland/BOSS Product Support

messages.msg_o:
That's the problem. Nothing is playing. Looping is stopped but it still won't let me.  I think I found a workaround. I have to switch out of the memory slot and then back - then I can turn on mass storage.

Another related issue is: how do I set what happens after a backing track in a mem slot plays  it keeps looping.  I went into the rhythm and loop menu and changed it, but when I come back to it it reverts back to something else. In my research I think I saw that I have to change it for each memory slot manually? Is this true? Furthermore is there a way to set up a template so that I don't have to do this for everything on memory slot.

Lastly, I need to understand how these memory locations work. I'm very confused about it. When I record a loop with the pedal, is it stored temporarily and then only locked into a particular memory slot when I manually write to mem slot using the menu+ exit?

I created a backing track on mem 1, and want to set the looping to be off. What exact steps do I need to do for it to stay that way next time I turn it on?

Sorry one last question. When I use the Roland rhythm app to make my own custom beats, where are they stored? In the rhythm memory or in the loop memory 1-99?
messages.name: Darian Leduc
messages.msg:
That's the problem. Nothing is playing. Looping is stopped but it still won't let me.  I think I found a workaround. I have to switch out of the memory slot and then back - then I can turn on mass storage.

Another related issue is: how do I set what happens after a backing track in a mem slot plays  it keeps looping.  I went into the rhythm and loop menu and changed it, but when I come back to it it reverts back to something else. In my research I think I saw that I have to change it for each memory slot manually? messages.name: Austin Sandick
messages.msg:
Darian,

I'd still suggest a factory reset to remedy your workaround. This does not seem like normal operation for the RC-10r. The particular memory slot you enter shouldn't matter whether the unit enter STORAGE MODE or not.

To play a TRK 1 or 2 only once and not loop, you'll need to change the setting for LOOP TRK (1 or 2) PLAY to ONE SHOT.
See parameter description in the screenshot below.

 ![](https://rolandus.zendesk.com/attachments/token/r0sv96iehC8KhSXp5kRsSGACR/?name=Screenshot+2025-06-10+at+5.45.37%E2%80%AFPM.png)

Memory slots work very much like presets, you need to perform the WRITE (save) process as documented on page 17 of the Owner's Manual under Saving a Phrase if you wish to save a LOOP or specific Rhythm to a MEMORY.

- **RC-10R Owner's Manual**

When uploading your custom MIDI files to played by the RC-10r using the Rhythm Converter program, these Rhythms are stored under the genre USER.
See the attachment for the RC-10r Rhythm Converter Owner's Manual, it may be helpful when using the software.

Hope this helps.


Thanks and enjoy your day.
Roland/BOSS Product Support

messages.msg_o:
The only options for ALL CLEAR either share button configurations with PLAY/STOP operations or are single button modes. This forces users to effectively wasteful in how they configure their valuable CTL mappings.

Users should not be forced to configure a single CTL button for ALL CLEAR
- the excludes the ability to use CLICK and HOLD capabilities of the button / footswitch

User should not be forced to use ALL CLEAR (HOLD or CLICK) in combination with PLAY / STOP operations
- these are incompatible operations since it forces loops to PLAY before they can be cleared
- this forces the musician to accept noise artifacts during their performance or use complex button operation to avoid spurious loop noise during clearing. Or users must waste a footswitch by dedicating it to the CLEAR operation.

As an example of a more practical / compatible button function combination for performance, ALL CLEAR (HOLD or CLICK) would be more compatible with UNDO/REDO and/or any other operation that does not play audio when activated.

Ideally, the user would be able to configure all button / footswitch actions independently rather than being limited by the pre-defined combinations provided by BOSS. Specifically, the user should be able to configure PUSH, HOLD, and CLICK actions independently for each footswitch. 
Product Name: RC-600
Serial Number: B8P0576
Purchase Date: 2023-10-04
Purchase Method: In a store
Purchase Dealer: GUITAR CENTER #216

messages.msg_o:
Hello.  I am considering purchasing a Roland FANTOM 8 EX Synthesizer Workstation, but I do have a number of questions where I can use some help.

1. Please provide me with details of your warranty and how it works if there is ever a problem issue.

2. This device was released in April 2024, I believe.  (1) Should I assume that the 2023 EX upgrade for Roland’s Fantom is now included and updated in the new Fantom? Thus, no need to purchase it?  Is that correct?  

3. You probably won't answer this question, but I will ask anyway: Does Roland intend to release a new Fantom Synthesizer Workstation in the next several months to a year or so?  If true, I would considering holding off a purchase.  

4. I currently own the Roland Integra 7.  Are those Synthesizer samples compatible for integrating with the Roland FANTOM 8 EX?   

5.  I downloaded the condensed manual and noticed it stated that it was version 1.  Is that the still the current version?

6. Just for your interest and perhaps entertainment will mention that the last Roland Synthesizer Workstation I purchased was the JV-1000 back in 1993, perhaps before you were born :)   I was among the very first to buy that product.  It was very expensive  - over $4 thousand dollars back then - an awesome instrument, but as you may know the keyboard eventually had disastrous issues with a red epoxy glue that melted the key weights and blew out the circuitry, and also shorted out the memory.  It was a very sad day for me.  I couldn't repair it even with Roland's help.  

Anyway, I am very interested in learning more about this product.   I appreciate any guidance you can provide me.  Thank you very much!   - John Cavadias

messages.name: Shane Pachica
messages.msg:
**Hey John,**

Thanks for reaching out about the Roland Fantom 8 EX! I’ll do my best to answer your questions clearly:


-

The Fantom 8 EX comes with a **2-year manufacturer’s warranty**. You can find full details on warranty coverage and how to request service at the link below:

Warranty Info & Service Requests

- If you purchased a **Fantom EX** (indicated on the packaging and top panel), the upgrade is **already pre-installed**—no need to purchase it separately.
- While we can’t comment on future product releases or timelines, there are **no new Fantom workstations** expected in the next several months to a year that I know of. The EX series is the latest release.
-

Regarding sampling from your Integra synthesizer: yes, you can import those samples into the **sampler section** of the Fantom EX and assign them chromatically across the keybed (as multisamples). This is demonstrated in the following video, around the **4:30** and **8:20** marks:

Fantom EX Sampling Demo

-

The current system version for the Fantom EX is **1.02**, available here:

Fantom EX Downloads



Also, we love hearing stories from customers about their vintage Roland gear—thanks for sharing! Sorry to hear yours couldn’t be repaired, but we’re glad it brought you joy while it lasted.

Let me know if you have any other questions or if you’d like help with purchasing or locating a dealer!

messages.name: Austin Sandick
messages.msg:
Hello Curt,

Thanks for reaching out and contacting Roland BOSS USA Operational Product Support about the DM-101.

Please confirm the current version of the DM-101 firmware your unit is operating on.
Please attempt to perform the update process again.

**HOW TO TELL THE VERSION**

Please check the version of the system working on your DM-101 before downloading the archive file.

1.

Hold down the [**MEMORY**] button on the panel and connect the AC adaptor.
The power comes on, and the **MEMORY** indicator shows the version.
When the **MANUAL** and **MEMORY 4** indicators light up, the version is 1.01. Carry out this update.
When the **MANUAL** and **MEMORY 3** indicators light up, the version is 1.02. Carry out this update.
When the **MANUAL** and **MEMORY 2** indicators light up, the version is 1.03. Carry out this update.
If the **MANUAL** and **MEMORY 1** indicators light up, the version is the latest version (version 1.04), there's no need to update your DM-101.

2.

After verifying the version, switch off the power.



In order to perform the update for the DM-101, you'll need the following pieces of gear.
1x micro USB A-B 2.0 data transfer rated
1x DM-101 DELAY MACHINE
1x BOSS PSA-120(s) power adaptor
1x your computer MAC or WINDOWS
1x SMF Player current version
Once you have these components, you're ready to perform the update to version 1.03.


* * *

### **Step 1: **
Download the update files needed from the website link below.
RE-202 FIRMWARE SYSTEM PROGRAM UPDATE:
**DM-101 SYSTEM PROGRAM ( VER.1.04 )**
scroll to the bottom of the webpage, click the agree check box, and then click DOWNLOAD on the website. Your computer should start downloading the zip folder named "dm101_sys_v104".
After this zip folder is downloaded, you'll need to open this folder.
On MAC, simply double-click the zip folder and MAC will unzip the folder automatically into a copy called "dm101_sys_v104"
On Windows, It is best to EXTRACT ALL to your DESKTOP, this makes accessing the files easier for the next steps in the update.


* * *

### **Step 2: **
Put your DM-101 into Update Mode and connect the DM-101 to a USB 2.0 compatible port on your computer.
Hold down the [**MEMORY**] foot switch and connect the included AC adaptor to turn on the power.
The DM-101 powers up, and only the indicator of the [**ON/OFF**] switch lights up.
Connect the DM-101 and the computer using the USB cable.
Download and open the SMF player that matches your computer's operating system below.

**SMF Player for macOS Big Sur 11.x - macOS Sequoia 15.x**
**SMF PLAYER FOR MACOS 10.13 - MACOS 14.X**
**SMF PLAYER FOR WINDOWS**
**SMF PLAYER FOR MACOS / OS X**

Open the SMF Player and you should see the DM-101 as a selectable option.
If you do not see DM-101 as a selectable option, please try a different USB cable to connect the DM-101 that is rated for Data Transfer 2.0.
**USB CONNECTIVITY TROUBLESHOOTING:**
1. If your Roland BOSS device connects to a desktop computer via USB, it’s very important to try and connect to a dedicated USB 2.0 A female type port directly on the computer.
Often times, USB ports on the front of computers and those on monitors and QWERTY keyboards are considered hubs, and are not recommended for proper Roland BOSS device USB connectivity.
However, some newer computers only have USB 3.0 or USB-C ports available, in which case a USB hub adaptor may be necessary. We test and use the following **USB hub adaptor**, and it provides multiple USB connectivity options, most importantly the USB 2.0 A port option.
USB cabling:
**(****micro B type USB to USB 2.0 A type data cable****).**
For example used with: POCKET-GT, WAZA-AIR, WAZA-AIR BASS, RC-5, RC-10R, RC-500, GT-1000CORE, BOSS DD/EQ/MD/OD/SY-200 Series Pedals, DM-101, RE-202 etc.

Note: Not all USB cables are the same, some are for charging only and not for data.
If necessary, when troubleshooting connectivity, try some alternate USB 2.0 or micro B type USB cables and try some alternate USB 2.0 A compatible ports on computer or USB hub.
3. If you have any onboard computer 3rd party security software running, please disable/disarm them temporarily while attempting to connect your Roland BOSS device along with software editor applications.
Also, temporarily disconnect any 3rd party USB interfaces or devices that may impede your Roland BOSS device connectivity.
Visual images of USB type connections for proper cable identification:
 ![](https://rolandus.zendesk.com/attachments/token/IubCIzk0lsWmBALEPnFHQ43nh/?name=inline-1581383714.png)


* * *


### **Step 3: **
In the SMF Player, select DM-101 as the MIDI OUT device
 ![](https://rolandus.zendesk.com/attachments/token/GWe98aJpewDZOynDBCrklQaFc/?name=Screen+Shot+2023-12-11+at+4.53.13+PM.png)

Click [**Path**] (click [**Select...**] for Mac) on “UpdSMF” and specify the location where the update files from SMF Path (SMF Folder for Mac). Then, click the [**OK**] button. Make sure to select the folder labeled "dm101_sys_v104". Please do not attempt to select the .mid or TXT files inside the folder, the DM-101 need all files in the folder labeled "dm101_sys_v104" for the update process.

 ![](https://rolandus.zendesk.com/attachments/token/7LkVwZ2xjOPlHwExvvx3nn4s9/?name=Screen+Shot+2023-12-11+at+4.53.41+PM.png) ![](https://rolandus.zendesk.com/attachments/token/4f5mnE6x5sAHMRSRWJrl7eQih/?name=Screen+Shot+2023-12-11+at+4.53.52+PM.png)


Once the folder "dm101_sys_v104" have been selected, and you see the .mid files present in the SMF Player, press SEND

When the DM-101 [**ON/OFF**] and [**TAP**] switch indicators light, the update has finished.
The SMF Player will also display COMPLETE.
Disconnect the USB cable and disconnect the AC adaptor to turn off the power.
You've successfully completed the update for the DM-101 DELAY MACHINE Pedal.
Use the How to tell the Version instructions from earlier to confirm the update was successful.

Below are additions to the DM-101 with the firmware v1.04.

**UPDATE HISTORY**
   [**Ver.1.04**] APR 2024

Bug Fixes
The following bugs have been fixed.

-

Fixed an issue where the DELAY TIME change sound was heard when switching MEMORY during MIDI SYNC operation.


[**Ver.1.03**] DEC 2023

Bug Fixes
The following bugs have been fixed.

- Fixed an issue in which the DELAY TIME was short only when VARIATION 4, 5, 9 was used in MULTI-HEAD mode during MIDI sync operation.


[**Ver.1.02**] OCT 2023

Bug Fixes
The following bugs have been fixed.

- The issue with the delay sound sometimes not produced when changing the delay mode while MIDI sync is in use has been fixed.
- The position of the [**DELAY VOLUME**] knob at which sound starts to be produced has been improved.


* * *


Thanks and enjoy your day.
Roland/BOSS Product Support

messages.name: David Marino
messages.msg:
Hello Curt,

Thanks for reaching out and contacting Roland BOSS USA Operational Product Support about the DM-101.

**Try a Factory Reset on the DM-101, to get back to normal functionality:**
**DM-101: Restoring the Factory Settings (Factory Reset)**

Then you should be able to try the firmware update once again.
**DM-101 SYSTEM PROGRAM ( VER.1.04 )**
**Q: Which WINDOWS/macOS Version are you using?**
**Review the Procedure for The Update section.**

**For macOS users, you can download the firmware update and the update files are ready to use and load into the SMF player.**
Make sure to use the correct SMF player for your specific macOS Version, otherwise it will incorrectly order the firmware update files.
The update files will be in numerical sequence once loaded in the SMF player correctly.
If you use the incorrect SMF player, it will scramble the order of the update files, and not update the unit.

For WINDOWS users, once you download the firmware update, make sure to Right Mouse Click the downloaded zipped folder, and Choose Extract All.
This will un-archive/unzip and extract all the contents to the desktop, so that the SMF player can properly load the update files.
Again, use the correct SMF player for your WINDOWS OS computer, however, there should be only one SMF player for WINDOWS.

**If using macOS, please make sure to use the correct SMF player for your specific macOS version.**

**macOS SMF Players:**
**SMF Player for macOS Big Sur 11.x - macOS Sequoia 15.x**
**SMF PLAYER FOR MACOS 10.13 - MACOS 14.X**

**WINDOWS SMF Players:**
**SMF PLAYER FOR WINDOWS**





Kind regards

messages.name: Austin Sandick
messages.msg:
Hello Curt Ng,

Thanks for reaching out and contacting Roland BOSS USA Operational Product Support about the DM-101 / SMF Player.

Sorry to hear you're having issues with your DM-101 / SMF Player.
If the pedal is still malfunctioning, then we suggest exchanging with your point of purchase/dealer/store/web store, for a new product, under the dealer's warranty (usually 30-day warranty terms).

Please inform the dealer/sales tech, of the product issues you're having, and arrange an exchange of product, for a new device. This would help with an expedited quick turn around.

- If outside of Dealer Warranty terms and Manufacturer Warranty Service/Repair is needed, you may choose to submit a Service Repair Request to our Roland BOSS Factory Service Department in Chino, CA. Once you have an RA/Return Authorization number, you may send your device in, for evaluation, diagnosis, service and repair.

- All that is needed, is to submit a Service Repair Request, and submit necessary service info, device, and a copy of your original point of sale purchase receipt/invoice, to honor the Manufacturer Warranty Terms.
If outside of warranty terms, the user may choose to have the device serviced/repaired outside of warranty.
Our Service Techs can provide a service/repair quote for parts and labor, if a repair option is available.
(Note: Some vintage legacy device pedals/products may not have parts available for service/repair)

* * *
**Please review our Roland BOSS Manufacturer Warranty Information, create a Roland BOSS Backstage account, register your product and submit a Service Repair Request and use the other self-service tools and weblinks available:**
 ![](https://support.roland.com/attachments/token/jchHAj757yHujYD2P8NF4bR38/?name=image.png)

* * *
**WARRANTY INFORMATION**
Roland BOSS Product Manufacturer Warranty Information:
https://www.roland.com/us/support/service_repair/

**REGISTER PRODUCT**
Register your Roland BOSS Product here:
https://www.boss.info/backstage/mygear#register_product

**SERVICE REPAIR REQUEST**
Submit a Service Repair Request for Warranty Service by Roland BOSS Factory Service Department.
https://www.boss.info/backstage/support#service_request

**REPAIR STATUS**
https://www.boss.info/backstage/support#repair_status

**PARTS REQUEST**
https://www.boss.info/backstage/support#parts_order_request

**SERVICE CENTER LOCATOR**
If your product is within or outside the Manufacturer Warranty terms, you can use one of our Roland BOSS Certified Service Centers nearest you for service repair. If there's not an available 3rd party Service Center nearby, then you'll need to submit a Service Repair Request to our Roland BOSS Factory Service Center.
https://www.roland.com/us/support/service_repair/service_centers/


* * *


Thanks and enjoy your day.
Roland/BOSS Product Support

messages.name: Travis Hartnett
messages.msg:
Hello Bobby Montenegro,

Thanks for contacting us!
Roland Cloud requires macOS 11 or later--macOS 10 support was dropped a while ago. You will not be able to update Cloud Manager.

You can try clearing your browser cache and restarting your machine, but that's about it with macOS 10 at this point.

Regards,

Travis

messages.name: David Marino
messages.msg:
Hello Thomas,

Thanks for reaching out and contacting Roland BOSS USA Operational Product Support about the IR-2.
Sorry to hear you're having issues with your IR-2 pedal.
Did you review the last email we sent to you, we did not receive a response from you, just another support email?

So when using an RV-6, first in your effect chain, before input to the IR-2, it will have a more pronounced reverb effect sound, because it's first in the chain, from guitar output direct into the RV-6. So usually, the first effect will have the most wet sound.
If using the RV-6 in the IR-2 FX LOOP: SEND/RETURN, it comes after the amp and cab but before the ambiance effect block, so is further down, but not last in the effect chain.

Are you connecting the RV-6 to the FX LOOP: with a Mono or Stereo Return option?
You could try using the IR-2 FX LOOP: Stereo Return option, this may also make the effect more pronounced if using headphones which are also stereo monitoring.

Review page 18 of the manual for how to change the RETURN setting to STEREO:
You'll also need a sold separate, INSERT Y CABLE with 1/4" TRS Stereo end and two 1/4" TS mono ends.
This allows to SEND MONO from the IR-2, and use the STEREO RETURN on the IR-2 and connect to the LEFT and RIGHT MONO OUTPUTS of the RV-6.

 ![](https://rolandus.zendesk.com/attachments/token/bez2JqfzEYYMpUwHnpFzpSZr3/?name=image.png)

messages.name: David Marino
messages.msg:
Hello Thomas,

Thanks for reaching out and contacting Roland BOSS USA Operational Product Support about the IR-2.
So sorry for the delay of reply on your query here.
Looks like it was accidentally back logged for testing, however, we had to wait for the proper gear to arrive for a cross-check.

So we did finally get to test your guitar rig effect chain set up, and we didn't find any issue with the RV-6 pedal reverb lushness to be affected at all.
However, we did find some items that may affect the headphones output sound.


- First, if setting to a STEREO FX LOOP SEND/RETURN setting on the IR-2, make sure to use a 1/4" TRS to 2 - 1/4" TS INSERT-Y Cable and connect the RV-6: OUTPUT A and B to the INSERT Y CABLE for the STEREO RETURN, and connect the IR-2: 1/4" TS MONO SEND to the RV-6: INPUT A.
This allows for the RV-6 for MONO INPUT > with STEREO OUTPUT, and connected to the IR-2 appropriately.
Otherwise, if only using a MONO signal, simply use the IR-2: FX LOOP SEND/RETURN, set to MONO.
Connect to the RV-6 INPUT A and OUTPUT A jacks, with 1/4" TS mono instrument/guitar cables, for mono reverb effect sound.
- If using a 1/4" TRS adapter, many adapters can have intermittent behavior.
So this can apply to both the IR-2: 1/4" TRS STEREO RETURN, and also the 3.5mm TRS stereo HEADPHONES jack on the IR-2.
We found different results, depending on what adapters were used, and had the best results when using direct wired 3.5mm TRS Stereo wired headphones, like our Beyer Dynamics, or similar wired quality, etc.
Another point to note, is that many headphones/earbud cables use TRRS cable ends, so these are not the best for compatibility with the IR-2: 3.5mm TRS headphones jack connection.

When we tested the IR-2 and RV-6 with stereo output set up, with your settings, the REVERB still sounded robust from amp output and from the headphones.
The only issues we encountered were from the 3.5mm TRS adapters or Insert Y Cable adapter, and this was mostly a mono/stereo headphone sound output issues, like only one side would be outputting for the headset.

Again, apologies for the delay of reply in regard to your query.
Thanks for playing Roland BOSS music gear!

messages.name: Austin Sandick
messages.msg:
Hello Tahnee,

Thanks for reaching out and contacting Roland BOSS USA Operational Product Support about the CUBE Street (Black).

Sorry to hear you're having issues.
If you were busking with the amp, most likely you were using batteries to power the Cube Street. Were the batteries left in the battery compartment before storing away? It's not if batteries will leak, it is when. Please check that the battery cavity is clean and does not contain old batteries.

For connection assistance, we recommend looking at page 10 of the owner's manual.
https://www.roland.com/global/support/by_product/cube_street/owners_manuals/a1cced7c-7237-4e1d-8251-6aae668278fc/

Unfortunately, the ROLAND BOSS CUBE Street (Black) is considered a discontinued legacy device, and we no longer provide operational support for it. We simply do not have this product in our offices for testing and troubleshooting anymore.
We appreciate your understanding and cooperation.

messages.name: Scotty Anderson
messages.msg:
Hello Joseph,

Thank you for contacting Roland Product Support.
Yes,  this should be possible, however,  I'm not familiar with the setup in Reaper.
I use the exact same process in Ableton for the P-6 and all of my other gear.

**In general, this is how a setup like this should go:**

1. Connect the P-6 to your computer with a data supported USB C cable.
2. Access the settings or preferences menu in your DAW.
3. Select Audio Settings in the DAW.
4. Select the P-6 as the Audio Input Device.
5. Select your Audio interface as the Audio Output Device
6. Ensure that the headphone volume on your Audio Interface is turned up to listening volume.
7. Create an audio track in your DAW.
8. Play the P-6 and you should be able to see activity in the track audio meter.
9. Use headphones to monitor the audio.
10. If there isn't audio in the headphones, but there's activity in the meter on the audio track, check that Input Monitoring is enabled for the audio track.

messages.msg:
Joseph,

The P-6 doesn't have a way to mix down the audio track for export, however, since you will  already be in your DAW for the vocals, recording the P-6 is as simple as opening an audio track selecting the P-6 as the audio device for the track and arming it for recording.

Best Regards,

Hi Brendan,

Here is your Return Authorization (RA) number for your V-4EX: RA# S14906863

Please use appropriate packaging and ship to the following address:

Roland Corporation US
15750 Mountain Ave
Chino, CA 91708

Please note - our factory service center does NOT have a will call area for drop offs or pickups, therefore all products must be shipped to the above address with UPS/FedEx. There is no postal service available at our service location, SO PLEASE DO NOT SHIP VIA USPS. Please make sure signature is required for package delivery.

Personnel at this address are not authorized to receive repairs directly from customers. Any attempt to drop off units will be rejected.

Please write your RA# clearly on the outside of the shipping box underneath the address. If this is a warranty repair, please place a copy of your sales receipt inside the box. We recommend that you insure your V-4EX with your shipping carrier to cover any accidental damage or loss that may occur in the shipping process.

For non-warranty repairs, we will contact you with an estimate after we have inspected your V-4EX. In most cases this will be 3-5 business days after we receive it.

Kind Regards,
Roland Service Department

messages.msg_o: I accidentally erased a sound from the JV 1080 plugin I just purchased from Sweetwater. How can I get it back? I tried deinstalling and reinstalling the plugin but the sound I was using is still missing. thanks
messages.name: david blazer
messages.msg: I accidentally erased a sound from the JV 1080 plugin I just purchased from Sweetwater. How can I get it back? I tried deinstalling and reinstalling the plugin but the sound I was using is still missing. thanks

messages.name: Travis Hartnett
messages.msg:
Hello david blazer,

Thanks for contacting us!
**How To Restore An Instrument’s Factory Presets**

If you find that the initial factory presets are missing from a Roland Cloud virtual instrument, here’s how to get them to re-appear.

If you’re using **Windows**:

1. Go to C:\ProgramData\Roland Cloud\ and move the folder of the plug-in with the missing presetsto the Desktop.
2. Start your DAW, add the plug-in to a track.

If you’re using **macOS**:

1. Select Go To Folder from the Finder's Go menu, and enter this entire path: /Library/Application Support/Roland Cloud/
2. Click Go
3. Move the folder of the plug-in (Juno-106 or whatever) with the missing presets to the Desktop
4. Start your DAW and add the plug-in to a track
5. Then exit your DAW, and reinstall the expansion patches.

Note: the two most common causes for missing factory patches are installing expansion patches before ever using the plug-in a track, or clicking the “Delete” button in the patch browser window by mistake.

Sent from my iPhone

messages.name: Travis Hartnett
messages.msg:
The patch/bank information is stored in that folder:

/Library/Application Support/Roland Cloud/JV-1080

You'll see the bank names in there with either.bin or .bak appended. Replace .bak with .bin and restart the plugin to use those sounds.

messages.name: Austin Sandick
messages.msg:
Christine,

Thanks for reaching out and contacting Roland BOSS USA Operational Product Support about the KATANA-100 GEN 3.

Every guitar amp will have varying noise floor, which is the noise/sound when idle.
This may differ depending on the AMP TYPE chosen and GAIN/VOLUME settings for the KATANA GEN3 amp.
If necessary, you can use the BTS for KATANA GEN3 software editor, each Channel is provided an NS/Noise Suppressor, to help gate the noise, whenever not playing.
So this is really useful when using high gain amp types and higher gain/volume settings, use the NS set with a higher threshold to gate out the sound, use the decay/release adjustment to make the gate sound more natural upon release, rather than abrupt.
PANEL mode is like any normal guitar amp, what you see knob wise, is what you hear.

While all the other CHANNELS are write/saved preset patches with saved settings.
When switching CHANNELS the knobs will not necessarily indicate what is set, the knobs are not motorized, and can't shift into place for every CHANNEL.
So if you touch a knob, it will catch up to that current position, but the actual saved preset value, may be higher or lower than what the knob is actually indicating.
This may take some time getting used to, but pretty much you can set your sound, with any of the knobs or software editor, then press hold a CHANNEL to save your settings, if using the editor use the WRITE button to write/save your custom user settings.

You can use the MASTER LEVEL volume to control the over all output of the amp, however, the POWER CONTROL and MASTER LEVEL can't be write/saved to a CHANNEL, these always remain separate, and for on the fly manual adjustment by hand, the values of POWER CONTROL and MASTER LEVEL, can not be saved to the CHANNEL.
All the other parameters can be write/saved to the CHANNEL or patch: AMP TYPE, GAIN, VOLUME, EQ, EFFECTS, PRESENCE, etc., can all be saved to the CHANNEL/PATCH.

We suggest, using more of your POWER AMP, so use the 50W POWER CONTROL setting, and use the MASTER LEVEL a bit more.
Then choose your CHANNEL, adjust the AMP TYPE, GAIN and VOLUME, adjust EQ and FX ON/OFF, then save the settings, by holding down the CHANNEL button.
A quick way of balancing CHANNELS, it to take this same "template patch" and save the same settings to all the other CHANNELS.
Once all are the same, then start making derivative changes to each CHANNEL, and save accordingly.
This may provide more of balanced CHANNELS/patches when switching.
However, keep in mind changing the AMP TYPE, is like changing the modeled amp type, so it may need a GAIN or VOLUME increase/decrease.

Hope this all makes sense.

messages.name: David Marino
messages.msg:
Hello Robert,

Thanks for reaching out and contacting Roland BOSS USA Operational Product Support about the RC-600 / Tascam DP-03SD.
Unfortunately, we don't provide 3rd party device support or instructions for exporting/importing audio from a hardware to your RC-600.
We are unable to provide individual audio flow effect chain, or computer tech assistance and consultation.
**With that said, the general process or overview would be a workflow similar to below:**

We reviewed your TASCAM recorder specs and audio file specs and found the following here:
The **DP-03SD Digital Portastudio 8-Track Recorder** from **TASCAM** is a multitrack digital recorder capable of recording 2 channels simultaneously for up to 8 channels total. The DP-03SD records 16-bit/44.1 kHz resolution audio to SD/SDHC cards and can export your mix to your computer via USB.

So from the TASCAM, connect to computer or use SD/SDHC card with audio files, upload these to your computer.
These will most likely be 16bit 44.1kHz WAV audio files.
These TASCAM WAV audio files are a lower spec and quality that what the **RC-600 reads/writes: 32/24bit 44.1kHz .WAV audio files.**

So once you've extracted the TASCAM WAV audio files to your computer, you'll need to use a WAV audio file converter, or DAW audio software application, or a simpler audio converter, available online, simply Google Search: "audio file converter"

You'll need to up-sample your TASCAM WAV audio, to meet the specs of the RC-600.
So use the audio converter, or a DAW audio software: Garageband, Logic Pro, ProTools, Ableton, Audacity, Reaper, etc. to up-sample your TASCAM audio to the RC-600 audio specs, so that the audio files are compatible for playback by the RC-600.
**RC-600 reads/writes: 32/24bit 44.1kHz WAV audio files.**

Once you've updated converted the TASCAM audio and up-sampled the audio files to the correct RC-600 specs, then you can import these into your RC-600 using the following RC software tool, connect with USB Storage Mode: ON, and the RC-600(DRIVE:) will appear as an external drive on your computer, and you can open the ROLAND folder > then open the WAV folder, and you can load any compatible WAV audio files to each MEMORY location and any of the 6 Tracks of each MEMORY location/patch.
You may also use the BTS for RC tool for importing/exporting audio to your RC-600, please make sure the audio is converted first for proper playback and usage, otherwise, the RC-600 may read, "unsupported format".
**BOSS TONE STUDIO for RC Ver.1.3.0 for Windows**
**BOSS TONE STUDIO for RC Ver.1.3.0 for macOS**

**Please also make sure your RC-600 firmware is up up-to-dateth the latest version:**
**RC-600 System Program ( Ver.1.50 )**

* * *
**PLEASE REVIEW OUR RC-600 SUPPORT INFO AND WEBLINKS BELOW**

**RC-600 FEATURES:**
**https://www.boss.info/us/products/rc-600/features/**

**RC-600 SPECS:**
**https://www.boss.info/us/products/rc-600/specifications/**

**RC-600 ARTICLES:**
**https://www.boss.info/us/products/rc-600/articles/**

**RC-600 ACCESSORIES:**

messages.msg:
To install any version of Zenology please follow these steps:


1. Download and install Roland Cloud Manager v3.1.16
2. Open Roland Cloud Manager and click on "Software Instruments."
3. Click on "My Library"
4. In the search bar, type Zenology
5. Click on "Install" on the right-side of the column.
6. Open Zenology in your favorite DAW
7.

Start making music!

Note: If Zenology Pro isn't unlocked to install, please sign out of Roland Cloud Manager then sign back in and that should unlock the download.

 ![](https://rolandus.zendesk.com/attachments/token/ltUUPaenGbLwHoUxaNCmuA1Eg/?name=Screen+Shot+2023-04-05+at+3.26.28+PM.png)


Please let us know if you have any other questions regarding this matter.

Thanks,
Jules

messages.name: Jules Richard
messages.msg:
Hi Roman,

Thanks for contacting us!

Your software instrument has successfully been registered on this account.

*      Next you'll need to download and install Roland Cloud Manager. This is where you'll install your software instrument from:

The newest version of RCM can be downloaded on the following page: https://www.roland.com/us/products/rc_roland_cloud_manager/

*      Once you've installed Roland Cloud Manager, open it, login and click on "Software Instruments > My Library page > My Products."

*      Then, you'll need to install your software instrument.
Roland Cloud: How To Install An Instrument From Roland Cloud Manager.
Note: Once you're on the My Library page you can type the name of your software instrument in the search bar.


The Roland Cloud virtual instruments are all plug-ins that are used by a host application such as Apple Logic/GarageBand, Avid Pro Tools, Ableton Live, Steinberg Cubase, Roland Zenbeats and many others. In general, any 64-bit DAW that supports VST, AU or AAX virtual instruments will work with the Roland Cloud catalog. Check with the DAW manufacturer and the specifications section of our website for further details. For specific instructions on using virtual instruments in your DAW, refer to the DAW documentation.

The basic process is:
*      Create a new project.
*      Add a MIDI track to the project.
*      Add the virtual instrument to the MIDI track.
*      Start making music.

Please let us know if you have any other questions regarding this matter.

Best regards,

Jules

Hi Zachary,

Apologies for the delay!

When you refer to "patterns", are you referring to patterns that were recorded on the pattern sequencer of a FANTOM? These patterns are SMF files but when executing the import operation the FANTOM shouldn't display a message to power cycle.

Please confirm what the customer is trying to do:

2. Is it an audio sample they're trying to import? What is the format of the file?

The message asking to power cycle the FANTOM is strange and we'll require more details in order to be able to assist further. Here's a link to the support documents for the FANTOM-8 EX. Please have the customer locate the operation they're trying to perform, and get back to us with more info.

https://www.roland.com/us/products/fantom_8_ex/support/

Best regards,

messages.name: Vincent Cifarelli
messages.msg:
Hello Jackson,

This is all very confusing. There is a lot here that the customer needs to clear up for us before we can proceed with further troubleshooting. The "Completed. Please Power Off" screen is not a message that should appear when importing a pattern, expansions etc.

Are they performing a Factory Reset?

Are they formatting the USB flash drive?

Are they performing a "RESTORE" to install a backup they made of the synth?

These are the types of functions that would bring up a screen like "Completed. Please Power Off".

**We will need a video to see what the customer is doing before proceeding any further. We also need to see the contents of the USB flash drive with all folders expanded. What type of file are they trying to import?**

** 1.  The pattern was made on the unit, Fantom 08 EX.**

There is no "FANTOM-08 EX". There is the FANTOM-08, or the FANTOM-8 EX. Based on the image provided, it's a FANTOM-8 EX. Please have the customer understand that these two synths use different System Programs/firmware, so should they update the FANTOM-8 EX using the incorrect update file, it could damage the synth.

** 2.  All information was saved onto a flash drive, just as suggested via keyboard book as well as video. **

Which keyboard book and video specifically? What are they trying to do specifically?


**3.  In retrieving the information, the file was recalled and the information is taking about 3 minutes to load back onto Fantom. **

Importing ususally takes seconds, not minutes. Again, what are they trying to do?


Thank you,



Roland Customer Support
This email was written by an actual human being.

If you have any further questions or concerns, simply reply to this message.

messages.msg:
No worries, Jackson! Apologies if my tone didn't come off as pleasant, it's totally fine. Sometimes customers jump into things that are perhaps a little too advanced before having a grasp of the instrument.

We always appreciate the time you and the Sweetwater staff take to troubleshoot. Perhaps this is a case where the customer should direct his questions to us directly as there are obvious errors in the wording they're using that is making it hard to understand the issue. We don't expect you guys to know the really advanced features of every piece of gear, there's too much to know, and you guys know and do so much already.

Please direct the customer to:

https://www.roland.com/backstage/login

It should only take them two minutes to set up an account and they'll be able to submit a ticket quite easily. They can even bypass the instrument registration procedure and go directly to "PRE-SALES ADVICE" to submit their question since they've already been waiting for a bit.

Ask them to mention that they've been transferred by Sweetwater and that their FANTOM-8 EX issue is ongoing.

I will see the ticket and handle asap. Once I "hopefully" resolve the issue, I can send you guys a summary in case the customer returns to you for more info.

Thanks!
