messages.msg_o:
I am specifically looking into the RC600 solely for routing options as I already own a 300 model. 
I'm looking into guitars that are hybrid, mostly the Taylor T5zPro but also possibly a Hybrid PRS. But hopefully this question still pertains to having a seperate Acoustic Guitar and Electric guitar to plug in if I end up using an exisiting Acoustic and seperate Electric guitar.

I wish to create live and also hopefully use for recordings as I'm currently learning about how to use the unit as an interface. So if there is any extra information on the interface side of it regarding the question, would be much appreciated.

But I want to know if i am to use say a Taylor t5z Pro that has both an acoustic (Piezo) sound and and electric (humbucker coils) Sound. I want to loop both acoustic and electric. But is it possible to loop a piece with the acoustic sound that would be routed out to a P.A. but then play the electric sound (Which I would manually switch with the guitar) Through a different routed out option of say 2 Marshalls in Stereo, BUT only to play and select the different route options without needing to record a loop.
Say I record on track 1 an acoustic sound that is routed out to a P.A. but then want to switch to the electric sound to play through the 2 marshall amps (in Stereo) BUT Without looping/Recording. Is this possible? 

Loop acoustic guitar through an output going to a P.A., but then play with an electric sound which is routed to the 2nd stereo outputs, but without needing to press record/loop?

Would I need some sort of AB or ABY switch? 
The Taylor T5z Pro has one input with inbuilt selectors that switch from Humbuckers  to a piezo to get the desired sound, So would essentially only be plugged into Input 1 on the rc600 with the output 1 going to a P.A. and Output 2 going Stereo to 2 Marshall amps.
Hopefully that's not too confusing.
Thanks,

messages.msg:
I am specifically looking into the RC600 solely for routing options as I already own a 300 model. 
I'm looking into guitars that are hybrid, mostly the Taylor T5zPro but also possibly a Hybrid PRS. But hopefully this question still pertains to having a seperate Acoustic Guitar and Electric guitar to plug in if I end up using an exisiting Acoustic and seperate Electric guitar.

I wish to create live and also hopefully use for recordings as I'm currently learning about how to use the unit as an interface. So if there is any extra information on the interface side of it regarding the question, would be much appreciated.

But I want to know if i am to use say a Taylor t5z Pro that has both an acoustic (Piezo) sound and and electric (humbucker coils) Sound. I want to loop both acoustic and electric. But is it possible to loop a piece with the acoustic sound that would be routed out to a P.A. but then play the electric sound (Which I would manually switch with the guitar) Through a different routed out option of say 2 Marshalls in Stereo, BUT only to play and select the different route options without needing to record a loop.
Say I record on track 1 an acoustic sound that is routed out to a P.A. but then want to switch to the electric sound to play through the 2 marshall amps (in Stereo) BUT Without looping/Recording. Is this possible? 

Loop acoustic guitar through an output going to a P.A., but then play with an electric sound which is routed to the 2nd stereo outputs, but without needing to press record/loop?

Would I need some sort of AB or ABY switch? 
The Taylor T5z Pro has one input with inbuilt selectors that switch from Humbuckers  to a piezo to get the desired sound, So would essentially only be plugged into Input 1 on the rc600 with the output 1 going to a P.A. and Output 2 going Stereo to 2 Marshall amps.
Hopefully that's not too confusing.
Thanks,
Stephen

messages.name: Austin Sandick
messages.msg:
Hello Stephen,

Thanks for reaching out and contacting Roland BOSS USA Operational Product Support about the RC-600.

The RC-600 has a numerous amount of ways you can route the inputs, outputs and tracks. All without the use of a foot switch or ABY switch.
There are separate menus in the unit that allow most of the mentioned functionality.
You'll need to enter these menus and adjust which inputs are routed to which outputs, as well as the specific output for the TRACK 1-6 playback.
You can learn more about the individual controls using the RC-600 Parameter Guide.

You may need to use the ASSIGNMENT menu to custom make a control to switch a single INPUT to a different set of OUTPUTS.

All outputs on the RC-600 have stereo L/R options.

Additional RC-600 info and support documentation below.

messages.name: David Marino
messages.msg:
Hello Mark,

Thanks for reaching out and contacting Roland BOSS USA Operational Product Support about the RC-500.
Please check out page 14 of the RC-500 Parameter Guide, there's a PREFERENCE setting for the functionality of the foot switches.
**RC-500 SUPPORT DOCUMENTATION AND LITERATURE (PDF):**
**https://www.boss.info/us/products/rc-500/support/**

**RC-500 OWNER'S MANUAL:**
**[English] RC-500 Owner's Manual [PDF]**

**RC-500 PARAMETER GUIDE:**
**RC-500 Parameter Guide**

The PREFERENCE, setting default is set to SYSTEM, but if you want custom pedal configuration and functionality for each MEMORY patch,
then you would want to set the PREFERENCE to MEMORY and not SYSTEM/GLOBAL for any PEDAL 1/2/3 that you want to have custom for every MEMORY patch.
However, note that if you program the PDL1/PDL2/PDL3 custom settings, and function, you'll need to WRITE/save the custom setting to each MEMORY patch.
When using Preference: SYSTEM, no need to WRITE/save the custom programming, because it's SYSTEM/global, so set it, forget it.

 ![](https://rolandus.zendesk.com/attachments/token/oIH1bmYCW1tzSsKOabxAEtnPb/?name=image.png)

If your RC-500 is not connecting properly with the BTS for RC software editor, then your RC-500 firmware may still need to be updated to the latest version.
We recommend updating the firmware, then do a Factory Reset on SYSTEM to SYSTEM, to reset the newly installed firmware.

**RC-500 SYSTEM/FIRMWARE UPDATE VERSION:**
**RC-500 System Program ( Ver.1.10 )**
Review the included Procedure for the Update and download and install the firmware update manually on to your RC-500 connected in "Update Mode".

**RC-500 Factory Reset:**
**RC-500 Factory Reset (Initialization)**

Also check your USB cabling and USB port connections.
Not all USB cables and ports are the same.
You'll want to use a micro USB B type to USB 2.0 A data cable, and connect directly to a USB 2.0 A port on your computer.
Some newer computers, only have USB-C ports, so you may need to use a USB-C HUB adapter to provide you with a USB 2.0 A compatible port.
Here in support, we use the following:
**https://a.co/d/3OJWj2l**


* * *
**HOW TO KNOW THE FIRMWARE VERSION**

Before you start, check the system program version of your RC-500.

1.

Hold down the [**MENU**] button , and connect a plug to the OUTPUT A/MONO jack. Then it will turn on.
* Press and hold the [MENU] button until "RC-500" appears on the display.

2.

The display indicates the current system version.

3.

Disconnect the plug from the OUTPUT A/MONO jack.

messages.name: Austin Sandick
messages.msg:
Hello Scott Sabbadini,

Thanks for reaching out and contacting Roland BOSS USA Operational Product Support about the LS-2.

Sorry to hear you're having issues with your LS-2.
We'll forward you over to our Roland BOSS Service Center Admins for follow up service info and help.
Please stand by for our Service Admins to reach out to you.

**Please be prepared to provide the following info.**

**Your Name:**
**Phone Number:**
**Shipping Address:**
**Model Number:**
**Serial Number:**
**Detailed description of issue:**
**Point of Purchase:**

* * *
In the meantime and interim:
- Please troubleshoot and test your BOSS compact pedal with the Manufacturer Recommended Power Supplies.

- Test using a brand new 9 volt quality, dry alkaline battery, or a Roland BOSS PSA-120S 500mA 9V power supply.
Unfortunately, we can't guarantee 3rd party other brand power supplies will provide proper functionality and performance. Some 3rd party other brand power supplies, can cause temporary device issues, or terminal damage.
Using a 3rd party other brand power supply will void all warranty terms.

- Test and check all cabling, use 1/4" TS mono unbalanced, instrument/guitar cables, for all guitar audio Input/Output connections, for proper connectivity, and audio signal transfer.

- Connect a 1/4" TS Mono Instrument guitar cable to pedal INPUT for pedal power ON/OFF.
_(For BOSS RC COMPACT LOOPERS: Connect to **OUTPUT A** for power ON)._

- For example cabling, use quality BOSS BIC Lifetime Instrument Cables for all guitar effect chain audio signal cable connections. _(NOTE: DO NOT USE_ _1/4" TRS STEREO CABLES_ _FOR GUITAR EFFECT CHAIN AUDIO CONNECTIONS. TRS cables may not engage the INPUT jack for power ON properly. TRS cables can be used for HEADPHONES audio connections, to a dedicated HEADPHONE jack, or for FS/EXP (FOOTSWITCH/EXPRESSION) CV/CONTROL VOLTAGE external control pedals)._

**EXPLANATION AND VISUAL OF DIFFERENT AUDIO CABLES:**
TS = TIP SLEEVE (UNBALANCED),
TRS = TIP RING SLEEVE (STEREO/BALANCED),
TRRS = TIP RING RING SLEEVE (STEREO LINE LEVEL WITH MIC/MOBILE DEVICE).
 ![](https://rolandus.zendesk.com/attachments/token/uDQRgtwMWKdTbpBwFYntcI8OF/?name=inline1957521896.jpeg)

- Review the BOSS pedal included Owner's Manual for functionality and how to use the pedal or go online for the Owner's Manual PDF downloadable:  https://www.boss.info/us/support/owners_manuals/
Search alphabetically for your device model and owner's manual.

- If the pedal is still malfunctioning, then we suggest exchanging with your point of purchase/dealer/store/web store, for a new product, under the dealer's warranty (usually 30-day warranty terms).

Please inform the dealer/sales tech, of the product issues you're having, and arrange an exchange of product, for a new device. This would help with an expedited quick turn around.

- If outside of Dealer Warranty terms and Manufacturer Warranty Service/Repair is needed, you may choose to submit a Service Repair Request to our Roland BOSS Factory Service Department in Chino, CA. Once you have an RA/Return Authorization number, you may send your device in, for evaluation, diagnosis, service and repair.

- All BOSS stompbox compact and twin pedals are Manufacturer Warrantied for 5 Years, parts and labor, from the date of purchase, for the original user and non-transferable.

- All that is needed, is to submit a Service Repair Request, and submit necessary service info, device, and a copy of your original point of sale purchase receipt/invoice, to honor the Manufacturer Warranty Terms.
If outside of warranty terms, the user may choose to have the device serviced/repaired outside of warranty.
Our Service Techs can provide a service/repair quote for parts and labor, if a repair option is available.
(Note: Some vintage legacy device pedals/products may not have parts available for service/repair)

* * *
**Please review our Roland BOSS Manufacturer Warranty Information, create a Roland BOSS Backstage account, register your product and submit a Service Repair Request and use the other self-service tools and weblinks available:**
 ![](https://support.roland.com/attachments/token/jchHAj757yHujYD2P8NF4bR38/?name=image.png)

* * *
**WARRANTY INFORMATION**
Roland BOSS Product Manufacturer Warranty Information:
https://www.roland.com/us/support/service_repair/

**REGISTER PRODUCT**
Register your Roland BOSS Product here:
https://www.boss.info/backstage/mygear#register_product

**SERVICE REPAIR REQUEST**
Submit a Service Repair Request for Warranty Service by Roland BOSS Factory Service Department.
https://www.boss.info/backstage/support#service_request

**REPAIR STATUS**
https://www.boss.info/backstage/support#repair_status

**PARTS REQUEST**
https://www.boss.info/backstage/support#parts_order_request

**SERVICE CENTER LOCATOR**
If your product is within or outside the Manufacturer Warranty terms, you can use one of our Roland BOSS Certified Service Centers nearest you for service repair. If there's not an available 3rd party Service Center nearby, then you'll need to submit a Service Repair Request to our Roland BOSS Factory Service Center.
https://www.roland.com/us/support/service_repair/service_centers/


* * *


Thanks and enjoy your day.
Roland/BOSS Product Support

messages.msg:
Buongiorno ricambi@electronic-services.it,

Volevo contattarti in merito al nostro recente scambio di biglietti, ma non ho ancora ricevuto una risposta da parte tua. Puoi farmi sapere se hai altre domande di supporto o se hai bisogno di ulteriore assistenza?

Sono ansioso di sentirti, ma ti informo che questo ticket verrà automaticamente chiuso se non avrò tue notizie entro i prossimi due giorni. Se hai bisogno di contattarmi (dopo che il ticket è stato chiuso), riapri il ticket e potremo continuare a lavorare insieme per risolvere i tuoi problemi di assistenza.

Buona Giornata.

Veronica

Roland Customer Support

Roland Europe Group Ltd

messages.name: Jozsef Beres
messages.msg:
Good day,

Thank you for contacting us about your GO: KEYS 3.

In response to your question, if you check an E. Organ sound in the Other sound bank, you could find
similar to a Hammond organ.

 ![](https://rolandus.zendesk.com/attachments/token/cX2EbVMgS7W0HGrU13LMItRh8/?name=image.png)

 ![](https://rolandus.zendesk.com/attachments/token/byKvPh5LqWT99syX5zbX9V1Xv/?name=image.png)

The Rotary effect simulates the Leslie of the Hammond organ.
Yo can also assing the slow and fast Leslie speed to the Wheel,
You have to select the Modulation to the Wheel and adjust the range parameter to a higher value, and you will be able to adjust the amount of the Rotary effect.

 ![](https://rolandus.zendesk.com/attachments/token/hahces38iRAVps1X4k2PjzJrD/?name=image.png)

 ![](https://rolandus.zendesk.com/attachments/token/dUa8FM92M0NsJUDZCCpir9wrS/?name=image.png)

More details:

-

[English] GO:KEYS 5/GO:KEYS 3 Reference Manual [PDF]

-

[English] GO:KEYS 3/GO:KEYS 5 Tone List [PDF]


I hope the above helps, but please let us know if you need more help.

Kind regards,



József

Customer Service

Roland Europe Group Ltd

I dont understand, please help me :)

messages.msg_o:
Request for FR-7x Bass Button Rubber Contact Replacement

⸻

Dear Roland Support Team,

I hope you are well.

I own a Roland FR-7x V-Accordion, and I am looking to purchase replacement bass button rubber contact strips (the rubber pads beneath the bass buttons that provide electrical contact).

Unfortunately, I have been unable to find this specific part through dealers or online, and I understand it may be an internal service part.

Could you please advise:
	•	If this part is available for purchase
	•	The part number or description
	•	Pricing and how I can order it (or through which authorized service center)

I would appreciate any guidance you can provide, as I would like to keep my instrument in good working order.

Please let me know if you need a photo or serial number to help identify the part.

Thank you for your time and assistance.
Product Name: FR-7x
Serial Number: No Data
Purchase Date: No Data
Purchase Method: No Data
Purchase Dealer: No Data

Hello Stephen,

Thank you for contacting Roland Support!
Yes that's correct. To obtain the Mix Pack voucher - you must register the DJ-202 at  **Roland Backstage**
After the DJ-202 has been registered, you will receive emails containing your unique codes.
It is important to check the "_**Spam,Junk,Other,etc..**_"  Inboxes as the auto-reply email may have been flagged by your email account settings.

Let me know if you have any questions.




Best Regards,

messages.name: Vincent Cifarelli

Hello Leoren,

We’re sorry to hear that you’re experiencing this issue. That is very strange.

Please try performing a System Program update, even if you’ve recently done so. Click on the following link to go to the update:

https://www.roland.com/us/support/by_product/juno-x/updates_drivers/495fe8ca-a253-4a72-90e2-512e250e839b/

messages.msg_o:
RCM connection keeps failing although I'm clearly logged into the app. I keep having to restart my computer each time I want to open a project using your VSTs.

What should I do?

Thanks,
Alex
messages.name: Alexander Raybould
messages.msg:
RCM connection keeps failing although I'm clearly logged into the app. I keep having to restart my computer each time I want to open a project using your VSTs.

What should I do?

Thanks,
Alex

messages.name: Travis Hartnett
messages.msg:
Hi Alexander Raybould,

We're sorry to hear you're having this issue.

Try these steps.
If you've already done one of the steps, just move on to the next one.
Please be sure that you've done all of the steps.

1. Make sure that you have **v3.1.16 **of Roland Cloud Manager installed.
2. In the Library of Cloud Manager, update any plug-ins that show an available update.
3. Clear your browser cache.
4. **Restart your computer. If you're on a Mac, make sure that the "reopen windows" isn't selected**
5. Launch Roland Cloud Manager
6. Start your DAW. <--very important!

Regards,

Travis

messages.msg_o:
What is the best way to save 15 programs for a concert so that I can change from program to program quickly? Is there a video showing how to do this?
Product Name: RD-2000 EX
Serial Number: Z7R2466
Purchase Date: 2025-04-16
Purchase Method: Catalog/Phone Order
Purchase Dealer: SWEETWATER SOUND INC
messages.name: Sheri Statler
messages.msg:
What is the best way to save 15 programs for a concert so that I can change from program to program quickly? Is there a video showing how to do this?
Product Name: RD-2000 EX
Serial Number: Z7R2466
Purchase Date: 2025-04-16
Purchase Method: Catalog/Phone Order
Purchase Dealer: SWEETWATER SOUND INC

messages.name: Scott Berry
messages.msg:
Hi Sheri,

The best way to save your Programs in a specific order would be to write them into the Scenes. Scene are a glorified Favorites as the Scene can also save parameter changes from the program.


Select the Program you would like to save as a Scene.

1. Press the [WRITE] button.
2. Use the cursor [∧] [∨] buttons to select "SCENE" and then press the [ENTER] button.
3. Use the cursor [∧] [∨] buttons to select the save-destination Scene, and then press the [ENTER] button.
4. Use the cursor [<] [>] buttons to move the cursor, and use the [DEC] [INC] buttons to change the character.
  - To insert a character, press and hold [SHIFT] and then the [>] cursor button.
  - To delete a character, press and hold [SHIFT] and then the [<] cursor button.
5. When you’ve finished editing the name, press the [ENTER] button.
The SCENE WRITE confirmation screen appears.
6. To execute, use the cursor [>] button to select “WRITE,” and then press the [ENTER] button.
If you decide to cancel, press the [EXIT] button.


In the video, Ed create some programs with a single Tone and then writes them as a Program. The Program is then saved to Scene for easy recall.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KSA2AA7T0UM&list=PLmLJ2Wanv6-ABtuPck00XMd_vYC3zl60B&index=9&t=4s

Let me know if that helps.

messages.msg_o: Can a program be copied and saved to also be in another program slot? And can a scene be edited without it also making changes to the original program from which it came?
messages.name: Sheri Statler
messages.msg: Can a program be copied and saved to also be in another program slot? And can a scene be edited without it also making changes to the original program from which it came?

messages.name: Vincent Cifarelli
messages.msg:
Hello Sheri,

We apologize for the delay in getting back to you regarding your RD-2000 EX. Scott is away for the time being so we're jumping in here to assist.

Here are the answers to your questions:

_**Somehow I have done something to make Scene 00 not registered.  Please can you tell me how to get it back?**_

Unfortunately it isn't possible to recall a scene that has been deleted. You'll need to register a new scene. Select the Program or Tone you registered as a Scene, and then follow the "Registering a scene" procedure outlined in the **Owner's Manual, page 15.**

_**Also, is all editing done within the program and not the scene? If I edit the program, can I easily resave the program into the same scene?**_

Scenes are basically just "favorites" made up of single Tones or Programs. They're there to give you quick access to your favorite Tones and Programs in a live performance using the large [TONE BUTTONS].

You can edit Programs, Tones (Tone Designer), or Zones (Zone Edit), as well as Scenes. If you're in a Scene, simply edit the tone using the knobs and volume sliders on the panel. Press and hold [SCENE] and then register the Scene to the same location to overwrite it, or register it to a different Scene. You can also press [MENU] > Program Edit > Zone Edit to edit the tones further.


- If you edit the Scene, it will not alter the Program you initially used to save as a Scene. Therefore, if you accidentally overwrite a Scene, it cannot be recalled/recovered. If you've made enough edits to a Scene and wish to save it in a second location, as sort of a backup, you can save it as a Program using the "SCENE TO PROGRAM" function. With the Scene selected ([SCENE] button lit), press the [WRITE] button. The "SCENE TO PROGRAM" screen appears. Follow the prompts on the screen to store the Scene as a new Program.

There is a second way to do this, and it's outlined in the **Parameter Guide, page 31.**


_**How do I delete a sound within a program?**_

You can't actually "delete" a single sound, you must either select a different one or simply turn OFF/deactivate the sound by press the [S1]-[S8] button that corresponds to the sound you wish to turn off. If the button is unlit, the sound won't play. You could initialize the Program but this will initialize all of the Tones in the Program. Press [MENU] > Program Utility > Initialize.

_**With the USB, can I import saved scenes to a second keyboard? Or can I only import Programs to a second keyboard?**_

It is only possible to do a full backup of the RD-2000 EX, which can then be loaded into a different RD-2000 EX if desired. You can load the full backup using the "Backup Load" procedure, or load a single Program using the "Program Utility" > "Import" procedure. This will use the same backup file created when you use the "Backup Save" procedure. There is no way to export individual Programs, Tones or Scenes.

_**Can a program be copied and saved to also be in another program slot?**_

Yes. Press [WRITE] and select a different spot in the list to save the Program.

_**And can a scene be edited without it also making changes to the original program from which it came?**_

Yes. If you edit the Program, it will not alter the Scene to which you registered the Program. The Program will remain unchanged and independent of the Scene.

Hope this helps.

Best regards,

Roland Customer Support
This email was written by an actual human being.

messages.msg_o: Often in programs I will have two of the zones sounding at the beginning of the song and then need to have a third saved sound enter in the middle of the song.  When I move the slider to make the 3rd sound come in there is a “popping noise.”  What is the best way to avoid this “popping noise?"
messages.name: Sheri Statler
messages.msg: Often in programs I will have two of the zones sounding at the beginning of the song and then need to have a third saved sound enter in the middle of the song.  When I move the slider to make the 3rd sound come in there is a “popping noise.”  What is the best way to avoid this “popping noise?"

messages.name: Vincent Cifarelli
messages.msg:
Hello Sheri,

We're sorry to hear that you're experiencing this issue.

There shouldn't be any sort of "popping noise" when introducing a new sound using one of the sliders.


1. Does the noise occur if you use one of the zone buttons to simply turn on/activate the tone rather than using the slider to fade it in? For example, if the slider is up to a medium level, and the zone is OFF/UNLIT, will pressing the zone button so that it is then ON/LIT RED produce the noise as well? Or is it the specific act of fading in with the slider that is causing the noise?
2. Does this noise occur in every program or scene that you've saved or only specific ones?
3. Does this noise occur with every tone that you bring in with the slider or only specific ones?
4. Does this noise occur on any slider you use or only a specific one? **(Basically we're trying to determine if the noise is being caused by the tone, program, scene, or slider)**
5. Is this a new RD-2000 EX or an RD-2000 that was upgraded to EX with the purchased EX Upgrade software update?
6. Would it be possible for you to record a video of the issue?
7. Would you be able to send us a "BACKUP FILE" of your RD-2000 EX? We can then load it into ours to see if the issue can be reproduced on different hardware or if it's a software/sound issue.

 ![](https://rolandus.zendesk.com/attachments/token/08wHAPdb7y06oO1mdgfCzo6gF/?name=RD-2000EX+Backup.png)

Thank you,

Roland Customer Support
This email was written by an actual human being.

messages.name: Vincent Cifarelli
messages.msg:
Hello Donnie,

Apologies for the delay. Since The FANTOM-X6 was discontinued many years ago, we no longer have access to the instrument to be able to provided advanced support.

If you tell us what you'd like to do (record audio or MIDI?) with the MPC, then we may be able to assist you, but it really depends on what you're trying to do.

Both the FANTOM-X6 and the MPC have audio and MIDI connectors so you should be able to connect the FANTOM-X6's MIDI and audio outs to the MPC's MIDI and audio ins.

It really depends on what you're trying to do.

You can have a look at the support documents and Knowledge Base articles of the FANTOM-X6 here:

https://www.roland.com/global/products/fantom-x6/support/

Best regards,

Roland Customer Support

messages.name: Vincent Cifarelli
messages.msg:
Hello Ron,

If the sound content was purchased through the Roland Cloud Manager in the JUNO-D6/D7/D8 section, then it is compatible with the JUNO-D8.

There are Wave Expansions and Sound Packs. These have different extensions, each requiring a different installation procedure to get the sounds on the JUNO-D8.

Please have a look at the document linked below to ensure that you're using the correct installation procedure for the correct type of sound content that you purchased.

If you tell us the precise name of the sound content that you downloaded as it appears on your computer, we will also be able to verify the installation procedure for you.

[English] JUNO-D6/D7/D8 Roland Cloud User's Guide [PDF]

We hope this helps. Keep us posted.

Best regards,

messages.msg_o:
Dear Roland Support,

I’m reaching out for technical assistance with my Roland Juno-DS61.

I’ve followed all documented steps to enable and use the Audio Player function, but it does not appear under the Utility menu, even though I’m running firmware version 2.11.

Here’s what I’ve already done:

Verified that the firmware is up to date (v2.11 confirmed under Menu > System > Info)

Tried multiple USB flash drives (formatted to FAT32, MBR, and 32KB cluster size)

Successfully formatted the USB drive within the keyboard using Utility > Format USB Memory

Created the correct folder structure: /JUNO-DS/AUDIO/

Placed a valid WAV file (44.1kHz, 16-bit, stereo) named test_real.wav inside the AUDIO folder

Restarted the keyboard with the USB inserted

Still, “Audio Player” does not appear at all under Menu > Utility


I’ve ruled out user error, formatting, and firmware version. This leads me to believe the USB port may not be functioning correctly or detecting the drive.

Could you please advise if this may require service, and if so, what the next steps would be?

Thank you for your time and support.

Best regards,

Tim Henry 
832-326-2852 
Product Name: JUNO-D6
Serial Number: A2I6040
Purchase Date: 2017-07-30
Purchase Method: Online
Purchase Dealer: MUSICIANS FRIEND INC

messages.msg_o:
I am trying to get the USB Audio function to work within Cubase 14 but using either the generic ASIO or the Steinberg ASIO driver - NOT the Fantom ASIO driver. The reason is I need the Stereo Out to still go to my Clarett audio interface to my monitors/headphones, which has my microphone plugged into it.

I am on a Windows 11 PC. The USB audio does work but only if I have the Fantom selected as the ASIO device, but that means my Clarett won't work as the output. Is there an incompatibility issue when using a generic ASIO driver? With the Steinberg driver I get a horrible loud buzzing, like a feedback loop it sounds like... with the Generic driver I get no sound at all. 

The Roland USB driver is installed, I am on Fantom EX 1.02, USB Driver is set to VENDOR.
Product Name: FANTOM-7EX
Serial Number: Z2S0634
Purchase Date: 2025-05-22
Purchase Method: Catalog/Phone Order
Purchase Dealer: GUITAR CENTER #101
messages.name: Kira Welton
messages.msg:
I am trying to get the USB Audio function to work within Cubase 14 but using either the generic ASIO or the Steinberg ASIO driver - NOT the Fantom ASIO driver. The reason is I need the Stereo Out to still go to my Clarett audio interface to my monitors/headphones, which has my microphone plugged into it.

I am on a Windows 11 PC. The USB audio does work but only if I have the Fantom selected as the ASIO device, but that means my Clarett won't work as the output. Is there an incompatibility issue when using a generic ASIO driver? With the Steinberg driver I get a horrible loud buzzing, like a feedback loop it sounds like... with the Generic driver I get no sound at all. 

The Roland USB driver is installed, I am on Fantom EX 1.02, USB Driver is set to VENDOR.
Product Name: FANTOM-7EX
Serial Number: Z2S0634
Purchase Date: 2025-05-22
Purchase Method: Catalog/Phone Order
Purchase Dealer: GUITAR CENTER #101

messages.name: Vincent Cifarelli
messages.msg:
Hello Kira,

We're sorry to hear that you're having trouble.

We're a little confused by your setup. To clear up some details, ASIO is a driver protocol that was not developed by Roland. "Steinberg designed this format to improve latency performance and channel count compared to Windows Audio drivers."

https://www.sweetwater.com/sweetcare/articles/roland-difference-between-asio-wdm-mme-drivers/

For the FANTOM-7 EX to transfer audio to and from a DAW like Cubase, you can either:


- Use the Roland Fantom Driver that you would install on your Windows computer, set the USB Driver mode to VENDOR and connect it via USB cable to your computer.
- Connect the physical main output jacks on the FANTOM-7 EX to the inputs of your Clarett interface, and select the Clarett as the audio interface in Cubase to record the FANTOM-7 EX's audio signal.

It isn't possible to use more than one audio interface at once on a Windows computer. This is possible on a Mac (setting up an daggregate device), but not on Windows.

We hope this helps.

Best regards,

Roland Customer Support

If you have any further questions or concerns, simply reply to this message.

messages.name: Vincent Cifarelli
messages.msg:
Hello Ron,

An unexpected pitch change or transposition can indicate that there is a problem with the pitch bend lever. This would have to be looked at by an authorized service technician. We provided the necessary information on how to proceed in our last message to you.

If you like, you can also try updating the System Program and performing a Factory Reset as well. This may help, but if it doesn’t, we would recommend a repair.

https://www.roland.com/us/support/by_product/juno-ds88/updates_drivers/6ab9c6fa-4e22-4ce9-9b49-bccb25ae50b3/

https://support.roland.com/hc/en-us/articles/206172576-JUNO-DS61-JUNO-DS76-JUNO-DS88-Factory-Reset

Hope this helps.

Best,

Roland Customer Support

messages.msg:
Olá Jose, Tudo bem?

Muito obrigado pelo envio de sua mensagem.

Nos desculpe a demora. Estávamos aguardando a emissão da nota.

Como combinado, segue abaixo o código para envio do produto via correios. Pedimos a gentileza que envie a nota fiscal em anexo junto ao produto e nos informe assim que o produto for enviado.

*Pedimos a gentileza que não envie nenhum acessório comprado a parte, apenas os itens originais da caixa.

 ![](https://rolandus.zendesk.com/attachments/token/aimuitTsaRycbnfVG7b0rJajH/?name=image.png)

Assim que o produto chegar em nosso estoque e dar entrada em nosso sistema, seguiremos com a troca ou estorno do valor. Pedimos a gentileza que nos envie os dados bancários para estorno, de preferência que esteja no nome do cliente. Caso tenha PIX, por favor nos informe.

Aguardamos seu retorno.


Abraços,

Equipe Roland/Boss Brasil.

Atendimento Roland

messages.name: David Marino
messages.msg:
Hello Bob,

Thanks for reaching out and contacting Roland BOSS USA Operational Product Support about the ME-90.
You can choose any output selection that sounds best to you for your output monitoring.
These are EQ filters that may help the output of your device sound better depending on the monitor connected.
Choose what sounds best using your ears, and what you think sounds best from the options.

You could use either 1 or 3 for your Fender combo amp, either the INPUT: 2x12 or 1x12 combo options.
Otherwise, we tend to prefer the LINE/PHONES option on other devices, but looks like not available on the ME-90.
 ![](https://rolandus.zendesk.com/attachments/token/WIS47nPDX4nZpPCm36usXxWXy/?name=image.png)

sound of a regular tube amp.  So in choosing the best parameter, is it better to select by type of amplifier (such as Katana which is digital), or what the amp SOUNDS like (such as a Fender tube amp)?  Thanks again.



Bob
messages.name: Bob Aresti
messages.msg:
On Monday, June 9, 2025 at 06:48:14 PM EDT, Roland Corporation <support@rolandus.zendesk.com> wrote:

Hi and thanks for the response.  One followup question.  My Fender ToneMaster Deluxe is a DIGITAL amp, which reproduces the

sound of a regular tube amp.  So in choosing the best parameter, is it better to select by type of amplifier (such as Katana which is digital), or what the amp SOUNDS like (such as a Fender tube amp)?  Thanks again.



Bob

messages.name: David Marino
messages.msg:
Hi Bob,

We would try both Output selections, and see which sounds better.
Our KATANA MKI/MKII/GEN3 amps are a little different from other digital amps, because we use a Class A/B power amp, while other amp companies use a Class D power amp.
The performance and sound of a Class A/B vs. Class D power amps is different.
So we recommend trying out both output selections and see which sounds best for your Fender Tone Master Deluxe DIGITAL amp.
You may also try the TUBE AMP combo selection and see if that sounds better than the other two selections.
Again, use your ears, and play test each output selection to see what feels and sounds best to your ears.



Kind regards

messages.name: David Marino
messages.msg:
Hello dk,

Thanks for reaching out and contacting Roland BOSS USA Operational Product Support about the GX-100.

The "root directory" drive should be a GX-100 (DRIVE:) on your desktop, this only appears when connected in "update mode" with your GX-100.
If for some reason the GX-100(DRIVE:) is not appearing, it may be due to your USB cabling or port connection.

Please try some alternate USB-C cables and ports that are for data transfer, check and try some alternate USB ports on the computer end as well.

Please review the Procedure For The Update Steps 1-3 below:

**PROCEDURE FOR THE UPDATE**

1. Hold down [**WRITE**] button and turn on the power.
* Continue to hold down WRITE until "GX-100 Updater" appears on the display.
2. Connect the computer to the GX-100's USB port by a USB cable.
3.

Open the "GX-100" drive folder in your personal computer.

With Windows

Within My Computer (or Computer), open "GX-100" (or Removable Disk).

With macOS

On the desktop, open the "GX-100" icon.


**GX-100 System Program (Ver.2.03)**

If necessary, you can do a firmware version check on your GX-100 either before or after the firmware update.
**HOW TO KNOW THE VERSION**

Before you start, check the system program version of your GX-100.

1. Turn on the power.
2. The version information appears in the lower right corner of the startup display.
If this shows the latest version (Version 2.00 or later), there's no need to update your GX-100.
3. After verifying the displayed version, turn off the power.

**If the firmware update is needed, please have the user use the link to download and follow the Procedure for The Update section.**
**Review the following instructions for getting your GX-100 updated and connected:**

- First download, extract, and install the latest GX-100 firmware update into your GX-100 when connected in "update" mode.
**GX-100 System Program (Ver.2.03)**
** **
- Once the GX-100 firmware has been update to VERSION 2.01, then install the GX-100 USB Device Driver for specific computer OS and Version.
**=>WINDOWS**
- **GX-100 Driver Ver.1.0.1 for Windows 10/11**

**=>macOS**
- **GX-100 Driver Ver.1.0.1 for macOS Big Sur 11.x / Monterey 12.x / Ventura 13.x / Sonoma 14.x / Sequoia 15.x**

- Next download, extract, and install the BTS for GX-100 software editor for your specific computer OS and Version:
**BOSS TONE STUDIO for GX-100 Ver.2.0.1 for Windows**
**BOSS TONE STUDIO for GX-100 Ver.2.0.1 for macOS**

- If using a sold separate **BT-DUAL adapter for BT pairing and connectivity** download and use the
BTS for GX-100 mobile device software editor for (Android/iOS mobile devices):
Download “BTS for GX-100” for Android
Download “BOSS TONE STUDIO for GX-100” for Windows/macOS

-

For troubleshooting USB cabling, make sure to use a USB 2.0 A to B printer data cable,
and connect to a USB 2.0 A port directly on the computer, or if necessary use a USB 2.0 A adapter or USB HUB with a USB 2.0 A port directly on it.
Many newer macOS computers only have USB-C or USB 3.0 A ports, and the USB 3.0 A ports are sometimes not backwards compatible for USB 2.0.
Here are some examples of cabling and hub/adapters:
- Amazon USB 2.0 A to B 10ft cable are affordable and work great.
- We use a USB-C Totu Adapter for our USB-C only MacBook and works great.
- Similar simple USB-C to USB 2.0 A adapters.



These steps should get the GX-100 firmware updated, USB driver installed for the computer to recognize the hardware,
and the BTS for GX-100 software editor installed and connected.

* * *
**PLEASE SEE OUR GX-100 DOWNLOADS AND SUPPORT INFO WEB LINKS BELOW:**
**GX-100 FEATURES:**
**https://www.boss.info/us/products/gx-100/**

**GX-100 SPECIFICATIONS:**
**https://www.boss.info/us/products/gx-100/specifications/**

**GX-100 ACCESSORIES:**
**https://www.boss.info/us/products/gx-100/accessories/**

* * *
**GX-100 DOWNLOADS:**
**https://www.boss.info/us/products/gx-100/downloads/**


#### **UPDATES & DRIVERS**
**GX-100 SYSTEM PROGRAM FIRMWARE:**

- **GX-100 System Program (Ver.2.03)**

**GX-100 USB DEVICE DRIVERS:**

**WINDOWS:**

- **GX-100 Driver Ver.1.0.1 for Windows 10/11**
**macOS:**

- **GX-100 Driver Ver.1.0.1 for macOS Big Sur 11.x / Monterey 12.x / Ventura 13.x / Sonoma 14.x / Sequoia 15.x**
- **GX-100 Driver Ver.1.0.0 for macOS 10.15**

**BOSS TONE STUDIO for GX-100 COMPUTER SOFTWARE EDITOR (WIN/macOS):**

- **BOSS TONE STUDIO for GX-100 Ver.2.0.1 for Windows**
- **BOSS TONE STUDIO for GX-100 Ver.2.0.1 for macOS**

- **GX-100 SUPPORT INFO & DOCUMENTATION:**
**https://www.boss.info/us/products/gx-100/support/**

- **[English] GX-100 Startup Guide**
- **[English] GX-100 Reference Manual [HTML]**
- **[English] GX-100 Reference Manual [PDF]**
- **[English] GX-100 Parameter Guide [HTML]**
- **[English] GX-100 Parameter Guide [PDF]**
- **[English] Using BOSS TONE STUDIO for GX-100 [HTML]**
- **[English] Using BOSS TONE STUDIO for GX-100 (mobile) [HTML]**
- **[English] GX-100/GX-10 MIDI Implementation [PDF]**

* * *
**GX-100 VIDEO CONTENT:**

**Tom Quayle on GX-100:**
**https://youtu.be/w9aOZwSbX2I**

* * *
**GX-100 + BT DUAL FUNCTIONALITY:**
**https://static.roland.com/manuals/gx-100_reference/eng/17822652.html**


* * *
**BT-DUAL PAIRING TROUBLESHOOTING:**

The BT-DUAL adapter is necessary for BT/Bluetooth AUDIO and MIDI connection between a BOSS device > and Android/iOS mobile device. The BT-DUAL is installed on the BT-DUAL port, on the top or back panel of the amp/device/product. (See attachment instructions detailed below)

The BT-DUAL adapter can be purchased and is sold separately with any Roland BOSS dealer, for example:
https://www.sweetwater.com/store/detail/BTDual--boss-bt-dual-bluetooth-audio-midi-dual-adapter
If the already implementing and using the BT-DUAL, then we can continue with some more instruction on BT connectivity with the BT-DUAL.

**There are two BT/Bluetooth connections to establish when using the BT-DUAL Bluetooth MIDI Adapter for any BOSS amp/device/product:**


1. **BT MIDI** : When you first power on the BOSS amp/device, with BT-DUAL connected,
the BT-DUAL BLUE LED light flashes slowly, for the BT MIDI / 'DEVICE' MIDI connection.
Usually the BTS mobile device app will sync automatically, using and establishing the BT MIDI connection.

Download and install the BTS app for your device, search BTS "device name" app for your mobile device on either the Google Play Store (Android) or Apply App Store (iOS):
For Android mobile devices: Google Play Store
For Apple iOS mobile device:  Apple App Store.

The user can manually connect using STEP 2, of the BTS/BOSS TONE STUDIO app and connect with the BT MIDI/DEVICE MIDI connection. This connection is for using the BTS software editor app to user edit the patches on the amp/device.

2. **BT AUDIO** : With the BT-DUAL installed on the device, long press and hold the BT-DUAL button, for about 3–5 seconds, the BT-DUAL BLUE LED light flashes BLUE rapidly, and the BT connection is then named BT AUDIO / 'DEVICE' AUDIO connection.
Connect, using the Android/iOS mobile device System menu > Bluetooth menu, select the BT AUDIO connection to pair and confirm or OK the pairing.
Once connected, you can then BT stream and play audio through the amp/device.
The connection process is similar to establishing a BT connection with a car stereo, AirPods, BT earbuds, or BT portable speaker, etc.

**NOTE: if having issues connecting or finding the BT MIDI or BT AUDIO, make sure that all other BT devices nearby are deactivated with BT OFF.**
This will prevent the connections from being paired with another device, other than the intended device.
You may also need to forget the device for certain BT products, in order for it to release the BT connection option.


* * *
**BT-DUAL LINKS:**
**https://www.boss.info/us/products/bluetooth_audio_midi_dual_adaptor/**
**https://www.boss.info/us/products/bluetooth_audio_midi_dual_adaptor/specifications/**
**https://www.boss.info/us/products/bluetooth_audio_midi_dual_adaptor/support/**

**BT OWNER’S MANUALS**

- **[9 Languages] Bluetooth Audio MIDI Dual Adaptor Owner’s Manual**

**ATTACHING THE BT-DUAL**
 ![](https://support.roland.com/attachments/token/xSRbwtdWCbw1XQKqEXjMHawu4/?name=image.png)

Kind regards

messages.name: Austin Sandick
messages.msg:
Dug,

Sorry to hear you're still having issues.
It looks like the BTS program is not seeing the GX-100.
Please make sure you're connecting the GX-100 to your computer via a USB data transfer rated cable. Not all USB cables are created equal.
Once using a USB data cable connected to a USB 2.0 compatible port on your computer or USB Hub, the GX-100 should be a selectable option when opening BOSS Tone Studio for GX-100.

Here are some quick tips for troubleshooting USB connectivity with your Roland/BOSS devices.

**USB CONNECTIVITY TROUBLESHOOTING:**

1. If your Roland BOSS device connects to a desktop computer via USB, it’s very important to try and connect to a dedicated USB 2.0 A female type port directly on the computer.
Often times, USB ports on the front of computers and those on monitors and QWERTY keyboards are considered hubs, and are not recommended for proper Roland BOSS device USB connectivity.
However, some newer computers only have USB 3.0 or USB-C ports available, in which case a USB hub adapter may be necessary. We test and use the following USB hub adapter and it provides multiple USB connectivity options most importantly the USB 2.0 A port option.

2. Depending on the BOSS device, connect using either:
(USB 2.0 A to B printer/data cable)
For example used with: KATANA MK1/MK2, KATANA-AIR, GT-1000, GT-100, GT-001, GT-1, GT-1B, SY-300, SY-1000, BOSS RV/DD/MD-500 Series Pedals, GR-55, RC-202, RC-3, RC-30, RC-300, RC-505 MK1, RC-505 MK2, RC-600, JS-10, GP-10, AD-10, VE-8, MS-3, ME-80, GP-10, etc.

OR alternate USB cabling:
(micro B type USB to USB 2.0 A type data cable).
For example used with: POCKET-GT, WAZA-AIR, WAZA-AIR BASS, RC-5, RC-10R, RC-500, GT-1000CORE, BOSS DD/EQ/MD/OD/SY-200 Series Pedals, etc.

(USB C - to A Data Type Cable Option)
(USB C - to C Data Type Cable Option 2)
For example used with: Katana Gen 3, Katana:GO and IR-2.

Note: Not all USB cables are the same, some are for charging only and not for data.
If necessary when troubleshooting connectivity, try some alternate USB 2.0 or micro B type USB cables and try some alternate USB 2.0 A compatible ports on computer or USB hub.

3. If you have any onboard computer 3rd party security software running please disable/disarm them temporarily while attempting to connect your Roland BOSS device along with software editor applications.
Also, temporarily disconnect any 3rd party USB interfaces or devices that may impede your Roland BOSS device connectivity.

Visual images of USB type connections for proper cable identification:

 ![](https://support.roland.com/attachments/token/HLAyr4WNBqRst4VWKFtUi4Ww0/?name=Screenshot+2024-07-10+at+4.37.54%E2%80%AFPM.png)


* * *


Thanks and enjoy your day.
Roland/BOSS Product Support

messages.name: David Marino
messages.msg:
Hello dk,

Yes, it may be either the USB-C cable or the USB ports on the computer.
Please check and try some alternate USB cables and USB port options on the computer, or use a USB-C hub if necessary.
-If using a USB-C cable that has a USB-C end, connect to a USB-C port on the computer.
-If using a USB-C to USB 3.0 A cable (blue inside) connect to a USB 3.0 A port (blue inside) on the computer.
-If using a USB-C to USB 2.0 A cable (black inside) connect to a USB 2.0 A port (black inside) on the computer.
This will help make sure that the GX-100 is connected and recognized by the BTS for GX-100 software editor.
From your screen captures, it looks like your other device is recognized but not the GX-100.
Maybe try disconnecting all other USB devices, beside mouse, keyboard and GX-100, and see if BTS recognizes the connected GX-100.



Kind regards

messages.name: David Marino
messages.msg:
Hello dk,

Seems not to be the USB cable, however, it may be the USB ports you're using.
Try connecting:

- Using the same USB 2.0 A to B printer data cable, however, connect specifically to a USB 2.0 A port (black insdide)

From your USB screenshot, seems like you may be connecting with a USB 3.0 A port, you'll need to connect to a USB 2.0 A port on your computer, if necessary use a USB HUB with a compatible USB 2.0 A port for proper connectivity.

This may be why your other friend's computer was working fine for the firmware update, they most likely have a compatible USB 2.0 A port necessary.
Purchase and use only a USB 2.0 A to B printer data cable, and connect using a TOTU USB-C HUB adapter supporting a USB 2.0 A compatible port, necessary for proper connectivity of the GX-100.

You can also cross-check with your friend's computer, simply install the free BTS for GX-100 software editor and try to connect using same USB cable.

Kind regards

messages.name: David Marino
messages.msg:
Hi dk,

Hmmm odd, it should show up if you're connecting with a USB 2.0 A to B printer data cable directly to a USB 2.0 A compatible port on the computer.
Did you set the GX-100 to "update mode" first before connecting USB cable to the computer?
**PROCEDURE FOR THE UPDATE**

1. Hold down [**WRITE**] button and turn on the power.
* Continue to hold down WRITE until "GX-100 Updater" appears on the display.
2. Connect the computer to the GX-100's USB port by a USB cable.
3.

Open the "GX-100" drive folder in your personal computer.

With Windows

Within My Computer (or Computer), open "GX-100" (or Removable Disk).

With macOS

On the desktop, open the "GX-100" icon.


**GX-100 System Program (Ver.2.03)**


Kind regards

messages.msg_o: I went back to my friend's macbook and downloaded the appropriate driver and BTS. BTS did not recognize my GX 100 even on his macbook  What can we conclude from that?
messages.name: dk dug
messages.msg: I went back to my friend's macbook and downloaded the appropriate driver and BTS. BTS did not recognize my GX 100 even on his macbook  What can we conclude from that?

messages.name: David Marino
messages.msg:
Hello dk,

Sounds like it could still be the firmware update for the GX-100 still needs to be done.

Please again check and try the firmware update on the GX-100.
**GX-100 System Program (Ver.2.03)**
After the firmware update, please do a factory reset immediately afterward.
GX-100: Restoring the unit to its factory-set default state (Factory Reset)
This should allow your GX-100 to connect to the BTS for GX-100 software editor.
Please use the link below for the BTS for GX-100 software editor.

Please check the firmware version on your GX-100 and send us a photo capture of the display for the firmware update, so we confirm, that your GX-100 is up to date.

**HOW TO KNOW THE VERSION**

Before you start, check the system program version of your GX-100.

1.

Turn on the power.

2.

The version information appears in the lower right corner of the startup display.
If this shows the latest version (Version 2.03 or later), there's no need to update your GX-100.

3.

After verifying the displayed version, turn off the power.





Kind regards

messages.msg_o:
Hello!

My WAZA-Air works well for the most part, but I am constantly encountering two issues.
First, the audio from the receiver will suddenly cut out, seemingly without pattern, yet the indicator lights on both the headphones and receiver indicate they are still connected. In each instance I need to pause to unplug the receiver and plug it back into my instrument. I’ve ensured that standby mode is turned off.
A second similar issue occurs with audio from my Bluetooth connection. Suddenly the audio from my phone will become garbled and choppy, despite no issues with Bluetooth connection displayed on the indicator lights or on my phone settings. This issue only seems to go away when I switch the headphones off and back on again.
Both issues have persisted for some time now, and obviously impact my practice, with audio from either source cutting out every couple of songs. What might solve this issue?

Thanks,
Max
Product Name: WAZA-AIR
Serial Number: 420321B
Purchase Date: 2024-03-09
Purchase Method: Online
Purchase Dealer: GUITAR CENTER #352

messages.name: Austin Sandick
messages.msg:
Max,

Thanks for reaching out and contacting Roland BOSS USA Operational Product Support about the WAZA-AIR.
Sorry to hear you're having issues.

You should check a couple of things related to your WL-T transmitter drop out.
- First check the physical connection of the WL-T transmitter to your GUITAR OUTPUT jack.
Not all output jacks are the same and not standardized, the jack needs to depress the small on/off pin at the base of the WL-T transmitter. You can press this small pin with your finger to see that it turns the WL-T on/off. When connected for guitar performance, this pin needs to be depressed down all the way continuously for guitar signal to send wirelessly.
- Check the BTS for WAZA-AIR mobile app SYSTEM > STANDBY/SLEEP MODE settings and configure to OFF or longer duration so that you know the system is not going into standby prematurely.
- Make sure to always pair up before performance, wireless interference is normal and is different throughout the day, depending on your immediate environment.
Try not be within proximity to 2.4GHz wireless devices, routers, mobile devices, smart TVs etc. When practicing, you can walk anywhere with the WAZA-AIR, so check some different locations.
But remember to always pair up as instructed in the manual:
- For proper pairing review: **2.4GhZ Wireless Guitar audio connection:** Pair your WL-T Transmitter with the WAZA-AIR HEADSET by mating and connecting the WL-T to the WAZA-AIR Pairing Jack,
**wait and allow for 10 seconds or LED blinks for proper pairing and CHANNEL selection**, 1 of 14 CHANNELS with the least amount of interference will be selected.
**Once the LED on the WL-T has gone dim then it has chosen and paired, now separate the WL-T and connect to GUITAR OUTPUT jack for usage.**
**Here's some additional info for all three connections:**
**BT/BLUETOOTH WAZA-AIR AUDIO for BT audio app streaming for backing tracks.**
**BT/BLUETOOTH WAZA-AIR MIDI for BT MIDI app connection and for programming the 6 Channels of the WAZA-AIR.**
**WIRELESS AUDIO 2.4 GHZ wireless WL-T transmitter to WAZA-AIR wireless guitar signal transmission.**

* * *
**BOSS WAZA-AIR Explainer Video:**
**https://youtu.be/izs9DYbty6o**

**PLEASE REVIEW AND EXECUTE ALL STEPS BELOW TO GET PROPERLY CONNECTED WITH YOUR WAZA-AIR DEVICE**
The WAZA-AIR is designed to be used for BT WAZA-AIR AUDIO streaming of music for backing track jam along, simultaneously with 2.4 GHz guitar/instrument signal while using the WAZA-AIR BT MIDI for control of the Boss Tone Studio for WAZA-AIR mobile app.

Please use the support connection instructions provided also for more info and detail use the WAZA-AIR Owner's Manual and Device Connection Addendums below.
- To start a fresh setup and pairing of your mobile device and WAZA-AIR headphones it's best if you first forget or unpair any BT WAZA-AIR AUDIO or MIDI connections on your mobile device Bluetooth system settings.
**If you happened to have tried to pair other mobile devices or there are BT mobile devices nearby make sure to clear all paired instances of WAZA-AIR or set other mobile devices Bluetooth: OFF.**
- Power Off your WAZA-AIR headphones **(2)**.
- Power ON the WAZA-AIR headphones **(2)**,
then long press the Bluetooth button **(7)** for 3-4 seconds,
the BLUE LED **(5)** should blink rapidly showing ready for pairing mode.
- Go to your ANDROID/iOS mobile device BT settings and first pair with **WAZA-AIR AUDIO** for the BT streaming audio connection.
- Once successfully paired to **WAZA-AIR AUDIO**, open the BTS for WAZA-AIR Software Editor Mobile App and press the **PAIRING: BLUETOOTH MIDI DEVICE** selection **PAIRING BUTTON** and in the **BT MIDI DEVICE CONNECTION** screen choose the **WAZA-AIR MIDI Input / Output** connection from the **BLUETOOTH DEVICES list**,
a small **"CONNECTING" message or * asterisk** will appear, use the return/back arrow (Android) or screen tap (iOS) of the mobile device to return to the app **BLUETOOTH PAIRING/CONNECT screen**, connections should now be listed -
**PAIRING: BLUETOOTH MIDI DEVICE CONNECT: WAZA-AIR MIDI(Bluetooth)**, now press the OK selection button and wait for sync.
- This should get you connected with both the **WAZA-AIR AUDIO for BT streaming music** and **WAZA-AIR MIDI for app sync control** with the **BOSS TONE STUDIO for WAZA-AIR software editor app**.
- For **2.4GhZ Wireless Guitar audio connection:** Pair your WL-T Transmitter with the WAZA-AIR HEADSET by mating and connecting the WL-T to the WAZA-AIR Pairing Jack **(9)**, **wait and allow for 10 seconds or LED blinks** **for proper pairing and CHANNEL selection**, 1 of 14 CHANNELS with the least amount of interference will be selected. **Once the LED on the WL-T has gone dim then it has chosen and paired, now separate the WL-T and connect to GUITAR OUTPUT jack for usage.**
 ![](https://rolandus.zendesk.com/attachments/token/7NPNaEkQyAwfaLWITZlHyhwBk/?name=inline-790836408.png) ![](https://rolandus.zendesk.com/attachments/token/EenucpkrrAT5B4FE79u1sFNHE/?name=inline-1314787853.png)

* * *

* * *

If still having WL-T issues, please fill out the Service Repair Request info below, and we'll forward you to our Roland BOSS Factory Service Center Admins for follow up service info and assistance.
**SERVICE REPAIR REQUEST:**

messages.name: Jules Richard
messages.msg:
Hi Larry Vallot,

We're sorry to hear you're having this issue.

Try these steps.
If you've already done one of the steps, just move on to the next one.
Please be sure that you've done all of the steps.

1. Make sure that you have **v3.1.16 **of Roland Cloud Manager installed.
2. In the Library of Cloud Manager, update Zenology if it shows an available update.
3. Clear your browser cache.
4. **Restart your computer. If you're on a Mac, make sure that the "reopen windows" isn't selected**
5. Launch Roland Cloud Manager
6. Start your DAW.

Regards,

Jules

messages.msg_o: my DAW is not finding Galaxia in my vst folder. Is Galaxia vst supported by DAW reason10?
messages.name: fenexx soto
messages.msg: my DAW is not finding Galaxia in my vst folder. Is Galaxia vst supported by DAW reason10?

messages.name: Jules Richard
messages.msg:
Hi Fenexx,

Thanks for contacting us!

Galaxias is VST3 only. I believe VST3 wasn't supported until Reason 12.5.

Regards,

Jules

Hello,

Thanks for contacting us. We're sorry to hear that you're having trouble. The following article troubleshoots this symptom:
R-09: SYMPTOM: SD Memory Card is Not Recognized

As the article indicates, if the problem continues, there's an issue with the R-09 unfortunately. At that point you may want to contact the Ebay seller for a refund.

We hope this helps though. 😊️

Kind regards,
Roland Customer Support

messages.name: Vincent Cifarelli
messages.msg:
Hello Lysa,

The TD-17 module uses the PSB-1U power adaptor. The replacement for this adaptor is called the **PSB-120** and it can be purchased at any Roland authorized dealer. We would call first to check stock availability before travelling.

Here's our dealer locator tool:

https://www.roland.com/ca/dealer_locator/td-17/

Hope this helps.

Best regards,



Roland Customer Support
This email was written by an actual human being.

If you have any further questions or concerns, simply reply to this message.

*Please note that we aim to respond within 48 hours. Office hours are Mon-Thu 9am - 5pm. Fri 9am - 4.30pm.

*Veuillez noter que nous nous efforçons de répondre dans les deux prochains jours ouvrables. Les heures d'ouverture du bureau sont les suivantes: lundi au jeudi de 9h00 à 17h00, et vendredi de 9h00 à 16h30.

messages.name: Jozsef Beres
messages.msg:
Dear Katherine,

Thank you for contacting us about your RP-501R.

I'm sorry you are having an issue with your piano.

In response to your question, if both headphone outputs are working properly, then there is nothing inside. Otherwise, an object such as a broken headphone jack may be turning off the speakers.

Based on the information provided, your piano needs to be checked/repaired at one of our local repair centres.

Unfortunately, according to the registered purchase date, your device is out of warranty.
In this case, we recommend that you contact one of our trusted service partners. They specialise in out-of-warranty repairs and can help you.
To find the right location, please visit our European engineer map, which lists all our service partners. This map will help you choose the one closest to you.

In addition, if you have any other questions or need further assistance, we're happy to help!

Best regards,



József

Customer Service

Roland Europe Group Ltd

messages.name: Niklas Lehto
messages.msg:
Hello,

All my Roland plugins are (suddenly) in demo mode and I am unable to authorize them. When attempting to authorize, I'm met with the message "your authorization is no longer active". My ultimate play 4 life membership is active though. Everything is updated to the latest versions. I even tried reinstalling Roland Cloud and Zenology Pro, but to the same effect. Zenology Pro can still not be authorized, nor can any other plugins be authorized.

How can I get the plugins authorized again?

Kind regards
Niklas Lehto

messages.name: Travis Hartnett
messages.msg:
Hi Niklas Lehto,

We're sorry to hear you're having this issue.

Try these steps.
If you've already done one of the steps, just move on to the next one.
Please be sure that you've done all of the steps.

1. Make sure that you have **v3.1.16 **of Roland Cloud Manager installed.
2. In the Library of Cloud Manager, update any plug-ins that show an available update.
3. Clear your browser cache.
4. **Restart your computer. If you're on a Mac, make sure that the "reopen windows" isn't selected**
5. Launch Roland Cloud Manager
6. Start your DAW. <--very important!

Regards,

Travis

messages.name: David Marino
messages.msg:
Hello Daniel,

Thanks for reaching out and contacting Roland BOSS USA Operational Product Support about the DD-200.
Sorry to hear you're having issues with your DD-200.

Can you please check that your DD-200 firmware is updated to the latest firmware version:

-

DD-200 System Program (Ver.1.13)

**HOW TO KNOW THE VERSION**

-

Before you start, check the system program version of your DD-200.

-

Hold down the [**MEMORY**] button and insert a plug into the INPUT A jack.
The power comes on, and the version is displayed on the Display.
If this shows the latest version (version 1.13 or later), there's no need to update your DD-200.

-

After verifying the displayed version, switch off the power.


Looks like from the notes of past firmware updates (shown on same web page) there were some changes and bug fixes, etc.

If you need to update the firmware, please use the included Procedure for The Update and instructions.

DD-200 System Program (Ver.1.13)


After updating the firmware, immediately afterward, do a Factory Reset:
DD-200: Factory Reset

Then check and test the DD-200 unit and continue using it normally, and see if your issue continues.

Also, please make sure to only use the recommended power supplies:
Either brand-new AA dry alkaline batteries or a Roland BOSS PSA-120S 500mA 9V power supply.
Unfortunately, we can't guarantee proper device functionality and performance if using a 3rd party other brand power supply.
Some 3rd party other brand power supplies may cause temporary or permanent device issues, and will void all warranty terms.

Please also note, if responding/replying to this email support ticket, our Product Support Department hours of operation are:
M-F 9-5pm PST, so if replying to this email over the weekend, we will follow up on Monday of the following work week.
Thanks for your cooperation and understanding.


Kind regards

messages.name: Austin Sandick
messages.msg:
Bobby,

Thanks for reaching out and contacting Roland BOSS USA Operational Product Support about the KATANA-100 GEN 3.

Every guitar amp will have varying noise floor, which is the noise/sound when idle.
This may differ depending on the AMP TYPE chosen and GAIN/VOLUME settings for the KATANA GEN3 amp.
If necessary, you can use the BTS for KATANA GEN3 software editor, each Channel is provided an NS/Noise Suppressor, to help gate the noise, whenever not playing.
So this is really useful when using high gain amp types and higher gain/volume settings, use the NS set with a higher threshold to gate out the sound, use the decay/release adjustment to make the gate sound more natural upon release, rather than abrupt.
PANEL mode is like any normal guitar amp, what you see knob wise, is what you hear.

While all the other CHANNELS are write/saved preset patches with saved settings.
When switching CHANNELS the knobs will not necessarily indicate what is set, the knobs are not motorized, and can't shift into place for every CHANNEL.
So if you touch a knob, it will catch up to that current position, but the actual saved preset value, may be higher or lower than what the knob is actually indicating.
This may take some time getting used to, but pretty much you can set your sound, with any of the knobs or software editor, then press hold a CHANNEL to save your settings, if using the editor use the WRITE button to write/save your custom user settings.

You can use the MASTER LEVEL volume to control the over all output of the amp, however, the POWER CONTROL and MASTER LEVEL can't be write/saved to a CHANNEL, these always remain separate, and for on the fly manual adjustment by hand, the values of POWER CONTROL and MASTER LEVEL, can not be saved to the CHANNEL.
All the other parameters can be write/saved to the CHANNEL or patch: AMP TYPE, GAIN, VOLUME, EQ, EFFECTS, PRESENCE, etc., can all be saved to the CHANNEL/PATCH.

We suggest, using more of your POWER AMP, so use the 50W POWER CONTROL setting, and use the MASTER LEVEL a bit more.
Then choose your CHANNEL, adjust the AMP TYPE, GAIN and VOLUME, adjust EQ and FX ON/OFF, then save the settings, by holding down the CHANNEL button.
A quick way of balancing CHANNELS, it to take this same "template patch" and save the same settings to all the other CHANNELS.
Once all are the same, then start making derivative changes to each CHANNEL, and save accordingly.
This may provide more of balanced CHANNELS/patches when switching.
However, keep in mind changing the AMP TYPE, is like changing the modeled amp type, so it may need a GAIN or VOLUME increase/decrease.

Hope this all makes sense.

Roland Cloud Question regarding LifeTime key and the XV-5080 plugin.

Thanks

messages.name: Jules Richard
messages.msg:
Hi Richard,

Thanks for contacting us!

If you've purchased the XV-5080 from an online dealer you can register the key for your purchase on the following page: https://www.roland.com/cloud/key#key


Once your software instrument has successfully been registered, you'll need to download and install Roland Cloud Manager. This is where you'll install your software instrument from:

The newest version of RCM can be downloaded on the following page: https://www.roland.com/us/products/rc_roland_cloud_manager/

*      Once you've installed Roland Cloud Manager, open it, login and click on "Software Instruments > My Library page > My Products."

*      Then, you'll need to install your software instrument.
Roland Cloud: How To Install An Instrument From Roland Cloud Manager.
Note: Once you're on the My Library page you can type the name of your software instrument in the search bar.


The Roland Cloud virtual instruments are all plug-ins that are used by a host application such as Apple Logic/GarageBand, Avid Pro Tools, Ableton Live, Steinberg Cubase, Roland Zenbeats and many others. In general, any 64-bit DAW that supports VST, AU or AAX virtual instruments will work with the Roland Cloud catalog. Check with the DAW manufacturer and the specifications section of our website for further details. For specific instructions on using virtual instruments in your DAW, refer to the DAW documentation.

The basic process is:
*      Create a new project.
*      Add a MIDI track to the project.
*      Add the virtual instrument to the MIDI track.
*      Start making music.

Please let us know if you have any other questions regarding this matter.

Best regards,

Jules

messages.name: Andy Santos
messages.msg:
Hi Garri,

Thanks for contacting us! Here's a bit of troubleshooting they can try:

- Please check the two cables that connect the top and bottom pads together on the VH-14D. Make sure the "A" cable is connected securely to the "A" jack on the bottom pad, and the "B" cable is connected securely to the "B" jack.
- We realize that the customer mentioned that they already updated but we just wanted to be sure the correct versions have been installed:
  - VH-14D Version 1.11
  - V71 Version 1.20
- Try performing a factory reset and then re-calibrate:
  - V71: Restoring the factory settings (Factory Reset)
  - V71: Configuring the VH-14D hi-hat

Please let us know how it goes!

Kind regards,
Roland Customer Support

messages.msg_o: I can't use any of the roland software because it said my account is inactive even though I paid for a three month subscription
messages.name: Brady Bronson
messages.msg: I can't use any of the roland software because it said my account is inactive even though I paid for a three month subscription

messages.name: Travis Hartnett
messages.msg:
Hi Brady Bronson,

We're sorry to hear you're having this issue.

Try these steps.
If you've already done one of the steps, just move on to the next one.
Please be sure that you've done all of the steps.

1. Make sure that you have **v3.1.16 **of Roland Cloud Manager installed.
2. In the Library of Cloud Manager, update any plug-ins that show an available update.
3. Clear your browser cache.
4. **Restart your computer. If you're on a Mac, make sure that the "reopen windows" isn't selected**
5. Launch Roland Cloud Manager
6. Start your DAW. <--very important!

Regards,

Travis

messages.msg_o: Hi thank you, yes, it's all working good now! 👍 😊
messages.name: Brady Bronson
messages.msg: Hi thank you, yes, it's all working good now! 👍 😊

messages.msg_o:
Buongiorno,
ho riscontrato il seguente problema: collegando l'amplificatore al mixer attraverso l'uscita LINE OUT il segnale viene trasmesso solo al mixer mentre il KATANA diventa muto.
Sul manuale ho letto che invece dovrebbe venire inviato il segnale al mixer e, contemporaneamente, riprodurre il suono: quale può essere il motivo di questo problema?
Grazie per la disponibilità!
Product Name: KATANA-100 GEN 3
Serial Number: A5R7735
Purchase Date: 2025-05-15
Purchase Method: Online
Purchase Dealer: STRUMENTIMUSICALI.NET SRL (Taranto)
messages.name: LUCA PELLEGRINI
messages.msg:
Good morning,
 I encountered the following problem: when connecting the amplifier to the mixer via the LINE OUT output, the signal is only transmitted to the mixer while the KATANA becomes mute.
 In the manual I read that the signal should be sent to the mixer and, at the same time, the sound should be reproduced: what could be the reason for this problem?
 Thanks for your availability!
 Product Name: KATANA-100 GEN 3
 Serial Number: A5R7735
 Purchase Date: 2025-05-15
 Purchase Method: Online
 Purchase Dealer: STRUMENTIMUSICALI.NET SRL (Taranto)

messages.name: Huw Lloyd-Williams
messages.msg:
Hallo Luca,

vielen Dank, dass Sie sich gemeldet haben. Es tut mir leid, das mit Ihrem KATANA-100 GEN3 zu hören!

Sie haben Recht, der LINE OUT sollte Ihnen immer noch erlauben, den Ton vom Hauptlautsprecher des Verstärkers zu hören. Entschuldigen Sie die Frage, aber Sie verwenden doch diesen Anschluss, richtig?

 ![](https://rolandus.zendesk.com/attachments/token/HGffBk0RfiJIgVA9zG3if3VQo/?name=image.png)

Ist die Lautstärke des Verstärkers richtig aufgedreht und der Leistungsschalter auf die gewünschte Einstellung eingestellt?

Wenn dies alles korrekt eingestellt ist, versuchen Sie, den Verstärker auf die Werkseinstellungen zurückzusetzen, nur für den Fall, dass das Problem durch ein Softwareproblem verursacht wird.

KATANA-100 GEN 3: Factory Reset

Mit freundlichen Grüßen,

Huw

Customer Service

Roland Europe Group Ltd

messages.msg_o:
Buongiorno,

Vi ringrazio per la risposta e mi scuso per il mio ritardo ma sono stato molto impegnato con il lavoro. Martedì avrò le prove per cui potrò verificare se il reset ha funzionato e vi comunicherò l'esito.



Cordiali saluti

Luca Pellegrini



Inviato da Outlook per Android

* * *
messages.name: LUCA PELLEGRINI
messages.msg:
Good morning,

 Thank you for your reply and I apologize for my delay but I have been very busy with work. I will have the tests on Tuesday so I can verify if the reset worked and I will let you know the result.



 Best regards

 Luke Pellegrini



 Sent from Outlook for Android

messages.name: Guilherme C.
messages.msg:
Olá Cesar, Tudo bem?

Muito obrigado pelo envio de seu e-mail.

Antes de darmos seguimento em seu atendimento, pode por gentileza encaminhar um vídeo demonstrando o problema que está tendo com seu equipamento? Assim, nós poderemos entender melhor o que está acontecendo e, a partir daí, te ajudar da melhor forma possível.

**Informamos que o vídeo pode ser enviado através de um link gerado no Google Drive com permissão de acesso para "Qualquer pessoa com o link"**.

É importante que no vídeo, você nos demonstre como estão os parâmetros do efeito Pitch Shifter em sua GT-1.

Aguardamos seu retorno.

Abraços,

Equipe Roland/Boss Brasil.

Service Request
My Registered Products: VAD507
Serial Number: Z1S6198
Contact Information
Name: Eric Wang
Email: shyshm@hotmail.com
Phone Number: 7789910301
Address 1: 960 Groveland Rd
Address 2: 
City: West Vancouver
Province: BC (British Columbia)
Postal Code: V7S1Z1

Issue:
Dear Roland Technical Support Team,
I recently purchased a Roland VAD507 drum kit with the VH-14D digital hi-hat and TD-27 V2 sound module. However, I’ve encountered a persistent issue that I hope you can help me with. When I press down the VH-14D hi-hat pedal, the system automatically triggers a series of repeated “chick” or “closing” sounds.  Sometimes even after lifting my foot, the sound continues to play. This occurs without striking the hi-hat pad.
What I have tried so far:
- Performed hi-hat calibration multiple times through the TD-27 V2 menu.
- Ensured VH-14D is correctly connected to the Digital Trigger In port.
- Adjusted Sensitivity and Close Adjust parameters.
- Rechecked physical alignment of the top and bottom hi-hat cymbals.
- Verified that the hi-hat stand is stable and vertical.
Despite these efforts, the issue persists. I would like to know if: 1. This may be a known issue with certain VH-14D units.2. There are any firmware updates or known solutions available.

messages.msg_o:
Dear Roland Support Team,

Apologies for the delayed response — I’ve just returned from a business trip in Europe.

As soon as I got back, I checked the firmware version of the VH-14D, and I can confirm that it is version 1.11. I also made sure that the connections are correct — A to A and B to B.

Unfortunately, the issue still persists. When I press down on the hi-hat pedal, I hear a rapid burst of unintended triggering (a sort of "ghost noise"), and even when I release the pedal, the sound does not stop.

I’d appreciate any further advice you can offer to resolve this issue.

Best regards,

Eric

messages.name: Travis McIntosh
messages.msg:
Hi Eric,

Thanks for contacting us!

Please check and confirm the two link cables that connect the top and bottom pads together are connected correctly and securely to the jacks. Initially it is difficult to notice, however they are labeled as "A" and "B."  Confirm the A cable is connected to the A jack, and the B cable is connected to the B jack. Connecting them incorrectly can cause the symptom you've described.

If the connections are correct, you'll want to update the VH-14D with version 1.11 if you have not done so already. After updating, be sure to recalibrate the VH-14D in the TD-27.
Here is a link to the download;
https://www.roland.com/us/products/vh-14d/downloads/

We hope this information is helpful. Let us know if you need further assistance.
Thanks for choosing Roland and BOSS products!

Kind regards,
Roland Product Support

messages.name: Austin Sandick
messages.msg:
Hello Jeff Zelevansky,

Thanks for reaching out and contacting Roland BOSS USA Operational Product Support about the DD-8.

Sorry to hear you're having issues with your DD-8.
We'll forward you over to our Roland BOSS Service Center Admins for follow up service info and help.
Please stand by for our Service Admins to reach out to you.

**Please be prepared to provide the following info.**

**Your Name:**
**Phone Number:**
**Shipping Address:**
**Model Number:**
**Serial Number:**
**Detailed description of issue:**
**Point of Purchase:**

* * *
In the meantime and interim:
- Please troubleshoot and test your BOSS compact pedal with the Manufacturer Recommended Power Supplies.

- Test using a brand new 9 volt quality, dry alkaline battery, or a Roland BOSS PSA-120S 500mA 9V power supply.
Unfortunately, we can't guarantee 3rd party other brand power supplies will provide proper functionality and performance. Some 3rd party other brand power supplies, can cause temporary device issues, or terminal damage.
Using a 3rd party other brand power supply will void all warranty terms.

- Test and check all cabling, use 1/4" TS mono unbalanced, instrument/guitar cables, for all guitar audio Input/Output connections, for proper connectivity, and audio signal transfer.

- Connect a 1/4" TS Mono Instrument guitar cable to pedal INPUT for pedal power ON/OFF.
_(For BOSS RC COMPACT LOOPERS: Connect to **OUTPUT A** for power ON)._

- For example cabling, use quality BOSS BIC Lifetime Instrument Cables for all guitar effect chain audio signal cable connections. _(NOTE: DO NOT USE_ _1/4" TRS STEREO CABLES_ _FOR GUITAR EFFECT CHAIN AUDIO CONNECTIONS. TRS cables may not engage the INPUT jack for power ON properly. TRS cables can be used for HEADPHONES audio connections, to a dedicated HEADPHONE jack, or for FS/EXP (FOOTSWITCH/EXPRESSION) CV/CONTROL VOLTAGE external control pedals)._

**EXPLANATION AND VISUAL OF DIFFERENT AUDIO CABLES:**
TS = TIP SLEEVE (UNBALANCED),
TRS = TIP RING SLEEVE (STEREO/BALANCED),
TRRS = TIP RING RING SLEEVE (STEREO LINE LEVEL WITH MIC/MOBILE DEVICE).
 ![](https://rolandus.zendesk.com/attachments/token/uDQRgtwMWKdTbpBwFYntcI8OF/?name=inline1957521896.jpeg)

- Review the BOSS pedal included Owner's Manual for functionality and how to use the pedal or go online for the Owner's Manual PDF downloadable:  https://www.boss.info/us/support/owners_manuals/
Search alphabetically for your device model and owner's manual.

- If the pedal is still malfunctioning, then we suggest exchanging with your point of purchase/dealer/store/web store, for a new product, under the dealer's warranty (usually 30-day warranty terms).

Please inform the dealer/sales tech, of the product issues you're having, and arrange an exchange of product, for a new device. This would help with an expedited quick turn around.

- If outside of Dealer Warranty terms and Manufacturer Warranty Service/Repair is needed, you may choose to submit a Service Repair Request to our Roland BOSS Factory Service Department in Chino, CA. Once you have an RA/Return Authorization number, you may send your device in, for evaluation, diagnosis, service and repair.

- All BOSS stompbox compact and twin pedals are Manufacturer Warrantied for 5 Years, parts and labor, from the date of purchase, for the original user and non-transferable.

- All that is needed, is to submit a Service Repair Request, and submit necessary service info, device, and a copy of your original point of sale purchase receipt/invoice, to honor the Manufacturer Warranty Terms.
If outside of warranty terms, the user may choose to have the device serviced/repaired outside of warranty.
Our Service Techs can provide a service/repair quote for parts and labor, if a repair option is available.
