messages.name: David Marino
messages.msg:
Hello Jackson,

Thanks for reaching out and contacting Roland BOSS USA Operational Product Support about the KATANA-50 GEN 3.
Sounds like odd functionality for a new BOSS KATANA GEN3 amp.

Please make sure you've updated the firmware to the latest version and immediately after do a factory reset.
**KATANA3 System Program (Ver.1.07)**
**KATANA-50 GEN 3: Factory Reset**

After update and reset, then check and test the amp functionality once again.

Please make sure to check all guitar electronics functionality and all input/output connections and only use quality 1/4" TS mono unbalanced guitar/instrument cabling, like our BIC Lifetime guitar/instrument cables.

**If the issue persists you may submit a service repair request here:**
**https://www.boss.info/backstage/support#service_request**

Or we can transfer you over directly to our Service Center Admins.


* * *
**Please review and execute the following steps below, to get setup with your KATANA-50/100/HEAD/ARTIST GEN3 amp.**

**You'll need the following gear at the ready:**
- Your KATANA GEN3 amp e.g., KATANA-50 GEN3, KATANA-100 GEN3, KATANA-HEAD GEN3, KATANA-ARTIST GEN3.
- USB-C to USB 2.0/3.0 A data cable. e.g.: https://a.co/d/6w69VFK
- WINDOWS OS / macOS desktop/laptop computer, with inter web access, and a USB 2.0/3.0 A port / USB adapter or USB-Hub adapter, with a USB 2.0/3.0 A port.

* * *
**As a quick overview there are three main steps to get you connected that you'll need to manually perform:**
**1 - Download, extract*, and install the** **KATANA3 System Program (Ver.1.07)** **firmware update files in to your amp, using a computer.**

**(Unfortunately, you'll need to manually update the firmware on your amp using a computer. It takes around 6 months for a product**
**to arrive in the hands of the end user from overseas, and there are often updates during the interim, so the user should update the firmware immediately).**

**After updating the firmware please Factory Reset your amp, this will realign the new firmware to defaults, just in case there was any data skew during the update process:** **KATANA-100 GEN 3: Factory Reset**

**2 - Download, extract*, and install the KATANA USB device driver for your specific WINDOWS/macOS computer OS and Version. **

- **KATANA3 Driver Ver.1.0.0 for Windows 10/11**
- **KATANA3 Driver Ver.1.0.0 for macOS Monterey 12.x / Ventura 13.x / Sonoma 14.x / Sequoia 15.x**

**3 - If using the sold separate** **BT-DUAL ADAPTER** **for BT/Bluetooth connecting with your Android / iOS mobile device.**
**Download and install the BTS for KATANA GEN3 APP for your mobile device.**
**Then follow instructions for BT-DUAL install on back of the amp, and KATANA3 BT AUDIO and KATANA3 BT MIDI connection, with your Android/iOS mobile device.**
**Download** **“BTS for KATANA GEN 3” for iOS**
**Download** **“BTS for KATANA GEN 3” for Android**

**4 - Download, extract*, and install the BTS/BOSS TONE STUDIO for KATANA GEN3 Ver.1.0.0 software editor application for your specific computer OS and Version.**

- **BOSS TONE STUDIO for KATANA Gen3 Ver.1.1.0 for Windows**
- **BOSS TONE STUDIO for KATANA Gen3 Ver.1.1.0 for macOS**
*Note if using WINDOWS 10/11, you'll need to EXTRACT the zipped/compressed download.
RIGHT MOUSE CLICK the downloaded zipped folder, and choose EXTRACT ALL,
choose a destination, either the DOWNLOAD folder or DESKTOP.

**If using macOS, the zipped download will auto unzip/extract, when downloaded, the two update files are ready to use:
Use both the **KATANA3.BIN and ROMINFO.TXT files (see example below).**

 ![](https://rolandus.zendesk.com/attachments/token/pI3AmTOC69PKWU2pzBOtbNwtC/?name=image.png)

**For USB-C to USB 2.0/3.0 A cable to USB-2.0/3.0 A port on computer troubleshooting:**
Test and check connection using an alternate USB-C to USB 2.0/3.0 A data cable, also try an alternate USB 2.0/3.0 compatible port directly on the computer if possible.
If possible try an alternate computer to check the same setup and see if the computer native security software features are blocking connection for the amp and BTS software editor.

* * *
**PLEASE COMPLETE THE FOLLOWING STEPS FOR THE KATANA GEN3.**
**UPDATE THE FIRMWARE, INSTALL THE USB DRIVER AND BTS FOR KATANA GEN3 SOFTWARE EDITOR.**

**THIS SHOULD ALLOW YOU TO SYNC KATANA GEN3 AMP WITH THE BOSS TONE STUDIO FOR KATANA GEN3 SOFTWARE EDITOR:**

**1. DOWNLOAD AND INSTALL THE LATEST SYSTEM PROGRAM VERSION UPDATE FIRMWARE FOR YOUR KATANA GEN3 AMP: **
**KATANA3 System Program (Ver.1.07)**

**2. DOWNLOAD AND INSTALL THE USB DEVICE DRIVER FOR YOUR SPECIFIC COMPUTER OS AND VERSION:**
**https://www.boss.info/us/products/katana-100_gen_3/downloads/**

**=>WINDOWS DRIVERS:**

- **KATANA3 Driver Ver.1.0.0 for Windows 10/11**
**(WINDOWS 10/11 USES AN AUTO DRIVER DOWNLOAD AND INSTALL PROTOCOL. MAKE SURE YOUR KATANA IS UP TO DATE WIHT THE LATEST SYSTEM PROGRAM FIRMWARE FOR THE WINDOWS 10/11 DRIVER AUTOMATED INSTALLATION. IF THE USB DRIVER DOESN'T AUTO INSTALL, YOU'LL NEED TO MANUALLY INSTALL THE USB DEVICE DRIVER USING THE LINK & DOWNLOAD ABOVE.**

**=>macOS DRIVERS:**

- **KATANA3 Driver Ver.1.0.0 for macOS Monterey 12.x / Ventura 13.x / Sonoma 14.x / Sequoia 15.x**
_**FOR OLDER macOS VERSIONS, PLEASE MAKE SURE TO ADJUST MAC SECURITY & PRIVACY SETTINGS AND "ALLOW" FOR THE DRIVER INSTALLATION AND FUNCTIONALITY. REVIEW TROUBLESHOOTING FOR SPECIFIC macOS AND VERSION. USE SPOTLIGHT SEARCH IN UPPER RIGHT CORNER OF DESKTOP AND TYPE: "INSTALL HELPER" CHECK IF INSTALLED DRIVER CAN BE "ALLOWED".**_
_**macOS Catalina (macOS 10.15) Driver Installation and Troubleshooting**_
_**macOS Mojave (macOS 10.14) Driver Installation and Troubleshooting**_
_**macOS High Sierra (macOS 10.13) Driver Installation and Troubleshooting**_

**3. INSTALL THE BT DUAL ADAPTER, DOWNLOAD THE BTS FOR KATANA GEN3 APP.**
** If using the sold separate** **BT-DUAL ADAPTER** **for BT/Bluetooth connecting with your Android / iOS mobile device.**
**Download and install the BTS for KATANA GEN3 APP for your mobile device.**
**Then follow instructions for BT-DUAL install on back of the amp, and KATANA3 BT AUDIO and KATANA3 BT MIDI connection, with your Android/iOS mobile device.**
**Download** **“BTS for KATANA GEN 3” for iOS**
**Download** **“BTS for KATANA GEN 3” for Android**

**4. DOWNLOAD AND INSTALL BOSS TONE STUDIOS FOR KATANA GEN3 SOFTWARE EDITOR FOR YOUR COMPUTER:**

- **BOSS TONE STUDIO for KATANA Gen3 Ver.1.1.0 for Windows**
- **BOSS TONE STUDIO for KATANA Gen3 Ver.1.1.0 for macOS**

- **THIS SHOULD ALLOW FOR YOUR KATANA GEN3 AMP TO SYNC WITH YOUR COMPUTER AND BTS/BOSS TONE STUDIOS for KATANA GEN3.**

- **After getting connected go visit BTX/BOSS TONE EXCHANGE for KATANA GEN3 USER PATCH SHARING:**
**BOSS TONE EXCHANGE/BTX WEB FORUM PORTAL FOR KATANA GEN3 USER PATCH SHARING**

* * *

* * *
**KATANA GEN3 SUPPORT:**

**KATANA GEN3 OWNER’S MANUALS:**

- **[English] KATANA3 Startup Guide [PDF]**
- **[English] KATANA3 Reference Manual [PDF]**
- **[English] Using BOSS TONE STUDIO for KATANA Gen3 (for PC) [PDF]**
- **[English] Using BOSS TONE STUDIO for KATANA Gen3 (for mobile) [PDF]**
- **[English] Connecting the BOSS TONE STUDIO for KATANA Gen3 iOS App to the KATANA Unit [PDF]**
- **[English] Connecting the BOSS TONE STUDIO for KATANA Gen3 Android App to the KATANA Unit [PDF]**

* * *

* * *
**Here are some quick tips for troubleshooting USB connectivity with your Roland/BOSS devices.**

**USB CONNECTIVITY TROUBLESHOOTING:**
1. If your Roland BOSS device connects to a desktop computer via USB, try and connect to a couple of different ports:
USB 2.0/3.0 A or USB-C, female type port directly on the computer.
- Often times, USB ports on the front of computers and those on monitors and QWERTY keyboards are considered hubs, and are not recommended for proper Roland BOSS device USB connectivity.
- However, some newer computers only have USB 3.0 or USB-C ports available, in some cases a USB hub adapter may be necessary. We test and use the following USB hub adapter, and it provides multiple USB connectivity options most importantly the USB 2.0/3.0 A port options.

2. Depending on the BOSS device, connect using either:
- A USB B type to USB 2.0 A cable: for old KATANA MKI/MKII
**- A USB-C to USB-C cable: for new KATANA GEN3**
**- A USB-C to USB 2.0/3.0 A cable: for new KATANA GEN3**
For example: **https://a.co/d/cmTWOuK**

OR alternate USB cabling for other BOSS devices:
**(****micro B type USB to USB 2.0 A type data cable****).**
For example used with: POCKET-GT, WAZA-AIR, WAZA-AIR BASS, RC-5, RC-10R, RC-500, GT-1000CORE, BOSS DD/EQ/MD/OD/SY-200 Series Pedals, etc.

Note: Not all USB cables are the same, some are for charging only and not for data.
If necessary when troubleshooting connectivity, try some alternate USB 2.0 or micro B type USB cables and try some alternate USB 2.0 A compatible ports on computer or USB hub.

3. If you have any onboard computer 3rd party or native security software running please disable/disarm them temporarily while attempting to connect your Roland BOSS device along with software editor applications. Some native security features on both WINDOWS/macOS can block proper connectivity, and app/driver functionality.
Also, temporarily disconnect any 3rd party USB interfaces or devices that may impede your Roland BOSS device connectivity.

Visual images of USB type connections for proper cable identification:
 ![](https://rolandus.zendesk.com/attachments/token/0clHRgOHVre7Alk4Bbh0Rwrsp/?name=inline821420174.png)

* * *

* * *
**All instructions are included in the update download link, we'll try to reword them for you to see if it helps:**

Once you've extracted the zipped download, there should be a folder: **"katana3_sys_v107" folder**,
you'll need to copy/paste or drag/drop the two update files into the connected KATANA GEN3 amp update drive, when the amp is connected via USB in update mode.
Make sure to first connect the amp in updater mode as instructed: [Hold down the TAP TEMPO button and power ON], then connect the KATANA via USB-C to USB 2.0/3.0A cable to your computer USB port.
The KATANA should connect and appear as an external drive, on your desktop: **KATANA3(DRIVE:).**
You'll then need to copy/paste or drag/drop the two update files: **KATANA3.BIN and ROMINFO.TXT** files into/onto the drive.
Once copied over to the KATANA3(DRIVE:), you can soft-eject the drive by dragging it to the Trash (for macOS only) or right mouse click EJECT (works for WINDOWS/macOS).
Then disconnect USB cable, this should start the update process, if it doesn't, then turn toward the amp and press the blinking RED LED PANEL button, manually if necessary. This will execute the update and will take about a minute to complete.

Once completed you should see all EFFECTS LEDS blinking GREEN simultaneously together showing a successful update.
If the EFFECT LEDs blink RED rapidly then the update was a failure and you'll need to try again.

In either situation, power OFF to exit updater mode and power back ON.

* * *
**PROCEDURE FOR THE UPDATE**
Caution

- You must not rename the extracted files.
- Never turn off the KATANA GEN3's power while the update is in progress.
Otherwise the system program or the KATANA GEN3 itself may be destroyed.

**PROCEDURE FOR THE UPDATE**
**Caution**

- You must not rename the extracted file.
- Never turn off the KATANA's power while the update is in progress. Otherwise the system program or the KATANA itself may be destroyed.
Please install the extracted system program files into your KATANA according to the following procedure.

1. Adjust the [MASTER] knob to minimum.
* Do not connect the KATANA and the computer yet.
2. Turn the POWER switch on while holding down the [TAP] button.
The indicators for the [EFFECTS] buttons flash.
3. Connect the computer to the KATANA's USB port by a USB cable.
"KATANA3" drive appears on the computer screen.
4. Open the KATANA3 icon.
"Removable Disk (*:)" may appear instead of the KATANA3 icon.
5. Copy (drag and drop) all the files included in the "katana3_sys_v107.zip" folder into the "KATANA3" icon.
* Do not copy the "katana3_sys_v107" FOLDER.
With Windows
Right-click on the "KATANA3" icon in My Computer (or the "Removable Disk (*:)" icon) and execute "Eject."
With macOS
Drag the "KATANA3" icon to the Trash icon in the Dock.
6. Disconnect the USB cable, start the update process.
7. While the update is in progress, the "EFFECTS" indicators light up.
When the update has finished, the "EFFECTS" indicators slowly flash simultaneously.
8. Turn the KATANA3 power off.

This completes the update operation. The new system program runs at the next startup.
Follow the procedure for verifying the version to verify that the version has been updated.

* * *

* * *
We'll further explain the instructions provided in the Procedure for Update here:

- **KATANA3 System Program (Ver.1.07)**
- Set the KATANA-50/100/ARTIST GEN3 amp to "updater mode" by starting with amp OFF,
Press and hold the [TAP] button, while powering ON the KATANA GEN3 amp.
- Connect the USB-C to USB 2.0/3.0 A data cable from KATANA USB-C port to computer USB-C/ 2.0/3.0 A port.
Blinking RED CHANNEL LEDs should be visible if not connected,
Solid RED CHANNEL LEDs should be visible if already connected with the USB cable to computer.

The KATANA3(DRIVE:) should mount and appear on computer:
- For WINDOWS KATANA3(DRIVE:) should appear in the WINDOWS FILE EXPLORER WINDOW left column.
- For macOS the KATANA3 Drive Icon should appear on the desktop or in the FINDER.

Make sure to download the update zip folder to your local drive and extract all the contents to your desktop, open the **katana3_sys_v107 folder, does not need to be extracted.**
If necessary RIGHT MOUSE CLICK the download and EXTRACT ALL to the DOWNLOADS folder or DESKTOP: ***katana3_sys_v107.zip (Compressed/zipped folder) needs to be EXTRACTED.**
NOTE: macOS will automatically extract an unzip the download into the DOWNLOADS folder, open folder, use the two update files: **KATANA3.BIN and ROMINFO.TXT** files.
User doesn't need to OPEN these files, only drag/drop or copy/paste these files into the mounted external KATANA3(DRIVE:).
*For WINDOWS users, right-mouse click the zip then select Extract All, follow the instructions and extract to your desktop or know location.
See side by side of the ZIPPED(highlighted) vs. extracted unzipped folder:
 ![](https://rolandus.zendesk.com/attachments/token/vezQ7t0wJZHhlMnmIy4a6KgiD/?name=image.png)
**Already extracted, open folder: Select copy/paste or drag/drop the two files KATANA3.BIN and ROMINFO.TXT files into the  KATANA3(DRIVE:) manually.**
 ![](https://rolandus.zendesk.com/attachments/token/KQeDHNUFeTwLEJKE1iOCpxgAR/?name=image.png)
When doing the update, make sure to copy/paste, drag/drop only the two update files into the KATANA3(DRIVE:).
**Again, use both the KATANA3.BIN and ROMINFO.TXT files for the update.**
NOT the zipped folder, or the extracted folder, ONLY these two update files should be added to the KATANA3(DRIVE:).
Once the update files are copied over into the KATANA3(DRIVE:) and only the two update files, soft-eject the KATANA3(DRIVE:), by Right Mouse Clicking, the KATANA3(DRIVE:) and choose EJECT.
Then disconnect the USB-C to USB 2.0/3.0 A cable from the computer or amp.

This will trigger the amp to recognize the update and you'll see the KATANA GEN3 amp, start the update process automatically, if it doesn't, then press the PANEL button with the RED flashing LED.
If necessary, press the PANEL LED button once and this will execute the update firmware code you've added to the amp.
Wait about a minute for the update to complete, check for slow blinking **GREEN EFFECT LEDS for successful update.**
Once the update has been confirmed, power OFF, and power ON, complete.

After attempting the update:
- If the EFFECT LEDS are flashing GREEN slowly simultaneously together, this indicates the update was a success.
- If the EFFECTS LEDS are flashing RED rapidly, this indicates the update failed and you'll need to try the process again.
In either circumstance/result, you'll need to recycle power, power OFF and back ON again to leave the "updater mode."

It's ok to power OFF the amp after the update processes has run and completed.
However, DON'T power OFF the amp while it's transmitting the update or in the process of updating.

* * *

* * *
**KATANA GEN3 FACTORY RESET INSTRUCTIONS:**

 ![](https://rolandus.zendesk.com/attachments/token/2PtLEtfq5Ch5kSdIwXovvCrHp/?name=inline1560582286.png)

**ATTACHING THE BT-DUAL ADAPTER INSTRUCTIONS:**
 ![](https://support.roland.com/attachments/token/hnk3slgafbjrm4MMWt18mcenb/?name=image.png)





Kind regards

messages.msg_o: ;As a brand loyal DW customer for 20+ years now;I respectfully request that DW consider the addition of two custom build options given the advancement of these technologies have progressed to the point;some players question why they’re not currently offered. 1) Powder Coating with color options for shell hardware. For the love of god;manufacturers have already released models occasionally and others offer black powder coatings for some existing models. So why not white or any other popular color? 2) A current project of mine is replacing the stock cookie gaskets on my white Illusion collectors kit wrapped in your modern version of the vintage Camco 3d moire wrap & replacing them with red gaskets. But honestly I’ve been hole punching cookies now for 2 days;and it friggin blows! Not to mention getting a reputable coating facility to accept my lugs & hoops for their return in a timely manner (preferably less than a year out) is proving to be frustrating when several to which I have inquired say they have no doubt about my items finish quality nor it’s application & durability;but rather the concern in their response seems focused on “the small size of my parts”. It’s been a chorus of “we’re willing to accept your parts” but what I interpret is “but we’re hesitant or concerned because the potential headache of lost or misplaced small pieces” Which I understand since they “typically work with larger items” Any sincere consideration given to these two suggestions would be welcomed not only myself but countless others in their effort to personalize their DW kits. With all due respect Sean M. Phone: Preferred contact: Email

messages.name: Travis Hartnett
messages.msg:
Hi Viktor tubiskongen@gmail.com,

We're sorry to hear you're having this issue.

Try these steps.
If you've already done one of the steps, just move on to the next one.
Please be sure that you've done all of the steps.

1. Make sure that you have **v3.1.16 **of Roland Cloud Manager installed.
2. In the Library of Cloud Manager, update any plug-ins that show an available update.
3. Clear your browser cache.
4. **Restart your computer. If you're on a Mac, make sure that the "reopen windows" isn't selected**
5. Launch Roland Cloud Manager
6. Start your DAW. <--very important!

Regards,

Travis

messages.name: Peter Jowett
messages.msg:
Hello Dmytro,

Thanks for your message, I hope you're well.
I'm sorry for the problems you're having with this.

Could you let me know do you specifically mean the BUS FX? Because I seem to be able to adjust the effects whilst in DJ mode, but I can't change the routing of the BUS FX and those sort of details.

Please check the below points.

Firmware.
The firmware needs to be on the latest version to minimize issues as much as possible; you can check your current version and download the latest update here if needed.
SP-404MKII System Program (Ver.5.00)
SP-404MK2: System Program Version Update

Factory Reset.
Please try a factory reset, as it can fix many problems.
SP-404MK2: Restoring the Unit to its Factory-set Default State

Video.
If none of the above helps, could you record a video example of this? Just a short recording on a phone will be fine, it would be helpful if we could see it. You can send me a link via WeTransfer or another free file transfer website, as the file is likely too large to attach to an Email.

I look forward to hearing back from you and getting this working.
Please let me know if you have further questions or concerns.
Best Regards,

Pete

Customer Service

Roland Europe Group Ltd

Hi Gavin,

Thanks for getting in touch, sorry to hear about your amp!

- Description of the incident
- Proof of purchase
- Address,
- Contact number

Kind regards,

Concha
Customer Service

Roland Europe Group Ltd

Hi thank you for the quick response

I very rarely use this app. It is always kept in the cover.

messages.name: Concha Rodriguez
messages.msg:
Hello, Gavin:

Thank you for sending us the requested information.

As you know, in order to activate your product warranty, we need a copy of your purchase. In addition, I wanted to inform you that, according to the serial number you provided, the amplifier was manufactured in 2019 and does not appear in our system.

However, we can come to an agreement: you send it to us, we repair it at no cost to you, and then you collect it.

If you confirm, please let me know so that we can open an RMA and provide you with the address of our technical facilities.

Thank you and best regards.

Concha
Customer Service

Roland Europe Group Ltd

messages.msg:
Hi Gavin,

I have now booked your warranty repair under reference SAMRGB2506110001


Please take a moment to carefully read our packing instructions, which can be found under our Warranty T&Cs under the heading 'Accessing our Repair Service'. When you have obtained sufficient packaging, please package the unit correctly to withstand transportation. Roland Europe Group cannot be held liable for any damage caused by insufficient packaging. If our attached guidelines are not followed, any occurrence of damage through inadequate packaging will void the product's warranty and will be returned unrepaired.

Roland UK (Ltd)
Atlantic Close
Swansea
SA7 9FJ

For hygiene reasons, we can only accept clean and suitable items for our Service Team to work on.

The average turnaround for a warranty repair is 14-28 working days. However, like many other electronic companies, we are currently experiencing long delays with spare parts that can cause delays out of our control. Therefore, if the parts required to repair your unit are not in stock, we will need to order them from Japan, which could delay the repair by 6-8 weeks.

Please provide me with the tracking number once you have sent it.

If you have any other questions, please let me know.

Kind regards


Concha
Customer Service

Roland Europe Group Ltd

messages.msg:
Hello William,

Thanks for reaching out and contacting Roland BOSS USA Operational Product Support about the GX-10.

See the link below to view the GX-10 Owner's Manual and other support documentation.

**GX-10 OWNER'S MANUALS:**

- **[English] GX-10 Startup Guide [PDF]**

- **[English] GX-10 Reference Manual [HTML]**
- **[English] GX-10 Reference Manual [PDF]**

**GX-10 PARAMETER GUIDE:**

- **[English] GX-10 Parameter Guide [HTML]**
- **[English] GX-10 Parameter Guide [PDF]**

**BTS for GX-10 MANUAL GUIDE:**

- **[English] BOSS TONE STUDIO for GX-10 Owner’s Manual [HTML]**
- **[English] BOSS TONE STUDIO for GX-10 (mobile) [HTML]**

**GX-10 BT/BLUETOOTH COMPATIBLE ACCESSORIES:**

- **[English] EV-1-WL Connection Guide (Connect with the GX-10) [PDF]**
- **[English] FS-1-WL Connection Guide (Connect with the GX-10) [PDF]**

**GX-10 MIDI IMPLEMENTATION GUIDE:**

- **[English] GX-100/GX-10 MIDI Implementation [PDF]**

**GX-10 KNOWLEDGE BASE ARTICLES:**
**https://support.roland.com/hc/en-us/search?utf8=%E2%9C%93&query=GX-10**

- **GX-10: Applying Effects to Dry Sound after Recording (Re-amping)**
-

**GX-10: What does the USB Computer port allow me to do with the GX-10?**

* * *



Thanks and enjoy your day.
Roland/BOSS Product Support

messages.name: Travis Hartnett
messages.msg:
Hello PRODBY SEVEN,

Thanks for contacting us!
**How to install a Roland Cloud instrument or expansion**
Products can be installed from either the Hardware Instruments or the Software Instruments view.
From the Hardware instruments view, click on the “download” icon for the item:

 ![](https://support.roland.com/attachments/token/cmq3M6H6v9YbOE2IkbmeT6CWR/?name=image.png)
From the Software Instruments, My Library view, click on the “install” link for the item:

 ![](https://support.roland.com/attachments/token/bj5kbv5eM2yq8nWjfZRVz3e2m/?name=image.png)Please let us know if you have further questions concerning this matter, and thanks for choosing Roland.

Regards,

Travis

messages.name: Eric Highsmith
messages.msg:
Hi Sevag,

Here is your Return Authorization (RA) number for your PM-100: RA# S14906842

Please use appropriate packaging and ship to the following address:

Roland Corporation US
15750 Mountain Ave
Chino, CA 91708

Please note - our factory service center does NOT have a will call area for drop offs or pickups, therefore all products must be shipped to the above address with UPS/FedEx. There is no postal service available at our service location, SO PLEASE DO NOT SHIP VIA USPS. Please make sure signature is required for package delivery.

Personnel at this address are not authorized to receive repairs directly from customers. Any attempt to drop off units will be rejected.

Please write your RA# clearly on the outside of the shipping box underneath the address. If this is a warranty repair, please place a copy of your sales receipt inside the box. We recommend that you insure your PM-100 with your shipping carrier to cover any accidental damage or loss that may occur in the shipping process.

For non-warranty repairs, we will contact you with an estimate after we have inspected your PM-100. In most cases this will be 3-5 business days after we receive it.

Kind Regards,
Roland Service Department

Eric

EMERGENCY! Can't get my plug-ins authorized and have gig tomorrow. I use this for live use! I can't get authorized .
I ONLY use cloud and specifically Zenology and D50 for LIVE use. My plug-in host is Gig Performer.
Most of the time I am in airplane mode with wifi off. 
We have a gig tomorrow, so yesterday, I turned on WIFI, went to RCM, uploaded updates to RCM, Going back to my session, white noise - all in "demo mode"
The little authorization window comes up, so I enter my email and password and hit the submit button. Then I quickly get a message that says "Your authorization is no longer active" despite the fact you just took money from me a few days ago - I'm on autopay. multiple reboots, trips to RCM, etc. HELP PLEASE!!!

messages.name: Travis Hartnett
messages.msg:
Hi Ken Matson,

We're sorry to hear you're having this issue.

Try these steps.
If you've already done one of the steps, just move on to the next one.
Please be sure that you've done all of the steps.

1. Make sure that you have **v3.1.16 **of Roland Cloud Manager installed.
2. In the Library of Cloud Manager, update any plug-ins that show an available update.
3. Clear your browser cache.
4. **Restart your computer. If you're on a Mac, make sure that the "reopen windows" isn't selected**
5. Launch Roland Cloud Manager
6. Start your DAW. <--very important!

Regards,

Travis

messages.name: Travis Hartnett
messages.msg:
We recommend rolling back to v3.1.3 of Roland Cloud Manager for the time being.

If you're using Windows, please go to the Windows Control Panel and use Add/Remove Programs to uninstall the current version of Cloud Manager.

If you're using macOS, use the uninstaller included on the installer disk image to uninstall the current version of Cloud Manager.

The installer for v3.1.3 can be found on this page:

If you're using Windows

and here

If you're using macOS 11 or later



Sorry for the inconvenience.

messages.name: Huw Lloyd-Williams
messages.msg:
Hi Brian,

Thank you for getting in touch, sorry to hear about your Gigcaster 8 troubles!

Firstly, can you please confirm that you're running the latest firmware - https://www.boss.info/global/support/by_product/gigcaster_8/updates_drivers/18d0d469-4010-40cb-8b1e-cf8fb8481a50/

It may be worth checking the pad parameters you have setup. The behaviour you're describing may relate to the MODE you have set. If you have this set to MOMENT, the effect will only engage while you are holding the pad button down. If it's on TOGGLE, the effect will remain in place until your hit the button again.

Check out page 11 of the parameter guide for details on this - https://static.roland.com/assets/media/pdf/GCS-8_parameter_eng01_W.pdf

Let me know if this helps!

Kind regards,

Huw

Customer Service

Roland Europe Group Ltd

messages.msg_o:
Hello Huw
Thanks for the speedy reply. It was as you said the pad was set to moment. Changed it to toggle and that worked a treat.

Many thanks.

Brian

Sent from my iPhone

messages.name: Huw Lloyd-Williams
messages.msg:
Hi Frederic,

Thank you for getting in touch, sorry to hear you're having trouble importing files on your GM-800.

Have you had a chance to review the following article?

GM-800: How to import Expansion Packs and Sound Packs from Roland Cloud Manager?

This details all of the steps you need to check off to make sure your EXZ files can be detected by the GM-800.

Does your USB drive fall within 4GB to 32GB? This is the recommended size for most Roland/BOSS instruments that are compatible with USB flash. Larger or smaller drives may not be detected.

Please let me know if there's anything in the article that doesn't quite go the way you would expect!

Kind regards,

Huw

Customer Service

Roland Europe Group Ltd

messages.msg_o: Bei bestimmten Presets habe ich immernoch white-noise im Hintergrund welches vom VST selber kommt, wenn ich es in FL-Studio als Instrument lade. Ich besitze allerdings eine ULTIMATE Membership, d.h. ich sollte alle besitzen. Wieso höre ich dann immernoch white-noise, auch wenn gar nichts am abspielen ist?
messages.name: Elia Fuchs
messages.msg: With certain presets, I still hear white noise in the background, which comes from the VST itself, when I load it as an instrument in FL Studio. However, I have an ULTIMATE membership, which means I should have all of them. So why do I still hear white noise even when nothing is playing?

messages.name: Travis Hartnett
messages.msg:
Hello Elia Fuchs,

Thanks for contacting us!
Are these Legendary plugins such as the Juno or Jupiter series? If you have the chorus turned on, you'll always hear white noise hiss even when you're not playing.

Please let us know if you have further questions concerning this matter, and thanks for choosing Roland.

Regards,

Travis

messages.msg_o: But why is that so?
messages.name: Elia Fuchs
messages.msg: But why is that so?

messages.msg_o:
Hello, Roland.  I have a new VDQ106 kit with the TD07.  I am very impressed, and in general it exceeds my expectations.  However, I would like some advice about one issue I have:
Among the 3 cymbals, 1 seems perfect.   The other 2 cymbals have areas where the response is uneven.  In some areas, the cymbal requires more force to get the same loudness.  One cymbal gives much louder response in its left portion than in its center and right portions. Another gives loud response when struck on the left and right regions, but quieter response in the center.  I would estimate the difference to be around 6dB.  I have adjusted the sensitivity and threshold settings, but they do not have an effect on the differences in the areas of the cymbal.

Is there something that can be done to correct this?  I do not want to adjust the screws on the underside of the cymbal, unless you advise that.  I'm not sure if the screws are intended for this type of adjustment.

Thanks in advance for your help.

Mark


Product Name: VQD106
Serial Number: z7r1634
Purchase Date: 2025-06-04
Purchase Method: Online
Purchase Dealer: ALTO MUSIC

messages.msg_o:
Hello, 
I would like to select multiple tracks while a loop is running, but they only start at the beginning of the next loop. In STOP MODE, this works: if I set it to Loop, the tracks only end at the end of the loop. In START MODE, however, this doesn't work; I can only select Immediate and Fade; the Loop option is missing. Is there a way to make such a setting? 
Best regards, 
Joachim Schuster

Guten Tag,
Ich möchte während ein Loop läuft mehrere Tracks auswählen die aber erst beim nächsten Loop Anfang starten.
Beim STOP MODE geht das wenn ich auf Loop einstelle, enden die Tracks erst am Ende des Loops,
Beim START MODE geht das aber nicht da kann ich nur Immediate und Fade auswählen, die Option Loop fehlt.
Gibt es eine Möglichkeit so eine Einstellung vorzunehmen?

Mit freundlichen Grüßen 
Joachim Schuster
Produktname: RC-600
Seriennummer: C1R1996

salve, da qualche tempo il mio fp e50 mi sta sta creando (saltuariamente) dei problemi di funzionamento tipo: a volte resta bloccato su un determinato stile e i vari tasti che dovrebbero fare il cambio non rispondono ,nella funzione accompagnamento on  a volte è capitato che mentre stai eseguento un brano , al momento di fare una variazione del ritmo (tasto variation 1/2) l'accompagnamemto si ferma e il tasto variation lampeggia e da quel momento il brano non si riavvia ,devo dire che le prime volte avevo pensato che magari fossi io ad aver sbagliato a pigiare qualche tasto e quindi spegnendo e riaccendendo lo strumento tutto tornava a funzionare normalmente ,ma  recentemente è capitato invece che la tastiera non emetteva nessuna nota ma la parte accompagnamento suonava  quindi ho capito che qualcosa non va, anche se con il procedimento spegni e riaccendi tutto si ripristina e funziona . avete già avuto delle segnalazioni di questi problemi? , soluzioni? lo strumento è stato acquistato il: 06/02/ 2024 quindi è in garanzia .

hi, for some time my fp e50 has been creating (occasionally) some problems with its functioning such as: sometimes it gets stuck on a certain style and the various keys that should make the change do not respond, in the accompaniment function on sometimes it has happened that while you are playing a song, when you make a variation of the rhythm (variation key 1/2) the accompaniment stops and the variation key flashes and from that moment the song does not restart, I must say that the first few times I thought that maybe I had pressed some key wrong and therefore by turning the instrument off and on again everything went back to working normally, but recently it happened instead that the keyboard did not emit any notes but the accompaniment part played so I understood that something is wrong, even if with the procedure of turning off and on again everything is restored and works. have you already had reports of these problems?, solutions? the instrument was purchased on: 06/02/ 2024 therefore it is under warranty.

messages.msg_o:
Hi. I am at the latest level of SPD-SX Pro firmware (May 2025). When I import a one bar loop that I've made in Logic (which loops perfectly in Logic), this will deviate from the internal click on the SPD-SX Pro even though the tempo is set to exactly the same value. If I export a 1 bar click from the same Logic session and set the SPD to use that as the click, then there's no deviation and it works fine. Is this a known issue? I have tried editing the .wav on the SPD to make it line up with the internal click and I can get it to deviate much less that way, but it still deviates. Seems like it should just work?

Thank you for your time.

Jamie Fraser
Product Name: SPD-SX PRO
Serial Number: Z0P0242
Purchase Date: 2022-12-05
Purchase Method: In a store
Purchase Dealer: LONG & MCQUADE

messages.msg_o:
Buongiorno,
ho due problemi da risolvere con il guitar sinth Roland GR-55 :
1  Quando mi creo un user Patch in User Patch , poi premo il tasto WRITE per salvarla,
ma al successivo rientro vengono salveti solo  i due suoni PCM e non quello a modelli fisici COSM, quindi sono costretto ogni volta a selezionarlo.

2 Come devo procedere per assegnare al pedale d'espressione quando è premuto tutto in basso un suono PCM e quando lo rialzo togliere lo stesso suono ?
grazie per le info
Stefano
Nome del Prodotto: SY-1000
Numero di Serie: Z6L2124
Data di Acquisto: 2022-07-27
Metodo di Acquisto: Secondhand
Rivenditore: No Data
messages.name: STEFANO PERISSOTTO
messages.msg:
Good morning,
 I have two problems to solve with the Roland GR-55 guitar synth:
 1 When I create a user Patch in User Patch , then I press the WRITE button to save it,
 but when I next return, only the two PCM sounds are saved and not the COSM physical modeling one, so I'm forced to select it every time.

 2 How should I proceed to assign a PCM sound to the expression pedal when it is pressed all the way down and remove the same sound when I raise it again?
 thanks for the info
 Stephen
 Product Name: SY-1000
 Serial Number: Z6L2124
 Purchase Date: 2022-07-27
 Purchase Method: Secondhand
 Reseller: No Data

messages.name: Daniel Stegmann
messages.msg:
Buongiorno Stefano,

Grazie per il tuo messaggio. Ecco come procedere per ciascun punto:

**1. Problema con il salvataggio della patch:**
Potresti gentilmente chiarire se il problema riguarda:

- la _selezione dello strumento COSM_ (ad esempio tipo di chitarra, pickup, accordatura ecc.)
oppure
- il fatto che il _modulo COSM Guitar_ risulti disattivato (in stato OFF) quando richiami la patch?
Questa distinzione ci aiuterebbe a capire meglio se si tratta di un problema di memorizzazione dei parametri o semplicemente dello stato attivo/disattivo del modulo.

**2. Uso del pedale d’espressione per attivare/disattivare un suono PCM specifico:**
Ecco una procedura adattata che ti permette di controllare solo _uno_ dei due suoni PCM con il pedale e di disattivare tutto il resto:

1. Premi **EDIT**.
2. Premi **PAGE** finché non arrivi alla schermata **TONE**.
3. Usa i cursori **DOWN** e **LEFT** per spostarti sull’icona a forma di rettangolo alla sinistra di “NORMAL PICKUP”.
4. Gira la manopola per attivarlo. Quando è attivo, apparirà un quadratino bianco nel rettangolo.
5. Premi **PAGE** fino a **SYSTEM**.
6. Usa il cursore per selezionare **PEDAL/GK CONTROL** e premi **ENTER**.
7. Premi **PAGE** fino alla sezione **EXP** (pedale d’espressione).
8. Alla voce **EXP FUNCTION**, seleziona **TONE VOLUME**.
9. Ora scendi alle voci **PCM1**, **PCM2**, **MODELING TONE** e **NORMAL PU**, e imposta:
  - Il modulo PCM che _vuoi controllare_ su **ON** (es. PCM1 = ON),
  - Tutti gli altri su **OFF** (es. PCM2 = OFF, MODELING TONE = OFF, NORMAL PU = OFF).

In questo modo, il pedale controllerà solo il volume del suono PCM scelto. Quando il pedale è abbassato al minimo, il suono sarà muto, e quando lo alzi, verrà progressivamente attivato.

Fammi sapere se qualcosa non è chiaro o se vuoi associare questo comportamento a un’altra funzione (es. mute/attiva a scatto).

Cordiali saluti,

Daniel
Roland Customer Support

messages.msg_o:
Buongiorno Daniel,

rispondo alle domande :

**1. Problema con il salvataggio della patch:**

-  il _modulo COSM Guitar_  e anche i suoni PCM risultano sempre disattivati (in stato OFF) quando richiamo la patch dopo averla
- salvata regolarmente con WRITE.
- invece per quanto riguarda la _selezione dello strumento COSM_ (ad esempio tipo di chitarra, pickup, accordatura ecc.)
oppure i vari parametri dei suoni PCM restano salvati quando richiamo la pacht.
-

**2. Uso del pedale d’espressione per attivare/disattivare un suono PCM specifico:**

ho eseguito tutta la procedura come già facevo in passato, ma non ho risolto il problema.

aggiungo che fino a poco tempo fà tutto era regolare, forse devo riportare il GR55 alle impostazioni di fabbrica ? oppure esiste un modo

per risolvere diversamente ? anche perchè perderei tutte le patch già memorizzate.

grazie per le info

messages.name: Peter Jowett
messages.msg:
Bonjour Lukas,
Merci de nous avoir contactés, j'espère que vous allez bien.
Je suis vraiment désolé pour les problèmes que vous rencontrez avec votre Bridge Cast.
Nous allons examiner cela, veuillez vérifier les points ci-dessous.

Bruit blanc.
Lorsque le niveau du canal est augmenté alors que la prise AUX n'est pas utilisée, vous pouvez entendre un bruit blanc. Lorsque vous n'utilisez pas la prise AUX, réglez le niveau du canal au minimum ou coupez le son.
Le bruit capté par le microphone (bruit de fond) peut être supprimé à l'aide de la fonction de suppression du bruit. Activez la suppression du bruit. Si le bruit persiste même lorsque la suppression du bruit est activée, réglez les paramètres de la suppression du bruit. Pour plus d'informations sur les paramètres de suppression du bruit, consultez le manuel d'utilisation du BRIDGE CAST, à la section « Calibrage de la qualité sonore du micro (nettoyage) ».

Suppression du bruit.
Le suppresseur de bruit intégré au BRIDGE CAST peut ne pas fonctionner correctement s'il est activé en même temps que la fonction de suppression du bruit de votre logiciel de chat (Discord, Zoom, etc.). Si votre voix est également supprimée de manière involontaire, désactivez cette fonction sur l'un des deux appareils.
BRIDGE CAST : le suppresseur de bruit intégré ne fonctionne pas correctement.

USB.
Veuillez vous assurer que vous utilisez un câble USB qui transfère des données et qu'il est branché directement sur un port USB de votre PC. Il peut être utile d'essayer plusieurs câbles. Les hubs USB peuvent causer des interférences avec la communication vers votre PC ; la connexion doit être directe. De plus, s'il s'agit d'un ordinateur de bureau, veuillez essayer d'utiliser l'un des ports à l'arrière de la tour, afin qu'il soit connecté directement à la carte mère de votre PC.

Pilote.
Veuillez vous assurer que le bon pilote est installé. Si c'est le cas, il serait également utile de le désinstaller et de le réinstaller. Il est nécessaire pour la communication avec votre PC.

- Pilote USB BRIDGE CAST Ver.1.0.0 pour Windows 10/11
- Pilote USB BRIDGE CAST Ver.1.0.1 pour macOS Sonoma 14.x
- Pilote BRIDGE CAST USB Ver.1.0.0 pour macOS Big Sur 11.x / Monterey 12.x / Ventura 13.x

Micrologiciel.
Le micrologiciel doit être à jour afin de minimiser les problèmes. Vous pouvez vérifier la version actuelle et télécharger la dernière mise à jour ici si nécessaire.
Programme système BRIDGE CAST ( Ver.2.00 )

Réinitialisation d'usine.
Veuillez essayer une réinitialisation d'usine, car cela peut résoudre de nombreux problèmes.
TR-8S : Réinitialisation d'usine

Vidéo.
Si aucune des solutions ci-dessus ne fonctionne, pourriez-vous enregistrer une vidéo illustrant le problème ? Une courte vidéo enregistrée avec votre téléphone suffira, cela nous aiderait beaucoup de voir le problème. Pourriez-vous inclure dans la vidéo les connexions que vous avez établies avec le Bridge Cast ? Vous pouvez m'envoyer un lien via WeTransfer ou un autre site web de transfert de fichiers gratuit, car le fichier est probablement trop volumineux pour être joint à un e-mail.

J'espère que l'une de ces solutions fonctionnera, sinon, nous serons au moins plus près de la solution.
N'hésitez pas à me contacter si vous avez d'autres questions entre-temps.
Cordialement,

Pete

Customer Service

Roland Europe Group Ltd

messages.name: Peter Jowett

messages.name: Peter Jowett
messages.msg:
Hello Tristan,

Thanks for contacting us, I hope you're well.
I'm sorry for the problems you're having with this, I'd be happy to help out.
Let's look into it, please check the below points.

SD card.
Which SD card are you using please? You can use an SD/SDHC card of up to 32GB, I tend to find that this one works well for me - SanDisk Extreme PRO SDHC - 32gb

Please check the format is correct format, you can find the guidelines for this on this link - TR-8S: How to import Wav Files on TR-8S

Could you send me the folder? I could see if I can get it to work on my device.

Factory Reset.
Please try a factory reset, as it can fix many problems.
TR-8S: Factory Reset

I look forward to hearing back from you, we can see the next steps from there.
Please let me know if you have any further questions or concerns.
Best Regards,

Pete

Customer Service

Roland Europe Group Ltd

messages.msg:
Hello, I have a problem with Roland Cloud. I have a pro subscription, but all the plug-ins are blocked and display "Not authorized" even though all my payments are up to date.
 Everything was still working fine a few days ago. I tried deleting and reinstalling the plugins, but the problem persists.

messages.name: Travis Hartnett
messages.msg:
Hi Kozaaahh Sama,

We're sorry to hear you're having this issue.

Try these steps.
If you've already done one of the steps, just move on to the next one.
Please be sure that you've done all of the steps.

1. Make sure that you have **v3.1.16 **of Roland Cloud Manager installed.
2. In the Library of Cloud Manager, update any plug-ins that show an available update.
3. Clear your browser cache.
4. **Restart your computer. If you're on a Mac, make sure that the "reopen windows" isn't selected**
5. Launch Roland Cloud Manager
6. Start your DAW. <--very important!

Regards,

Travis

messages.msg_o: Currently I'm subscribing the Pro plan right now. However, I can only choose 1 legendary items. I choose JX-3P today and that was it... I couldn't choose one more item. Please fix this bug or explain to me what's going on with this plan.
messages.name: Hae Yoon
messages.msg: Currently I'm subscribing the Pro plan right now. However, I can only choose 1 legendary items. I choose JX-3P today and that was it... I couldn't choose one more item. Please fix this bug or explain to me what's going on with this plan.

messages.name: Travis Hartnett
messages.msg:
Hello Hae Yoon,

Thanks for contacting us!
**Introduction to a Pro Membership. **

Congratulations on purchasing a Roland Cloud Pro membership!

A Pro membership gives you access to **three** plug-ins at any given time: Zenology, and any **two** Legendary or AIRA series plugins of your choosing, using the **Pro Access switch** in the Cloud Manager Library.

**Any other available plug-in will stay in demo mode** _**until**_ **it's turned on using the Pro Access switch.**

Here’s a list of the Legendary and AIRA series plugins available to you with a Pro membership:


D-50, JD-800, JUNO-106, JUNO-60, JUNO-60 CHORUS, JUPITER-4, JUPITER-8, JV-1080, JX-3P, PROMARS, SH-101, SH-2, SOUND CANVAS VA, SYSTEM-100, TB-303, TR-606, TR-707, TR-727, TR808, TR-909, XV-5080, SYSTEM-8 (AIRA), SYSTEM-1 (AIRA)


Please note that the SRX plugins are not included in a Pro membership.

To choose your two Legendary series plugins, make sure that you have v3.0 of Cloud Manager installed.

Turn off the "Show Only Owned/Free" switch by moving it to the left.

 ![](https://rolandus.zendesk.com/attachments/token/ytXG6RrMagUm6w8sFuwwyzbvt/?name=Screen+Shot+2023-03-14+at+1.55.45+PM.png)

Next follow these steps:


1. Go to My Library
2. Click Series and choose either Legendary or AIRA from the drop down menu.
3. Click Type, then choose Plug-in.
4. You'll then see the Pro Access switches to let you choose your two Legendary plug-ins. The same process works for the AIRA instruments (System-8 and System-1).

See this example:

 ![](https://rolandus.zendesk.com/attachments/token/YgJtTiovVfdiBfkLIns4qCJUD/?name=Screen+Shot+2023-03-14+at+9.51.50+AM.png)


**Remember**--if you've already got two instruments selected, you'll need to deselect at least one of those before you can select and install/update another instrument.

If you’re not sure which instruments you’ve already selected, just open Cloud Manager, go to the Library, and filter on “Series: Legendary”. Anything with a blue switch has been selected and is available for use in your DAW or other plugin host software. Anything without a blue switch can’t be authorized, installed or updated.

Please see the attached video for a demonstration of selecting and changing plugins with the Pro Access switch.



Regards,

Travis

I followed the standard steps to save to a memory given on page 10 (which p12 directs you to) but I’m finding the external controller is remaining eg on depth only on both memories. I do not understand what it says on page 12 about “can be set and saved for each memory if the preference (SWP/MEP/C1P/C2P/EPP) is set to MEM… “ is that where I am missing something please? Or am I trying to do something that cannot be done? 

And another separate question. I’m not quite clear how you actually switch memories to use them. Your manual on page 10 on the right says you just press the memory button and seems to suggest that will take me to memories Man > 1 > 2 > 3 > 4 >… 127..   but no it only takes me 1-4 and back to Manual again.. please help! 

Many thanks in advance.

messages.name: Peter Jowett
messages.msg:
Hello Phillip,

Thanks for contacting us, I hope you're well.
I'm sorry for the wait, a few of my colleagues were off ill, myself included - leaving only a few of our agents for all our European tickets.
I'm also sorry for the problems you're having with your MD-200, let's look into it.

So I assume you are using an expression pedal? Just so we can rule out any incompatibilities, which one is it?

I will need to test this out in person, unfortunately my MD-200 is in the office and I'm working from home today, though I will be in for the rest of the week.

However, it seems to me that you would need to set the below settings on both memories. Please open the menu ( Press the [TAP DIVISION] button and [MEMORY] button simultaneously. )

Set this symbol - ![](https://rolandus.zendesk.com/attachments/token/mNaWLglKJVD4kDco0KkCepF7Y/?name=image.png) to Memory

And set this to ![](https://rolandus.zendesk.com/attachments/token/ZKfjZr65fXa0j8G8s9FcJ1mZ6/?name=image.png) to ![](https://rolandus.zendesk.com/attachments/token/f1A9yzxR27WHn4xKvPyGQ1zhy/?name=image.png)

Then save the memory, as shown below.
 ![](https://rolandus.zendesk.com/attachments/token/xGTLnywuUnl0zo9hylWEAacCY/?name=image.png)

Then repeat this process on the next memory, swapping out the expression pedal's function to what you would like it to do in the second memory.
It might be a problem of when you are saving the memory, so it would be worth the order you are trying this.
Please let me know if this works or not and I will try and re-create your setup as closely as possible when testing it myself.

In regards to your second question about the memory ranges, there's a setting for this in the menu ( Press the [TAP DIVISION] button and [MEMORY] button simultaneously. )
 ![](https://rolandus.zendesk.com/attachments/token/cW09cCtakw2RwIUuHLdKiVAQV/?name=image.png)
So if you set the 'extent to' to 127 you will have the full range of these memories to use.

Please let me know how you get on with the above and which pedal you are using, we can see the next steps from there.
Best Regards,

Pete

Customer Service

Roland Europe Group Ltd

Hi:



Thanks for answering my query; I’ve done a Factory Reset and all of the Guitar Chorus options appear now…. YAY!  However, I still cannot get the orange light to appear when adjusting mic sensitivity. What happens is, when I turn up the “mic sens” dial on the back of the VE-8, at some point I get a green light and some very loud, horrible, screeching feedback. Where should the Vocal volume level be set when adjusting mic sensitivity? Please tell me how I can get the orange to light up; I only get “green” when it’s feeding back – never get “red” or “orange”. Green isn’t even mentioned in the manual, so it’s very confusing.  Please help.

Thanks so much. Regards, Arlene
messages.name: Arlene Zuccato
messages.msg:
Hi:



Thanks for answering my query; I’ve done a Factory Reset and all of the Guitar Chorus options appear now…. YAY!  However, I still cannot get the orange light to appear when adjusting mic sensitivity. What happens is, when I turn up the “mic sens” dial on the back of the VE-8, at some point I get a green light and some very loud, horrible, screeching feedback. Where should the Vocal volume level be set when adjusting mic sensitivity? Please tell me how I can get the orange to light up; I only get “green” when it’s feeding back – never get “red” or “orange”. Green isn’t even mentioned in the manual, so it’s very confusing.  Please help.

Thanks so much. Regards, Arlene

messages.name: Austin Sandick
messages.msg:
Arlene,

The MIC SENS control is adjusting the internal microphone preamp of the VE-8.
You'll need to balance the levels of the MIC SENS, OUTPUT LEVEL of the VE-8 and the output volume of your amp/pa system you're using to amplify the VE-8.
We suggest starting with your amp off, adjust the MIC SENS control to the halfway point or until the ORANGE LED appears, then set OUTPUT LEVEL of the VOCAL to the halfway point. Turn the volume to 0 on your amplifier, then slowly raise the volume of your output device until the vocal sound can be heard clearly without feedback.

Below is a Google search link on balancing Gain, Volume and Level of any microphone.
https://www.google.com/search?q=tips+on+balancing+mic+gain%2C+volume+and+level&rlz=1C5CHFA_enUS913US913&oq=tips+on+balancing+mic+gain%2C+volume+and+level&gs_lcrp=EgZjaHJvbWUyBggAEEUYOTIHCAEQIRigATIHCAIQIRigATIHCAMQIRigATIHCAQQIRiPAjIHCAUQIRiPAtIBCDg2ODJqMGo3qAIAsAIA&sourceid=chrome&ie=UTF-8

Hope this helps.

* * *


Thanks and enjoy your day.
Roland/BOSS Product Support

messages.name: Travis Hartnett
messages.msg:
Hi Adam Zalm,

We're sorry to hear you're having this issue.

Try these steps.
If you've already done one of the steps, just move on to the next one.
Please be sure that you've done all of the steps.

1. Make sure that you have **v3.1.16 **of Roland Cloud Manager installed.
2. In the Library of Cloud Manager, update any plug-ins that show an available update.
3. Clear your browser cache.
4. **Restart your computer. If you're on a Mac, make sure that the "reopen windows" isn't selected**
5. Launch Roland Cloud Manager
6. Start your DAW. <--very important!

Regards,

Travis

messages.name: Austin Sandick
messages.msg:
Hello Aaron,

Thanks for reaching out and contacting Roland BOSS USA Operational Product Support about the KATANA:GO (KTN-GO2).

In order to connect your phone to the KATANA:GO,
please first, review, read, and use the directions found on page 7 of the KATANA:GO Owner's Manual:

- **[English] KATANA:GO Owner's Manual [HTML]**
- **[English] KATANA:GO Owner's Manual [PDF****]**
Keep in mind, there are two different Bluetooth signals to connect to on the KATANA:GO. In your device's Bluetooth menu, you should see the following connections.

KATANA:GO AUDIO = this is the Bluetooth audio signal to use KATANA:GO as a playback audio device for Spotify, YouTube and other apps.

KATANA:GO MIDI = This is the Bluetooth signal that is used to connect the KATANA:GO to the BTS for KATANA:GO APP for iOS/Android. Please connect to this signal using the BTS App ONLY.
**BTS app for mobile device KATANA:GO GUIDE:**

- **[English] Connecting the BOSS TONE STUDIO iOS App to the KATANA:GO Unit [PDF]**
- **[English] Connecting the BOSS TONE STUDIO Android App to the KATANA:GO Unit [PDF]**

**iOS USERS:**
**Download “BOSS TONE STUDIO for KATANA:GO“for iOS**

**ANDROID USERS:**
**Download “BOSS TONE STUDIO for KATANA:GO“for Android**
**If you're having issues connecting to either Bluetooth signals, please check that these signals haven't connected to a different Bluetooth device in your vicinity. Sometime, BT signals can become crossed with other devices. **
You may need to attempt to "FORGOT THIS DEVICE" settings in your Bluetooth menu for both the KATANA:GO AUDIO and KATANA:GO MIDI signals. You can then press the Bluetooth icon button on the KATANA:GO to restart the syncing process.

Please make sure your KATANA:GO is using the latest device firmware.
**KATANA:GO FIRMWARE UPDATE:**
**KATANA:GO System Program ( Ver.1.04 )**

* * *
After downloading the BTS for KATANA:GO App for iOS/Android, open the App and then connect to the signal labeled KATANA:GO inside the BTS App.
**iOS USERS:**
**Download “BOSS TONE STUDIO for KATANA:GO“ for iOS**
**ANDROID USERS:**
**Download “BOSS TONE STUDIO for KATANA:GO“ for Android**

* * *
You can learn more about connecting to the BTS for KATANA:GO App in the documents below.
**KATANA:GO SUPPORT:**
**https://www.boss.info/us/products/katana-go/support/**


#### **OWNER’S MANUALS:**

- **[8 Languages] KATANA:GO Quick Start [PDF]**
- **[English] KATANA:GO Owner's Manual [HTML]**
- **[English] KATANA:GO Owner's Manual [PDF****]**
- **[English] KATANA:GO Parameter Guide [PDF]**

- **[English] About the external design of the KATANA:GO [HTML]**
- **[English] About the external design of the KATANA:GO [PDF]**

- **[English] Using BOSS TONE STUDIO for KATANA:GO/EV-1-WL, FS-1-WL Connection Guide [PDF]**

- **[English] Connecting the BOSS TONE STUDIO iOS App to the KATANA:GO Unit [PDF]**
- **[English] Connecting the BOSS TONE STUDIO Android App to the KATANA:GO Unit [PDF]**

**KNOWLEDGE BASE ARTICLES:**

- **KATANA:GO: How do I charge the unit?**
- **KATANA:GO: How many hours can I continue to use the unit on the rechargeable lithium-ion battery power?**
- **KATANA:GO: What you can do with BOSS TONE STUDIO for KATANA:GO**
- **KATANA:GO : Can I connect the EV-1-WL and FS-1-WL, BT foot controls simultaneously?**
- **KATANA:GO: Is it possible to replace the internal lithium-ion battery myself?**
- **KATANA:GO: Can I use it while charging?**
- **KATANA:GO: Factory Reset**
- **KATANA:GO Why are there no ASIO drivers available?**
- **KATANA:GO: Is a dedicated carrying case available?**
- **KATANA:GO: Can it be used for a bass guitar?**
- **KATANA:GO: How do I edit the effects?**
- **KATANA:GO: When I left the unit for a while, a dot moving along the screen edge appeared instead of characters: Is this a malfunction?**
- **KATANA:GO: Can I turn off the screen saver?**
- **KATANA:GO: What type of USB cable can I use for USB audio functionality?**
- **KATANA:GO: How do I perform the guitar along with songs playing on my mobile device?**
- **KATANA:GO: Can I connect the unit to my computer via Bluetooth?**
- **KATANA:GO: "KATANA:GO AUDIO" does not appear on the Bluetooth settings screen of my mobile device.**
- **KATANA:GO: Livesets you can download at BOSS TONE EXCHANGE for the KATANA:GO**

There are two BT/BLUE TOOTH connections to establish with the KATANA:GO:

1.

BT-AUDIO : Connect with KATANA:GO AUDIO connection using your mobile device BT system settings, and pair with the KATANA:GO BT AUDIO connection.

Simply press hold the BT button on the KATANA:GO for 2 seconds, then release, this should enable BT pairing and detection for the KATANA:GO AUDIO BT connection.

2. BT-MIDI : Connect with KATANA:GO MIDI connection using your mobile device and the BTS for KATANA:GO mobile app, Step 2 when you open the app should prompt you to connect, with the KATANA:GO MIDI, and pair.

* * *
First deactivate any other BT connections for your mobile device.
Deactivate any BT devices in your environment, this includes other mobile devices, computer, smart TVs, etc.
Sometimes the connection will connect or go elsewhere, thus appearing as if the selection is not available.

Try removing the BTS for KATANA:GO app, then reinstall the app.
Then power on the KATANA:GO > open the BTS app > choose CONNECT > if the KATANA:GO MIDI doesn't appear, try rescanning, if KATANA:GO MIDI is not detected, try pressing the BT pairing button off/on for the KATANA:GO, and then rescan again, once the KATANA:GO MIDI connection appears and select it, go back to the first app page, and confirm or OK the connection.

If connecting with KATANA:GO BT AUDIO connection, then press hold the BT pairing button for 2 seconds, this should make the audio connection available.

* * *



Thanks and enjoy your day.
Roland/BOSS Product Support

messages.msg_o: My SRX Brass and Zenology are both having authorization issues. I've reinstalled both to no avail. Please help.
messages.name: Nick Pratt
messages.msg: My SRX Brass and Zenology are both having authorization issues. I've reinstalled both to no avail. Please help.

messages.name: Travis Hartnett
messages.msg:
Hi Nick Pratt,

We're sorry to hear you're having this issue.

Try these steps.
If you've already done one of the steps, just move on to the next one.
Please be sure that you've done all of the steps.

1. Make sure that you have **v3.1.16 **of Roland Cloud Manager installed.
2. In the Library of Cloud Manager, update any plug-ins that show an available update.
3. Clear your browser cache.
4. **Restart your computer. If you're on a Mac, make sure that the "reopen windows" isn't selected**
5. Launch Roland Cloud Manager
6. Start your DAW. <--very important!

Regards,

Travis

messages.msg_o:
I updated my SPD-S from software version 1.01 to 1.20 and saw the expected "memory damaged" error as per the ReleaseNote_SPDS120.pdf.  As per the release note, the "memory damaged" error appears at first power-on and pressing "ENTER" the first time brings up the message "ENTER to init".  All buttons extinguish and the only button illuminated is the "ENTER" button, however pressing "ENTER" now does nothing.  When the button is depressed its LED extinguishes but nothing happens.  I have tried holding it down for over 20 seconds, pressing it repeatedly, re-installing the software and trying other keys, but nothing will clear the "ENTER to init" and bring up the “Patch 001” display as per the release note instructions.
I have searched for version 1.01 of the software to try and roll it back to a known good version, but have not been able to find it.
Please could you advise a potential solution or provide me with the v1.01 software so that I can at least return the SPD-S to useable order.

Many thanks,
Steve Rendall
Product Name: SPD-S
Serial Number: AS70322
Purchase Date: 2025-03-02
Purchase Method: Secondhand
Purchase Dealer: No Data

messages.name: Daniel Stegmann
messages.msg:
Hello Steve,

Thank you for your detailed message.

Since pressing "ENTER" does not complete the initialization process after updating to version 1.20, one workaround that has helped in similar cases is to load the factory data from a CompactFlash (CF) card that was previously used with the SPD-S.

You can download the factory data from the following page:
SPD-S Factory Restore Data

Please try copying the factory data to your CF card and loading it into the SPD-S to see if that clears the issue.

Let us know if this resolves the problem or if the issue persists.

Best regards,

Daniel
Roland Customer Support

messages.msg_o:
Hi Daniel,


Thanks for the quick response, but unfortunately your suggestion does not work.



I have a CF card with the factory restore data in the card’s ROLAND folder, but holding [PATCH], [WAVE] and [CARD] when booting up merely moves the “memory damaged!” error message (with all buttons flashing) to the “[ENTER] to init.” message after power-on.  It’s as if the memory state check happens before a button-state check and all processes stop once the memory’s discovered to be damaged.



I tried to check the content of the CF card but it hung my computer (2020 MacBook Pro with four thunderbolt 3 ports running Sequoia 15.5).  This had happened before and the only way to rescue the card was to boot the Mac into Recovery mode and use the Disk Utility to erase it, re-format it to a PC standard then re-format it using the SPD-S.  Unfortunately however, I can now no longer use the SPD-S to format the card as it won’t get beyond the “memory damaged!” error.



With the CF card completely blank and formatted to MS-DOS (FAT) using the Mac’s recovery mode disk utility, I copied the v1.20 SPD-S.PRG file to the card’s root and re-tried the update.  After the “Card Updater” prompt appeared I pressed [PATCH] and [PHRASE MAKER] together but, instead of beginning the update process, all of the front panel LEDs illuminated and error message “Update ERROR 14” appeared in the display with none of the buttons responding.  Power-cycling the unit returned it to the “memory damaged!’ message.



I went back to the Mac’s recovery disk utility and erased and formatted as ExFAT, but this only gets as far as the “Card Updater” message.  Pressing the flashing [PATCH] and [PHRASE MAKER] buttons has no effect.



I now have a CF card which is probably formatted incorrectly and no way of correctly formatting it to attempt further uploads.



Could you advise a further course of action please?  Is there a way I can roll-back the software to the previous version?  Is there a power-on key combination which will put the unit into an engineering mode perhaps from which I can reset or obtain further diagnostic data?



Best regards,

Steve

On 11 Jun 2025, at 15:33, Roland Corporation <support@rolandus.zendesk.com> wrote:

messages.name: Daniel Stegmann
messages.msg:
Hi Steve,

Thank you for your follow-up and for the extensive troubleshooting you've done already.

Unfortunately, based on your detailed description and all the steps you've taken, it does seem likely that your SPD-S has developed a hardware fault. There is no known power-on key combination to enter an engineering or diagnostic mode, and unfortunately no official way to roll back to version 1.01 once the unit is stuck in this state.

I’m forwarding your case to our service department. They will be in touch shortly to help you with organizing a repair and provide further instructions.

We’re sorry for the inconvenience, and thank you for your patience so far.

Best regards,

Daniel
Roland Customer Support

messages.name: Concha Rodriguez
messages.msg:
Hi Steve,

According to your registered purchase method, your SPD-S was purchased second-hand. Please provide us with the original owner's proof of purchase so we can backdate any remaining warranty from when your unit was first purchased.

As per our warranty policy, the warranty for Roland products can be transferred to a new owner if the original proof of purchase from the first owner is provided.

If the product is out of warranty or you do not have the original proof of purchase, we recommend contacting one of our trusted Service Partners. They specialize in repairs for out-of-warranty and second-hand products and should be able to help you.

To find a convenient location, you can visit our European Engineers Map, which lists all our Service Partners. This tool will help you find the best option for you.

If you have any other questions or need more help, please don't hesitate to contact us.

Kind regards,

Concha
Customer Service

Roland Europe Group Ltd

messages.name: Austin Sandick
messages.msg:
Hello Trevor,

Thanks for reaching out and contacting Roland BOSS USA Operational Product Support about the DM-2W.

For convenient and easy product registration there should be a QR code card included with your device that allows your mobile device to conveniently link into Roland BOSS Backstage for registration of your product.
 ![](https://rolandus.zendesk.com/attachments/token/YR2y8U4LQEYLFcnD3KoouezVn/?name=inline-1660318938.png)


Please review the Serial Number/SN# locations and identification here:
Unfortunately we can't provide you with the missing SN#.
The SN# should be alphanumeric, typically with 2 - letters, and 5 numbers, for a total of 7 characters.
The SN# should be viewable on the bottom, top panel, or back panel of the unit, on the registration card and on the product packaging/box, for example the stomp boxes have the SN# on the side or back of the BOSS black box.

Check out: How to find my Serial Number Knowledge Base Article.
https://www.boss.info/us/support/knowledge_base/201979699/

Note: Registration of Roland BOSS devices are used for customer product tracking, product support, and marketing purposes.
All that is needed to honor the Manufacturer Warranty is the new product's itemized point of sale purchase receipt/invoice.

BOSS stomp box SN# location examples here:
 ![](https://rolandus.zendesk.com/attachments/token/2DDVmazsIq3u7UIBO7PDYBTIy/?name=inline1433978122.png) ![](https://rolandus.zendesk.com/attachments/token/RkDHZZJzDhFTMMqs0lAaMosPj/?name=inline1381395213.png)

Hope this helps.

* * *


Thanks and enjoy your day.
Roland/BOSS Product Support

 Purchase date: 2023-07-20
 Purchasing method: Secondhand
 Dealer: No Data

messages.name: Peter Jowett
messages.msg:
Hej Torkel,

Tack för att du kontaktade oss, jag hoppas att du mår bra.
Jag är mycket ledsen för de problem du upplever med din GT-100.
Låt oss undersöka saken, vänligen kontrollera följande punkter.

USB.
Se till att du använder en USB-kabel som överför data och att den är ansluten direkt till en USB-port på din dator. Det kan vara värt att prova flera kablar. USB-hubbar kan orsaka störningar i kommunikationen med din dator; anslutningen måste vara direkt. Om det är en stationär dator, prova dessutom att använda en av portarna på baksidan av tornet, så att den är ansluten direkt till datorns moderkort.

Drivrutin.
Se till att du har rätt drivrutin installerad. Om du har det kan det också vara värt att avinstallera och installera om den. Det är nödvändigt för kommunikationen med din dator.
GT-100 Ver.2 Drivrutin Ver.2.1.1 för Windows 10/11

Firmware.
Firmware måste vara den senaste versionen för att minimera problem så mycket som möjligt. Du kan kontrollera din aktuella version och ladda ner den senaste uppdateringen här om det behövs.
GT-100 Systemprogram ( Ver.2.12 )

Återställ till fabriksinställningar.
Försök med en återställning till fabriksinställningar, eftersom det kan lösa många problem.
GT-100: Återställning till fabriksinställningar (initialisering)

Vänligen meddela mig hur det går med dessa kontroller.
Med vänliga hälsningar,

Pete

Customer Service

Roland Europe Group Ltd

messages.name: Peter Jowett
messages.msg:
Hej Torkel,

Jag ville kontakta dig angående vårt senaste biljettutbyte, men jag har inte fått något svar från dig än. Kan du låta mig veta om du har några ytterligare supportfrågor eller behöver ytterligare hjälp?

Jag ser fram emot att höra från dig, men observera att det här ärendet kommer att stängas automatiskt om jag inte hör från dig inom de närmaste dagarna. Om du behöver kontakta mig (efter att ärendet har stängts) öppnar du bara ärendet igen så kan vi fortsätta att arbeta tillsammans för att lösa dina supportfrågor.

Allt gott.

Pete

Customer Service

Roland Europe Group Ltd

messages.name: Travis McIntosh
messages.msg:
Hi Jeewon,

Thanks for contacting us!

You don't mention calibrating the VH-14D in the TD-27, so we'd recommend that first.
(Confirm all of the connections are correct prior to calibrating).
TD-27: Calibrating the VH-14D

Next, you'll want to update the VH-14D with version 1.11 if you have not done so already. After updating it, be sure to recalibrate again.
Here is a link to the download and instructions;
https://www.roland.com/us/products/vh-14d/downloads/

We hope this information is helpful. Let us know if you need further assistance.
Thanks for choosing Roland and BOSS products!

Kind regards,
Roland Product Support

messages.msg_o:
my Zenology pro is not showing up imy DAW since I udated it. I am using Reaper. Whatadvice do you have ?
It will certainly be appreciated .
messages.name: Oliver Riley
messages.msg:
my Zenology pro is not showing up imy DAW since I udated it. I am using Reaper. Whatadvice do you have ?
It will certainly be appreciated .

messages.name: Travis Hartnett
messages.msg:
Hello Oliver Riley,

Thanks for contacting us!
Make sure that Reaper is scanning the system VST folders:

**macOS**
/Library/Audio/Plug-Ins/Components
/Library/Audio/Plug-Ins/VST
/Library/Audio/Plug-Ins/VST3
/Library/Application Support/Avid/Audio/Plug-Ins

**Windows**
C:\Program Files\VstPlugins
C:\Program Files\Common Files\VST3
C:\Program Files\Common Files\Avid\Audio\Plug-Ins\Roland\

Please let us know if you have further questions concerning this matter, and thanks for choosing Roland.

Regards,

Travis

messages.name: Jules Richard
messages.msg:
Hi Mauricio,

Thanks for contacting us!

Try this:

Go to Safari > Preferences > Security where you can choose to receive warnings when visiting websites using HTTP instead of HTTPS, which is typically referred to as a "Not Secure Connection Warning" on newer versions of Safari; this setting allows you to enforce secure connections by default.

You’ll see a checkbox for “Non-secure site connections: Warn before connecting to a website over HTTP”

Please uncheck that box. Then restart your computer and that should resolve the issue.

Best regards,

Jules

messages.name: David Marino
messages.msg:
Hello Ian,

Thanks for reaching out and contacting Roland BOSS USA Operational Product Support about the GX-10.
To get connected with your macOS computer and Logic Pro:


1. You'll want to first, download, and install the firmware update on your GX-10:
**GX-10 System Program (Ver. 1.02)**

2. Then download, and install the GX-10 USB device driver for your macOS computer:
**GX-10 Driver Ver.1.0.0 for macOS Ventura 13.x / Sonoma 14.x / Sequoia 15.x**

3. Finally, download, and install the BTS for GX-10 software editor for your macOS computer:
**BOSS TONE STUDIO for GX-10 Ver.1.0.0 for macOS**

Once the updated and USB device driver installed on your macOS computer, Logic Pro, will recognize the GX-10 as a DAW audio input/output interface in Logic Pro System Preferences
Use the GX-10 to connect a guitar/bass to input and record to a Track in your Logic Pro session on an audio track armed and enabled for the same GX-10 Input.
Use headphones, connected to the GX-10 headphones output, to monitor your Logic Pro recording session.

* * *
**First, do a firmware version check on your GX-10:**

**HOW TO KNOW THE VERSION**

Before you start, check the system program version of your GX-10.

1.

Turn on the power.

2.

The version information appears in the lower right corner of the startup display.
If this shows the latest version (Version 1.02 or later), there's no need to update your GX-10.

3.

After verifying the displayed version, turn off the power.


If the firmware update is needed, please have the user use the link to download and follow the Procedure for The Update section.

Review the following instructions for getting your GX-10 updated and connected:

- First download, extract, and install the latest GX-10 firmware update into your GX-10 when connected in "update" mode.
**GX-10 System Program (Ver. 1.02)**

- Once the GX-10 firmware has been update to VERSION 1.02, then install the GX-10 USB Device Driver for specific computer OS and Version.
**=>WINDOWS**
- **GX-10 Driver Ver.1.0.0 for Windows 10/11**

**=>macOS**
- **GX-10 Driver Ver.1.0.0 for macOS Ventura 13.x / Sonoma 14.x / Sequoia 15.x**

- Next download, extract, and install the BTS for GX-10 software editor for your specific computer OS and Version:
**BOSS TONE STUDIO for GX-10 Ver.1.0.0 for Windows**
- **BOSS TONE STUDIO for GX-10 Ver.1.0.0 for macOS**

-

For troubleshooting USB cabling, make sure to use a USB 2.0 A to B printer data cable, and connect to a USB 2.0 A port directly on the computer, or if necessary use a USB 2.0 A adapter or USB HUB with a USB 2.0 A port directly on it. Many newer macOS computers only have USB-C or USB 3.0 A ports, and the USB 3.0 A ports are sometimes not backwards compatible for USB 2.0.
Here are some examples of cabling and hub/adapters:
- USB C - to A Data Type Cable Option

-  USB C - to C Data Type Cable Option 2
- We use a USB-C Totu Adapter for our USB-C only MacBook and works great.
- Similar simple USB-C to USB 2.0 A adapters.

These steps should get the GX-10 firmware updated, USB driver installed for the computer to recognize the hardware, and the BTS for GX-10 software editor installed and connected.

* * *
**PLEASE SEE OUR GX-10 SUPPORT INFO AND WEB LINKS BELOW: **

**GX-10 FEATURES:**
**https://www.boss.info/us/products/gx-10/features/**

**GX-10 SPECS:**
**https://www.boss.info/us/products/gx-10/specifications/**

**GX-10 ACCESSORIES:**
**https://www.boss.info/us/products/gx-10/accessories/**

* * *
**GX-10 DOWNLOADS:**
**https://www.boss.info/us/products/gx-10/downloads/**

**GX-10 FIRMWARE UPDATE:**
**GX-10 System Program (Ver.1.02)**

**GX-10 USB DEVICE DRIVERS (WINDOWS/macOS):**
**=>WINDOWS DRIVERS:**

- **GX-10 Driver Ver.1.0.0 for Windows 10/11**
**=>macOS DRIVERS:**

- **GX-10 Driver Ver.1.0.0 for macOS Ventura 13.x / Sonoma 14.x / Sequoia 15.x**

**BTS for GX-10 SOFTWARE EDITOR (WINDOWS/MACOS):**

- **BOSS TONE STUDIO for GX-10 Ver.1.0.0 for Windows**
- **BOSS TONE STUDIO for GX-10 Ver.1.0.0 for macOS**

**BT/BLUETOOTH MOBILE DEVICE SOFTWARE EDITOR (ANDROID/iOS):**
**Download “BTS for GX-10” for iOS**
**Download “BTS for GX-10” for Android**

**NOTE: BT-DUAL IS** **SOLD SEPARATELY** **AND NECESSARY FOR BT FUNCTIONALITY:**
**https://www.boss.info/us/products/bluetooth_audio_midi_dual_adaptor/**

* * *
**GX-10 SUPPORT DOCUMENTATION**

**GX-10 OWNER'S MANUALS:**

- **[English] GX-10 Startup Guide [PDF]**

- **[English] GX-10 Reference Manual [HTML]**
- **[English] GX-10 Reference Manual [PDF]**

**GX-10 PARAMETER GUIDE:**

- **[English] GX-10 Parameter Guide [HTML]**
- **[English] GX-10 Parameter Guide [PDF]**

**BTS for GX-10 MANUAL GUIDE:**

- **[English] BOSS TONE STUDIO for GX-10 Owner’s Manual [HTML]**
- **[English] BOSS TONE STUDIO for GX-10 (mobile) [HTML]**

**GX-10 BT/BLUETOOTH COMPATIBLE ACCESSORIES:**

- **[English] EV-1-WL Connection Guide (Connect with the GX-10) [PDF]**
- **[English] FS-1-WL Connection Guide (Connect with the GX-10) [PDF]**

**GX-10 MIDI IMPLEMENTATION GUIDE:**

- **[English] GX-100/GX-10 MIDI Implementation [PDF]**

**GX-10 KNOWLEDGE BASE ARTICLES:**
**https://support.roland.com/hc/en-us/search?utf8=%E2%9C%93&query=GX-10**

- **GX-10: Applying Effects to Dry Sound after Recording (Re-amping)**
- **GX-10: What does the USB Computer port allow me to do with the GX-10?**




Kind regards
