messages.name: Austin Sandick
messages.msg:
Hello Michael Panella,
Thanks for reaching out and contacting Roland BOSS USA Operational Product Support about the RC-5.

Sorry to hear you are having issues with your RC-5.
Here are some general suggestions and help to troubleshoot your effect chain/rig setup.
When troubleshooting, simplify and limit your variables.

CONNECTIONS
INPUT: Please check cable INPUT connection to the correct INPUT JACK.
OUTPUT: Please check cable OUTPUT connection to the correct OUTPUT JACK.
OUTPUT should connect to Amp/Monitor INPUT.

PEDAL or MULTI EFFECTS
ON/OFF: Look for CHECK LIGHT On/Off and or foot switchable ON/OFF.
Master Volume: Make sure device MASTER VOLUME is set to 12o'clock or preferred monitoring volume.
Expression Pedal Position for Volume Control-On board Expression Pedals by default may adjust volume, make sure toe down for Maximum.

CABLING
Quality Instrument and Patch Cables: Test and inspect current cables in use for intermittent or low level issues.
Use quality instrument cables to help limit possible RF interference, buzz, hum, grounding issues.
Check cable length, shorter lengths of cable will help provide a healthy, strong instrument signal.
Please use TS 1/4" instrument type male to male cables only.

POWER SUPPLY:
If the device allows for batteries, use Brand New Dry Alkaline Batteries
Check battery power connection leads have not been damaged.
OR
a ROLAND BOSS PSA-120 /PSB-120/PSB-1U ----- POWER SUPPLY.
To help limit ground loop issues, plug amp and pedals or pedal board into the same circuit.

INSTRUMENT:
Volume: Check instrument VOLUME is set to maximum.
Instrument Output Connection: Check the instrument OUTPUT JACK for intermittent signal, grounding or connection issues. Gently jiggle the cable end while the INPUT connected to the Instrument OUTPUT JACK
Battery: Check the internal pre-amp Battery is new and full charge.

If it is possible, you can attempt to perform a factory reset of the RC-5 to remedy the issue.
RC-5: Factory Reset (Initialization)


* * *


Thanks and enjoy your day.
Roland/BOSS Product Support

Roland Service Department

Eric

messages.msg_o:
機器（SDカード挿入済み）をPC（Windows１１）とストレージ接続してアップデートプログラムをSDカードにコピー後、
ドライバーver.1.03からver.1.12へアップデートを試みましたが、update failed !  off,Pull [POWER] と表示されました。
画面指示通り一度電源を切り、再度RECとPOWERを入れアップデートを試みましたが、今度は PROG:-533  ー〉1.12 Update,Push[REC] と表示され指示通り操作しました。やはりupdate failed !  off,Pull [POWER]  と表示されます。
以降機器が起動しなくなってしまいました。
回復するための方法が何かあるでしょうか？
製品名: R-26
シリアル番号: Z1B3055
購入日: 2016-03-30
購入方法: Secondhand
購入店: No Data
messages.name: 丈裕 室園
messages.msg:
Connect the device (with SD card inserted) to a PC (Windows 11) and copy the update program to the SD card.
 I tried to update the driver from ver.1.03 to ver.1.12, but the message "update failed! off,Pull [POWER]" appeared.
 I followed the on-screen instructions to turn off the power, turn on the REC and POWER buttons again, and tried to update, but this time it displayed "PROG:-533 -> 1.12 Update, Push [REC]" and I followed the instructions. But it still displayed "update failed! off, Pull [POWER]".
 After that the device would not start up.
 Is there any way to recover?
 Product name: R-26
 Serial number: Z1B3055
 Purchase date: 2016-03-30
 Purchase Method: Secondhand
 Purchased from: No Data

messages.name: Yasuhiro Ando
messages.msg:
室園様、こんにちは。
お問い合わせをいただきありがとうございます。
R-26のアップデートに失敗してR-26が起動しなくなったとのことでご不便をおかけして申し訳ございません。

R-26 System Program Ver.1.12の「アップデート方法」手順４に記載されている「**REC**ボタンを押しながら電源をオンにする」で、R-26がアップデート待ちの状態で起動できるかどうか、ご確認ください。

もしR-26がアップデート待ちの状態で起動できるのであれば、再アップデートを試してみてください。再アップデート時は以下についてご注意ください。

- 今一度R-26 System Program Ver.1.12に記載されている内容をお読みいただき、内容を十分ご理解の上で再アップデートを実行してください。
- アップデートファイルは、R-26 System Program Ver.1.12のページから改めてダウンロードしてください。
- 可能であれば、前回とは別の方法でZipファイルを展開してみてください。
- アップデートに使用するSDカードは、前回とは別のもの（32GB以下）をご使用ください。
R-26がアップデート待ちの状態でも起動できない場合、または再アップデートを実行しても完了しない、またはアップデートが完了しても状況に変化がない場合は、R-26のシステムが修復不可能な状態に破損していると思われます。ただしR-26はすでに補修用の部品が枯渇しているため、弊社で修理を承ることはできません。あしからずご了承のほどよろしくお願いいたします。

担当：あんどう

messages.msg_o:
あんどう様



返信ありがとうございました。

ご提案の方法を何度か試してみました。

アップデート待ちの状態は現在でもＲＥＣ＋Ｐｏｗｅｒで待ち状態にはなります。

SDカードを変え、ZIPダウンロードしたアップデートプログラムも違うやり方で解凍して、

改めての一回目一瞬completed!!が出ましたがその一瞬後にはupdate feiled!となり、update failed ! off,Pull [POWER]となり一回電源を切りました。

次にREC＋Powerを入れると　PROG:1.12 ー〉1.12update push[REC]と出たのでRECを押してみましたが、update failed ! off,Pull [POWER]となってしまいました。

以降何度アップデートを再試行してもupdate feiled!となってしまいます。

やはり修復不可能ということで理解するしかないようです。

室園丈裕

t.murozono@hotmail.co.jp



* * *
messages.name: 丈裕 室園
messages.msg:
Mr. Ando



 Thank you for your reply.

 I've tried your suggested method several times.

 The update waiting state will still be displayed as waiting in REC+Power.

 I changed the SD card and extracted the ZIP update program in a different way.

 The first time I tried again, it displayed the message ``completed!!'' for a moment, but a moment later it said ``update failed!'', and then ``update failed! off, Pull [POWER]'', so I turned off the power.

 Next, when I pressed REC + Power, the message PROG:1.12 -> 1.12update push[REC] appeared, so I pressed REC, but it said update failed! off,Pull [POWER].

 After that, no matter how many times I try to update again, I get the message "update failed!"

 I guess I have no choice but to accept that it cannot be repaired.

 Takehiro Murozono

 t.murozono@hotmail.co.jp



 * * *

messages.msg_o:
Good afternoon, I purchased my ME-90 in November from Anderton's UK and have been using it professionally every day since with no issue.
Over the last 2 weeks though, in the middle of shows, I experienced a couple of issues.
The first issue was May 31st in the middle of a show, the pedal (which was plugged in with a BOSS power supply) shut itself off randomly and wouldn't come back on until I unplugged the power unit from the strip it was in and into a different one.
So, I thought I was dealing with a dodgy power strip.

On the 7th of this month, however, throughout the duration of a 1.5 hour long show, the pedal was turning itself up in volume randomly, without being touched by me.
Sometimes, if I changed patch the volume was instantly louder than it should have been, other times, I could see the numbers actually changing on the LED screen as the volume increased quickly. At this point, it was plugged in through the same BOSS power supply and, once again, I moved the power supply to a different power strip, but that did not resolve the issue.

What seemed to resolve it in this particular show was turning the machine off, wiggling the output volume knob, the EQ Level knob and the Preamp Level knob, turning the machine back on and resuming the show. I didn't have an issue after that, but then again, only had 3 songs left in the show at that point.

At the hotel the next day before another show, I cleaned the pedal quite well, removing the knob covers and making sure they all turned with no issue.
I also put batteries in the machine and played that night's show with no issues. (I did not plug the machine in through power that night)

This morning, I have updated the machine's firmware.

I have not yet seen the issue return, but then again, its hard to recreate the situation, as I'm not on a big live stage with huge sound and the power supply in my rehearsal room has never given me any issues.

I wondered if you could shed any light on this for me?


Product Name: ME-90
Serial Number: A4Q4456
Purchase Date: 2024-11-24
Purchase Method: Online
Purchase Dealer: Andertons Music (Guildford)

messages.name: Huw Lloyd-Williams
messages.msg:
Hi Erin,

Thank you for getting in touch, sorry to hear about your ME-90!

Your troubleshooting that you've already gone through is most helpful. In all honesty, this sounds as though the unit will require inspecting for any issues.

If you backup your patches and then reset the ME-90 and use the unit for an extended period, does the issue crop up again?

ME-90: Factory Reset (Initialization)

It's not something I've come across before, but there could be a hardware issue if the factory reset post update doesn't alleviate things.

Kind regards,

Huw

Customer Service

Roland Europe Group Ltd

messages.msg_o:

I fear having to send it in for inspection as I have quite a few shows coming up. But, as you say, it might need it in the end.

I'll keep you posted!

messages.msg_o:
Zenology Pro 2.0

Op 19-12-22 heb ik Zenology Pro Analog Icons gekocht (Life Time Key) en onlangs geupdate naar V 2.0. Na het herstarten van het programma in Cubase bemerkte ik dat een aantal Expansions ontbraken (EXZ001 t/m EXZ015 + EXM005 JD-800).  De laatst gekochte Expansions EXZ101 t/m EXZ107 worden WEL in de Tone Browser bijgezet!

De EXZ001-0015 Expansion zijn gratis voor de Fantom 7 (EX) te downloaden en de EXM005 JD-800 heb ik via de EX uitbreiding gekocht en zou volgens de informatie ook in Zenology Pro 2.0 aanwezig moeten zijn.

Wat is de oorzaak van dit probleem en hoe kan ik deze Expansions in Zenology Pro 2.0 krijgen?

Met vriendelijke groeten,

Paul Mentink
messages.name: Paul Mentink
messages.msg:
Zenology Pro 2.0

 On 19-12-22 I bought Zenology Pro Analog Icons (Life Time Key) and recently updated to V 2.0. After restarting the program in Cubase I noticed that a number of Expansions were missing (EXZ001 to EXZ015 + EXM005 JD-800). The last purchased Expansions EXZ101 to EXZ107 ARE added to the Tone Browser!

 The EXZ001-0015 Expansion can be downloaded for free for the Fantom 7 (EX) and I bought the EXM005 JD-800 via the EX expansion and according to the information it should also be present in Zenology Pro 2.0.

 What is the cause of this problem and how can I get these Expansions in Zenology Pro 2.0?

 Kind regards,

 Paul Mentink

messages.name: Travis Hartnett
messages.msg:
Hello Paul Mentink,

Thanks for contacting us!
Do they show as "installed" in Roland Cloud Manager?

Please let us know if you have further questions concerning this matter, and thanks for choosing Roland.

Regards,

Travis

messages.msg_o:

    I checked this in the Roland Cloud Manager - Software Instruments - Zenology - My Library.

    The JD-800 Model Expansion and the Wave Expansions EXZ001 to EXZ015 have expired. This has to do with a 2022 free year membership. After the last Update, these suddenly disappeared in the Tone List of Zenology Pro 2.0.



    All Model Expansions, including the JD-800, were purchased together. Normaly, buyed Expansions will always added to the list. Only the JD-800 is not listed in the Tone list of Zenology Pro 2.0.



    The EXZ Wave Expansions are free but are also not listed in Zenology Pro 2.0.



    What is going on and how can I solve this?



    Regards,



    Paul Mentink

Meu piano comprado em dezembro de 2020 apresentou defeito este ano (maio de 2025). Na assistência técnica HTEC natal RN, após avaliação informaram.que precisava trocar a placa principal. Mas que a garantia da placa é de apenas 3 meses. Esta informação procede? Como o orçamento equivale a quase 1/3 do valor que comprei o piano não sei se vale a pena o reparo. Fiquei de fato decepcionada pois achei que a durabilidade de um piano da marca Roland era maior. Por isso não comprei outras marcas mais baratas na época. Uso apenas em minha casa. Resolvi aprender a tocar depois que me aposentei. Tenho aulas semanais online e pratico em torno de 4 vezes por semana. Mantenho ele sempre coberto pra não pegar poeira. Ou seja uso pouco e com cuidado.

Agradeço desde já a atenção 

Saudações
Dione

messages.name: Dione Valença
messages.msg:
My piano, purchased in December 2020, developed a defect this year (May 2025). After an evaluation at the HTEC Natal RN technical assistance center, they informed me that the main board needed to be replaced. However, the warranty for the board is only 3 months. Is this information correct? Since the quote is almost 1/3 of the price I paid for the piano, I don't know if it's worth the repair. I was really disappointed because I thought that a Roland piano would last longer. That's why I didn't buy other cheaper brands at the time. I only use it at home. I decided to learn to play after I retired. I have weekly online lessons and practice around 4 times a week. I always keep it covered so that it doesn't get dusty. In other words, I use it sparingly and carefully.

messages.msg_o:
Hello!
The Boss IR-2 has been great on the past 15 gigs or so. Only on one occasion (at a gig) did it behave strangely with the green led flashing (maybe 1/sec) and stuck in bypass. The unit was unresponsive to any reset attempts etc. It finally worked again on a random power cycle after trying multiple other power cycle and reset routes. 
The unit worked fine for a few gigs after that so I thought it was a fluke until a showed up at a show two weeks ago and it was immediately back into the same behavior - green led flashing and completely unresponsive to any reset attempts. I ended up using the back line HX Stomp to do the show . I took the IR-2 home and went thru the manual again, trying every reset method, tried connecting it to the PC, etc. It is stuck in bypass mode with flashing green led. 
As a side bit the behavior was also strange when it connected to the PC, as now it isn’t recognized by the IR-2 Loader software but instead shows up as an empty memory drive (never did that before). Please help!
Product Name: IR-2
Serial Number: A5R5261
Purchase Date: 2025-01-01
Purchase Method: Online
Purchase Dealer: SWEETWATER SOUND INC

messages.msg_o: Zenology Liteを使用したいのですが、Zenology Proの方が毎回一緒にダウンロードされてしまって、ZenologyがDemoの状態になってしまいます。
messages.name: 叶夢 加藤
messages.msg: I would like to use Zenology Lite, but Zenology Pro is always downloaded along with it, so Zenology remains in Demo mode.

messages.name: Travis Hartnett
messages.msg:
Please could someone on the team please provide support for this customer in Japanese?

Thank you,

Travis

* * *
Hi 叶夢 加藤,

We're sorry to hear you're having this issue.

Try these steps.
If you've already done one of the steps, just move on to the next one.
Please be sure that you've done all of the steps.

1. Make sure that you have **v3.1.16 **of Roland Cloud Manager installed.
2. In the Library of Cloud Manager, update any plug-ins that show an available update.
3. Clear your browser cache.
4. **Restart your computer. If you're on a Mac, make sure that the "reopen windows" isn't selected**
5. Launch Roland Cloud Manager
6. Start your DAW. <--very important!

messages.name: 亮太 齊藤
messages.msg:
加藤さま、こんにちは。

日頃は Roland Cloud のご利用ありがとうございます。

このたびは Zenology がデモモードになってしまうとのことですね。

お手数ですが、まずは以下の作業をお試しいただき改善が見られるかご確認いただけますでしょうか。


1. Roland Cloud Managerが最新バージョン（v3.1.16）であることを確認する。
2. Roland Cloud Managerのマイライブラリにてアップデート可能なプラグインをアップデートする。
3. お使いのブラウザのキャッシュを削除する。
4. コンピューターを再起動する。
※もしMacコンピューターをお使いの場合は「再ログイン時にウインドウを再度開く」の選択は解除してください。
5. Roland Cloud Managerを起動する。
6. DAWを起動してオーソライズを行います。

お手数をおかけしますが、なにとぞよろしくお願いいたします。

担当：齊藤

messages.msg:
Hello Nicholas,


Thanks for reaching out and contacting Roland BOSS USA Operational Product Support about the KATANA GEN 3 amp.
Sorry you're having issues with your KATANA Gen 3 amp and connectivity with BTS for KATANA GEN 3 software editor and computer.

Please have the following gear at the ready:
- KATANA Gen 3 amp.
- USB A to C Data cable.
- Windows/macOS desktop/laptop computer with inter web access and USB A or C port.


Please review, execute and complete the following steps:
- Download the KATANA Gen 3 latest firmware System Program Update Version X.XX and install it manually into your amp.
- Download and install the KATANA USB Driver for your specific computer OS Version for Windows/macOS.
- Download and install the BOSS TONE STUDIO for KATANA Gen 3 Version X.X.X software editor application for your specific computer OS and Version.


* * *
**PLEASE COMPLETE THE FOLLOWING STEPS FOR THE KATANA GEN 3 TO SYNC WITH BOSS TONE STUDIO FOR KATANA GEN 3 SOFTWARE EDITOR AND COMPUTER:**


**1. Download and install the latest SYSTEM PROGRAM VERSION UPDATE amp firmware:**
**KATANA GEN 3 System Program (Ver. 1.07)**
**Review "How To Tell Version" and "Procedure for Update" instructions in webpage link also see below.**

* * *
**2. Download and install the USB Device Driver for your specific computer OS and Version:**
**https://www.boss.info/global/products/katana-100_gen_3/downloads/**


**=>WINDOWS DRIVERS**
**- ****KATANA3 Driver Ver.1.0.0 for Windows 10/11**
**(WINDOWS 10/11 USES AN AUTO DRIVER DOWNLOAD AND INSTALL PROTOCOL. MAKE SURE KATANA IS UPDATED TO THE LATEST SYSTEM PROGRAM FIRMWARE FOR THE WINDOWS AUTOMATED DRIVER INSTALLATION, IF AUTO INSTALLATION DOESN'T WORK, DOWNLOAD AND INSTALL THE DRIVER MANUALLY).**
**- ****What to Do If the Driver for Windows(R) 10 Is Not Automatically Installed**

**=>macOS DRIVERS**
**- ****KATANA3 Driver Ver.1.0.0 for macOS Big Sur 11.x / Monterey 12.x /Ventura 13.x /Sonoma 14.x / Sequoia 15.x**
**Compatible with Apple Mac series (Intel-based).**
**Compatible with Apple Silicon Mac (using the M1 chip).**


_**MAKE SURE TO ADJUST MAC SECURITY & PRIVACY SETTINGS AND "ALLOW" FOR THE DRIVER INSTALLATION AND FUNCTIONALITY. REVIEW TROUBLESHOOTING FOR SPECIFIC OS AND VERSION:**_
_**macOS Catalina (macOS 10.15) Driver Installation and Troubleshooting**_
_**macOS Mojave (macOS 10.14) Driver Installation and Troubleshooting**_
_**macOS High Sierra (macOS 10.13) Driver Installation and Troubleshooting**_



* * *
**3. DOWNLOAD AND INSTALL BOSS TONE STUDIOS FOR KATANA SOFTWARE EDITOR FOR YOUR COMPUTER OS:**

**- ****BOSS TONE STUDIO for KATANA GEN 3 Ver.1.1.0 for Windows**
**- ****BOSS TONE STUDIO for KATANA GEN 3 Ver.1.1.0 for macOS**

**THIS SHOULD ALLOW FOR YOUR KATANA GEN 3 TO SYNC WITH YOUR COMPUTER AND BOSS TONE STUDIOS.**


* * *
**KATANA-50 GEN3 SUPPORT DOCUMENTATION:**
**https://www.boss.info/global/products/katana-50_gen_3/support/**

**CONNECTING THE BOSS TONE STUDIO FOR KATANA GEN3 IOS APP TO THE KATANA UNIT [PDF]**
**CONNECTING THE BOSS TONE STUDIO FOR KATANA GEN3 ANDROID APP TO THE KATANA UNIT [PDF]**

* * *

Here are some quick tips for troubleshooting USB connectivity with your Roland/BOSS devices.

**USB CONNECTIVITY TROUBLESHOOTING:**

1. If your Roland BOSS device connects to a desktop computer via USB, it’s very important to try and connect to a dedicated USB 2.0 A female type port directly on the computer.
Often times, USB ports on the front of computers and those on monitors and QWERTY keyboards are considered hubs, and are not recommended for proper Roland BOSS device USB connectivity.
However, some newer computers only have USB 3.0 or USB-C ports available, in which case a USB hub adapter may be necessary. We test and use the following USB hub adapter, and it provides multiple USB connectivity options, most importantly the USB 2.0 A port option.

2. (USB C - to A Data Type Cable Option)
(USB C - to C Data Type Cable Option 2)
For example, used with: Katana Gen 3, Katana:GO and IR-2.

Note: Not all USB cables are the same, some are for charging only and not for data.
If necessary, when troubleshooting connectivity, try some alternate USB or USB-C type USB cables and try some alternate USB A compatible ports on computer or USB hub.

3. If you have any onboard computer 3rd party security software running, please disable/disarm them temporarily while attempting to connect your Roland BOSS device along with software editor applications.
Also, temporarily disconnect any 3rd party USB interfaces or devices that may impede your Roland BOSS device connectivity.

Visual images of USB type connections for proper cable identification:

 ![](https://rolandus.zendesk.com/attachments/token/IubCIzk0lsWmBALEPnFHQ43nh/?name=inline-1581383714.png)


* * *

Thanks and enjoy your day.
Roland/BOSS Product Support

messages.name: Austin Sandick
messages.msg:
Hello Nicholas,

Thanks for reaching out and contacting Roland BOSS USA Operational Product Support about the KATANA-Artist (KTN-ARTIST).

Unfortunately, we only provide Roland BOSS Backstage email support here, we no longer provide telephone support.
We only provide general device support, we do not provide computer literacy training, music device training, or audio flow effect chain or MIDI event chain consultation.

Any new device/electronic typically may need a firmware update when it is received by the end user, for example: mobile device/smartphone, smart TV, computers, most electronic music gear with firmware.
In some circumstances, it may take six months to a year plus for a product to reach the end users from overseas production facility > shipped to dealer > then available via retail with the dealer, which may take some time before it's sold to the end user. Once the user receives the new electronic device, it's the responsibility of the user to check for the latest firmware updates, and manually update the firmware of their new device to the latest firmware version.

Is there a specific step in the updatew process or connection process that we can help you with first? This can help remedy the connection issues you're having.

Please download and update your amp to the latest version.
**KATANA GEN 3 System Program (Ver. 1.07)**
**Review "How To Tell Version" and "Procedure for Update" instructions in webpage link also see below.**


* * *


Thanks and enjoy your day.
Roland/BOSS Product Support

messages.name: Austin Sandick
messages.msg:
Hello Jeremy Smith,

Thanks for reaching out and contacting Roland BOSS USA Operational Product Support about the RC-500. Sorry to hear you're having issues with your RC-500.
If it's a brand-new BOSS stompbox, twin pedal, 200/500 series pedal or pedalboard please start troubleshooting the issue using the following info below.

Please troubleshoot and test your BOSS compact pedal with the Manufacturer Recommended Power Supplies:

- Test using brand-new quality brand dry alkaline 9V battery (for stompbox), AA batteries (for 200/500 series) or alternative power supplies: either a Roland BOSS PSA-120S 500mA 9V or the larger Roland BOSS PSB-120/1U 2000mA 9V power supply.

Unfortunately we can't guarantee 3rd party other brand power supplies will provide proper functionality and performance.
For dealer retail power supply reference, see the following link examples here:
**https://www.sweetwater.com/store/detail/PSA120S--roland-psa-120s-power-supply**
**https://www.sweetwater.com/store/detail/PSB120--roland-psb-120-ac-adapter**

- Test and check all cabling 1/4" TS Mono guitar/instrument cables and all input/output audio and power connections for proper connection and audio/power signal transfer.

- Connect 1/4" TS mono instrument guitar cable to INPUT/OUTPUT for pedal power ON.
(NOTE: For RC LOOPERS: Connect to OUTPUT A for power ON).
**BIC 1/4" TS mono instrument guitar cable examples here:** **https://www.boss.info/us/search/?q=BIC**
TS = TIP SLEEVE (UNBALANCED) _***Use this type of cable for audio input/output connections, see image below.**_
TRS = TIP RING SLEEVE (STEREO/BALANCED) *Do not use 1/4" TRS stereo cables for audio connections unless for headphones connection to a dedicated headphone jack for audio line level signal.
TRRS = TIP RING RING SLEEVE (STEREO LINE LEVEL WITH MIC/MOBILE DEVICE).
 ![](https://rolandus.zendesk.com/attachments/token/uDQRgtwMWKdTbpBwFYntcI8OF/?name=inline1957521896.jpeg)

- Review the BOSS pedal included Owner's Manual for functionality and how to use the pedal or go online for the Owner's Manual PDF downloadable, search alphabetically by device model/name:
**https://www.boss.info/us/support/owners_manuals/**

- If the pedal is still malfunctioning, then we suggest exchanging with your point of purchase for a new product under the typical 30-day Dealer Warranty, and inform the dealer/sales tech, of any product issues, and arrange an exchange for a new properly functioning new device.

- If outside the dealer warranty terms, and manufacturer warranty service repair is necessary, you may choose to submit a Service Repair Request to our Roland BOSS Factory Service Department in Los Angeles, CA.

- *All BOSS stomp box compact and twin pedals are Manufacturer Warrantied for 5 Years, from the date of purchase, for the original user, and non-transferable.

- *All Roland BOSS "stage amps" are Manufacturer Warrantied for 3 Years, from the date of purchase, for the original user and non-transferable.

- *All BOSS 200/500 series pedals, amps and pedalboards are Manufacturer Warrantied for 2 Years, from the date of purchase, for the original user and non-transferable. This may also include, other BOSS pedals, pedalboards, amps, devices and accessories.

I paid $140 for the Katana GO and now I'm asked to pay another $15 for Katana Librarian to simply import .tsl files?  Unacceptable. This software is clunky at best, disconnects too often, and there are far fewer patches available than Positive Grid (which is FREE, has a super slick interface, and never seems to disconnect).  

For a company that deals in tones, you seem tone deaf to the industry and your customer base.  I'm returning this device and will avoid BOSS products in the future.

Jack Thomas

messages.name: David Marino
messages.msg:
Hello Jack,

Thanks for reaching out and contacting Roland BOSS USA Operational Product Support about the KATANA:GO / KATANA LIBRARIAN.
Sorry for any confusion or frustration on the matter.
However, the KATANA LIBRARIAN software is made by a 3rd party developer and not associated to Roland BOSS Corp.
Unfortunately, we are not able to provide support or assistance with 3rd party other brand products, apps, or software.

The following mobile device software editor is provided free to KATANA:GO users and public below:
**DOWNLOAD THE BOSS TONE STUDIO APP FOR IOS/ANDROID MOBILE DEVICE: **
**iOS USERS:**
**Download “BOSS TONE STUDIO for KATANA:GO“ for iOS**
**ANDROID USERS:**
**Download “BOSS TONE STUDIO for KATANA:GO“ for Android**

**We suggest using the provided free software editor instead of the KATANA LIBRARIAN 3rd party developer app.**

**Make sure to update the KATANA:GO firmware to the latest version, if not already updated:**
**KATANA:GO FIRMWARE UPDATE:**
**KATANA:GO System Program ( Ver.1.04 )**


* * *
**PLEASE SEE OUR KATANA:GO SUPPORT WEB LINKS BELOW:**

**KATANA:GO FEATURES:**
**https://www.boss.info/us/products/katana-go/features/**

**KATANA:GO SPECS:**
**https://www.boss.info/us/products/katana-go/specifications/**

**KATANA:GO ARTICLES:**
**https://www.boss.info/us/products/katana-go/articles/**

**KATANA:GO ACCESSORIES:**
**https://www.boss.info/us/products/katana-go/accessories/**

* * *
**KATANA:GO DOWNLOADS:**
**https://www.boss.info/us/products/katana-go/downloads/**

**KATANA:GO FIRMWARE UPDATE:**
**KATANA:GO System Program ( Ver.1.04 )**

* * *
**DOWNLOAD THE BOSS TONE STUDIO APP FOR IOS/ANDROID MOBILE DEVICE: **

**iOS USERS:**
**Download “BOSS TONE STUDIO for KATANA:GO“ for iOS**

**ANDROID USERS:**
**Download “BOSS TONE STUDIO for KATANA:GO“ for Android**

* * *
**KATANA:GO SUPPORT:**
**https://www.boss.info/us/products/katana-go/support/**


#### **OWNER’S MANUALS:**

- **[8 Languages] KATANA:GO Quick Start [PDF]**
- **[English] KATANA:GO Owner's Manual [HTML]**
- **[English] KATANA:GO Owner's Manual [PDF****]**
- **[English] KATANA:GO Parameter Guide [PDF]**

- **[English] About the external design of the KATANA:GO [HTML]**
- **[English] About the external design of the KATANA:GO [PDF]**

- **[English] Using BOSS TONE STUDIO for KATANA:GO/EV-1-WL, FS-1-WL Connection Guide [PDF]**

- **[English] Connecting the BOSS TONE STUDIO iOS App to the KATANA:GO Unit [PDF]**
- **[English] Connecting the BOSS TONE STUDIO Android App to the KATANA:GO Unit [PDF]**

**KNOWLEDGE BASE ARTICLES:**

- **KATANA:GO: How do I charge the unit?**
- **KATANA:GO: How many hours can I continue to use the unit on the rechargeable lithium-ion battery power?**
- **KATANA:GO: What you can do with BOSS TONE STUDIO for KATANA:GO**
- **KATANA:GO : Can I connect the EV-1-WL and FS-1-WL, BT foot controls simultaneously?**
- **KATANA:GO: Is it possible to replace the internal lithium-ion battery myself?**
- **KATANA:GO: Can I use it while charging?**
- **KATANA:GO: Factory Reset**
- **KATANA:GO Why are there no ASIO drivers available?**
- **KATANA:GO: Is a dedicated carrying case available?**
- **KATANA:GO: Can it be used for a bass guitar?**
- **KATANA:GO: How do I edit the effects?**
- **KATANA:GO: When I left the unit for a while, a dot moving along the screen edge appeared instead of characters: Is this a malfunction?**
- **KATANA:GO: Can I turn off the screen saver?**
- **KATANA:GO: What type of USB cable can I use for USB audio functionality?**
- **KATANA:GO: How do I perform the guitar along with songs playing on my mobile device?**
- **KATANA:GO: Can I connect the unit to my computer via Bluetooth?**
- **KATANA:GO: "KATANA:GO AUDIO" does not appear on the Bluetooth settings screen of my mobile device.**
- **KATANA:GO: Livesets you can download at BOSS TONE EXCHANGE for the KATANA:GO**

* * *
**BT-DUAL CONNECTIVITY AND TROUBLESHOOTING**

There are two BT/BLUE TOOTH connections to establish with the KATANA:GO:

1.

BT-AUDIO : Connect with KATANA:GO AUDIO connection using your mobile device BT system settings, and pair with the KATANA:GO BT AUDIO connection.

Simply press hold the BT button on the KATANA:GO for 2 seconds, then release, this should enable BT pairing and detection for the KATANA:GO AUDIO BT connection.

2. BT-MIDI : Connect with KATANA:GO MIDI connection using your mobile device and the BTS for KATANA:GO mobile app, Step 2 when you open the app should prompt you to connect, with the KATANA:GO MIDI, and pair.

* * *
First deactivate any other BT connections for your mobile device.
Deactivate any BT devices in your environment, this includes other mobile devices, computer, smart TVs, etc.
Sometimes the connection will connect or go elsewhere, thus appearing as if the selection is not available.

Try removing the BTS for KATANA:GO app, then reinstall the app.
Then power on the KATANA:GO > open the BTS app > choose CONNECT > if the KATANA:GO MIDI doesn't appear, try rescanning, if KATANA:GO MIDI is not detected, try pressing the BT pairing button off/on for the KATANA:GO, and then rescan again, once the KATANA:GO MIDI connection appears and select it, go back to the first app page, and confirm or OK the connection.

If connecting with KATANA:GO BT AUDIO connection, then press hold the BT pairing button for 2 seconds, this should make the audio connection available.




Kind regards

messages.name: David Marino
messages.msg:
Hello Jack,

On the BTS for KATANA:GO mobile app, you can IMPORT the downloaded .TSL/Tone Studio LIVESET.
Simply download the .TSL file of patches, either from the BTX/BOSS TONE EXCHANGE website, or use the TONE EXCHANGE integrated tab (login with BOSS Backstage credentials), then in the BTS LIBRARIAN section, use the Down Arrow IMPORT button, navigate to the .TSL file and import it into the LIBRARIAN if the .TSL was downloaded to your mobile device. If you simply use, the integrated TONE EXCHANGE tab, in the BTS software editor, you can log in, then navigate to a user PATCH/LIVESET, and simply click the Download button, and this will automatically download the .TSL LIVESET of patches into the BTS LIBRARIAN and is available to use.
Then you can test audition the patch and load it into a USER PATCH location on your KATANA:GO device.

Please review the documentation for how to use the BTS for KATANA:GO software editor, see page 24 or use Table of Contents to navigate to a specific section if using the PDF.

-

[English] Using BOSS TONE STUDIO for KATANA:GO/EV-1-WL, FS-1-WL Connection Guide [PDF]

Kind regards

messages.name: David Marino
messages.msg:
Hi Jack,

Another point to note, .TSL LIVESETS and patches only work for the devices that they were designed for.
So only KATANA:GO .TSL and patches will work for your device, and other KATANA GEN3 or GT-1000 .TSL LIVESETS will NOT be compatible for usage.
This is because the devices each have different firmware and engineering, so the patches are not device cross compatible.


Kind regards

Hello Roy,

Thanks for reaching out and contacting Roland BOSS USA Operational Product Support about the GM-800.
After updating the firmware of the GM-800, please do a Factory Reset, to reset the unit back to default settings for the latest firmware update you just installed.
This may remedy any data skew or glitchy behavior in firmware and properly align it back to the firmware defaults.
GM-800 : Factory Reset (Initialization) Instructions

Q: Are you using the GK-5 pickup connected with a BGK cable to the GK INPUT of the GM-800?

If you've confirmed there's a device malfunction or issue, and it's not cabling, input/output connections or settings.
You may submit a Service Repair Request here, and our service center techs will be able to evaluate the unit to see if the issue is covered for service/repair/replacement, under warranty terms.
https://www.boss.info/backstage/support#service_request
However, we suggest, troubleshooting first before sending your new GM-800 for service and evaluation.

Kind regards

messages.name: Daniel Stegmann
messages.msg:
Hallo Herr Korner,

vielen Dank für Ihre Anfrage.

Für die Verbindung Ihres BOSS Katana-100 Gen 3 Verstärkers mit dem Computer zur Nutzung von BOSS TONE STUDIO benötigen Sie ein USB-C-Kabel, das Datenübertragung unterstützt (nicht nur zum Laden geeignet ist). Wichtig ist außerdem, dass das andere Kabelende zu Ihrem Computeranschluss passt – in der Regel ist das entweder USB-A (klassischer USB-Anschluss) oder ebenfalls USB-C, je nach Modell Ihres PCs oder Laptops.

Beispiel:

- Wenn Ihr Computer einen klassischen USB-Anschluss hat, benötigen Sie ein USB-C auf USB-A-Kabel (mit Datenübertragung).
- Wenn Ihr Computer über einen USB-C-Anschluss verfügt, können Sie ein USB-C auf USB-C-Kabel verwenden (ebenfalls mit Datenübertragung).

Bitte achten Sie beim Kauf darauf, dass das Kabel ausdrücklich für Datenübertragung geeignet ist, da einige USB-C-Kabel nur für das Laden von Geräten ausgelegt sind und in diesem Fall nicht funktionieren würden.

Bei weiteren Fragen helfen wir Ihnen gerne weiter!

Mit freundlichen Grüßen

Daniel
Roland Customer Support

Heute mal eine technisch-organisatorische Frage im Zusammenhang mit dem Looper (RC 500), dem Katana 100 und der Software Tone Studio:



Organisatorisch:

A) Ist es möglich von einem Song (z.B. Honky Tonk Woman) nur eine bestimmte Tonspur einzeln herauszufiltern – z.B. nur die Drums?

B) Muss ich dafür den Originalsong kaufen? Wo?

C) Braucht es dazu eine spezielle Software um Tonspuren einzeln herausfiltern zu können? Name?



Technisch:

Falls das klappt, kann ich dann diese eine Tonspur (z.B. Drums) auf den Looper laden? (via Ton Studio)?

Und die letzte Frage: Was für ein USB-Kabel brauche ich, um den Looper an den PC anzuschliessen.



Anmerkung zur Weitergabe an die Entwicklungsabteilung:

Ich staune, und kann echt nicht nachvollziehen, warum der Looper und der Katana unterschiedliche USB-Anschlüsse haben?



Ich bedanke mich im Voraus für die kompetenten Antworten.

Mit besten Grüssen

Peter Korner
messages.name: Peter Korner
messages.msg:
Good day

 Today I have a technical and organizational question related to the Looper (RC 500), the Katana 100 and the Tone Studio software:



 Organizational:

 A) Is it possible to filter out only a specific track from a song (e.g. Honky Tonk Woman) – e.g. only the drums?

 B) Do I have to buy the original song? Where?

 C) Is special software required to filter out individual audio tracks? Name?



 Technically:

 If that works, can I then load this one audio track (e.g. drums) onto the looper? (via Ton Studio)?

 And the last question: What kind of USB cable do I need to connect the looper to the PC.



 Note for forwarding to the development department:

 I'm amazed and really can't understand why the Looper and the Katana have different USB ports?



 Thank you in advance for your competent answers.

 Best regards

 Peter Korner

messages.name: Daniel Stegmann
messages.msg:
Guten Tag Herr Korner,

vielen Dank für Ihre Anfrage und Ihre Fragen zum Zusammenspiel von Looper, Katana und Tone Studio.

A) Unsere Geräte und Software bieten keine Funktion zum Herausfiltern einzelner Tonspuren (z. B. nur Drums) aus einem kompletten Song.

B) Wenn Sie mit einzelnen Spuren arbeiten möchten, benötigen Sie entweder sogenannte "Stems" (also separat vorliegende Spuren) – diese sind teilweise käuflich auf Musikplattformen erhältlich – oder Sie nutzen eine Drittanbieter-Software, die Tonspuren mithilfe von KI trennt.

C) Ein Beispiel für solche Software ist Moises (www.moises.ai). Dort können Sie einen Song hochladen und anschließend z. B. nur die Drumspur extrahieren.

Falls Sie die gewünschte Spur als WAV-Datei vorliegen haben, können Sie diese mit dem Tone Studio auf den RC-500 Looper übertragen.

Zum Anschluss an den PC benötigen Sie für den RC-500 ein USB-B auf USB-A Kabel (klassisches USB-Druckerkabel). Beim Katana ist es, wie besprochen, ein USB-C-Kabel.

Anmerkung zur unterschiedlichen USB-Buchse:

Sie haben absolut recht – die unterschiedlichen Anschlüsse resultieren schlicht daraus, dass die beiden Geräte in unterschiedlichen Entwicklungszeiträumen entstanden sind. Zukünftige Produkte – auch bei uns – werden immer häufiger mit USB-C ausgestattet sein, da dies mittlerweile der Standard ist.

Vielen Dank noch einmal für Ihr Feedback!

Mit freundlichen Grüßen

Daniel
Roland Customer Support

messages.name: Daniel Stegmann
messages.msg:
Guten Tag Herr Korner,

vielen Dank für Ihre Nachricht - und ein wichtiger Hinweis vorab:

Der Katana-100 Gen3 verfügt nicht über einen USB-B-Anschluss, sondern über einen USB-C-Anschluss.
Das bedeutet: Für die Verbindung mit Ihrem MacBook Air, das ebenfalls über USB-C verfügt, benötigen Sie ein USB-C auf USB-C-Kabel, das Datenübertragung unterstützt.

Wir können Ihnen folgende Modelle empfehlen, mit denen unsere Kunden sehr gute Erfahrungen gemacht haben:

**1. Chroma Cable USB-C/C 1,5 m**
• Entwickelt speziell für die Verbindung von Musikgeräten

**2. Anker USB-C to USB-C 2.0 Cable (Type C)**
• Robustes, zuverlässiges Datenkabel

Achten Sie beim Kauf immer darauf, dass es sich nicht um ein reines Ladekabel handelt, sondern um eines mit Datenübertragung.

Bei weiteren Fragen helfen wir Ihnen gerne weiter.

Mit freundlichen Grüßen

Daniel
Roland Customer Support

messages.name: Daniel Stegmann
messages.msg:
Guten Tag Herr Korner,

vielen Dank für Ihre Rückmeldung und die Informationen zur WAV-Datei.

Die Fehlermeldung „unsupported file“ deutet darauf hin, dass die Datei vom RC-500 nicht erkannt wird, weil sie nicht dem unterstützten Format entspricht oder der Dateiname ungeeignet ist.

Bitte achten Sie auf folgende Punkte:

1. **Dateiformat**
Die Datei muss im Format **WAV** vorliegen, mit folgenden Spezifikationen:

- **16 Bit / 24 Bit / 32 Bit (Float)**
- **44,1 kHz Abtastrate**
- **Linear PCM**
- **Stereo**

1. **Dateiname**
Der Dateiname darf **keine Sonderzeichen oder Klammern** enthalten und sollte **möglichst kurz** sein.
Beispiel: drumsbacking.wav

Bitte probieren Sie das aus und geben Sie uns Bescheid, falls es weiterhin Probleme gibt.

Mit freundlichen Grüßen

Daniel
Roland Customer Support

Auf ein Neues, danke!



Danke für Ihre Kontaktaufnahme.

Der lange Dateiname, den Sie sehen, ist ein Standardformat, das von Moises verwendet wird, um Details zum Titel wie Titel, Tonart, Tempo und weitere Informationen anzugeben.

Um dieses Problem zu beheben, können Sie die Datei nach dem Export einfach umbenennen. So geht's:


1. **Datei suchen:** Suchen Sie die exportierte WAV-Datei auf Ihrem Computer.
2. **Rechtsklick (bzw. Strg-Klick auf dem Mac):** Wählen Sie die Option zum Umbenennen der Datei.
3. **Neuen Namen eingeben:** Wählen Sie einen kürzeren und einfacheren Namen für die Datei.
4. **Änderungen speichern:** Stellen Sie sicher, dass die Dateierweiterung (.wav) unverändert bleibt, da dies für die ordnungsgemäße Funktion der Datei erforderlich ist.


Nach dem Umbenennen sollte Ihr Looper die Datei erkennen und Sie sie über Ihren Verstärker abspielen können.

Sagen Sie mir Bescheid, wenn Sie weitere Hilfe benötigen!

best,

Mari
messages.name: Peter Korner
messages.msg:
I'm happy to do that.

 Below is the answer from _moises_'s support team regarding their file:

 I've already tried that, but it doesn't work either - unfortunately...

 Here's to another one, thank you!



 Thank you for contacting us.

 The long filename you see is a standard format used by Moises to specify details about the track such as title, key, tempo, and other information.

 To resolve this issue, you can simply rename the file after exporting. Here's how:


 1. **Browse File:** Locate the exported WAV file on your computer.
 2. **Right-click (or Ctrl-click on Mac):** Select the option to rename the file.
 3. **Enter new name:** Choose a shorter and simpler name for the file.
 4. **Save changes:** Make sure the file extension (.wav) remains unchanged, as this is required for the file to function properly.


 After renaming, your looper should recognize the file and you should be able to play it through your amplifier.

 Let me know if you need further help!

 best,

 Mari

messages.name: Daniel Stegmann
messages.msg:
Guten Tag Herr Korner,

vielen Dank für die Übermittlung der Datei und die ergänzenden Informationen.

Falls die direkte Kopiervariante auf den RC-500 nicht zum gewünschten Ergebnis führt, empfehlen wir Ihnen, die Datei mit der Software BOSS TONE STUDIO for RC zu importieren. Diese Anwendung konvertiert WAV-Dateien automatisch in das richtige Format, sodass der RC-500 sie problemlos erkennt und abspielen kann.

Sie können die Software hier herunterladen:
https://www.boss.info/de/products/rc-500/downloads/

Bitte installieren Sie die Software, verbinden Sie den RC-500 mit dem Computer und nutzen Sie dann die Importfunktion innerhalb des Programms, um Ihre Audiodatei auf das Gerät zu übertragen.

Geben Sie uns gerne Bescheid, wenn es dabei noch Fragen gibt.

Mit freundlichen Grüßen

Daniel
Roland Customer Support

messages.msg_o:
Es ist Weihnachten – Jiiiipi! Es läuft. Herzlichen Dank.

Ihr Tipp war ein Volltreffer!!!



Ihre nachfolgende Empfehlung vom 11. Juni:



Zu Ihrer aktuellen Frage:
ausführliche Anleitung dazu finden Sie auf folgender Support-Seite von Roland:Die WAV-Datei, die Sie als Begleitung nutzen möchten, können Sie ganz einfach auch ohne BOSS TONE STUDIO auf den RC-500 übertragen. Eine

…war wohl so nicht ganz korrekt, BOSS TONE STUDIO braucht es zwar nicht, aber offenbar ist **BOSS TONE STUDIO for RC** absolut zwingend, (jedenfalls in meinem Fall) sonst klappt das nicht.

Einfach auch für Sie als Feedback, sollten User-Fragen in dieser Richtung auf Sie zukommen….

Peter Korner
messages.name: Peter Korner
messages.msg:
It's Christmas – yippee! It's working. Thank you so much.

 Your tip was spot on!!!



 Their following recommendation from June 11:



 Regarding your current question:
 Detailed instructions can be found on the following Roland support page:You can easily transfer the WAV file you want to use as accompaniment to the RC-500 without BOSS TONE STUDIO.

messages.msg_o:
…. zum Abschluss noch ein Allerletztes, dann sind sich mich endgültig los.



Am 11. Juni schrieben Sie:

Zur Verbindung mit dem Katana:
Sie können einfach OUTPUT A des RC-500 mit dem POWER AMP IN des Katana-100 verbinden. Auf diese Weise umgehen Sie die Vorstufe des Verstärkers, und das Signal wird direkt und unverfälscht wiedergegeben – ideal für Playback-Spuren.



…das funktioniert zwar, allerdings ist die Tonqualität der Playback Spur dann absolut schlecht, eigentlich unbrauchbar.



Wenn ich den Looper allerdings via **EFFECT LOOP RETURN** anschliesse (siehe IMG) – ist die Tonqualität absolut perfekt!

Das Blöde ist nur, dass ich dann die Gitarre, via Katana, nicht mehr hören kann. Häää!?



Ist es wirklich so, dass ich nur via POWER AMP IN, Playback-Spuren abspielen, resp. via Looper begleiten kann?



Danke sehr für eine letzte (hoffentlich positive) Antwort.



Mit besten Grüssen

Peter Korner
messages.name: Peter Korner
messages.msg:
…. one last thing to finish off, then you'll be rid of me for good.



 On June 11, you wrote:

 To connect with the katana:
 You can simply connect OUTPUT A of the RC-500 to the POWER AMP IN of the Katana-100. This bypasses the amplifier's preamp, allowing the signal to be played directly and unaltered—ideal for playback tracks.



 …that works, but the sound quality of the playback track is absolutely poor, actually unusable.



 However, if I connect the looper via **EFFECT LOOP RETURN** (see IMG) – the sound quality is absolutely perfect!

 The only annoying thing is that I can no longer hear the guitar via Katana. Huh!?



 Is it really true that I can only play playback tracks or accompany them via the looper via the POWER AMP IN?



 Thank you very much for a final (hopefully positive) answer.



 Best regards

 Peter Korner

messages.name: Travis McIntosh
messages.msg:
Hey ..
Can you check this one out?  Sounds like an Ableton rec level issue. The USB Input Gain is the only setting in the TD-27, but if they have the TD-27's outputs connected to speakers for the playback of the audio, then there is a Master Out Gain level that can be increased as well.
T.

messages.name: Andy Santos
messages.msg:
Hi Murphy,

Thanks for contacting us! Here's a bit of troubleshooting they can try to pinpoint the source of the issue:

- Try using Test Tone in Ableton to see if there's a channel setting in Abelton that may be causing this:
 ![](https://rolandus.zendesk.com/attachments/token/2fSmT7qZIjD7ibR9nbF68DQBm/?name=Screen+Shot+2025-06-12+at+10.34.30+AM.png)
- Try closing Ableton and play audio from youtube, iTunes, etc. Be sure that Window’s sound settings have the TD-27 as the output device. If the audio issue is resolved, then there is a setting Ableton that is likely causing this. In this case, troubleshooting Ableton will be needed.

Please let us know how it goes!

Kind regards,
Roland Customer Support

Hi again!



Here is an update from the customer:



**_“Thank you very much for your email and reaching out to Roland about my issue._**

**_I did what Roland customer service suggested. In Ableton, I did the Test Tone in Ableton and it worked fine._**

**_The sound was very loud. I closed Ableton and went to YouTube with the Windows sound setting to the TD-27._**

**_I could hear what was playing on YouTube with no problem._**

**_The volume was plenty loud._**

**_Back in Ableton, when I hit the drums they are loud and clear._**

**_I tried recording a song. The volume levels on all the tracks were set to the max._**

**_I listened to the recording I did. I could hear the drums at moderate level along with the backing tracks. I just don't think the volume levels should be set to the max in order to hear the drums during playback.For example, if the tom 1 is not loud enough during the playback, there is no way I can increase the volume to make it louder._**

**_I am not sure if this is an Ableton issue. I was wondering if Roland customer service could describe what the settings in the TD-27 should be for recording (i.e. the routing path for the individual pads). I am just guessing here. It may be in Ableton like Roland said.”_**



Do you have any insight into this?



Best,

(about://Sweetwater.com)

**MURPHY STEWART**
Tech Support
(800) 222-4700 ext. 6400

messages.name: Travis Hartnett
messages.msg:
Hi Tristian Lynch,

We're sorry to hear you're having this issue.

Try these steps.
If you've already done one of the steps, just move on to the next one.
Please be sure that you've done all of the steps.

1. Make sure that you have **v3.1.16 **of Roland Cloud Manager installed.
2. In the Library of Cloud Manager, update any plug-ins that show an available update.
3. Clear your browser cache.
4. **Restart your computer. If you're on a Mac, make sure that the "reopen windows" isn't selected**
5. Launch Roland Cloud Manager
6. Start your DAW. <--very important!

Regards,

Travis

Hi Stephen,

Thank you for getting in touch, sorry to hear you're having trouble with your ME-90B.

It sounds like you are seeing switch between memory and manual mode. Perhaps if you're not fully depressing the switch, it isn't registering a long press for the tuner. So it may toggle memory/manual mode. If you even lift your foot slightly, it may register this change rather than engage the tuner.

If you let go early, the ME-90B may start to think you're trying to navigate patches, not activate the tuner. This may be why pressing it again, even briefly then holding is giving you the tuner. Ergo, resetting the function.

If you like, you can send over a quick video that demonstrates what you're seeing and I'd be happy to take a closer look.

Kind regards,

Huw

Customer Service

Roland Europe Group Ltd

messages.msg_o:
I have a WAZA-BASS. v1.30 firmware. V1.1.0 app. The unit works very poorly. The problems happen consistently (daily) on 2 basses and a guitar. The crackles happen even when the Fender American Ultra II is set to PASSIVE, so it's not a distance-from-active-amp problem. I have tried the unit in two different homes (locations) as well. The transmitter disconnects daily, 5-6 times per 30 minute session. It disconnects regardles of the STANDBY setting (15min, 30min, or even OFF). Finally, after about 20-30 minutes of use, the bluetooth audio from my Mac (music lesson teacher voice) will studder / play with a chopped up garbled sound (bluetooth packet loss). I repeat that ALL 3 of the above issues happen every day, as I practice.

What are my options? I purchased from Amazon for $345.50 + WA stated taxes. I really wanted to like this unit but it's 100% unusable for me, given these 3 problems. I am reaching out to you before I go to Reddit and other forums.
Product Name: WAZA-AIR BASS
Serial Number: Z2R7878
Purchase Date: 2025-05-13
Purchase Method: Online
Purchase Dealer: AMAZON.COM

messages.name: Austin Sandick
messages.msg:
Dan,

Thanks for reaching out and contacting Roland BOSS USA Operational Product Support about the WAZA-AIR.

You should check a couple of things related to your WL-T transmitter drop out.
- First check the physical connection of the WL-T transmitter to your GUITAR OUTPUT jack.
Not all output jacks are the same and not standardized, the jack needs to depress the small on/off pin at the base of the WL-T transmitter. You can press this small pin with your finger to see that it turns the WL-T on/off. When connected for guitar performance, this pin needs to be depressed down all the way continuously for guitar signal to send wirelessly.
- Check the BTS for WAZA-AIR mobile app SYSTEM > STANDBY/SLEEP MODE settings and configure to OFF or longer duration so that you know the system is not going into standby prematurely.
- Make sure to always pair up before performance, wireless interference is normal and is different throughout the day, depending on your immediate environment.
Try not be within proximity to 2.4GHz wireless devices, routers, mobile devices, smart TVs etc. When practicing, you can walk anywhere with the WAZA-AIR, so check some different locations.
But remember to always pair up as instructed in the manual:
- For proper pairing review: **2.4GhZ Wireless Guitar audio connection:** Pair your WL-T Transmitter with the WAZA-AIR HEADSET by mating and connecting the WL-T to the WAZA-AIR Pairing Jack,
**wait and allow for 10 seconds or LED blinks for proper pairing and CHANNEL selection**, 1 of 14 CHANNELS with the least amount of interference will be selected.
**Once the LED on the WL-T has gone dim then it has chosen and paired, now separate the WL-T and connect to GUITAR OUTPUT jack for usage.**
**Here's some additional info for all three connections:**
**BT/BLUETOOTH WAZA-AIR AUDIO for BT audio app streaming for backing tracks.**
**BT/BLUETOOTH WAZA-AIR MIDI for BT MIDI app connection and for programming the 6 Channels of the WAZA-AIR.**
**WIRELESS AUDIO 2.4 GHZ wireless WL-T transmitter to WAZA-AIR wireless guitar signal transmission.**

* * *
**BOSS WAZA-AIR Explainer Video:**
**https://youtu.be/izs9DYbty6o**

**PLEASE REVIEW AND EXECUTE ALL STEPS BELOW TO GET PROPERLY CONNECTED WITH YOUR WAZA-AIR DEVICE**
The WAZA-AIR is designed to be used for BT WAZA-AIR AUDIO streaming of music for backing track jam along, simultaneously with 2.4 GHz guitar/instrument signal while using the WAZA-AIR BT MIDI for control of the Boss Tone Studio for WAZA-AIR mobile app.

Please use the support connection instructions provided also for more info and detail use the WAZA-AIR Owner's Manual and Device Connection Addendums below.
- To start a fresh setup and pairing of your mobile device and WAZA-AIR headphones it's best if you first forget or unpair any BT WAZA-AIR AUDIO or MIDI connections on your mobile device Bluetooth system settings.
**If you happened to have tried to pair other mobile devices or there are BT mobile devices nearby make sure to clear all paired instances of WAZA-AIR or set other mobile devices Bluetooth: OFF.**
- Power Off your WAZA-AIR headphones **(2)**.
- Power ON the WAZA-AIR headphones **(2)**,
then long press the Bluetooth button **(7)** for 3-4 seconds,
the BLUE LED **(5)** should blink rapidly showing ready for pairing mode.
- Go to your ANDROID/iOS mobile device BT settings and first pair with **WAZA-AIR AUDIO** for the BT streaming audio connection.
- Once successfully paired to **WAZA-AIR AUDIO**, open the BTS for WAZA-AIR Software Editor Mobile App and press the **PAIRING: BLUETOOTH MIDI DEVICE** selection **PAIRING BUTTON** and in the **BT MIDI DEVICE CONNECTION** screen choose the **WAZA-AIR MIDI Input / Output** connection from the **BLUETOOTH DEVICES list**,
a small **"CONNECTING" message or * asterisk** will appear, use the return/back arrow (Android) or screen tap (iOS) of the mobile device to return to the app **BLUETOOTH PAIRING/CONNECT screen**, connections should now be listed -
**PAIRING: BLUETOOTH MIDI DEVICE CONNECT: WAZA-AIR MIDI(Bluetooth)**, now press the OK selection button and wait for sync.
- This should get you connected with both the **WAZA-AIR AUDIO for BT streaming music** and **WAZA-AIR MIDI for app sync control** with the **BOSS TONE STUDIO for WAZA-AIR software editor app**.
- For **2.4GhZ Wireless Guitar audio connection:** Pair your WL-T Transmitter with the WAZA-AIR HEADSET by mating and connecting the WL-T to the WAZA-AIR Pairing Jack **(9)**, **wait and allow for 10 seconds or LED blinks** **for proper pairing and CHANNEL selection**, 1 of 14 CHANNELS with the least amount of interference will be selected. **Once the LED on the WL-T has gone dim then it has chosen and paired, now separate the WL-T and connect to GUITAR OUTPUT jack for usage.**
 ![](https://rolandus.zendesk.com/attachments/token/7NPNaEkQyAwfaLWITZlHyhwBk/?name=inline-790836408.png) ![](https://rolandus.zendesk.com/attachments/token/EenucpkrrAT5B4FE79u1sFNHE/?name=inline-1314787853.png)

messages.msg_o:
Bonjour, Je tente désespérement d'enregistrer du midi dans mes daws (Cubase/Luna) et ce à partir par ex d'une simple Scene d'origine du clavier la no A003Ultimate String ! Cette scène est très intéressante car multi zone et split diverses et le jeu est plaisant tel que sur le synthé ! 
Mais quand je tente d'enregistrer sur le DAW .... galère totale Alors que l'entrée midi et la sortie sont bien assignée au Roland Fantom 08 rien en midi ne rentre dans le daw sauf si je sélectionne une Zone particulière !!! Alors la oui j'écris dans le DAw mais je ne contrôle qu'une seule zone cependant la scène  que je désirais enregistrer est composée de 5 zones ... bref je galère et suis à deux doigts de revendre cette belle machine .
Précisons que je ne suis pas débutant , j'utilise des daw depuis longtemps mais la ça calle ,
Le meme phénomène se reproduit dans différents daws !!
Je voudrais simplement enregistrer en midi la scène que je joue en direct !!! 
Osx Catalina, Imac I7, Version 1.03 Fantom 08, 

Merci d'avance 
Nom du produit: FANTOM-08
Numéro de série: Z9P6496
Date d’achat: 2023-08-31
Mode d’achat: In a store
Revendeur concerné: OMEGA (Cuesmes)
messages.name: Vincent Troupin
messages.msg:
Hello, I am desperately trying to record midi in my daws (Cubase/Luna) and this from for example a simple original Scene of the keyboard no A003Ultimate String! This scene is very interesting because multi zone and various split and the playing is pleasant as on the synth!
 But when I try to record on the DAW .... total hassle While the midi input and output are correctly assigned to the Roland Fantom 08 nothing in midi enters the daw unless I select a particular Zone !!! So yes I write in the DAw but I only control one zone however the scene that I wanted to record is made up of 5 zones ... in short I struggle and am on the verge of reselling this beautiful machine.
 Let me point out that I am not a beginner, I have been using DAWs for a long time but this is stuck,
 The same phenomenon occurs in different daws!!
 I would just like to record in midi the scene that I play live!!!
 Osx Catalina, Imac I7, Version 1.03 Fantom 08,

 Thanks in advance
 Product Name: FANTOM-08
 Serial number: Z9P6496
 Purchase date: 2023-08-31
 Purchase method: In a store
 Reseller concerned: OMEGA (Cuesmes)

messages.name: Johan Gullbo
messages.msg:
Bonjour Vincent.
Merci d'avoir contacté le service clientèle Roland.
Nous sommes désolés d'apprendre que vous rencontrez des problèmes avec votre configuration qui comprend le FANTOM-06.
Tout d'abord, vérifiez que le mode du pilote USB du FANTOM-06 est réglé sur VENDOR.
Pour ce faire, appuyez sur MENU - SYSTEM, faites défiler jusqu'à USB Driver dans GENERAL et sélectionnez VENDOR.
N'oubliez pas d'enregistrer ce paramètre en appuyant sur le bouton WRITE.
Veuillez également vous assurer de télécharger et d'installer le pilote adapté au système d'exploitation de votre ordinateur.
Veuillez suivre ce lien vers notre site Web où vous trouverez les pilotes disponibles pour cet appareil.
https://www.roland.com/global/products/fantom-06/downloads/
J'espère que ces informations vous seront utiles. N'hésitez pas à répondre à cet e-mail si vous avez besoin d'aide supplémentaire.

Cordialement.




Johan

Customer Service

Roland Europe Group Ltd

Hjælpppppppppppp.
Jeg har i mange år med stor glæde brugt GT-100, hvor jeg benytter Limitor VTG Rack U som stut Limitor.
GT-1000 har så vidt jeg kan se ikke nogen limitor, er det noget der kunne komme på tale i en fremtidig update?
Hvis ikke, har i forslag til hvad jeg kunne bruge i stedet for?
Jeg har i årenes løb brugt mange mange timer på at forsøge at opnå en lige så god tone som på PT-100, men det er aldrig lykkedes, så GT-1000 står stadig ensom tilbage på hylden, og det er jo en skam, for det er jo en både dyr og fin maskine.

messages.name: Knud Erik Rimmer
messages.msg:
Helppppppppppp.
 I have been using the GT-100 with great pleasure for many years, using the Limitor VTG Rack U as a support Limitor.
 As far as I can see, the GT-1000 doesn't have a limiter, is this something that could be addressed in a future update?
 If not, do you have any suggestions for what I could use instead?
 Over the years, I have spent many, many hours trying to achieve a tone as good as the PT-100, but it has never succeeded, so the GT-1000 still stands alone on the shelf, and that's a shame, because it is both an expensive and fine machine.

 Product name: GT-1000
 Serial number: Z815912
 Purchase date:: 2018-05-29
 Purchase method: Online
 Dealer: Thomann GmbH (Burgebrach)

messages.name: Huw Lloyd-Williams
messages.msg:
Hej Knud,

Tak for din henvendelse!

Du har helt ret, GT-1000 har ikke en dedikeret LIMITER FX-blok. Den har dog LIMITER-funktioner med en af COMPRESSOR-blokkene, men mere effektivt med MASTERING FX.

Hvis du kigger på side 19 i parameterguiden, kan du se en række begrænsere, der er tilgængelige i MASTERING FX. På side 12 under FX1/FX2/FX3/FX4 TYPE beskrives det desuden, hvordan COMPRESSOR kan bruges som limiter til kun at undertrykke spidserne og dermed forhindre forvrængning.

Her er det direkte link til guiden - https://static.roland.com/assets/media/pdf/GT-1000_parameter_eng12_W.pdf

Jeg er dog klar over, at det ville være nyttigt at have en dedikeret limiter. Med dette i tankerne vil jeg videresende dette som en anmodning om en funktion, der skal overvejes i en fremtidig opdatering. Selv om vi ikke kan love, at noget bliver implementeret, sætter vi alligevel pris på din feedback.

Med venlig hilsen,

Huw

Customer Service

Roland Europe Group Ltd

messages.name: Roman Pierre
messages.msg: ;DW 5500 and 9500 hi-hat stands Dear Sir or Madam;Would you be so kind as to answer the following question: concerning the aforementioned hi-hat stands;of which diameter is the rod to which the clutch is fixed? Yours sincerely;Roman P. Rudin Phone: Preferred contact: Email

messages.name: Joe Hofer
messages.msg:
_**Hello Roman. **_
_**Thank you so much for reaching out to us with your inquiry. My name is Joe, and I'm part of the Customer Service team here at Drum Workshop. **_
_**It's a pleasure to meet you via email. **_

_**Both the 5500 and 9500 use DWSP2013 (15") and DWSP358 (21"). The standard clutch would be DWSM379. **_
_**These part can be purchased through our site or an authorized dealer. If the dealer does not have the parts, they can special order them for you. **_

_**Do you have any other questions?**_

_**Joe- **_

DW Drums Customer Support

messages.msg_o: Competition has its downsides. I have most strenuously tried not to come up with a topic you would be uncomfortable with but as you have not answered my question in the slightest way, id est "of which diametre are the rods of your stands," my words have to becom as clear as crystal. I am sorry for my bluntness but I am interested in the exact opposite of what you have answered. I would like to know whether, if I bought DW 5500 or 9500, the clutches by Pearl SGC-300P or DCL300P and cups could be used on DW 9500 or 5500. The problem is that your stands have old-fashioned felts and nothing like Pearl H-2000 hi-hat stand have (SGC-300P or DCL300P and rubber three-point holding "cups" NP208) or even Axis hi-hat stands clutches and "cups". I would like to buy sometime in the future one of your stands but use such a modern clutch with two rubber half-spheres. I have read everywhere that your rod have the largest diametres and it seems that Pearl uses 7 millimetres but I have no idea I do not want to spend money clutches without knowing whether they would work on your stands. I have no idea whether your rods are really 8 millimetres in diametre. I do not want to buy Pearl H2000 stand but one of your stands and use one or at least try out on them one of those Pearl clutches. That is the problem.

messages.msg_o:
Dear Joe!

**Is it possible to adjust** the parametres of the DW 9500 stand in such a way (distance of the hi-hats, the angle of the pedal, tension of the pedal ...) **that the pedal never reaches the foot plate** **although the hi-hats could be completely closed by the pedal movement** so no noise would come from the clapping of the pedal on the foot plate, which would disturb the sound of the hi-hats themselves?
messages.name: Roman Pierre
messages.msg:
Dear Joe!

**Is it possible to adjust** the parametres of the DW 9500 stand in such a way (distance of the hi-hats, the angle of the pedal, tension of the pedal ...) **that the pedal never reaches the foot plate** **although the hi-hats could be completely closed by the pedal movement** so no noise would come from the clapping of the pedal on the foot plate, which would disturb the sound of the hi-hats themselves?

messages.name: Joe Hofer
messages.msg:
_**Hi Roman. **_
_**You kinda can adjust the angle of the footboard on the 9500 hi hat. **_
_**When making adjustments to the tension spring, it'll lower the footboard as you loosen the tension and raise the foot board upward as you tighten the tension spring with the dial. Please keep in mind that it can only adjust so far**_
 ![](https://rolandus.zendesk.com/attachments/token/TrhOQZpe732S9jnz6SmRatK4X/?name=image.png)
_**Other than that, that's the only way to make such adjustment. **_

_**If you have any other questions, please feel free to reach out. **_
_**Joe-**_



DW Drums Customer Support

messages.msg_o:
Dear Joe,

**That is some bad news! I was already struggling at the decision between DW 5500 and 9500 and at their astronomical prices when you answered. My grandmother would finally have to overcome her avarice to give me enough money for MFG. Until the lecture of your answer, I had thought that what I regarded as your flagship model, DW 9500, allows the angle of the pedal to be adjusted. For three days only, after finally having found a reviewer's video on your model DW 9500, I have known that DW 9500 is not your flagship model, that its touching the foot board makes a loud noise when the pedal is completely pressed down, that its chain springs out of the cogwheel each and every time it is suddenly released, making a chain noise! Of course, the noise of MFG's pedal touching the foot board must be somewhat softer because MFG's pedal is made of a material thinner, softer and less elastic, Aluminium, but still I would need to know whether it were possible to adjust the angle of the pedal and the distance between the hi-hats in such a way that the pedal would never have to touch the foot board making a noise although the hi-hats were completely closed.**

**I am still waiting for my stand 9599 AL ordered and paid in advance as was mandatory on April 4, 2025 from Boullard Musique in Morges, Switzerland. They wrote that I had to wait until MID-JULY this year!**

Yours sincerely,

Roman

had an angle adjustment because of the astronomical prices but I have been completely muted three days ago when I saw

messages.msg_o:
I forgot to mention that for three days only I have known that your DW 5500 (and certainly 3500 too) makes a noise when the stopper reaches the cast-iron arch (frame) as one suddenly releases the pedal. That is not for me. At those prices at least. Your company has to reduce prices by 70% as I had told you. Getting the money together for 9599 AL was a hard task as everyone I had talked to was shocked about the price for that stand. Now the same again for inferior dynamic qualities and no double-sphere rubber or similar clutch as SGC 300P or TCL 300 P by  Pearl! You surely have to go over a lot of things. Besides, one poster on the internet, a professional drummer, wrote that he had never seen a DW hi-hat stand from any professional musicer that had not become defect in one way or the other. And several posters regret your changes made to the '90s versions of your hi-hat stands (and bass drum pedals).

That is not for me. At those prices at least. Your company has to reduce prices by 70% as I had told you. Getting the money together for 9599 AL was a hard task as everyone I had talked to was shocked about the price for that stand. Now the same again for inferior dynamic qualities and no double-sphere rubber or similar clutch as SGC 300P or TCL 300 P by  Pearl! You surely have to go over a lot of things. Besides, one poster on the internet, a professional drummer, wrote that he had never seen a DW hi-hat stand from any professional musicer that had not become defect in one way or the other. And several posters regret your changes made to the '90s versions of your hi-hat stands (and bass drum pedals).

On 11/06/2025 09:26, temporary@bluemail.ch wrote:

> Dear Joe,
>
> **That is some bad news! I was already struggling at the decision between DW 5500 and 9500 and at their astronomical prices when you answered. My grandmother would finally have to overcome her avarice to give me enough money for MFG. Until the lecture of your answer, I had thought that what I regarded as your flagship model, DW 9500, allows the angle of the pedal to be adjusted. For three days only, after finally having found a reviewer's video on your model DW 9500, I have known that DW 9500 is not your flagship model, that its touching the foot board makes a loud noise when the pedal is completely pressed down, that its chain springs out of the cogwheel each and every time it is suddenly released, making a chain noise! Of course, the noise of MFG's pedal touching the foot board must be somewhat softer because MFG's pedal is made of a material thinner, softer and less elastic, Aluminium, but still I would need to know whether it were possible to adjust the angle of the pedal and the distance between the hi-hats in such a way that the pedal would never have to touch the foot board making a noise although the hi-hats were completely closed.**
>
> **I am still waiting for my stand 9599 AL ordered and paid in advance as was mandatory on April 4, 2025 from Boullard Musique in Morges, Switzerland. They wrote that I had to wait until MID-JULY this year!**
>
> Yours sincerely,
>
> Roman
>
> had an angle adjustment because of the astronomical prices but I have been completely muted three days ago when I saw

messages.name: Joe Hofer
messages.msg:
_**Hi Roman. **_
_**I am truly and deeply sorry that you're frustrated about our hardware, my friend. I really am. Just a gentle and friendly reminder that I am just a Customer Service Rep that provides general information about our drums and hardware. But I do sympathize your frustration and can totally understand. **_

_**Here is my direct phone#, (805) 822-5240. You are totally welcome to call me and we can talk about it. **_

_**If you need in person help, your dealer can also assist you too. **_

_**Take care and have a great weekend. **_
_**Joe- **_

DW Drums Customer Support

messages.msg_o:
Good morning, Joe,

Thank you for your help.

I am quite satisfied with your services because, although "That is information that is not available," was not the right answer concerning the rod's diametre but now at least, amotionality and money issues left aside, it has become clear due to your answers and due to your pauses that I can only be happy with MFG or Yamaha HHS9D or a cheap stand from a competitor without a noisy base plate!

Farewell!

Roman

Service Request

Contact Information
氏名: 近藤 あかり
メールアドレス: asamatsu.0621.jun.26.5214@au.com

郵便番号: 5650825
都道府県: 大阪府

住所 (区町村/番地): 山田北8-31
住所 (建物名/部屋番号): プティベール千里305

購入日: 2023-10-12
購入方法: オンライン
購入店: ワタナベ楽器店 京都本店

Issue:
2025年6月14日夜に、液体(スキンケア用の美容液)を5ml程こぼしてしまいました。場所はA0からB0あたりです。隙間に入り込んでしまい、電源をつけて確認したところA0とB♭0が濁った音になっていました。
その後は1度も電源をつけていません。
messages.name: あかり 近藤
messages.msg:
Service Request
 Product: JUNO-DS76
 Serial number: Z3Q9130
 Contact Information
 Name: Akari Kondo Email address: asamatsu.0621.jun.26.5214@au.com
 Phone number: 08058364668
 Postal code: 5650825
 Prefecture: Osaka Prefecture City: Suita City Address (Ward/Block): Yamadakita 8-31
 Address (Building name/Room number): Petit Vert Senri 305

 Purchase date: 2023-10-12
 How to buy: Online Purchase store: Watanabe Musical Instruments Kyoto Main Store

 Issue:
 On the night of June 14, 2025, I spilled about 5ml of liquid (skin care serum). It got into the gap between A0 and B0. When I turned it on and checked, A0 and B♭0 sounded muddy.
 Since then it has never been turned on.
